Name: Stratford University
Overview: Stratford University is a private organization in Fairfax, Virginia. and is a for-profit institution. The institution provides a wide range of programmes, including certificate, diploma, associate's, bachelor's, and graduate degrees. The university has three campuses, including Alexandria (Eisenhower Ave), Falls Church (Tysons Corner), and Woodbridge, located throughout the U.S. state of Virginia (Potomac Mills).The university's school of business administration provides a number of courses, including an MBA, an International MBA, an M.Sc. in Accounting, a BBA, a B.Sc. in Accounting, and an AAS in Business Administration. The M.Sc. in software engineering, M.Sc. in information systems, are all offered by the school of computer science and information technology.The school of hospitality and culinary arts provides courses in areas like the M.Sc. in international hospitality management, the Bachelor of Arts in hospitality management.

Name: San Jose State University
Overview: Earlier known as the Minns Evening Normal School, San Jose State University was founded in 1857 and is located in San Francisco. It is one of the oldest universities situated on the West Coast. It is ranked 7th in the Top Public Schools (US News) list, and almost 12% of the students are international students from all over the world.The university offers about 88 undergraduate and 70 graduate programs through its eight colleges. Along with that, it also offers certification and doctorate professional-level programs. Some of the popular courses at the San Jose State University include- Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services, Engineering, Visual and Performing Arts, Communication, Journalism, and Related Programs and Psychology. The university also has unique research centres that study the lives and works of Nobel Prize-winning author John Steinbeck and amazing composer Beethoven. Along with academic facilities, the campus also provides more than 450 organizations and a Greek System. The organizations are based on categories like- academics, club sports, cultural/religious, fraternity/sorority, and special interests. The total fees vary depending upon the course one opts for, but fees for undergraduate students are 30,065 USD ( campus housing) and 29,382 (off-campus), including transportation, books and supplies, and other miscellaneous expenses. The university provides around 425 million USD as loans, grants, awards, and scholarships for international students studying in the USA based on merit. Need-based scholarships are not for international students and are a part of financial aid.

Name: California State University Monterey Bay
Overview: Established in 1994, California State University Monterey Bay is a public institution situated on the decommissioned army base Fort in Monterey County, California. Backed by years of experience, this university has evolved and developed different study programs, thereby offering lucrative opportunities to students. Approximately 7,000 students are admitted to this university's undergraduate and significant graduate programs. This educational institution also provides a distance learning program for the convenience of students. This university is recognized by the WASC Senior College and University Commission. Moreover, it offers more than 7,500 students an opportunity to learn through a residential campus. The student body of different countries and cultures get special attention in small classes while continuing degrees in 25 undergraduate and seven major graduate programs. The California State University Monterey Bay has created a matchless record in service-learning and community outreach. Further, it won the President's Award for Higher Education Community Service twice. This university's international programs provide flexible opportunities for students willing to pursue undergraduate, graduate or master's degrees for a year or learn quality English from well-known experts. This university offers approximately 60 undergraduate programs for all applicants. All the campuses of this university are featured with top-notch facilities and amenities. The student-faculty ratio of California State University is nearly 24:1, and the most popular courses here include General Studies and Management, Business Management, Psychology, Marketing, Computer and Information Sciences, Biological and Biomedical sciences and more. In the initial days, the first-year faculty students assist students in launching college careers.

Placement: Internships Academic internships are conducted as part of a class, as part of a major or programme requirement, or under the supervision of a faculty member. In order to get academic credit, internship sites must be approved by the institution.Consult your internship class instructor or your faculty mentor. You might wish to check out CSUMB Placements for a list of acceptable internship venues. County of Monterey The purpose of the Monterey County Internship Program is to offer students an experience that will allow them to learn significant skills and information as they pursue a professional career. Internships might last anything from a single summer to a quarter or semester, or even numerous quarters or semesters.Undergraduate and graduate students can participate in paid or unpaid internships with the County of Monterey.  Monterey Bay Internships Monterey Bay Internships is a service that assists young individuals in making the transition from higher education to the job. Employers can benefit from the talent that has been developed right here in the United States. Students acquire the training they need to meet the needs of the local business community in terms of employment. Everyone can contribute to the region's success if we work together.
Accommodation: Living on campus allows you to be close to your classes, friends, and all that CSUMB has to offer. The university endeavours to offer you a pleasant setting to thrive in and out of the classroom, from our different housing options to the Living-Learning Programs. Residence Halls Residential Halls are reserved for first-year students and up. To live in the Residence Halls, students must be matriculated CSU Monterey Bay students pursuing a degree. Each semester that students live on campus, they must be enrolled full time. This translates to 12 units for undergraduates and at least 8 units for graduate students per semester. Meal preparation is essential. The main area of the campus is surrounded by residence halls. Classrooms, the library, the Dining Commons, computer facilities, the Media Learning Complex, the Campus Health Center, the Otter Sports Center, and all administrative offices are all within walking distance. First-Year Housing Asilomar, Cypress,  Willet, Yarrow, and Manzanita Halls are all three-story structures with the same layout. All rooms feature private bathrooms and are suited for triple and double occupancy. A mailroom, a laundry room, and a fully equipped kitchen with a microwave and stove are all available in each building.  Area Two Three-story buildings with three different room styles are Avocet, Tortuga, and Sanderling Halls. Double, triple, or quadruple occupancy rooms with private or communal bathrooms will be assigned to guests. On the first level, there is a mail space, a TV lounge, a laundry room, and a full kitchen and lounge. Facilities the students receive are: No charge laundry facilitiesStaff available 24 hours every daySecure ID card building accessPrivate or shared bathroomsCable televisionWi-Fi For more information, visit: https://csumb.edu/housing/housing-options/residence-halls/  North Quad Suites in the North Quad are reserved for students in their second and third years of residence. All residents of the Strawberry Apartments, as well as the Vineyard and Pinnacles Suites on the North Quad, must be matriculated CSU Monterey Bay students pursuing a degree. Each semester that students live on campus, they must be enrolled full time. This translates to 12 units for undergraduates and at least 8 units for graduate students per semester. Strawberry Apartments Single occupancy rooms are available in either a two-bedroom, one-bath or a four-bedroom, two-bath apartment configuration in North Quad. The mailroom, laundry room, living area, and shared kitchen are all common areas. The Vineyard or Pinnacles Suites Located in the North Quad, these rooms can accommodate single or double occupancy and come in two-bedroom, one-bathroom or four-bedroom, two-bathroom configurations. The main quad, classrooms, the library, the Dining Commons, computer facilities, the Media Learning Complex, the Campus Health Center, the Otter Sports Center, and all administrative offices are all within walking distance of these four-story suites. On the fourth level of the Vineyard Suites, there is a Health & Wellness programme. Facilities the students receive are: No charge laundry facilitiesStaff available 24 hours every daySecure ID card building accessPrivate or shared bathroomsCable televisionWi-Fi For more information, visit: https://csumb.edu/housing/housing-options/north-quad/  Promontory Promontory is for students who have completed 60 units or more. All Promontory Apartments residents must be matriculated CSU Monterey Bay students pursuing a degree. Each semester that students live on campus, they must be enrolled full time. This translates to 12 units for undergraduates and at least 8 units for graduate students per semester. The Promontory has single and double occupancy rooms, as well as apartment-style living with a washer and dryer in each unit. Facilities the students receive are: No charge laundry facilitiesStaff available 24 hours every daySecure ID card building accessPrivate or shared bathroomsCable televisionWi-Fi For more information, visit: https://csumb.edu/housing/housing-options/promontory/   East Campus Apartments On Cal State Monterey Bay's East Campus, the Frederick Park Apartments are a student residential complex. Students with families, graduate students, and individuals 21 and older who have earned a minimum of 90 units are eligible to live in these flats. The two-bedroom, one-bathroom apartments provide pleasant lodging as well as a short commute to university classes and activities. Cars, Monterey Salinas Transit buses, and bicycles are all options for residents.All students wishing to live in the East Campus Apartments must be enrolled at CSU Monterey Bay and pursuing a degree. Each semester that students live on campus, they must be enrolled full time. Undergraduates must take 12 units per semester, while graduate students must take at least 6 units. At various periods during their academic careers, students may be asked to present verification of enrolment. For more information, visit: https://csumb.edu/housing/housing-options/east-campus-apartments/  For general enquiries, visit: https://csumb.edu/housing/

Name: Charleston Southern University
Overview: Charleston Southern University (CSU) is the only Christian university in Lowcountry. It has received accreditation from the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges for awarding doctorate, master's and bachelor's degrees. The institute delivers over 15 graduate programs, more than 60 undergraduate programs, 15 Online programs and 1 Doctoral program. The various undergraduate study areas include Aeronautics, Biochemistry, Christian Studies, Accounting, Child Development, Criminal Justice, Graphic Design, Marketing, etc. Some of the areas of study in the graduate program are Clinical Counselling, Human Resources, Physical Assistant, Organisational Leadership, Project Management, etc. The Charleston Southern University online program study areas include Professional Studies, Cybersecurity, Business Analytics, Ministry, Supply Chain, Nursing, Leadership, etc. Students get to experience top-notch education at an affordable price range. Over 95% of CSU students receive financial aid every year. Moreover, during the last academic year, this institute awarded students upwards of $74 million in financial aid.

Name: SUNY Polytechnic Institute - Utica
Overview: Located in New York, the SUNY Polytechnic Institute was formed in 1966. Accredited by the Board of Regents of the State of New York, the institute offers various educational programs to develop students and learners. Initially known as the Upper Division College at Herkimer/Rome/Utica, it adopted its current name in 1977. With about 2,200 undergraduate enrollments, SUNY Polytechnic Institute has been on a growing spree. Spread across two campuses, the institute offers undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Some popular courses involve Accountancy, Data analytics, Computer and Information Science, Nursing practice, Business administration, Engineering, Healthcare and so on. The Utica campus is spread across 400 acres, located in Marcy, Utica. It aims at providing all the resources essential for the students to meet their ultimate goal of studying at this university. Currently, the SUNY Polytechnic Institute acceptance rate is at 69%, making the institute moderately selective for the new enrolments. The classes here maintain a general student-faculty ratio of 14:1 to focus on each student separately. The average student retention rate from the first year has increased to 79%, showing student satisfaction. According to Utica/Albany's ranking 2022, the university is ranked 12th in Best Colleges in Regional Universities North.Moreover, the fee structure set for the international students is affordable for most students, ranging between $15,000 and $20,000. The institute believes in helping students and alumni with job prospects by developing employable careers. The Office of Career Services at SUNY Polytechnic Institute connects the students and alumni with organisations and employers. It uses career assessment tools such as StrengthsQuest to assess the students' strengths and help them find appropriate jobs.

Name: University of Wyoming
Overview: A public land-grant research university in Laramie, Wyoming, the University of Wyoming was established in 1886. With over 130 years at its hand, it has become a well-known name in the educational industry here at Wyoming. Surrounded by the rugged Rocky Mountains, the university maintains a strong commitment to excellence and ensures the future of its students as aware, critical and innovative citizens of the global world with the potential to lead. The academic structure of the university is organized into multiple interdisciplinary institutes and seven colleges and College of Agriculture and Natural Resources, College of Arts and Sciences, College of Business, College of Education, College of Engineering and Applied Sciences, College of Health Services, College of Law, Haub School of Environment and Natural Resources, Honours College, and School of Energy Resources. The university maintains a 96% of acceptance rate and functions with a promising student teacher ratio of 15:1. It offers over 80 undergraduate and 90 postgraduate degree programmes with opportunities for students to pursue their study abroad through various scholarships. Some of the popular and highly ranked courses offered at the university belong from the Engineering, Arts and Applied Science programs. The university hosts a discrimination free and vibrant academic environment for thousands of students so that they can enjoy an inclusive college life. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come around $ 32K but through many of the scholarships and grants provided by the college, the cost can be brought down to $ 13K. Spread across acres of scenic land, the university campus remains equipped with auditoriums, libraries, museums, recreation centers, residence halls, laboratories, art centers, student organizations, and athletic centers. With a brilliant alumni network of notable alumni positioned at the apex of leading industries, it also ensures an amazing placement rate for the graduating batch.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the eligibility criteria and language requirements for applying to various programmes at the University of Wyoming that are available to international students:International Student Eligibility Requirements —The following are the program-specific generic eligibility requirements for international graduates and undergraduates:Undergraduate Admissions: Students are admitted to undergraduate programmes based on their high school GPA or SAT or ACT scores. To be admitted to undergraduate programmes, students must have a high school diploma or certificate. On a 4.0 unweighted grading scale, a student's cumulative grade point average should be 3.0 or higher, and they must have a composite ACT score of 21 or a SAT score of 980 (math/critical reading combined).Graduate Eligibility: To be admitted to the university's graduate programme, students must have earned an undergraduate or bachelor's degree from an approved institution. All applicants must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.000. (scale of 4.000). GRE/GMAT scores may be required for some graduate programmes.Indian Students' Country-Specific Requirements —Examination boards such as ISC, GCSE, AISSCE, and others must give Class 12 or Standard XII Board Examination results to students. The college or a transcript assessment agency, such as World Education Services (WES) or any other evaluation agency listed as a member on the NACES website, must provide original or certified true copies of transcripts. Transcripts and papers must be submitted in the local language, together with documents that provide English translations.

Name: Western Illinois University
Overview: With an acceptance rate of 57%, Western Illinois University is a public institute headquartered in Macomb, Illinois, established in 1899, offering over 100 undergraduate and graduate programs. It has an enrollment of 7,490 students and a staff of 1,280. Some of the courses are Agriculture, Political Science, Sociology, Mechanical Engineering, and Educational Leadership. The two Western Illinois University campuses are the Macomb Campus and the Quad Cities Campus. There are four libraries, namely the main Leslie F. Malpas Library, Curriculum Library, WIU-Quad Cities Library, and Music Library, that house printed and online resources and study spaces. Through the Integrated Baccalaureate and Master's Program, exceptional undergraduates can earn both degrees within five years. The university offers various Post-Baccalaureate Certificate programs like Police Executive Administration, Community Development and Planning, and Supply Chain Management. The nine Pre-Professional programs prepare students for undergraduate and graduate-level professional studies at other universities; Pre-Forestry and Pre-Law are some of them. Dual Programs, organized with other universities, are a way for students to work towards their professional degrees/ certificates while meeting their School of Arts and Sciences bachelor's degrees. Some of the dual programs are Arts and Sciences and Law, and General Studies and Chiropractic. Western Online comprises several online degrees and certificate programs like Accountancy, Business Administration, and Supply Chain Management. The estimated undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 22,271. Financial aids include scholarships, grants, loans, and student employment like the Presidential Scholarship, Leatherneck Books Award, Federal Pell Grant, Federal Direct Loans, and Veterans Education Benefits. On-campus accommodation is available at Corbin-Olsen, Caroline Grate, University Village, Westbrook House, etc.; there are singles, doubles, apartments, and suites. More than 250 student organizations like Agribusiness Club, Beta Alpha Psi, Club Baseball, Forensic Science Club, and 17 NCAA sports teams like baseball, soccer, and football. Western Illinois University graduates earn a median starting salary of USD 45,000.

All grades and scores will be translated to a scale of 4.0.Non-native English speakers must take one of the following exams to demonstrate their English proficiency: TOEFL, IELTS, ITEP, or PTE Academic. (WIU's school code is 1900.) Name: Georgia State University
Overview: Georgia University is one of the most famous public universities among the four research universities of the University System of Georgia. The university has more than 54,000 students spread across six university campuses. The university offers over 250 majors, minors, and certificates in around 100 fields. The university is known for offering bachelor's, master's, doctorate, post-baccalaureate, and post-master certificate courses. Around 12 academic schools and colleges are provided by the university, out of which the College of Arts and Sciences is considered the largest college. According to the US News and World, Georgia State University is ranked 3rd in best undergraduate teaching. Facilities like laundry rooms, study rooms, and many others are included in the housing. No financial aid is provided to international students.

Name: Gonzaga University
Overview: Gonzaga University is a private Catholic university located in Spokane, Washington. The university was founded by a Jesuit priest Joseph Cataldo, with the aim of serving society through education and holistic development. The university consists of seven schools offering 43 courses in various fields. This includes 16 undergraduate programs with nearly 52 majors to choose from, 23 graduate programs and 4 doctoral programs. Being a Catholic institution, the university provides theology courses for those looking to become priests. The best programs at Gonzaga University include Masters in Business Administration (MBA), BS in Mechanical Engineering and B.A. in Psychology. The main campus of the university has a total of 105 buildings spread across 152 acres near Downtown Spokane. The Foley Center Library caters to the literature needs of undergraduate and graduate students, while the Chastek Law Library is dedicated solely to law school students. The Jundt Art Museum is also located on campus, which is home to exclusive artworks by Picasso, Rembrandt and other famous artists. The average annual costs of studying at Gonzaga University come to around USD 62,500. The fee structure of the program varies depending on the type and duration of the program. The university has a vibrant student culture with around 95 active clubs functioning on campus. The intramural games within the departments encourage over 60% of students to participate and socialize with fellow students and faculty. The basketball team, known as the Gonzaga Bulldogs, have achieved major success in national collegiate tournaments. Other sports promoted on campus include baseball, football and track and field athletics. Notable alumni from Gonzaga University include former Governor of Washington Christine Gregoire, actor and singer Bing Crosby and basketball player John Stockton.
Eligibility Overview: Those applying for college admission at Gonzaga University will not be required to provide a SAT or ACT score. This policy has two essential caveats: homeschooled students with fewer than 30 semester or 45 quarter college credits (at the time of application) must submit a SAT or ACT, and international students must submit a TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, iTEP, SAT, or ACT score to establish English ability.As mentioned below, we will continue to examine submissions holistically. Admission, automatic merit scholarships, direct admission to nursing and engineering, the Honors Program, and additional Gonzaga scholarships are all accessible to those who apply without taking a test.

Name: Florida International University
Overview: Florida International University is a public research university located in Florida. Since its foundation in 1965, it has become the second-largest university in Florida. The university consists of 11 different colleges across its campuses. These schools together offer over 190 programs, including undergraduate and graduate studies. The B.Sc. and MS in Biomedical Engineering, the MBA, and the MS and Ph.D. in Psychology are Florida International University's top-ranked programmes. The doctoral program at the university is also highly sought-after and renowned for its high research output. The university has two campuses located in Florida. The main campus, formally known as the Modesto A. Maidique Campus, is a 344-acre facility housing the most important university buildings. Biscayne Bay Campus's regional campus is located in a 200-acre area on Miami Bay. The university provides state-of-the-art facilities like the Engineering Center, Motorola Nanofabrication Research Facility, and Green Library to promote research on the campus. Famous alums to have completed programs at Florida International University include actor Andy Garcia, basketball player Carlos Arroyo, and Manny Diaz, the former mayor of Miami.The university has over 300 academic associations and a diverse international student community to help them develop their careers and personalities while promoting multicultural collaboration and interaction. Some of the outstanding sports facilities include FIU Stadium and FIU Arena. The average annual cost of attending university here comes to around $24,000. The tuition fee varies depending on the program's duration and the type of program chosen.

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The university focuses on four major areas to assist the students to become leaders in serving the local and global communities. Residential Life supports the purpose because it thinks that living on-campus enhances the academic experience by allowing students to learn both inside and outside of the classroom.Multiple ideas and ways to involve students living on-campus are being used to help improve not only the residential experience but also the learning that takes place in our residence halls. Personal development Residents will explore their identities, values, and purpose in order to learn more about themselves. Residents will be able to do the following: Make their identities clearDetermine their emotions, motivations, and desiresBy communicating their needs and desires, they may advocate for themselvesDefine and (re)evaluate their goal Community Residents will understand and appreciate living in a multi-cultural environment in which they can grow and communicate across differences while also working to foster mutual respect. Residents will be able to do the following: Create and maintain healthy connectionsDescribe the community's expectations as well as the consequences of their behaviourMaintain community standards by holding peers accountableChange your habits to have a beneficial impact on the community Social Justice Residents will become more self-aware as a result of participating in social dialogue in order to build inclusive communities, advocate for equity, and learn about various cultures and belief systems. Residents will be able to do the following: Make their prejudices and biases knownUnderstand the vocabulary and concepts associated with social justiceDescribe how societal institutions contribute to oppression and privilegeStrive for equity and inclusion Global responsibility Residents will take part in a learning environment in which they will reflect on issues that affect all communities, learn how to advocate for others, and engage globally. Residents will be able to do the following: Identify community challengesMake a positive contribution to your communityAdvocate on behalf of othersParticipate on a local, national, and worldwide level Safety and Security For students who are living on their own for the first time, FIU Housing is a safe option. Campus police and Residence Life employees maintain security 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The first objective is to provide a supportive and safe learning and living environment for students. For more information, visit: https://housing.fiu.edu/

Name: Purdue University
Overview: Founded in 1869, Purdue University in Indiana is a public research university dedicated to advancing mathematics, science, technology, health sciences and engineering. Some of the programs offered include over 200 undergraduate, 69 doctoral and 160 graduate courses which consist of master, doctoral and professional certificate programs. Some of the areas covered include Applied Physics, Biomedical Engineering, Farm Management, STEM, Marketing, Veterinary Medicine etc. Aspiring students get to pick between 4 Purdue University campuses: Purdue University West Lafayette (the flagship campus), Purdue Fort Wayne, Indiana University- Purdue University Indianapolis and Purdue University Northwest. Depending upon the campus, the university offers between 70 and 350 different courses across the various levels. Students can also enrol at the Purdue Polytechnic Institute, which has 9 locations around the state, offering technical and scientific programs.Furthermore, for those unable to attend classes the conventional way, Purdue University Global and Purdue University Online provide many programs. Given the student diversity, the Purdue University fee structure depends upon various parameters, and there are specific courses such as Data Science, Management and Engineering, which charge additional fees. The estimated highest fee for an undergraduate course is USD 45,644. There is also an option for applying for one of the freshman Purdue University Scholarships or Financial Aid, awarded based on merit or need. The three scholarships are University-Wide Merit Scholarships, College-Based Scholarships and Financial-Need-Based University-Wide Scholarships. Numerous Purdue University Residences are available for students who wish to live on campus; the housing options are divided into co-ed, male and female. The university also consists of 11 cooperative houses, over 100 student organizations, 18 intercollegiate sports teams and over 80 fraternities and sororities. Purdue University is also one of the few in the country to have an LGBTQ Center. Based on placement records, Purdue University students, especially Computer Science majors, have received an average starting salary of USD 92,023.

Placement: On-the-job experience such as internships, practicums, and clinicals, according to Worcester State University, is a crucial component of a good education. Participating in an internship, according to a recent survey by the National Association of Colleges and Employers, provides you with a competitive advantage over other students. New graduates who had paid internships reported starting wages that were more than 20% higher than those who did not have internships during their undergraduate years. Internships Internships are designed to provide you with valuable job experience in your major while also allowing you to learn more about a particular industry, organisation, or vocation. Internships at WSU typically last a semester and provide a strategic opportunity to apply what you've learned in the classroom or laboratory to real-world situations. Internships provide essential job experience as well as a platform for learning new skills and expanding your professional network. As a result, you'll have a leg up on the competition in the employment market. Internships frequently result in employment offers from the company that hosted the internship. Practicums If you are pursuing a teaching degree at Worcester State University, you must complete a practicum, which is a semester of student teaching. You should apply for the student-teaching practicum the semester before you want to complete it. As a student-teacher in the early childhood and elementary education programme, you will begin by carefully observing, then progress to working on daily lessons with a host teacher, and then accept full responsibility for a classroom in your final two weeks. If you're a secondary education teacher candidate, you'll go from teaching one class to teaching four over the course of a semester. Clinicals Worcester State University's health-care programmes pioneered community-based, hands-on learning. The nursing, communication sciences and disorders, occupational therapy, and health sciences departments have built symbiotic relationships with healthcare providers, regional schools, and nonprofits, guided by their individual accreditation and certification exam standards.Clinics give you the opportunity to put your classroom and lab work to the test by caring for others in real-world situations and discussing new ideas, techniques, and perspectives with your partners. Your confidence will grow as a result of the experience, and you will be able to deliver an important service to the community.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation You will be a part of a vibrant and diverse community of roughly 1,600 full-time students who live on campus as a resident at Worcester State University. You'll form lifetime connections and share a college experience that will leave an indelible impression on you. The university is dedicated to providing a welcoming living-learning environment that encourages you to pursue your academic and personal goals.  The university is dedicated to providing a welcoming living-learning environment that encourages you to pursue your academic and personal goals. They are available 24*7, to meet your physical, emotional, and developmental requirements. Traditional to contemporary, the residence halls provide a wide range of pleasant living options. Each hall has a full-time, live-in residence director available 24*7, all year. A resident assistant is assigned to each wing or living space. All staff members in the resident halls assist with relevant, enjoyable programming that will help shape your academic and social development. The cost of living on campus varies depending on your resident hall room and food plan selection. All resident students must purchase a meal plan. Residence Halls Chandler Village About 420 upper-class students live in Chandler Village, which is an apartment-style community. Each apartment contains a kitchen and a common space and may accommodate 4, 8, 9, 10, or 11 people. Each apartment has a bedroom for one, two, or three people. Each complex has a conveniently placed laundry room. Chandler Village has a full-time professional residence director who lives on-site, as well as 12 student resident assistants. The RAs share apartments with four other people. Dowden Hall Dowden Hall is a 400-student residence hall with a traditional design. Each wing features a shared single-gender restroom and a corridor with beds on both sides. Residents share gender-specific restrooms and share co-ed bedrooms by room. Although the bulk of the bedrooms is meant for two people, there are a few single and triple-occupancy rooms available. On the first level, there is a laundry room as well as two sitting areas. It also houses the local student fitness centre and the C-Store, which sells coffee, salads, sandwiches, and snacks to students. It has a full-time professional residence director who lives on-site, as well as 13 student resident assistants who live on each floor's wing. Sheehan Hall The newest residence hall is Sheehan Hall. It holds 400 students, including first-year and upper-class, and includes the primary campus dining hall, which has two-story windows that overlook John F. Coughlin Field. Each suite has two double or four single rooms with a shared bathroom. This residence hall also includes Health Services, the Residence Life and Housing Office, a multifunctional room, a game room, student lounges, and a communal kitchen, in addition to housing students. The 2nd level houses a modest fitness facility, laundry room, and mailboxes for Sheehan Hall residents. It has a full-time professional residence director who lives on-site, as well as 12 student resident assistants who live on each floor's wing. Wasylean Hall Wasylean Hall has 348 upper-class students living in apartment-style living quarters. Apartments can accommodate 2, 4, or 6 people, and each one has a kitchen and a communal room. The lobby houses mailboxes for all students living in Wasylean Hall, Dowden Hall, and Chandler Village. Woo Scoops, located in Wasylean Hall, sells fresh ice cream, floats, shakes, and sundaes served on fresh waffle cones. On the first level, there are laundry facilities. It employs a full-time professional residence director who lives on-site, as well as ten student resident assistants. The University Police Department's offices are located on the first level. For more information, visit: https://www.worcester.edu/Life_at_WSU/Residence_Life/Residence-Halls/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.worcester.edu/Residence-Life/

Name: Humboldt State University
Overview: Humboldt State University, a public university in Arcata, California, is a 23-institute California State University member. Founded in 1913, the main campus spreads over 144 acres and has many satellite campuses and other academic buildings. The three academic colleges, namely the College of Natural Resources and Sciences, College of Professional Studies, and College of Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences, offer 48 undergraduate, 12 postgraduate, 73 minors, 51 majors, and 14 credential degrees. The average undergraduate tuition and fee are 17,368 USD, whereas that for postgraduate courses is 16,426 USD. However, an MBA degree can amount to 36,201 USD per year. Financial aid is provided through the HSU International Student Scholarship worth 1000 USD - 2,000 USD for academic achievers, athletic scholarships, and work-study facilities available at the campus. On-campus accommodation in traditional halls, suite-style, and apartments are provided to almost 2,100 students in single, double, and triple occupancy rooms.Applications through the official website are to be filled for intake into the Fall and Spring semesters with an application fee of 55 USD and 70 USD for undergraduates and postgraduates, respectively. The housing expense ranges from 4,938 USD to 8,686 USD and an application fee of 200 USD, while the meal plans cost from 2,176 USD to 6,924 USD. With a high placement rate, Humboldt graduates have an annual median salary of 36,600 USD. The campus provides several Greek life societies, more than 200 student clubs, organizations, and sports like rugby, baseball, volleyball, basketball, track, etc.

Name: Duquesne University
Overview: Duquesne University is a private Catholic university located in the state of Pennsylvania. The university was founded in 1878 as the Pittsburgh Catholic College of the Holy Ghosts, before going on to become the first Catholic university in the state. The university has nine schools and institutions that offer around 189 courses, including undergraduate, graduate and doctoral studies. The university has also been classified as a doctoral university for its high research output. The top programs at Duquesne University are Bachelors in International Business (BSBA), Ph.D in Nursing and MS in Supply Chain Management B The university main campus is located on 49 acres of land in the Uptown area of Pittsburgh. The campus is home to numerous historic buildings that accommodate classrooms, residential halls and offices. It is also the location of the Gumberg Library, which provides over half a million publications to students and faculty. The other campuses of the university are the Capital Region Campus and a campus located in Rome, Italy. The average annual costs of attending university come to around USD 57,000, with tuition fee varying according to the length and type of program chosen. The university promotes Catholic values on campus thanks to its Spiritian origins. It is also home to over 150 student clubs and organizations that promote collaboration and interaction for projects and non-academic activities. 19 fraternities and sororities help build the network of current students with alumni, improving their career prospects. The university is also represented in various collegiate sports by the Duquesne Dukes. A number of eminent personalities have graduated from Duquesne University over the years. Amongst the most notable alumni include basketball player Norm Nixon, Bishop of Pittsburgh David Zubik and former United States Ambassador to Ireland Dan Rooney.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Eligibility RequirementsApplicants for undergraduate admissions must have completed a high school diploma with a minimum GPA of 3.0 in the US equivalent. All other programmes at Duquesne require students to have acceptable SAT and/or ACT scores, with the exception of a few majors that provide test-optional admission. A combination score of 1130 on the SAT and 23 on the ACT is considered satisfactory.Indian Students' Country-Specific Requirements The Class 12 Board Examination or the International Baccalaureate diploma must be completed by students. In general, applicants should have received an overall grade in relevant qualifying exams that is similar to a B in the US system.Graduate and Postgraduate Eligibility Requirements The eligibility requirements for graduate programmes differ from one school to the next. In general, a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale in the United States is expected. Depending on the programme to which students apply, GMAT or GRE scores are also necessary.International Students' English Requirements International students from non-English-speaking countries, such as India, must demonstrate their language competency using one of the standardised English exam scores listed below:

Name: University of Louisville
Overview: A public research university in Louisville, Kentucky, the University of Louisville is part of the Kentucky State University System. It was founded as the first city-owned public university in the United States in 1798. The university promotes a personalised learning experience to ensure the future of its students as ethical, culturally aware and critical leaders with potential to make their impacts in the global world. Organised into 12 academic schools and colleges College of Arts and Sciences, College of Business, School of Dentistry, College of Education and Human Development, Graduate School, Kent School of Social Work, Brandeis School of Law, School of Medicine, School of Music, School of Nursing, School of Public Health and Information Sciences, and Speed School of Engineering. The university is one of the critically recognised, popular and praised educational institutes with 69% of acceptance rate It enables the students to explore different career options by providing diverse areas of study and over 200 undergraduate, postgraduate and doctorate degree programs to choose from. The vibrant and inclusive campus life at the university of Louisville is composed of the students hailing from different parts of the world. It reflects its academic excellence through courses from the programs of Criminal Justice, Curatorial Studies, Dental Education, English and Business. The average annual cost including the on-campus living cost can come around $ 36K but with various grants and scholarships offered at the university it can be brought down to $ 24K. With three campuses on Health Science Campus, Shelby Campus and Belknap Campus in parts of Louisville, the university remains equipped with residence halls, recreational halls, libraries, athlete centres, laboratories, conference halls and student organisations. It also maintains a successful alumni network of notable alumni to ensure a promising placement rate with personal and professional triumph for students.

Name: University of Illinois Springfield
Overview: The University of Illinois Springfield (UIS), founded in 1969, is a public institution accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate School of Business(AACSB). UIS offers a wide range of courses, including 30 bachelor's, 21 master's, and one doctoral program in business, management, education, human services, accounting, computer science, liberal arts, sciences, psychology, administration, and public affairs, along with 1,681 online majors.With an acceptance rate of 77%, the college also provides scholarships to its students to aid their cost of learning. UIS is home to over 85 student organizations and clubs. It provides exchange opportunities in 55 countries, including Australia, Canada, Botswana, China, Germany, The Gambia, Greece, Japan, Jamaica, Mexico, Poland, Nicaragua, the United Kingdom, and Romania, thanks to its strong international connections.The university's student government association provides opportunities for leadership development and promotes social, cultural, educational, and recreational activities on campus.

Name: The City College of New York
Overview: The City College of New York is in New York, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students.  In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. The City College of New York's main campus is in New York. The university offers over 14 undergraduate programs and 14 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. An international student's estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure, are around INR 24,38,139. The City College of New York offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Read more details about The City College of New York on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants from other countries All foreign applications are welcome!International students must have a foreign equivalent degree, a cumulative undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 (translational services to the US 4.0 GPA system are required if appropriate), and a minimum passing IBT (Internet-Based Test) TOEFL score of 79 or IELTS score of 6.5. Many of our international students, especially STEM-OPT students, stay for OPT after they finish their degree. Please make sure that the GPA system used in the United States is included in your application.Students who have completed any part of their secondary or post-secondary education outside of the United States and/or require a student (F-1) visa are considered international students. International students must submit a freshman or transfer application, as well as official certifications, complete transcripts, and translations, to be considered for admission (if necessary).Applicants with a temporary visa who do not speak English as their first language must take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). To learn more about the TOEFL, write to: Test of English as a Foreign Language, Educational Testing Service, Princeton, NJ 08541-6151, or go to their website.
Placement: Placements at City College of New York City College of New York hosts a number of job fairs and placement options for its students. Every year, companies including ARF, Bradford Group Global Marketing, CUNY Communications, McCann, MediaLink, and others come to the campus to position students. Its Career & Professional Development Institute provides a wide range of high-quality programmes and services to students and alumni. Counseling, workshops, seminars, and job fairs are all offered, as well as internship information and preparation. Graduates working in financial services can earn up to 152,000 dollars on average.Every year, City College of New York admits a large number of students. Admission to the college is moderately competitive, with a 45 percent acceptance rate. The college is well-known for its historical significance in producing a number of distinguished alumni over the years. It is without a doubt one of the premier institutes for overseas students interested in scientific and liberal arts education.

Name: Lancaster University
Overview: Located in Lancaster, Lancashire, UK, Lancaster University is one of the leading research-intensive universities in the UK. It is a public university established in 1964. This university is one of the top universities associated with GCHQ, CEH, NHS, EA, UFLA, Sunway University, and LEP in Brazil.The university has nine colleges responsible for offering around 18 research programs. However, the students are enrolled in the fields of management, finance, computer science, medicine, engineering, arts, entrepreneurship, economics, accounting, banking, and many more. M.Sc in Data Science, M.Sc in Advanced Financial Analysis, M.Sc in Money, Banking, and Finance, M.B.A, BEng Hons in Chemical Engineering, B.Sc Hons in Marketing, and M.Sc in Logistics and Supply Chain Management are some of the top courses that the university offers. The fee structure basically depends on the course a student chooses. Lancaster University also provides various scholarships and financial aid to its students. The average living expense of a student on campus is 109.76 pounds.Recruiting companies like Google, Credit Suisse, BBC, Johnson & Johnson are quite common in the university as it provides excellent placement options.
Course Ranking: According to the subject rankings of Lancaster University, its MBA programmes are quite well-liked by the ranking publishers. From 2016 to 2019, Financial Times ranked its MBA programme among the top 100 programmes worldwide. Additionally, since 2016, FT has listed its Master in Finance programme among the top 50 programmes worldwide. Additionally, it placed its Master of Management programme among the top 100 programmes worldwide. In terms of PG Business and Economics, Times Higher Education ranked it among the top 100 programmes in 2018 and 2019, but in 2020 it was ranked between 101 and 125.Lancaster rose one spot in 2021 to take 83rd place. Since 2017, The Guardian has ranked it among the top 20 in the UK for both accounting and finance and business, management, and marketing. Among UK universities, its engineering degrees are highly coveted. Since 2017, it has been ranked among the top 20 programmes in Chemical Engineering, Electrical & Electronic Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering by The Complete University Guide. Likewise, since 2017, The Guardian has ranked Lancaster's Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Electronic & Electrical Engineering programmes among the top 20 in the UK.
University Ranking: Lancaster University, a well-known college public research university located in Lancaster, Lancashire, UK, was established in 1964. With a focus on academic repute, QS World University Ranking has positioned it under the top 150 worldwide since 2017. Since 2017, THE, a publication that prioritises teaching, research, and citation, has ranked it among the top 150 universities in the world. From 2017 to 2020, Shanghai (ARWU) World University Ranking, which places an emphasis on research output and faculty quality, consistently ranked it between 301 and 400.Lancaster's ranking increased from 242 in 2018 to 177 in 2021 according to US News & World Report, which focuses on local and global reputation and citation. Therefore, we may conclude that Lancaster's performance has improved across the board. Since 2017, it has been ranked among the top 10 universities in the UK by The Complete University Guide and The Guardian.

Name: University of Worcester, (HOLMES EDUCATION GROUP)
Overview: The University of Worcester was incorporated in 1948 as Worcester Emergency Teacher Training College. The Privy Council affirmed the degree awarding powers of this institution in 1997, which resulted in its name getting changed to University College Worcester. It received university status in 2005, thereby receiving its present name. The HM Privy Council gave the University of Worcester the power of awarding research degrees in 2010. There are four sprawling campuses of this university that are distributed across Worcester. St John's Campus is known to be the site of this university's establishment. It is home to many teaching spaces, sports facilities, and residence halls. It houses the Worcester Students' Union, University's National Pollen, and Aerobiology Research Unit. This campus includes several facilities like AstroTurf pitches, Digital Arts Centre, Drama Studio, a multigym, and a sports hall. This university's City Campus is located at Worcester City Centre. It houses the Hive library, Worcester Business School, McClelland Health and Wellbeing Centre, and Jenny Lind building. The Severn Campus is situated along a riverbank and features the University's Arena, performance analysis suites, modern study facilities, and dance studios. The institution’s Lakeside Campus serves as an outdoor learning and activity centre. The University of Worcester consists of nine academic schools. They provide several part-time and full-time UG and PG programs in different fields like humanities, education, arts, sciences, nursing, psychology, allied health, environment, etc. It houses more than 10,800 students, including many international students from different nations across the globe. As per the Times Higher Education’s University Impact Rankings, the University of Worcester ranking was within the top 3 in the UK for Quality Education in three consecutive years - 2019, 2020, and 2021. It has also been the No. 1 university in England for gender equality in these three years of rankings. This institution maintains strategic partnerships with several prestigious international and local international institutions. This includes Iron Mill College in Devon, Coleg Gwent in Wales, and Birmingham Metropolitan College in England.
Eligibility Overview: English Proficiency RequiredIELTS: An IELTS of 6.0 (with no less than 5.5 in each component) or 60 percent in English from both standard X and standard XII will be considered for admission to our Undergraduate degree programmes. Postgraduate 6.5 on the IELTS (with no less than 5.5 in each element). Other English language credentials are also acceptable.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: HousingYour home away from home. Your place guaranteed!If you apply for university-managed housing by May 31st, you will be guaranteed a spot if you are a first-year undergraduate student who has accepted a conditional or unconditional offer. Because spaces are filled on a first-come, first-served basis, the sooner you respond, the greater your chances of getting your first-choice of lodging.We offer contemporary housing to accommodate a variety of budgets and demands, with over 1,000 single-occupancy rooms across our campuses. We prioritize your safety and comfort, thus all university-managed halls provide 24-hour security, 24-hour emergency maintenance, free contents insurance, and communal area cleaning. Internet connection (wired and wireless), utility charges, and a free gym membership are also included.Check: https://www.worcester.ac.uk/study/international-students/information-for-international-applicants/international-accommodation.aspx

Name: University of Cumbria
Overview: One of the newest public universities in the United Kingdom is the University of Cumbria. Carlisle served as the university's administrative centre when it was founded there in 2007. The other major campuses are in Ambleside and Lancaster. There are also classrooms and open workspaces in the "Energus'' facility in Blackwood Road, Lillyhall, Workington. The university is affiliated with the Cathedral Group and Million+. The College provides many undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral degrees. Additionally, there are CPD/short courses too. Furthermore, five departments at the University of Cumbria offer various multidisciplinary programs in multiple fields, namely the Institute of Business, Industry, and Leadership; the Institute of Health; the Institute of Arts; the Institute of Education; the Institute of Education; Natural Resources; the Institute of Science; and Outdoor Studies. Some famous courses ranked highly at this university are teacher training, law, and psychology. Around 9% of students studying at the University of Cumbria are international students, and there is one staff member for every 16.5 students. There are well-developed laboratory and library facilities offered to the students. Other facilities include sports and fitness programs. Stanwix Theatre, Vallum Gallery. The university provides on-campus living facilities for students. There are en suite to standard rooms with catering or self-catering options, costing around 75 GBP-120 GBP.The international fee structure ranges from 12,800 GBP - 15,500 GBP. There is financial aid offered to the students based on their academic excellence.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Academic Requirements:You must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Undergraduate60 per cent plus in tenth and twelfth grades, or 50 per cent plus in the tenth and 65 per cent plus in twelfth grades. PostgraduateFirst division or 60 per cent or more in a Bachelor's degree plus at least a year of work experience, or 55 per cent or more in a Bachelor's degree plus at least a year of work experience. English Requirements:You must meet the below-mentioned English language proficiency score requirements:

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: Carlisle is a terrific area to live and study, with a vibrant city centre, gorgeous surrounds, and a wealth of history. Find out what campus dormitories offer if you're considering going to school. Brampton Road Halls: One hundred thirteen rooms, including a mix of ensuite and ordinary single rooms and a fully equipped dining kitchen. Flats are shared by a group of 5-7 students.These flats, located near the college, have a courtyard atmosphere that is ideal for meeting friends or receiving inspiration for your creativity. Carrock Hall: Carrock Hall provides modern, fashionable student housing with 85 ensuite bedrooms, shared flats for 5-7 students, and a fully furnished open-plan kitchen/lounge.For your convenience, it's directly on campus. Denton Holme Denton Holme has 249 rooms spread among 25 townhomes, as well as resident parking and bike storage. The village is a 20-minute walk from Fusehill Street and a 40-minute walk from Brampton Road, with riverbank views.Host, Victoria Hall Management Ltd's student-facing brand, owns and manages Denton Holme Student Village. This accommodation is available through the University of Cumbria's application process. If you are selected, your information will be forwarded to the Host, who will contact you directly. Off-Campus Accommodation: The University of Cumbria is located in Lancaster, England. Hundreds of thousands of students go to this lovely metropolis to realise their aspirations and achieve success. As a result, finding student housing near the University of Cumbria will not be a problem. While there are several student housing options in the city, some of the more popular options include budget-friendly halls of residences, studios, student dorms, shared rooms, and economical, individual places (PBSA).Newcomers may find it simple to find a place to stay because the college provides accommodation for all first-year undergraduate students. The University of Cumbria offers a variety of housing options, from inexpensive flats near Lancaster City Centre to undergraduate halls near Scotforth that provide exclusive rooms and basic amenities to enrolled students. These locations are substantially closer to colleges and have lower maintenance costs, making them difficult to fill. For more, visit.

Name: University of Strathclyde
Overview: The University of Strathclyde is a public research university in Glasgow, Scotland. Founded in 1796, the university became the first technological institute in the United Kingdom in 1964 after receiving university status by the Royal Charter. The university has its disciplines and courses organized into the departments and faculties of Engineering, Humanities and Social Sciences, Science, and Strathclyde Business School. With over hundreds of programs, the university offers its students abundant opportunities for their undergraduate, graduate, and doctorate degrees. It hosts students worldwide by ensuring an inclusive and culturally nourishing environment for them to prosper.The courses from the disciplines of Accounts and Financing, Social Policy, Oral and Aural Sciences, English, and Tourism top the list to reflect the university's academic excellence. The average annual cost, including the on-campus living cost, can come to around Œ£ 35K, but with various grants and scholarships offered by the university, it can be brought down to accommodate the budgetary constraints of international students. The successful network of notable alumni in leading industries reflects a favourable placement rate with personal and professional triumphs for students.
Eligibility Overview: The University of Strathclyde has course-specific and country-specific entry requirements for international students. Indian aspirants need the following qualifications as per course/program:Undergraduate Admissions: Candidates applying for any undergraduate degree should have a minimum score of 70-75% in Grade 12 and an overall IELTS score of 6.5.Postgraduate Admissions: Applicants should have a first-class undergraduate degree from a recognized institution with a minimum score of 60% and an IELTS score of 6.5 overall. Graduates from the IITs and IIMs are considered for admission with an average of 55%. If you are applying for a research program, you are required to have a master’s degree and relevant research experience.MBA Admissions: A bachelor’s degree is required from a recognized institution with an IELTS score of 6.5 overall. GMAT score is not the standard requirement, however, applicants can submit the score if they believe it will strengthen their profile.
Placement: Careers Service International allows international students to gain experience while working as an intern and enhance their entrance to a professional career. Students of the University of Strathclyde get employed by around 6 months after completing education. Executive master is the highest-paid degree offered by the university with an average annual salary of 125,000 GBP (~1.26 lakh INR)
Accommodation: On-campus accommodation University provides accommodation to both undergraduate and graduate studentsAll Halls of Residence are self-cateringFor all residences rent includes, personal possessions insurance, gas, and electricity plus cleaning once a weekEach kitchen has a: Cooker with electric hob, Microwave, Fridge-freezer, Sink, Kettle, Toaster, Toasted sandwich maker, mop and bucket, brush and shovel, and Kitchen binA 'watched' CCTV system beamed back to University Security Control provides an extra level of security to hall residentsfor more detail click on this link-https://www.strath.ac.uk/studywithus/accommodation/
Course Ranking: Let's now examine the University of Strathclyde's course ranking! According to the Financial Times' rankings for the GMBA, Master of Finance, and Master of Management programs, Strathclyde is among the top 100 universities in the UK. The University of Strathclyde has been ranked by The Complete University Guide at position 2 in its Accounting & Finance Ranking for 2021 and at position 8 in its Business & Management Studies (UK) Ranking for 2021. The University of Strathclyde has also been ranked by The Guardian among the top 20 universities in the UK for accounting and finance as well as business, management, and marketing.The University of Strathclyde is ranked fourth in chemical engineering by The Complete University Guide and ninth in civil engineering for 2021. Strathclyde is ranked sixth in mechanical engineering by The Guardian, and tenth in electronic and electrical engineering for the year 2021. According to the aforementioned statistics, the University of Strathclyde's Accounting & Finance programme is well-liked in the UK.
University Ranking: The University of Strathclyde is a public research university with its headquarters in Glasgow, UK, and was founded in the year 1796. Strathclyde's standing in the Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking) university ranking has increased from 601–700 for 2019 to 401–500 for 2020. However, Strathclyde's position in the 2021 QS (Top Universities) world university ranking has dropped from 272nd rank for 2017 to 300th rank. Since 2017, Strathclyde has consistently been listed in the top 500 universities by THE (Times Higher Education). Another publisher, US News & World Report, has ranked Strathclyde at 406th in its ranking of the world's universities for 2021, up from 434th in 2020. Name: UWE Bristol
Overview: The UWE Bristol International College, in collaboration with UWE Bristol, provides quality education to students at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. This university offers 600 major student programmes in several disciplines. UWE also provides various short-term professional courses across different fields such as business and technology, arts, science, health etc. Being one of the top research-oriented universities, it carried out various national and international research-oriented programmes. For this, this university has achieved several recognitions and has contributed immensely to the global knowledge economy. As per the Guardian University League Tables 2022, the university holds 5th position for its philosophy programme and earned 21st position among the top 121 institutions in the country. This university maintains different campuses that offer a variety of facilities for their students to ensure a balanced academic life. Each of these campuses provides unique amenities to the students such as recreational space, design studios, health tech hub etc. With a student strength of approximately 29,000 and more than 3000 staff members; this university is one of the most popular educational institutions in the country. According to the National Student Survey (NSS) 2020, this educational institution earned a student satisfaction rate of 88%, which positioned it in the 2nd and 7th positions respectively in England and the UK. For delivering excellent teaching and learning programmes to the students, this university is Gold rated in the Teaching Excellence Framework. This recognised educational institution also helps students develop employability skills through pathway courses through which students can get access to different professional resources and network with experts who are successful in their respective fields. Students are offered lucrative opportunities to improve their professional skills and obtain high value career opportunities. Furthermore, UWE Bristol offers a range of competitive scholarships for international students provided they select their course early and ensure filling an application for the same.

Name: Durham University
Overview: Durham University is located in England. The university holds 563 acres of the estate with an ancient monument, more than 300 buildings, and additional 111 acres of woodland. Being 40 miles apart, the two major university campuses, Queen's Campus and Durham City, are connected by a frequently run bus service, With over 18,000 (30% international) students in 26 schools and 17 colleges. The university offers more than 200 graduate and 100 postgraduate courses and an online research portal called Durham Research Online (DRO). Durham University admits certified students to IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (92), SAT (1300), GMAT (600), and PTE (62) with a 72% acceptance rate. You can apply for three academic terms at Durham University- Michaelmas Term (October to December), Epiphany Term (January to March), and Easter Term (April to June) The average tuition fees for undergraduate and postgraduation students are GBP 17,500 and GBP 16,000, respectively. University also offers financial aid of up to GBP 2,000 to international students under various performance-based scholarship programs. With 97.9% placement rates (highest in the UK), undergraduates from Durham University get jobs in sectors like Law, Healthcare, Engineering, and Banking. University allows students to enrol in various internships and part-time jobs while studying.
Eligibility Overview: You may be qualified to attend a route programme at the Durham University International Study Centre if you do not meet the prerequisites for direct entry to an undergraduate or postgraduate degree. The International Study Centre, located on our Queen's Campus, provides a welcoming setting in which you will be introduced to the teaching style you would encounter if you continue on to your degree. The programmes are designed to help you improve your academic knowledge, study skills, and English language abilities. You can progress to your degree at Durham University City Campus after completing your pathway programme at the International Study Centre and earning the requisite grades.English Preparation, International Foundation Year, and Pre-Masters route programmes are available.
Accommodation: Durham University Library contains 1.5 million printed volumes in its five branches, Bill Bryson Library (main), Queenäó»s Campus Library, Leazes Road Library, Palace Green Library, and Durham Business School Library. With 63 listed buildings, the university also handles the Durham World Heritage Site, including Palace Green, Durham Castle, and Art Deco chapel. With an average expense of GBP 111 per week with different room and catering options, you can accommodate the on-campus hostels in every college with a TV room, Games Room, Cafí©, Study Space, and Laundry Facilities. There are around 220 undergraduate places and 30 postgraduate rooms available. The majority of our rooms are single, standard - with a single bed and common bathroom and toilet – but we also have 42 ensuite rooms, 26 shared rooms with two single beds, and several double rooms. All of the bedrooms feature a bed, a bin, storage, a desk and chair, and all but two have a sink. Please contact us for more information about our accessible accommodations.The University's price for College accommodation is adopted by St John's College, with certain changes to additional levies and reductions. These include not charging extra for 3/4 and double beds, as well as not offering discounts for rooms without a sink.for more information click on this link-https://www.durham.ac.uk/colleges-and-student-experience/colleges/st-johns/accommodation/

Theology & Religion, which is ranked seventh worldwide, and Archaeology are two of the university's top 10 fields of study (8th). The QS Global MBA Rankings have continuously placed Durham University's MBA programme in the top 100. It is listed as being in the 78th place in 2022. In the QS subject rankings, the Masters in Business Analytics programme is ranked 47th overall. According to the 2023 Times Higher Education rankings, the PG Business and Economics courses are ranked between 101 and 125. Courses at Durham University The Complete University Guide 2023 lists the Accounting & Finance course in third place. The Accounting & Finance course is ranked eighth in the 2023 Guardian rankings. According to the Complete University Guide 2023, Durham University's computer science programme is ranked among the top 10 in the UK. This course is listed as being in sixth place.

Located in Durham,UK the university is home to about 4499 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Durham University is ranked 141th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. Name: University of Law - Bristol
Overview: Founded in 1962, the University of Law – Bristol is one of the most sorted law institutes in the world. The Bristol campus is closer to the city centre and offers a vibrant, friendly atmosphere for students to study. As the city is the South West’s commercial hub, it provides a variety of amenities for students. Apart from its campus locations in the UK, the university also has international campuses in Hong Kong and Berlin. At the University of Law – Bristol, a range of courses are available for undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Courses available at the University of Law – Bristol are LLB Law, LLB Law with Business, LLB Law with Criminology, a postgraduate course in Legal Practice, LLM Company Law, LLM Corporate Governance GradCG, LLM Corporate Governance, LLM Employment Law, LLM International Business Law, LLM International Corporate Governance, LLM Master of Law (International) MA Law (Conversion), MSc Legal Technology and others. The University of Law also provides different scholarships for deserving students, such as Law First Scholarship, Choose Law Scholarship, The Daniel Turnbull Memorial Scholarship, The Lord Blunkett Widening Access Award, and others. The University of Law is one of the earliest specialized institutions for legal studies. As per QS World University Rankings, it received 5 QS Stars. The full-time fee of the university is approximately £13,600, whereas the part-time fee is £6,800. The University of Law – Bristol is equipped with all sorts of amenities such as a café, computer suites, libraries, free Wi-Fi, wellbeing services, a silent study area and others.  The University of Law – Bristol offers a wide range of courses for both undergraduate and postgraduate degree seekers. Students can also get the benefit of accommodation at the Bristol campus.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: For Undergraduate Students :  Only the Birmingham, Bristol, Guildford, Leeds, London Bloomsbury, Manchester, and Nottingham campuses are open to 17-year-olds.There are several courses which the university offers with different eligibility requirements. For Postgraduate Students :  Each of the postgraduate programmes has its own set of admissions requirements. English Language Proficiency :  Most programmes IELTS score required is 6.5 overall with no bands below 6.0Certain programmes demand a score of 7.0 overall with no bands below 6.5
Placement: The courses, in conjunction with the experienced Employability Service, seek to help the students become employable, ensuring that the goal of employment is ingrained in the teaching. The University is a five-star university in terms of teaching, employability, online learning, academic development, and inclusiveness, according to QS. Experts are accessible to help you at any time with career planning, applications, CVs, cover letters, and anything else they might require help with.The Employability Service staff will assist the students in search for internships, part-time jobs, volunteer opportunities, and graduate positions. They can count on the expert Employability Services team to assist them with everything from work experience opportunities to skill development guidance. The students can schedule appointments with the career counsellors on campus or over the phone for support and advice. Law :  The University provides a number of services to assist students, the students get their career off to the best start, whether it's career information from the Student and Professional Employability Programmes, a one-on-one interview with a career adviser, practical legal experience through the pro bono activities, coaching, or simply scanning the vacancy database for a job. Business :  The personnel of the University of Law Business School does more than only assist students in finding a career as a business graduate. They train pupils for a career in business. And you should continue to encourage the pupils throughout their careers. Regardless of their background or education, whether they study full-time or part-time, on-campus or online, whether they're looking for their first business graduate job, a career change, or to advance in their current position, the University has the skills, services, and passion to help them achieve their goals.
Accommodation: Off-Campus Accommodation There are ten student halls in Bristol that are available. These halls offer studios, flats, and single and en-Suite rooms within a few minutes walk from the university's Bristol campus. These student halls include a variety of services and amenities, including: Wi-FiAll-inclusive bills (Electricity, water, maintenance etc.)Bike storageCCTV security
