Name: Cambridge School of Visual & Performing Arts
Overview: CSVPA is a Cambridge Arts and Sciences Ltd sister school. The Institute owns & operates this international co-educational school that offers both day & boarding programs. Headquartered in Cambridge, it offers courses like foundation, undergraduate, extended diploma, postgraduate, English language, and online levels. It provides personalized portfolio advice and assistance. Weekly one-on-one rehearsals for theatre, music and auditions are included. It has also linked itself to Harper's Bazaar, Cosmopolitan, Esquire, ELLE, Hearst Magazine, and ELLE Decor, among others. There are the reasons why you should study at the Cambridge School of Visual & Performing Arts that can benefit you:As a student, you will be actively encouraged through a hands-on approach and substantial contact time with your lecturers. The college provides all of the equipment, materials, space, and time you need to discover and develop your distinctive voice and style as a creative artist. Their goal is to provide the best possible environment for you to achieve your full potential.They have several residence halls for students of varying ages, most of which are single ensuite rooms. The College and City Centre is within a short walk or bus ride of all student residences.CSVPA provides an iMac to students pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Graphics and Illustration.In a three-floored building, they have the following facilities maintaining top-notch standards:Five studios4 Drama studiosIllustration and Graphics and illustration studios3D studios for architecture as well as interior and product designCraft StudioWet and dye roomsGarment Construction and Pattern cutting roomsMetal and Woodwork workshopsFashion studiosFine arts studiosSound recording studiosMakeup studioCasting studio
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility requirements for admission to the Cambridge School of Visual and Performing Arts are here:17 years old and upLevel of EducationHigh school graduation (year 11 or year 12 depending on the original country) or 1 x A level or 2 AS levels at grade E or above, plus 5 x GCSEs at grade 4 or C or equivalent, particularly in a related creative field, are required.Students who do not achieve these entry standards will still be evaluated based on their ability to succeed independently.A portfolio of work includes personal and school work that has been completed and prepared.English Language ProficiencyIELTS 4.5  or more English Level is required for International Students
Placement: Here is some of the placement information you were looking for:They assist with interviews and auditions so that students get the best-paying jobs. They help students make performance portfolios that they can submit to leading production houses or employers.They also have a full-fledged student support system to prepare students for employment auditions and screenings.

Name: University of York, (KAPLAN)
Overview: Located in Heslington, the University of York has been revamping and developing its campus since its establishment in 1963. This esteemed university comprises 9 colleges, more than 30 research centres, and academic departments. The Privy Council accredits this university. Interested aspirants can confirm their entry into this university through on-campus preparation from the University of York International Pathway College or Kaplan International College for an off-campus pathway course.It offers multiple bachelor's, post-graduate and research programmes in different fields such as medicine, arts, sociology, archaeology, management, language etc. This university has a student strength of approximately 18,930. Approximately 25% of the students in this institute are from foreign countries. The University of York is partnered with recognised research institutions worldwide and is a significant part of an alliance with 24 acknowledged research-intensive universities. With an acceptance rate of almost 79%, this university offers scholarships and financial grants to eligible students. Moreover, in 2021, this university opened a new campus in Greece in collaboration with CITY College with several new subjects not previously offered, such as Neuropsychology, Human Resources, English Language Linguistics and Literature, and more. Also, it is the first university in the UK to offer emergency funds to students facing unanticipated costs due to a pandemic. One of the other distinguishing features of this college is that it offers outstanding professional training to the students and assists them in exploring lucrative employment opportunities in reputed organisations.

Name: CASS Business school
Overview: Located in London, England, CASS Business School is considered one of the top five schools in London. Established in 1966, the college is home to more than 4,000 students pursuing degrees in economics, business, entrepreneurship, management, accounting, and marketing. The Association of MBAs (AMBA), Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), and European Quality Improvement System all accredit the school (EQUIS).The CASS Business School offers undergraduate, postgraduate, diploma, and Ph.D. certificate courses, summer school programs, and executive education courses via both on-campus and online modes. The Business school operates under the City University of London, with its main campus at Northampton Square. The Ph.D. in Actuarial Science, B.Sc in Business Management, B.Sc in Analytics and Actuarial Science, M.Sc in International Business, and M.Sc in Marketing Strategy and Innovation are the top CASS Business courses the School offers. In addition, over 30 clubs and societies are associated with the Business School, handled primarily by the students. On-campus accommodation is provided by the CASS Business School in its residential halls. The City University of London comprises 11 residential halls divided between undergraduates and graduates. The tuition fees for international students are around 44,000 GBP. The students enrolled in this school are also provided scholarships or financial aid. There are more than five scholarships for undergraduates, around 15 awards and scholarships for MBA students, and more than 11 master's scholarships and waivers.
Eligibility Overview: More than 100 nations are represented among Cass Business School's international student community. International students must meet the entrance standards set forth by their home country. Candidates must have the following documents to be eligible for admission at CASS Business school: Bachelor's Degree: Higher Secondary Certificate Master's Degree: A Bachelor's degree is required for all MSc programmes.  English language proficiency requirements :  International students must submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:

Placement: Cass Business School graduates have gone on to work and intern at companies such as IBM, UNICEF UK, Lloyds Banking Group, Deloitte, UBS, J.P. Morgan, Warner Bros, Goldman Sachs, PwC, L'Oréal, and Morgan Stanley, to name a few. Executive MBA graduates at Cass Business School earn an average of 114,000 GBP (147,000 USD) per year, according to Emolument. Cass' Career and Professional Development Team offers development workshops, training, career guidance, and resources to Cass graduates to help them succeed in their careers even after graduation. Career fairs are another opportunity for students to meet with employers from reputable companies.
Accommodation: Accommodation for Undergraduate Students : Most Bayes students live in the university's residence halls for the first year before relocating into privately leased housing with friends in future years. Applicants can take help from the Student Centre's Accommodation team regarding housing facilities.  Halls OF Residence: The university's residence halls have private, modern study bedrooms and shared living spaces with internet connectivity.  Private Housing: Students looking for private rental housing can seek information and assistance from the Student Centre's Accommodation Service and Studentpad, a partnered interactive web-based service for private sector accommodation. For more information, visit:  https://www.bayes.city.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/student-life/accommodation Accommodation for Postgraduate Students : Bayes master's students are eligible to apply for City's postgraduate housing. For Bayes and City students, there are a variety of housing alternatives, including halls of residence for candidates wanting to rent privately, the accommodation team may be able to provide them with information, advice, and support.Please note, however, that the accommodation service will not accept applications unless the deposit is paid. For more information, visit:  https://www.bayes.city.ac.uk/study/masters/student-life/accommodation

Name: University of Reading
Overview: The University of Reading is one of the leading public universities located in Reading, England. Established in 1892, the University of Reading is an extension college of the esteemed University of Oxford. A red brick university, the University of Reading is ranked among the Top 30 UK universities. The institution has been at the forefront of higher education. It is a pioneer in academic innovation and initiating social change. The University of Reading offers a wide variety of pure and applied streams in business, social science, humanities, and the arts. Some of the top programs at the University of Reading are M.A. in Film, Theatre and Television, B.A. in Public Policy, M.A. in Languages and Culture. Spread across 395-acres, the University of Reading has four campuses: the Whiteknights Campus, the London Road Campus, the Greenlands Campus, and the extension Malaysia campus which formally opened in 2016.\ The Malaysia Campus is home to the prestigious Henley Management College. At the University of Reading, students are offered various career opportunities including part-time and full-time summer internships that allow them to nurture their skills. The average tuition fee at the University of Reading is 16,850 GBP. International students have access to government grants and merit-based scholarships. The University of Reading is a high-spirited place for students, with several student organizations and junior common rooms. The popular Junction11 Radio is a student endeavor. Besides, the institution also runs its very own publication titled Spark. The University has a wide range of activities and events that students can participate in. Independent film screening at the Reading Film Theatre is one of the most loved student attractions in the institution. The University of Reading Accommodation offers several residence halls that facilitate on-site student housing. With a multidisciplinary curriculum, the institution makes a significant social and economic contribution to society.
Eligibility Overview: Each course has its own set of entry requirements. Some programmes will require you to have a particular level of understanding in a subject before you can begin your degree; this is referred to as a subject requirement. All courses require you to meet a certain educational standard and obtain certain exam grades in order to be admitted.With their course information, most courses will give a typical offer. All courses at the University of Reading are competitive, so even if you have (or are expected to have) marks that match our typical offer, you will not be assured a place on a degree programme.Please keep in mind that the entry requirements listed on our course pages are simply a guide. Throughout the year, we may adjust entry criteria, so check online or contact the Admissions Office for the most up-to-date information. Furthermore, we consider each submission on its own merits, so don't rule yourself out.If you're not sure if your expected grades are acceptable for admission, ask our Admissions Office for help. If you are offered a place on a course, the requirements that must be met in order to accept the offer will be stated in your offer letter.
Accommodation: for on and off campus accommodation click on this link-https://www.reading.ac.uk/ready-to-study/accommodation

While Reading was ranked 151–175 for 2020 in THE's PG Business and Economics ranking, it has moved up to 101–125 for 2021, a notable increase.Since 2017, Reading has been listed among the top 50 universities in the UK for business, management studies and accounting. Reading has also been ranked by The Guardian in the bottom 50 spots for accounting & finance and business, management, & marketing. The University of Reading's rating in QS's Engineering and Technology ranking has dropped over time, from 296th in 2017 to 345th in 2020.For computer science in 2021, Reading is ranked 59th in The Complete University Guide. While THE's PG Computers ranking has continuously placed Reading between positions 401 and 500 since 2019. The information above reveals that the business and accounting programmes offered by the University of Reading are well-liked in the UK.

Name: Manchester Metropolitan University (INTO)
Overview: Manchester Metropolitan University is situated in the heart of one of the world’s most exciting cities as per Time Out City Life Index 2018 – Manchester. The Business School of this institute has received accreditation from AMBA and AACSB International. Also, the Department of Engineering is a partner of IET providing accredited degrees. The programmes at INTO Manchester are in partnership with Manchester Metropolitan University. The offered courses at Manchester Metropolitan University are aimed at helping international students in progressing to undergraduate degrees in the United Kingdom. Students get prepared for a direct entry to Year 1 of an undergraduate degree. These are offered in Business and Humanities, Science and Engineering, Art and Design. The International Year One is equivalent to the first year of study for an undergraduate degree and is offered in International Business, Accounting and Finance. Besides these, the institute also provides English Language courses in Academic English. This institute is a rising young University ranked in the top 200 universities globally under 50 years old as per Times Higher Education Young University Rankings 2019. It received university status in 1992. For the 2021-22 academic year, the tuition fees for new undergraduate students are around £9,300. Students pursuing postgraduate research would have to pay tuition fees. This covers research that leads to MPhil, Masters, MRes, and PhD by Research qualifications. This institute extends four different scholarship types for international candidates. These include research grants, postgraduate scholarships for specific courses, general and Chancellor’s international awards and sports scholarships. Manchester Metropolitan University strongly focuses on the development of employable graduates and industry-relevant degrees. It is linked with professional bodies such as CIMA, RIBA and ACCA. This institute offers comprehensive career services that help the students with placements, work experience, writing personal statements, developing CVs, meeting employees on campus and assisting students with volunteer work. The global community of this institute features over 320,000 Manchester Metropolitan University alumni in more than 170 nations.
Eligibility Overview: You must have both:passed Standard XII with a good gradeand the Higher Secondary School CertificateYou should have the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) at level 6.0, with no scores less than 5.5 in any section. We may accept equivalent qualifications.We will accept the following XII standard English State Boards with a score of 70% or above as an alternative to IELTS:CBSECISCE (ISC)We will accept the following XII standard English State Boards with a score of 80% or above as an alternative to IELTS:MaharashtraTamil NaduWest Bengal
Accommodation: The rooms that appear on our booking system are those that are currently available.If you don't see something you wish to book, you can still use the gateway, but there's no guarantee that something will become available.for more information click on this link-https://www.mmu.ac.uk/study/accommodation

Name: Nottingham Trent International College, (KAPLAN)
Overview: NTIC, or Nottingham Trent International College, is integrated into the Nottingham Trent University (NTU) campus. It is a public research university and is the 13th largest one in the UK. Besides this, the latest Complete University Guide 2022 also states that it is among the top 25 institutions in the United Kingdom for student satisfaction.NTU This university features more than 70 research centers and groups. This institution extends pathway courses in partnership with the university. Students willing to enter into a degree at this university can opt for a pathway course at NTIC.NTIC offers several course options at both undergraduate as well as postgraduate levels. Their courses, such as The Undergraduate: Foundation Certificate, are for students who have completed high school but do not meet the university entry requirements. This helps them gain entry into an undergraduate degree. While The Undergraduate: International Year One program combines university preparation with a degree in 1st year. The Undergraduate: International Year One with Internship program includes an online internship for all IYO subject areas at NTIC.The programs at the master's level catered to students who have a bachelor's degree or equivalent but do not meet the entry requirements for a master's can opt for the Pre-Master's program.The University Placement Service ensures a spot at a UK university for students who pass this institute's pathway course but do not satisfy the progression requirements of their desired NTU degree.
Eligibility Overview: English LanguageTo meet the University’s language requirements you’ll need one of the following:Higher Secondary Certificate (Standard XII) - Awarded by CBSE, ISC and select State Boards70/100 (70%) or 160/200 (80%)A degree from the following universities:The University of Mumbai; The University of Delhi; The University of Calcutta; The University of Bangalore; Savitribai Phule Pune University (formerly The University of Pune); The University of Chennai/Madras; Anna University; Osmania University; The University of Goa
Placement: Through the FutureHub platform, students can find hundreds of opportunities, course-approved experiences, and jobs in the UK. The school also offers business support to students who wish to start up a business of their own after graduation. The school employability team also offers career counseling, CV writing advice, interview skills, etc. The average annual salary of a Nottingham Trent University graduate in the UK according to PayScale is 26,000 GBP.
Accommodation: Nottingham Trent University accommodations are available at three campuses- Brackenhurst, City, and Clifton.The room rate ranges from 4,262 GBP to 8,875 GBP annually, covering bills and content insurance. The housing contract is usually for 44 weeks.Room types include Standard en suite, Double bed en suite, Studio en suite, Standard en suite, and Studio en suite. Amenities on campus include free Wi-Fi, 24/7 security, cleaning, laundry, Secure bicycle storage, etc.The New Hall at the Clifton Campus offers excellent en suite rooms with prices ranging from 7,247 – 7,505 GBP per year. The hall is close to the shop, the gym, lecture theatres, the pub, diner, and club.Students at the Clifton or Brackenhurst campuses who live in private accommodation in the city have access to the Go2 Uni 4 bus that conveys students every day from one campus to another and the halls of residence.For more detail click on this link-https://www.kaplanpathways.com/colleges/nottingham-trent-international-college/accommodation/

Name: Lancaster University International Study Centre
Overview: Lancaster University International Study Centre is based in one of the United Kingdom’s top 15 universities. The centre provides degrees that help international students adapt to the British way of life and navigate their career options in the UK. These programmes are offered via a collaboration between Lancaster University and a Study Group. As most students at Lancaster University International Study Centre are from foreign nations, the city of Lancaster will allow them to live a comfortable, safe life without spending too much. The city is renowned for its mix of culture and high-quality lifestyle. The study centre is located just 3 minutes away from the main campus building. It is on the city's outskirts, giving students a magnificent view and a quiet environment. To enhance the social life of international students, the university organizes events like Christmas Market, Campus festival, and the Graduation ball. Students can also access the Sports Centre, ranked sixth in the UK by the Times Higher Education Student Experience Survey 2015. Lancaster University International Study Centre offers International Foundation Year and Pre-Master’s Programmes, taught alongside the core modules. The programmes help the students transition from bachelor’s to master’s by training them in university-level study skills and academic modules. English Language Preparation programmes are offered to international students who cannot fulfill the English language requirement. To make students ready for a future career, career preparation is also a part of the syllabus. As these preparatory programmes are meant to provide a pathway to a master’s degree at Lancaster University, no scholarship or financial aid is offered.
Eligibility Overview: If you meet all of the program's entry requirements, you can begin your studies with a UKVI-approved Secure English Language Test (SELT).The results of the test must have been obtained within the last 24 months and must meet the minimum English equivalency score required for your chosen programme.IELTS Academic for the United Kingdom VITrinity Integrated English Skills UKPearson PTE Academic in the United Kingdom VILanguageCert International ESOL SELT PSI Skills for English UKVI (4 components)
Placement: Enhance your academics with a once-in-a-lifetime experience. To take on a new challenge, enhance your confidence, and develop new abilities, consider a study abroad or industrial placement degree.Study abroad, placements, or a combination of both are available in many of our programmes. Because our degrees are flexible, you can choose this option throughout your first year even if you haven't enrolled in one of those programmes from the start as long as you have done well in your studies.Check here: https://www.lancaster.ac.uk/lums/undergraduate/placements-and-study-abroad/
Accommodation: Welcome!You have the option of living in student housing or finding your own private accommodation. Living on campus with other students is an excellent way to maximize your student experience. Why should you live in University-managed housing?Lancaster University is one of the few collegiate universities in the United Kingdom. This means you live, socialise, and graduate alongside your college classmates. Even though you are studying at a huge, multinational university, you will feel like you are part of a smaller, close-knit group. You'll meet and interact with students from various courses, as well as share interests outside of your academics. On campus, there are numerous events to participate in.https://www.lancasterisc.com/about-us/accommodation

Name: Northumbria University
Overview: Northumbria University is among the many reputed universities in the UK and is famous for its business and research focus. It has tie-ups with the BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art, BINUS Design School, and International Centre for Life, offering great academic opportunities. The University of Northumbria has four major faculties: health and life sciences, engineering and environment, art, design, and social sciences, and the faculty of business and law. The university has an excellent reputation for its academic excellence. It has scored multiple awards for the same, including the 'Queen Anniversary Prize,' the highest form of recognition a UK university can get. Northumbria University is a diverse cultural confluence of students from over 120 countries. It offers students a great study and social-life balance and has facilities for research, sports, and recreation that are modern and attractive. The library at Northumbria University has one of the largest collections of print and e-books and journals and comes with round-the-clock IT support. The college has tie-ups with several prominent universities worldwide to help students outside the UK. Notably, the University of Northumbria has several programs that have either been sponsored or accredited by reputed professional bodies and top brands like BBC, NHS, and Nike.
Eligibility Overview: Northumbria University has a set of requirements for aspiring students. Below is an overview.For the Undergraduate Certificate:Standard XII/Class XII from CBSE, CISC: 65% and aboveFor Postgraduate Certificate:You must have an undergraduate degree55% (52% from Delhi/Mumbai/Pune Universities) for courses requiring a 2:265% (60% from Delhi/Mumbai/Pune Universities) for courses requiring a 2:1
Placement: Northumbria University has a Career and Employment Service cell that helps students plan their careers, find jobs, and brings recruiters to campus throughout the year. The college provides 1-1 support regarding personal development, career advice, and enhancing your employability rate. You can also sign up on Jobsonline to discover part-time jobs and volunteering options. Plenty of job fairs are held throughout the year, allowing you to meet potential employers and understand the business world closely. You can do the impossible with the proper support, and Northumbria is here to assist you through it. Some of the biggest names are associated with the University, including Nissan, BBC, NHS, Procter & Gamble, IBM, and Nike. The average salaries for graduates in different roles are given below.Master of Arts -GBP 32,000Bachelor of Arts – GBP 31,000Bachelor of Science – GBP 36,000MBA – GBP 60,000

Name: The University of Manchester Alliance Manchester Business School
Overview: Alliance B-school, Manchester, England, is one of the top colleges ranking 4th in the UK and 30th worldwide. It is a triple-accredited business school by AACSB (Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business), AMBA (Association of MBAs) and EQUIS (European Quality Improvement System). Honours courses are in Accounting; IT Management for Business; International Business, Finance and Economics; International Management; and Management. The PG courses are also offered under the study areas of Accounting and Finance; Entrepreneurship, Innovation and Policy; International Business and Management; Marketing operations and Business Analytics; People and Organisation. The school offers PhD in Business and Management; Accounting and Finance; Science, Tech and Innovation Policy. Other courses offered for the research and doctorate degrees, MPhil and MRes, are available in many subjects. A full-time MBA degree, Global part-time MBA and Kelly- Manchester. Students can take up courses as full-time or Part-time as they deem fit. There are on-campus and off-campus facilities available for student accommodation. The on-campus living would cost approximately $9000 per year (room rent and food). The study cost for undergraduate degrees would be $31,680 per year, and postgraduate degrees would cost $32,250 per year. The programs with the highest placements and salaries are executive management and change (Œ£89,000 annually), Energy Chemicals and Environment (£77,000 annually) followed by other courses. The campus facilities include a well-equipped library overlooking oxford road, reading places with space breaks, events and meeting spaces, observatories and laboratories.

Name: Liverpool Hope University
Overview: Liverpool Hope University, established in 1844, is affiliated with Christian Ecumenical and is the only university in Europe with Catholic and Anglican roots. Liverpool Hope University has a rich history extending 175 years and emphasizes the philosophy ‘educate in the round,’ meaning that it wants the holistic growth of the mind, body, and spirit of its students.The university houses two teaching campuses, one in the leafy suburb of Liverpool, Hope Park, and another specializing in creative and performing arts subjects in the Liverpool City Centre. The university also has an outdoor education center, Plas Caerdeon, in Snowdonia, North Wales, which provides outdoor activity courses.It maintains a 16:1 student-to-faculty ratio, with 13% international students out of over 6,000 students from 60+ countries registered across its undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Liverpool Hope University is a recipient of the Gold in Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) for its excellent performance in learning and teaching outcomes. Among the 130 United Kingdom universities, its students stood fourth in terms of satisfaction concerning the quality of teaching and living.

Hence, students have to furnish proof of the same for admission. Here are the minimum score requirements depending on the course:

Name: Royal Holloway University of London
Overview: Located in Egham, Surrey, England, Royal Holloway, the University of London was established in 1985. Spread over 135 acres, the University is a public university and known for providing quality education to its students. The campus is named one of the most beautiful colleges in the world. It has 20 departments in the fields of computer science, biological sciences, economics, business and management, drama, theatre and dance, computer science, etc. that offer a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and graduate research programs. Some of the top courses include LL.B., B.Sc. in Computer Science, B.Sc. in Biomedical Sciences, B.Eng. in Electronic Engineering, M.Sc. in International Management, M.A. in Marketing, M.Sc. in Computational Finance, M.Sc. in Information Security, etc. The fee for the courses ranges approximately between GBP 12,512 to 20,218. The University provides ample facilities to its students, including teaching and study spaces, sports facilities, bars and cafes, accommodation facilities, aerobic space, and a fitness suite. Also, students can be a part of various societies and clubs including Students Union and Student Media Clubs. The university offers on-campus accommodation in residence halls which are both catered and self-catered to its undergraduate students, and graduate students live in self-catered halls. The residence halls have single rooms and shared rooms with a variety of facilities for the students. The meal and hostel expenses amount to GBP 6,643. Scholarships are offered by the University to international students to study in the U.K. and departmental or academic scholarships are also offered by specific departments. Job opportunities are also offered to the students, such as internships, part-time jobs, micro placements, etc., and career fairs and other workshops are also organized on the campus.
Eligibility Overview: English language proficiencyIf English isn't your first language, you'll need to show that you've completed a recognised English language course.If your language scores are slightly below the acceptable level, you may be eligible for a pre-sessional English language course, which will allow you to avoid retaking any exams or tests.You may not need to take an IELTS or comparable test if you received your secondary education in an English-speaking country or in English (such as International A-levels).If you wish to double-check, use our application query form.Year One of the International CalendarIn January, begin International Year one and go on to the second year of your undergraduate degree in September.The International Year One, which is equivalent to the first year of an undergraduate degree, provides academic and English language support tailored to international students' needs. The level of English assistance you receive is determined by your IELTS score, with options for IELTS scores of less than 6.5 and alternatives for IELTS scores of more than 6.5.
Accommodation: Going to university is an exciting prospect. You'll be off to a fantastic start if you choose the perfect spot to reside. There are several options available to you, both on and off campus, so you may select a location that suits your needs at every level of your studies.for more information click on this link-https://www.royalholloway.ac.uk/student-life/accommodation/
Course Ranking: Currently, we can see that Times Higher Education (THE), in its PG Business and Economics ranking, has mainly maintained Royal Holloway University of London (RHUL) between 126-150 since 2018. According to The Complete University Guide's rankings for accounting & finance and business & management studies, RHUL is one of the world's top universities in the United Kingdom. The Guardian's rankings for business, management, and marketing, as well as accounting and finance, have kept RHUL in the top tier of UK universities.In both the UK publisher's rating and the Business and Management ranking, RHUL's standing has increased. Additionally, from 2019 to 2021, THE regularly ranked RHUL in 251-300. RHUL is ranked among the top 50 universities in the UK for computer science by The Complete University Guide. According to the aforementioned facts, RHUL's computer science programme is well-liked in the UK.
University Ranking: Established in 1985, Royal Holloway University of London (RHUL) is a relatively new institution of higher learning. RHUL's position in the Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking) list of top universities fell from 501–600 in 2019 to 701–800 in 2020. RHUL's position in the QS (Top Universities) global university rating dropped with time, from 235th in 2017 to 308th in 2021. Similarly, Times Higher Education (THE), which ranks the best universities, has lowered RHUL's position from 173rd in 2017 to 301-350 in 2021. The data from THE shows that RHUL has fallen short on important metrics like teaching, research, and citation (research influence).In its ranking of the world's universities, US News & World Report also degraded RHUL's standing from 2020 by 20 points, placing the institution at 378th place for 2021. But RHUL has continued to hold a commanding position among UK universities. Since 2017, RHUL by The Guardian and The Complete University Guide have been among the top 100 universities in the UK.

Course Description: Royal Holloway University of London is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Royal Holloway University of London was founded in 1879. Located in Egham,UK the university is home to about 2086 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Royal Holloway University of London is ranked 1307th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 6 undergraduate and 2 postgraduate programs. Royal Holloway University of London has 1 intakes in Sep. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Royal Holloway University of London is around £17,800- £27,200.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Royal Holloway University of London include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Royal Holloway University of London is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Royal Holloway University of London has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Ulster University
Overview: The New University of Ulster is highly reputed in Northern Ireland and was founded in 1968. The University of Ulster is affiliated with the Universities in Ireland and Universities UK and is also an active member of the European University Association and the Association of Commonwealth Universities.The university has various campuses in Jordanstown, Belfast, Coleraine, and Derry, as well as Birmingham and London, and each of the campuses include state-of-the-art teaching, research, accommodation, and support amenities.The Belfast campus provides architecture, hospitality, photography, digital animation, and event management programs. The Coleraine campus offers subject areas like- biomedical sciences, psychology, history, geography, environmental science, pharmacy, tourism, media and journalism, English, and teacher training. The campus in Jordanstown offers programs in engineering, business, social sciences, communication, education, science, and sports. The Magee campus in Derry has programs in business, cinematic arts, drama, music, engineering, computing, law, nursing, and the Irish language.The fees for undergraduate and integrated masters courses, including accommodation, book and supplies, and meals, lie between 14296-14338 GBP. The university also provides financial aid and scholarships to its students, including GREAT Scholarships, International Foundation Scholarship, and International Undergraduate Scholarship.
Eligibility Overview: Foundational Education Indian Standard XII with a 50% total average, including passing five subjects (Maths required for STE pathway) Undergraduate Programmes Please verify the relevant course in the undergraduate online prospectus as each programme will have slightly different criteria, both in terms of overall points and specific subjects. Ulster University typically accepts applications from individuals who: All Indian Standard XII (Central Boards or a State Board) students must have a 60% overall average, with at least 50% in 5 subjects. Where a course includes subject-specific prerequisites, 60% of each of those prerequisites must be metOrA three-year degree in engineering or technology with a 60% overall grade point average from a state board of technical education (Accredited by ACITE)Math at GCSE is requiredIndian Standard XII Grade B: 60%Indian Standard XII, Grade C: 50%OrStandard X for CBSE or CISCE60% for grade B50% for grade C Graduate Programmes Typically, universities require applicants for taught programmes to have the equivalent of a first-year degree from the United Kingdom (usually in a relevant subject area). Please refer to the online prospectus's detailed description of the specific entry requirements for your selected course of study. Students with high marks in the following are taken into consideration: Master's Degree60% of a 2:155% of 2:1 English Language Proficiency:

Name: University for the Creative Arts
Overview: The University for the Creative Arts (UCA) is located in Canterbury, England. Students can enrol in undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programmes in various fields and online degree programmes for distant learners. The estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around 1916961 INR. The university also offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students.In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.

Placement: Placement is required for professional registration programmes such as nursing, teaching, and social work, but you can still obtain vital vocational skills in a real-world setting if you're studying business, computing, engineering, science, or the creative industries. Because of the developing international collaborations, work experience overseas may also be an option.
Accommodation: The University For The Creative Arts forms a safe haven for students who want to study at the university. The university provides the student with the necessary accommodation. On-Campus Accommodation :  All new international students who apply before the primary room allocation, which takes place in mid-June, are assured university housing.Self-catering single study bedrooms with shared or en-suite amenities make up the majority of the accommodation.Accommodations are available on all four of the university's campuses. For more information, visit:  https://www.uca.ac.uk/study-at-uca/accommodation/  Off-Campus Accommodation :  The typical monthly rent is between 500 and 600 pounds.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.The majority of the student accommodations are dispersed across the convenient location, with student rooms that are well designed and equipped.There is a security crew on-site and a protected door entry to the facility to ensure complete security.

Name: University of Birmingham
Overview: The University of Birmingham, established in 1825 as the Birmingham School of Medicine and Surgery, is a public research institute in Edgbaston.Enrolling over 34,075 students across all degree programs, the university offers more than 350 undergraduate, 600 postgraduate, 140 research courses, and 450 Ph.D. opportunities. Furthermore, it has five colleges (Social Sciences, Arts & Law, Medical & Dental Sciences, Engineering & Physical Sciences, and Life & Environmental Sciences). Some courses taught here are Anthropology, Drama and English, Theology and Religion, Economics and Marketing. To make University of Birmingham education accessible to everyone all around the globe, the university has introduced initiatives like Distance Learning courses for postgraduates, free Massive Open Online Courses, and Continuing Professional Development Courses. Some of the disciplines taught under these initiatives include Biological Sciences, Geology, Civil Engineering, LLB, and Global MBA. The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is GBP 9,250 per year for UK students and GBP 19,020 for international students. Financial aid is available to UK and EU undergraduate students in the form of a Tuition Fee Loan through the Students Loan Company. In contrast, US and Canadian students can take advantage of the Direct Subsidized Stafford Loan, Direct Parent PLUS Loan, Smart Option Loan, etc.
Eligibility Overview: Foundation Pathways For consideration for admission to Birmingham Foundation Academy, candidates must hold a Standard XII Higher Secondary Certificate with an average score of 65% from the ICSE, CBSE, or West Bengal State Board. The general requirement for all other state boards is 70%. You must have at least a 65% grade in mathematics from the ICSE, CBSE, or West Bengal State Boards to be eligible for the Engineering and Physical Sciences programme. You must have at least a 65% grade in biology from the ICSE, CBSE, or West Bengal State Boards in order to apply for a biology-based degree. Undergraduate Indian Standard XII graduates will be given consideration for admission to the first year of undergraduate degree programmes. A*AA = 90% ISC, CBSE, Maharashtra or 85% West Bengal or 95% Other State boardsAAA = 85% ISC, CBSE, Maharashtra or 80% West Bengal or 90% Other State boardsAAB = 80% ISC, CBSE, Maharashtra or 75% West Bengal or 85% Other State boardsABB/BBB = 75% ISC, CBSE, Maharashtra and West Bengal or 80% Other State boards Graduate School Taught A four-year bachelor's degree; (first-class or very good upper second-class)Or: A three-year Bachelor's degree with honours from an Indian institution of repute.Holders of three-year degree programmes (first-class or very good upper second-class) from reputable Indian schools will be taken into consideration for MSc programmes by the Business School.Birmingham is glad to welcome applications from 3 or 5-year LLB holders from top colleges in India for admittance into LLM programmes. English Proficiency Requirements

Name: International College Dundee
Overview: International College Dundee is located in Dundee, Scotland in the United Kingdom. The college is affiliated with the University of Dundee, established in 1881. It is among the top universities in the UK. This college offers study programmes for undergraduate, and post-graduate degrees as well. It is situated on the campus of the University that offers various facilities to its students. Students of the International College of Dundee automatically become eligible for the University. The college offers a broad range of subjects such as Design and art, Law, Nursing, Business, Biomedical, and Life Sciences. Other subjects such as Social Studies, English language, and Engineering for bachelor's and master's degrees are also taught here.The small size of classes and friendly environment is one of the major student attractions. It is situated on the eastern coast which gives a great view of colorful landscapes and greenery. Around more than 1800 students from above 45 countries arrive every year for admission. The average tuition fee for students is around 270000 USD per year. Hence, the average cost of living may reach around 4,200 USD per year. Some of its scholarship programs are “ICD Progressing with Excellence Scholarships (PWES)”. It is given to those students who excel throughout the academic year with the highest grades. Another scholarship programme is known as College Citizen Scholarships (CCS). The CCS is given to four students who can make a positive change for the college.Another scholarship programme that the International College of Dundee offers is the "College Citizen Scholarships". This scholarship is provided to those students who are studying MSc in Islamic Finance. Dundee University is the single University in the entire UK where students apply for postgraduate qualifications along with an internship with top companies.

Name: Imperial College London
Overview: Imperial College, founded in 1907, and ranked as the No.1 college in London, is among the most prestigious colleges. It is a public university, with the main campus in South Kensington, an innovation campus in White City, and the Silwood Campus, which is exclusively for post-graduation with advanced laboratories and academic buildings. Imperial College is accredited by the BCS and IET and offers many UG and PG courses. The college exclusively focuses on science, engineering, medical, and business programs, out of which BSc, MSc, B. Eng, M. Eng, and MBBS are the courses offered. In addition, it has free access to other professional courses. The college provides three-year duration UG courses and a four-year integrated Master's Degree with a fee structure that ranges from EUR 28,000 to EUR 30,000, whereas the PG course is for one year with a fee structure of around EUR 30,000-EUR 35,000. The college also offers Scholarships, part-time jobs, and loans for student education.Imperial College provides excellent career services to students from the first year, including one-to-one sessions with professional career consultants, daily skills seminars, and a free CV checking service. Students passing out from Imperial College get placements across the UK and other countries.

Name: University of Sunderland
Overview: Located North East of England in the port city of Sunderland, the University of Sunderland is a public research university that gained the status of a university in 1192. With three campuses in Sunderland and London and one international campus in Hongkong, the university promotes the idea of sweet absorption of knowledge through its motto while ensuring the transformation of its students into aware and leading citizens of the global world. The disciplines at the university are organized into five uniquely designed faculties: the faculty of arts and creative industries, the faculty of business, law, and tourism, the faculty of education and society, the faculty of health sciences and wellbeing, and the faculty of technology. Each of the faculties is constituted by several schools and research centers. Named the University of the Year for Social Inclusion, the university hosts tens of thousands of students from different parts of the world by maintaining zero tolerance for discrimination. It offers more than 2,000 undergraduate and postgraduate courses from other programs, and its academic brilliance is reflected in the Tourism, Nursing, Engineering, and English Programs. An accessible and global university, it ensures various opportunities for its students through its spread-out networks of partner colleges and other organizations. The successful network of notable alumni catalyzes a favorable placement rate for the graduating batch.The average annual cost, including the on-campus living cost, can come to around £ 15,000. Still, various grants and scholarships offered by the university can be brought down to accommodate the budgetary constraints of international students.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: High school certificate or diploma with a score of a minimum of 75-90% or higher in Grade 12. Postgraduate: A first-class undergraduate degree from a reputable university or its equivalent in your own country. MBA: A three-year bachelor's degree with a minimum of 50–55 per cent in a related discipline. English Requirements:

Name: University of Central Lancashire ONCAMPUS UK North Centre
Overview: Founded in 1828 as the Institution for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge, the University of Central Lancashire is primarily a public university in Preston city, Lancashire, England. In 1992, this Institution received its university status from the Privy Council.  As per statistics, this university is the 19th largest in the UK in student strength. This university comprises researchers and students from more than 100 countries and associations with 125 international institutions. The urban campus of this university is in Preston, and the other one is located in Burnley, Westlakes in West Cumbria.  It has a base campus in China's Shenzhen Virtual University Park, conducting effective research with China's top-notch universities in nanotechnology with applications in fire toxicity, water purification, etc. The academic framework of this university comprises several schools providing over 400 undergraduate and more than 200 postgraduate programs.  Besides, it offers several career-related courses in multiple disciplines such as psychology, engineering, arts, business and management, social science, design and fashion, language and global studies, media studies, etc. This university is home to more than 30,000 students from various countries, including Greece, India, Singapore, etc.  This college's research activities are popular as they involve working with NASA on a solar dynamics project in association with the Department of Health on Stroke Research. This university is known for establishing one of the largest paid undergraduate research internship schemes.  This campus offers one of the most competitive courses in the UK and several routes to studying medicine through partner institutions. However, as per the Complete University Guide, this university is ranked at 70th place. With a graduate employment rate of nearly 95.5%, students are employed within six months of graduation.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the minimum eligibility requirements for candidates to be considered for admission :  For Undergraduate : 50% overall scoreIf a certain topic is necessary for admission to a degree program, it must be completed with a grade of 55%.3% margin to be considered by UCLan staff based on the institution's reputation, work experience, etc.65% or 70% in Year 12 English – dependent upon State Board For Postgraduate : 75% in Year 12 English OR 70% average grade in Year 11 and Year 12 English provided Year 12 is not below 65%.58% in bachelor's degree.
Placement: Faculty of Science and TechnologyWork placements are an excellent method to improve one's employability while gaining valuable experience. It's also a terrific method to put one's talents to the test and stand out while applying for graduate positions. The university provides an optional work placement in the industry to enhance your job experience. The length of this varies by program and can range from a year, 6-12 months, or shorter work placement of between 10-15 weeks. Business Administration with Professional Placement  The Master of Business Administration with Professional Placement is an internationally recognized business management degree. It's a rigorous two-year curriculum that focuses on leadership and strategic management, which sets it apart from other master's programs. What pupils will discoverLearn how to establish a new business and hone your entrepreneurial skills.Take on project work in business management on a topic that interests you and is relevant to your future career.Analyze the primary difficulties that the world's largest firms face using the most up-to-date business management concepts.
Accommodation: The University wants the students to enjoy their time at the University and feel safe in accommodations. Whether the student stays within the campus like Preston, Burnley, or Westlakes, the skilled and friendly staff will help settle in quickly and feel at ease.The University provides several accommodation options that provide excellent value for money in a safe, active, and inclusive hall community. Name: Royal Agricultural University
Overview: Royal Agricultural University is a public institution of higher learning in the South-Western County of Gloucestershire, England, and is situated in the market town of Cirencester.  The university offers undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in rural land management, business, agriculture, food, animal science, equine science, farm management, and other related fields. Additionally, several certificates and short-term courses are available to students in agriculture and environmental studies. Students need an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher with a minimum of 5.5 in IELTS academic sectionsThe university offers the ‘Great scholarship’ worth £10,000 for PG courses.90% of the students from RAU are employed within 6 months of graduation
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Undergraduate Degrees Standard XII must be completed with a minimum of:60% (for ICSE, CBSE, ISC, and West Bengal Boards)70% (for all other boards)ORA recognised foundation course must be completed.ANDIELTS band score of 6.0 or higher overall, with no less than 5.5 in any of the 'academic' IELTS components.Academic transfers to RAU are allowed in Years 2 and 3. Bachelor's degree Standard XII must be completed with a minimum of:50% (for ICSE, CBSE, ISC, and West Bengal Boards)60% ( for other Boards)ORA recognised foundation course must be completed.ANDUKVI IELTS band score of 6.0 or higher overall, with no less than 5.5 in any of the 'academic' IELTS components. Taught Postgraduate DegreesA minimum of 50% in a four-year bachelor's degree or a minimum of 55% in a three-year bachelor's degreeIELTS band score of 6.5 or higher overall, with no less than 5.5 in any of the 'academic' IELTS components.
Accommodation: In 1842, the Fairford and Cirencester Farmers' Club held a conference when the formation of the Royal Agricultural College was first proposed. The college officially started operations in 1845 with only 25 pupils thanks to Queen Victoria's Royal Charter. It was given university status in 2013 and given its current name. In the heart of Cirencester, RAU boasts a stunning 25-acre campus encircled by the Cotswolds' undulating hills.There are 11 on-campus resident halls where the institution offers housing for its students, with both catered and self-catered options. The site also offers a chapel, a health center, counseling, IT services, and various dining options. The restaurant serves various meals and beverages and is the main campus dining hall.On-Campus Accommodation  RAU provides on-campus housing for its studentsThe accommodation is a mix of catered and self-catered, with the Dinner Bed and Breakfast option being the standard; however, students can upgrade to a fully catered packageRAU also has silent rooms for students who seek a more relaxing atmosphereOn-campus housing link

Name: Goldsmiths, University of London
Overview: The Goldsmiths, University of London is a university located in London, UK. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Computer Engineering. The main campus of Goldsmiths, University of London is located in London. The university offers over 3 undergraduate programs and 1 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around 1052. Goldsmiths, University of London offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Goldsmiths, University of London on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: In most cases, you should have (or expect to get) an undergraduate degree in a relevant topic with at least a second-class standing.You must also meet our fitness to train requirements for some of our master's degrees.To study with us, you must complete our English language requirements if English is not your first language. Our programme pages have a list of these. When you begin your studies with us, your English language qualifications should be less than two years old.We usually request IELTS since it allows us to see which aspects of your English need to be improved. We do, however, accept a variety of alternative English language credentials.If you require further assistance in meeting our English language standards, we offer courses that can assist you. Pre-sessional English Language courses are available to help you enhance your English skills in preparation for your main term of study with us. International Pathways are also available, which can help you prepare for degree-level study at Goldsmiths or another UK university.
Accommodation: Whether you prefer the supported setting of halls or more autonomous living, we have a variety of options for you.Our devoted resident life team ensures that no matter where you live, you'll be a part of our vibrant and welcoming campus community.for more information click on this link-https://www.gold.ac.uk/accommodation/

Name: University of Northampton
Overview: Founded in 1975, the University of Northampton in Northamptonshire, England, gained the status of a university in 2005. It is a renowned public university dedicated to transforming lives and inspiring change.It is one of the institutions awarded Gold in the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) for its exceptional practice of inspiring positive change in its students. By offering hundreds of programmes in various disciplines, the university has become a popular choice for students seeking admission in undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. Its academic strength lies in the popular courses in the Fashion, Business, Illustration, Interior Architecture, and Film programmes. The University ensures multiple opportunities in terms of internships, projects and careers for its students. They are guaranteed to experience a world-class academic culture and holistic engagements through the multitude of co-curricular activities organized by different student bodies at the university.The average annual cost, which includes the living charges, can come to around Œ£ 20K, but with many grants and scholarships offered by the university, it can be brought down to accommodate the budget for international students.
Eligibility Overview: International applicants need to meet the programme and course-specific criteria English language proficiency requirements: Bachelors degrees: IELTS 6.0 overall, with a minimum of 5.5 in each band (or equivalent)Masters degrees: IELTS 6.5 overall, with a minimum of 6.0 in writing and 5.5 in each other band (or equivalent)Postgraduate research degrees: IELTS 7.0 overall with a minimum of 6.5 in each band (or equivalent)
Placement: One of the many advantages of studying at the University of Northampton is that many academic programmes provide opportunities for practical work-based learning to supplement your studies. Work-based Learning (WBL) allows you to gain work experience while also earning an award by completing module assessments that reflect on your experience.Every year, 3,500 students participate in WBL as part of their coursework, with high module pass rates (93 per cent).Placements, client briefs, internships, and paid employment are all examples of WBL. Professional recognition will be given to some of the work placement programmes. All combined honours students are eligible for optional placement years, which are always funded. The Changemaker Hub, which is available to all confirmed offer holders, can help you. So, even before you begin your studies at the University of Northampton, you can begin to consider the skills and knowledge you want to focus on to improve your employment prospects. The university does encourage you to discover your own WBL opportunities for some of the courses, but this allows you to put your previous job experience to good use while also improving your employability. You'll be supported by the Changemaker Hub and your course teams, who will make sure you have the correct WBL chances to fit your course's criteria as well as your particular interests.
Accommodation: At the University of Northampton, we understand that choosing the perfect place to live while you study may have a significant impact on your university experience. Whether you prefer to live in our halls of residence or privately-owned housing, we have a variety of options to fit your needs. In the three university-owned Halls of Residence sites: on the Waterside campus, in the town centre (St. John's Halls), and Scholars Green Student Village, the university has over 2,250 beds.Standard single and twin rooms, en-suite rooms, townhouse rooms, and studio apartments are all available at inexpensive, comfortable, and secure rates to suit all budgets and demands. All rooms are completely furnished and include network and Wi-Fi connectivity, as well as access to hall facilities and lodging services, 24-hour security, and a dedicated support team. For more information, visit: https://www.northampton.ac.uk/student-life/accommodation/  On-Campus Accommodation Waterside Student Village The on-campus Student Village has been designed with your studies and social life in mind; living on campus at Waterside is a great opportunity to live away from home for the first time, with all the support and facilities you may need right on your doorstep, including our 24-hour-access library, Student Information Desk (SID), and Students Union clubs and societies. Waterside campus is close to Northampton town centre, so you'll simply have to go a short distance to catch a train or a bus home.Apartments with large, small, and accessible en-suite rooms, townhouse rooms, and studio flats, all with hall facilities and services, are available in Waterside Student Village. Some halls are namely Charles Bradlaugh Hall of Residence, Francis Crick Hall of Residence, Margaret Bondfield Hall of Residence, John Clare Hall. All the Halls of Residence include the following:Free Wi-Fi internet accessHeating, lighting, and water included in your rentKitchen (with appliances incl. toasters, microwaves, etc) and living areaWashing machines and dryersRecycling and waste collectionDedicated support team24-hour securityRoom insurance included in your rent For more information, visit: https://www.northampton.ac.uk/student-life/accommodation/halls-of-residence/waterside-halls/  Town Centre Accommodation St. John's Halls (NN1 1DH) is located in the centre of Northampton, among supermarkets, restaurants, and shopping.For lectures and on-campus events, the town centre accommodation is only a five-minute walk through neighbouring Becket's Park, and you will still be assisted by our 24-hour Security and Residential Life professionals.Flats with single en-suite rooms, as well as single and twin studio flats, are available at St. John's Halls, and all feature hall facilities and services.St. John's House is right next door and offers standard single and twin rooms on a termly basis for students on short courses or postgraduate students who prefer a quieter setting. All the Halls of Residence include the following: Kitchen (with appliances incl. toasters, microwaves, etc) and living areaHeating, lighting, and water included in your rentRecycling and waste collectionWashing machines and dryersFree Wi-Fi internet accessRoom insurance included in your rentDedicated support team24-hour security For more information, visit: https://www.northampton.ac.uk/student-life/accommodation/halls-of-residence/st-johns-halls/   Off-Campus Accommodation Scholars Green Student Village Scholars Green Student Village (NN2 7AG) is located in the surrounding area of Kingsthorpe and is ideal for individuals looking for a calmer atmosphere or a lower budget.The student community is located about 4.5 miles from Waterside and features a free Uno bus service that runs frequently to school, as well as a convenience store, post office, and hall facilities and services.Single en-suites with common kitchens and twin en-suite 'bedsits' are available at Scholars Green Halls (Simon Senlis, Spencer Perceval, and William Carey), Simon Senlis also has single studio flats. All the Halls of Residence include the following: Free Course Ranking: The university's Accounting & Finance programme was ranked at position 64 in 2022 and 99 in 2023. The university has continued to rank among the top 100 institutions in the UK for this programme since 2019, despite a fall in the accounting and finance rankings for the current year. The Complete University Guide rankings place the Business & Management Studies course at the 98th position in 2023 and the 81st position in 2022. The Accounting & Finance course, on the other hand, was ranked 57th in 2022 and 59th in 2023 by The Guardian. Courses at the University of Northampton The Complete University Guide states, the University of Northampton's Computer Science programme is ranked 106th in the nation in 2023. According to The Complete University Guide's ranking for 2022, the computer science course is ranked at 105th place. The Complete University Guide's most recent rankings show an improvement in the placement of the Psychology course. In 2022, the Psychology course was ranked at position 107; in 2023, it is ranked at position 94.
University Ranking: The University of Northampton was founded in 2005 and given full university status and the authority to grant research degrees. However, the history of the university dates back to 1924. The University of Northampton is ranked between 1001 and 1200th worldwide according to the QS WURs for 2022. In 2023, the University of Northampton will maintain its current QS rating and rank between 1001 and 1200.The University of Northampton and rank among the best 100 universities in the UK by the Complete University Guide. If we look at the University of Northampton's ranking in the UK, it was 90th in 2022 and 98th in 2023, according to The Complete University Guide. The Complete University Guide considers factors including entry requirements, student happiness, research excellence, research intensity, etc., while determining rankings. The Guardian reports that Northampton University will be ranked 95th in the UK in 2023 and 101st in 2022, respectively. Entry requirements, the student-staff ratio, the quality of the instruction, student comments, overall satisfaction, etc., are all factors taken into account by The Guardian's ranking methodology.

Name: Royal Holloway, University of London International Study Centre
Overview: Royal Holloway, University of London International Study Centre ensures that students get the finest British education from a group of experienced international experts. The institution was established in 1886 and remained one of the oldest universities in the United Kingdom. Over the years, due to its innovative program structure, it has received multiple recognitions, including 22nd position in the UK in the Guardian University League Table 2022. Apart from being renowned for its world-class research facilities, it has also gained immense popularity for being one of the first women’s colleges in the UK in 1886. The institution is highly ranked for its international outlook and flexible study options. The campus is located on Highfield Rd, Englefield Green, Egham TW20 0EX, and is only 40 minutes away from London by train. It provides a fantastic experience to the international students as they get access to multiple academic facilities and cultural and artistic aspects. Royal Holloway students have access to several campus facilities, from student-run clubs and societies where they can find students having similar interests to libraries, sports clubs, etc. The pathway programs are designed by industry professionals and only for international students. The institution covers a range of subjects at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Students can even pursue their degree online; however, only the Pre-Master’s Program has been introduced with this facility. Regarding students’ satisfaction, Royal Holloway, University of London International Study Centre, has remained consistent with its innovative approach to studies. It scored 88% in the National Student Survey (NSS) 2019, where additional conveniences like internship participation, accommodation facility, post-study work visa, etc., had a significant role.

Name: University of Art and design Linz
Overview: University of Art and Design Linz was established in 1947 as the Art School of the City of Linz or the 'Kunstschule' and later in 1988 was transferred into a university. One amongst the four universities in Linz, Upper Austria, as per the Universities Organisation Act of 2002, this university is constituted as a corporation under public law and thus is autonomous. Also known as the University of Arts, Linz has degree programs in art studies, arts and technical studies, cultural studies, inter-university studies, media design, space design, and other programs for teachers and Ph.D. students. The university is a center for top-level research experience, artistic-scientific projects, and the development of cross-sectional skills. It ranks as one of the top five universities in national ranking and has a dedicated library for students. The academic year is based on a two-semesters per year system and has provisions for online learning for students. Comprising around 2500+ students, this small educational institution has 350+ academic faculties and specialists to understand respective fields with the best practical knowledge. The university also organizes international student exchange programs for both students and teachers. For admission to the University of Art and Design Linz, applicants will have to sit for university examinations. The estimated tuition fee for international students pursuing bachelor's and master's degrees is approximately 1,000 USD per year. The estimated tuition fee for students from Austria seeking bachelor's and master's degrees is about 1,000 USD per year. The average cost of living for students in the University of Arts and Design varies between 700 to 1400 USD per month.

Name: Queens University Belfast Study Centre
Overview: Located near Belfast, Northern Ireland, Queen's University Belfast Study Centre received its charter in 1845 from Queen Victoria and opened formally after four years. A prominent member of the Russell Group of UK research-intensive universities, the university is considered one of the oldest universities in the UK. Currently, the university offers courses and programs at various levels. Queen's University Belfast Study Centre is currently serving over 24,000 students. There are over 200 programs for undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. Some of the popular areas of study include Accounting, Science, Business, Civil law, Computer science, Criminology, Healthcare, Fine arts and several others. The diverse nature of the institute is evident as international students from across 80 countries are currently studying here. The university's current Knowledge Transfer Partnerships (KTP) has made its infrastructure more appealing, besides the McClay library, central Wi-Fi, a Trading Room with Bloomberg terminals, sports clubs, and others. Queen's University Belfast Study Centre maintains a research-based curriculum. With an acceptance rate of 86.1%, the university might seem selective regarding new enrollments. The classes maintain a standard student-faculty ratio of 10:1. Moreover, it's A score for graduation rate makes the university competent in the industry (88,1). The Queen's University Belfast Study Centre ranking reveals that it holds the 43rd position in top universities across the globe according to Times Higher Education Impact Rankings 2021. The fees structure can be affordable for the students, ranging from £15,000-£20,000. The university offers merit-based scholarships every year for deserving candidates. The university is concerned regarding the future of the students. The career counselling and Alumni Career Mentoring options enable the graduates to understand their job prospects and apply for the appropriate job roles.
Eligibility Overview: As illustrated below, the General Entrance Requirement can be met in a variety of ways. GCSE English Language at grade C/4, or an equivalent qualification accepted by the University, must be offered in all situations. In lieu of a grade C/4 in GCSE English Language, the University accepts Level 2 Essential Skills in Communication. Please keep in mind that the General Entrance Requirement cannot be satisfied by taking the same course at various levels. English language Requirements :
