Name: University of Southampton
Overview: Founded in 1862, the University of Southampton is a research university in England. It is mainly known for its Geology, Nursing and Statistics & Operational Research research. More than 20,000 students are enrolled in undergraduate and postgraduate (taught and research) programs across five faculties consisting of 6,000 staff members. Forty academic schools and departments offer BA, BSc, BEng, MPhys, MRes, MSc, MA, PhD, etc., in Biochemistry, Fashion Design, Criminology, Finance, and Transportation courses. There are five University of Southampton campuses in the city and one in Winchester; Highfield Campus, Avenue Campus, Waterfront Campus, Boldrewood Innovation Campus, Southampton General Hospital Campus and Winchester Campus. The University of Southampton provides free online learning through Massive Online Open Courses (Understanding Language, Web Science, Digital Marketing etc.), professional development courses (Business & Management, Engineering, Statistics etc.), Pre-sessional English language, as well as Pre-master courses. The Study Abroad program consists of summers abroad, exchange programs and work placements abroad on six continents. UK students' estimated undergraduate tuition fee is GBP 9,250 (EU students will pay international fees). Financial aid available includes scholarships, grants, bursaries, loans and awards such as Bursary, Fulbright Commission Scholarship, Chevening Scholarship, Stafford Loans, Fulbright Awards etc.
Eligibility Overview: For undergraduate study, we accept a variety of credentials, which are shown below. Please see the individual course websites for the particular grades and entry requirements for each subjectfor specific detail click on this link-https://www.southampton.ac.uk/courses/how-to-apply/undergraduate-applications/requirements.page
Accommodation: In our university student housing, you can find your new home. We have economical rooms for rent near campuses or in the city centre to fit your budget and lifestyle. There are also some postgraduate options available.for more detail click on this link-https://www.southampton.ac.uk/student-life/accommodation
Course Ranking: When it comes to the University of Southampton's subject rankings, we can see that the ranking publishers tend to favour its engineering and business programmes. According to Times Higher Education's PG Business and Economics ranking for 2020 and 2021, it is among the 151–175 best. For the years 2019 and 2020, QS's Accounting and Finance ranking placed it in the range of 201-250. The University of Southampton is ranked among the top 100 institutions in its field by prestigious UK publishers. Since 2017, The Complete University Guide has placed it outside of the top 50 in the UK for Accounting & Finance and Business & Management. The Guardian also ranked it outside the top 100 in the UK for business, management, and marketing as well as accounting and finance. From 2018 to 2020, THE graded it lower than 100 for PG Engineering and Technology. It has been set between 101 and 125 for 2021. From 2017 through 2020, QS ranked it among the top 150.
University Ranking: Popular research university The University of Southampton is situated in Southampton, Hampshire, United Kingdom. It was founded in 1862 as Hartley Institution, and in 1952 it was granted university status. With the exception of 2018, when it was ranked at position 102, it has consistently been among the top 100 universities in the world according to the QS World University Ranking. Since then, the university has made considerable strides, and in 2021, it was ranked 90th. Since 2018, US News & World Report has also listed it among the top 100 universities in the world. Southampton has maintained a ranking in the top 150 of the Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU, Shanghai Ranking) for the past five years. Similarly to that, THE has ranked in the top 150 worldwide since 2017. When we examine the University of Southampton's ranking in the UK, we can see that it has fallen outside of the top 50 institutions. Since 2017, Southampton has not been listed among the top 50 universities in the UK by The Complete University Guide or The Guardian.

Name: Middlesex University London
Overview: Middlesex University was established in 1878 in England and is a public research institute with a teaching staff of 1,016 members. Offering undergraduate and postgraduate programs in eight fields, including Arts & Design, Business, Creative Writing & Media, Natural Sciences and more, students can pursue a degree in Illustration, Mathematics, Film and Television, Law, Sociology etc. The Grove, StoneX Stadium and Ritterman Building are some key learning centres, while the Grove Atrium, the Quad and MDX House are some social hang-out locations.  Short courses, continuing professional development courses, and English courses are offered to students in areas like Clinical Supervision, Digital Marketing and Understanding ADHD in Adults. Students can become degree apprentices in teaching, social work, policing etc. and gain professional experience while learning. Through Middlesex University's global campuses in Dubai and Mauritius, international collaborations and the Erasmus+ program, students can study abroad and participate in student exchanges.  The estimated undergraduate cost of attending for UK and EU students is GBP 9,250. Financial aid for all degree levels comes as scholarships, bursaries, loans and grants such as Maintenance loans, Hardship Fund, Santander Mobility Scholarship, Alumni Bursary and Optivo Study4Success Award. Undergraduate and postgraduate students can find university accommodation in several residence halls like Platt Hall, Ivy Hall, Writtle House and Usher Hall, and private accommodation in flats, rooms and houses. Middlesex students can join one of the 85 clubs, societies, or groups to participate in cultural, artistic, academic, and co-curricular and attend events concerning music, comedy, movie screenings, balls, etc. There are 30 sports teams involved in football, tennis, rugby, taekwondo, etc. Fitness facilities on campus include The Pod, sports courts, a bouldering wall, pitches, etc.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Entry Requirements Students from the United States who wish to pursue an undergraduate degree must have completed one of the following courses:High school graduation with a minimum GPA of 3.2 and SAT scores of 550 on each section, or an ACT composite score of 23.High school diploma with a minimum GPA of 3.2 and 3+ on at least two advanced placement exams is required.A diploma from the International Baccalaureate and SAT scores of 550 on each subject or an ACT total score of 23A year of college or university studies with a minimum GPA of 2.8
Placement: The placement opportunities accessible to you may vary according to your degree. Many MDX courses at the university will allow you to complete a year-long placement in which you will be immersed in a relevant role. Six months after graduation, 90% of Middlesex University graduates are reported to have a job. According to Emolument, Middlesex graduates working in Compliance, AML, KYC, and Monitoring earn an average of 80,000 GBP per year.
Accommodation: Residence hallsLiving in resident halls has a lot of advantages. Here are the top three benefits of living in halls.Thriving student bodyHaving roommates is a terrific way to socialize. Utilize communal areas to study, eat, watch TV, and play sports.Security and safetyThere is always someone available to assist in our halls thanks to the round-the-clock reception and security services. Additionally, the crew will promptly and painlessly resolve maintenance issues.Promise of accommodationsFor all first-year, full-time undergraduate and graduate students, MUL guarantee housing in residence halls. Visit the halls pages for more information about how our guarantee operates.

Name: University of York
Overview: The University of York is a collegiate research university, established in 1963. Located in the York city of England, the university is one of the 24 research universities in the UK of Russell Groups and accredited by the Privy council. Spread across 500 acres, 20,400+students from around 150+ countries study in UY. The university is ranked 150 in the QS- World University Ranking and has bagged the Athena Swan awards for commitment to gender equality. It has ten colleges and offers master's and bachelor's programs in international business, management, computer science, public health, finance, global marketing, and many others. Housing more than 30 academic departments involved in exemplary research and undertakings, the University of York contributes Œ£1.8bn to the economic impact of the UK economy. The West Campus harbors the York Science Park and National Science Learning Center, and the East Campus, established recently in 2009, has three colleges and three departments. It is the founding member of the Worldwide Universities Network. On-campus accommodation in UY is available for students and pre-sessional students, families, care-leavers, couples, and visiting students. More than 200 student societies, 65+ sports clubs, study-abroad programs, and additional volunteering activities are organized for active campus life. The university also has a University of York Students' Union (YUSU) run by students. It has tons of scholarship programs like Be Exceptional Scholarship, Vice-Chancellor Scholarship, and country-specific funding programs. The tuition and fees for a UK resident undergraduate are approximately Œ£9,250 per year. Notable alumni of the University of York include former prime minister of Portugal Anibal Cavaco Silva, governor-general of Belize Colville Young, and others.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet to be considered for admission are: A bachelor's degree with honours or equivalent from a recognised post-secondary institution; some programmes will consider applicants with a three-year bachelor's degree and related job experienceA minimum overall Grade Point Average (GPA) of 'B' or equivalent is required; the GPA from the previous two years of study will be considered English language requirements are,

Placement: The university is eager to collaborate with local, national, and worldwide businesses that want to use our students' abilities and expertise. They can assist in defining the placements' scope, hiring, shortlisting candidates, and appropriate forms of agreement. Most York University students can spend a year working through the department-led Year In Industry Program or the Placement Year programme. Some recruiting organisations are STEM Learning, Warner Brothers, City of York Council etc.
Accommodation: York's housing is centred on our ten college communities around our compact parkland campus. To make the most of University life, you'll have access to teaching, study, and social facilities right on your doorstep. The university's buildings and amenities are close to the on-campus housing. The self-catered single rooms and studio apartments available to postgraduates are conveniently situated on the small campus and close to the university's services. Name: Edge Hill University

The Graduate School on the campus is for research students on MREs, MPhil, and Ph.D. The average tuition fee for a UG is 12,500 GBP, and graduate courses are 13,500 GBP. Students also receive scholarships from the university. 95.8% of students are either employed or studying further. The Career Centre offers part-time jobs through Edge Hill Works Vacancy Service.The university also helps students with self-employment opportunities. In addition, the university has a media platform named VibeMedia and a Library called Catalyst, which also serves as the student services and information center.

Name: University of De montfort
Overview: The University of De Montfort is a public university located in Leicester, England. Also called DMU, the university is affiliated with the Association of Commonwealth Universities, EUA and the Universities UK. The university has been recognized for its teaching quality and awarded a Gold rating in the Teaching Excellence Framework. The university offers more than 300+ programs. They include 100+ undergraduate and 70+ masters courses in the fields of business, law, art, design, humanities, media, engineering, energy, computing, sciences and social sciences, 44 distance learning courses for MSc in Advanced Clinical Practice, MSc in Cyber Technology, MSc in Clinical Pharmacy etc. DMU's most famous courses are Business and Management, Creative Arts and Design, Engineering, Computer Science and IT, Health and Medicine, Social Studies and Media. There are also other courses like foundation courses, Learning Beyond Registration modules, and full-time and part-time courses. Students are trained to be employed in companies by conducting Mock Interviews, Virtual Internships, Recruitment Fairs, and Guidance Fairs; 97.3% of the DMU graduates are either placed in reputed companies or enrolled in higher studies. The university has roped the Best University Careers and Employability Service award for its career services to its students. Accommodation facilities include ten halls of residence (self-catered) with weekly rents ranging up to 99 - 186 GBP.The average tuition fee for a UG Degree is around 14,250 - 15,836 GBP; a PG Degree may cost about 12,000 - 21,000 GBP. There are plenty of scholarships provided to students based on merit.
Eligibility Overview: Minimum requirements for undergraduate studyIn Standard 12, you must have a minimum of a 65 percent average in your four top subjects (excluding Hindi). We may also examine your standard 10 English and math results.It's feasible to get into year 2 or 3. You must include thorough information, such as courses taken, grades earned, a syllabus, and a grading guide.Language requirements in EnglishIf English is not your first language, you must present an IELTS or comparable certificate. Our IELTS criteria for undergraduates are:For Art and Design, Business, Computing, and Engineering courses, IELTS 6.0 is required.IELTS 6.5 is required for law school.For Humanities and Media courses, IELTS 6.0-6.5 is required.For science courses, IELTS 6.5-7.5 is required.Postgraduate (taught) study requires certain qualifications.A bachelor's degree with a 50 percent -60 percent graduation rate, depending on the university and course you are applying for.Some courses include extra requirements for admission, such as a portfolio, job experience, or a degree in a related discipline.Language requirements in EnglishIf English is not your first language, you must present an IELTS or comparable certificate. The following are the postgraduate IELTS requirements:For Business and Computing courses, IELTS 6.0 is required.For Art, Design, and Engineering courses, IELTS 6.0-6.5 is required.For Humanities, Media, Law, and Science courses, IELTS 6.5 is required.

Students can also enrol in our Enterprise Placement Year programme, which allows them to work on their own business idea for a year while receiving college credit.For Placement:https://www.dmu.ac.uk/current-students/careers/placements.aspx#:~:text=Placements%20are%20a%20popular%20and,placement%20working%20for%20an%20employer.

Name: London South Bank University
Overview: Located in the London City Centre in Southwark on the south bank of the Thames, London South Bank University is a public university. The university laid its foundation in 1892 and was shortly called LSBU. It has seven schools and 15 research centers, and 36 research groups. London South Bank University offers various UG, PG, and apprenticeship degrees. The programs are divided into 172 undergraduate courses, 96 master's courses, 31 research and doctorate degrees, 46 continuing professional education, 22 short courses, and five foundation programs. Some programs include BA, BSc, BEng, LLB, MEng, MA, MSc, MRes, Ph.D., etc. Some popular systems are engineering, accounting and science, game design and development, MBA, law, computer science, and health. The London South Bank Students' Union organizes around 85 student clubs and societies and 11 sports clubs for students. In addition, the university provides various internships, placements, and work experience for students. The Employability Service helps students find jobs, develop ideas to crack interviews, and more. They also offer the students on-campus residences (a 10-minute walk) with four residence halls. The city's cost of living is approximately 8,199.92 GBP. The university has excellent infrastructure and facilities like skill laboratories, workshops, a media center, a theater, a library, and a learning resources center. The typical fee structure at this university is between 14,470 GBP to 15,860 GBP, depending upon the course. The university provides scholarships and discounts like the National Scholarships Fee, discounts for alums, and a 5% discount for early payment of tuition fees.

Name: Glasgow Caledonian University
Overview: Glasgow Caledonian University was established in 1993 as a public research university in Scotland, United Kingdom. The university has three schools: Glasgow School for Business and Society, the School of Engineering and Built Environment, and the School of Health and Life Sciences.The university provides numerous undergraduate and postgraduate undergraduate programs in various fields such as law, business, management, nursing, education, renewable energy, midwifery, construction, fashion, social science, journalism, tourism, engineering, physiotherapy, and psychology. The university conducts employer fairs and events for placement of students or engages the students to work with employers. An on-campus hostel facility is provided at the Caledonian Court to its international students with basic amenities. The housing facility includes 600 rooms arranged in flats for 6 to 8 people. The accommodation provided by the university is fully furnished and self-catering. The cost and living expenses amount to approximately GBP 3947 per year. Students can also stay off-campus in rented or shared apartments in Glasgow or London. The Student Accommodation Office of the University helps students find the perfect home to stay in.The fee of the courses offered ranges between GBP 10,590 to 16,367. Financial aid provided to the students is a guaranteed scholarship of GBP 1,000 to self-funded students, scholarships based on merit, alumni scholarships, joint scholarships, and external international scholarships to study in the United Kingdom awarded by private organizations.
Eligibility Overview: For our Master's Degrees  which are comparable to a UK 2:2 honors degree at GCU London, we accept a wide range of international qualifications as eligible admission criteria. Qualifications that aren't stated will be considered on an individual basis. If English is not your first language  you will be required to demonstrate your English ability prior to beginning your study by obtaining an English language certification. Although the minimum prerequisites are listed below, greater levels may be necessary for particular courses.1. TOEFL internet-based test overall score of 78 with minimum element scores of reading 18, listening 17, speaking 20, and writing 172. TOEFL internet-based test overall score of 78 with minimum element scores of reading 18, hearing 17, speaking 20, and writing 173. Pearson A total score of 54 on the PTE Academic, with no element below 51.4. A minimum grade of C in Cambridge Advanced English (CAE).5. Integrated Skills in English (ISE) at Trinity College London - Level II Pass

Name: University of Oxford
Overview: The Institution of Oxford, founded in 1906 in England, is the world's oldest English-speaking college research university. Among the 39 colleges and Permanent Private Halls that provide undergraduate and graduate (taught and research) courses are All Souls College, Merton College, Pembroke College, and Wycliffe Hall. The college has about 400 cultural, political, intellectual, and professional student organizations and 85 university and 200 college sports clubs. Oxford University Sport is a sports complex with a gym, sports courts, a dojo, and other facilities such as clubhouses, boathouses, and cricket pitches.Over 2 million printed materials and 80,000 e-journals, manuscripts, maps, and other resources are housed in the University of Oxford Bodleian Libraries, including the Bodleian Library, Education Library, Horton Hospital, and Nizami Ganjavi Library. More than 90 online and distance learning courses are available through the Department of Continuing Education, including short and lengthy online and professional practices. The University of Oxford is noted for its versatile graduate and postgraduate programs. The university uses advanced learning techniques and provides industry-relevant practical exposure to prepare students for real-world jobs. It has a world-class campus that offers excellent facilities for students. Oxford comes with a particular brand legacy and offers exceptional career support to ensure that graduates and postgraduates get well-paying, top-notch jobs. Additionally, the university has excellent skill development courses that help students develop their overall personalities. It also provides international students with earning opportunities to help them pay their loans or aid.

These conditions must be met for you to be considered for admission.  English Language Proficiency  Oxford’s chosen language of instruction is English. Placement: According to placement records, 80% of PGR graduates found work, with an average beginning income of GBP 41,600. Oxford provides a special career support facility for undergraduate and postgraduate students. They train them in skills like CV building, writing cover letters, etc. They also arrange career fairs and meetings with a career adviser or counselor.  They actively provide internships to students that usually end up being a pre-placement offer. They conduct seminars on various sectors and occupations, allowing students to build networking skills. The median annual pay of Oxford graduates is £35,700, and the average has been £41,600. Nearly 89 percent of Oxford graduates earn excellent job opportunities after completing their degree.
Accommodation: Flats, en-suites/non-en-suites, and houses offer some accommodation options for undergraduate and graduate students on and off-campus. Some popular options opted for by students on campus are Cluster RoomsOxford Student ApartmentsStudio ApartmentsThe Park Oxford Oxford doesn't guarantee its students accommodations on campus. When you receive your college offer, the university will typically explain how to request accommodations. The Graduate Accommodation Office at the University may be able to assist you. However, you can also look for private accommodation if they don't have any vacant housing available or if your college offer is delayed. If you're a student with a disability, please be sure to disclose your nature of disability when you apply for your course and if you have any special needs for your accommodation. Although the college has various rooms that can accommodate different needs, these are distributed over the admissions cycle, so if your needs are not known until a later date, suitable housing may not be available.

In the years 2020 and 2021, The Complete University Guide listed the university's computer science programme as number two.

Name: Newcastle University (INTO)
Overview: Situated in Newcastle upon Tyne, North East England, Newcastle University is a UK public research university with two overseas campuses in Malaysia and Singapore. This university is a significant member of Russell group and receives Gold Award in the Teaching Excellence Framework, one of the 10 Russell Group universities to achieve a gold rating. The university is subdivided into three faculties: the Faculty of Medical Sciences, the Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, and the Faculty of Science, Agriculture, and Engineering. The campus of this university is equipped with an advanced library and the Centre for Sport and Recreation. Besides, every building of this campus has top-notch teaching and research facilities like high-end lecture theatres, massive libraries, spacious classrooms, advanced laboratories, and large conference rooms. Besides, it provides outstanding residential and catering facilities. It is considered the first UK University to set up a completely owned international medicine campus in Malaysia. Also, this university extends various graduate and post-graduate programs in multiple fields such as architecture, engineering, accounting, agriculture, computer science, business, accounting, history, social sciences, mathematics, psychology, languages, mathematics, philosophy, finance, etc. Newcastle University is associated with multiple recognised organisations and institutions across several countries. Also, the university’s Training Centre and Career Support use international associations to provide students with a broader perspective and professional skills. This institution provides students with many outstanding opportunities. International students can select from more than 500 world-class degrees. The Newcastle centre (INTO) was established in 2007 and is situated at the centre of this university's main campus. With more than 120 dedicated teaching staff, it offers an excellent student experience. Besides providing advanced classrooms and outstanding IT facilities, it offers top-notch laboratories. It also provides speaking and listening support through workshops, lectures and can also explore effective English programs.

Overview: Cardiff Metropolitan University, founded in 1865 as the University of Wales Institute, is located in Wales, London. The university holds a position among the British Universities and College Sports (BUCS) top 20 institutions. The Llandaff Campus is the university's main campus and provides more than 200 undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs in art, design, technology, management, education, health sciences, and sports. The average tuition fee for undergraduate courses is GBP 12,794, and for postgraduate is GBP 12,605. The university follows a moderately selective admission policy with an acceptance rate of 64% and an extensive network of 5,000 enterprise connections worldwide that help the graduates grab good job opportunities. The university offers various scholarships and bursaries to its undergraduate and postgraduate students on a need and merit basis, along with career service opportunities like funded internships, work placements, student support services, counseling, disability service and health service, financial assistance, and welfare advisory service.The university ranked no. 1 for ‘Employability and Work Experience Satisfaction’ in the International Student Barometer 2019. The university has a high placement rate, with 96% of graduates employed or pursuing further studies within six months of degree completion.
Eligibility Overview: The entry requirements vary depending on the programme, course, and applicant's country. The university considers students from various backgrounds and values work experience and academic qualifications. English Language Score Requirements: International students must submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores to be eligible for admission.

Name: University of Wolverhampton
Overview: The University of Wolverhampton is located across various locations in Wolverhampton, England. The university was founded in 1827 and has become a highly ranked public university in the United Kingdom. The university has eighteen institutes and schools under its banner, offering over 380 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in various fields. The best courses at the University of Wolverhampton include MSc in Mechanical Engineering, MSc in Professional Accounting and Finance, and MSc in Civil Engineering. Prominent alumni from the university include Chauhdry Abdul Rashid, former Mayor of Birmingham, TV presenter Suzi Perry and Nando Bodha, the former Mauritian Minister of Foreign Affairs.The university's four campuses are spread across the West Midland and Shropshire regions of Wolverhampton, with the Main Campus located at the center of Wolverhampton. It is home to numerous academic facilities, including the Alan Turing Building and the Harrison Learning Center. Other campuses include the Walsall Campus and the University of Wolverhampton Science Park.The Walsall and City Sports Centres encourage students to stay healthy and fit. Facilities include gyms, various sports courts, and an indoor running track. The average tuition costs for international students per annum can cost around GBP 11,500. The university has a diverse student community well supported by the campus. The Knowledge Transfer Partnerships (KTP) allow graduate students to gain work experience during the program and even after graduation. They also have access to over 60 student societies that promote collaboration and integration outside their academics.

Over 2,000 accommodation options are available at the university, including over 1,000 rooms with private bathrooms. Rooms are assigned on a first-come, first-served basis on campus. The cost of basic utilities is included in the rent.

Name: University of Sussex
Overview: Established in the 1960s, the University of Sussex is a public research institute in East Sussex, England and has approximately 500 undergraduate and postgraduate degree courses. The ten schools, including the School of Global Studies, School of Life Sciences and School of Psychology, and the Doctoral School, offer courses like Accounting and Finance, Biochemistry, Filmmaking and Art History. Students can pursue BA, BSc, BEng, MA, MRes, MSc, LLM, PhD and other degrees.The university offers several online postgraduate (masters and certificate) courses such as Energy Policy MSc, Corruption and Governance MA and Sustainable Development MSc. Through the Virtual Learning Environment, students can interact with professors and fellow students, access all study materials and attend lectures without being on campus. The study abroad program allows students to spend a semester or year at the university, attend its summer school or take advantage of its 329 academic global partnerships. Financial aid options available to students are scholarships, loans, grants, bursaries and employment like Article 26 Scholarship, Postgraduate Doctoral Loan, Careerhub, private loans and Chancellor's Master Scholarship.

Placement: Improve your academic performance, pick up priceless experience, and start climbing the corporate ladder. By participating in placement or internship opportunities with the UK and international businesses, you can develop the skills necessary for the graduate job market at Sussex. You can develop your network and acquire experience by doing an internship. An internship may help you land a graduate job because more businesses are including them in their graduate hiring strategies. A placement is a method to hone your abilities in the business so that you can move on to a variety of careers after graduating from Sussex.  Placements can be useful for: Surpass the competition: For graduate employment and programmes, employers are more frequently seeking appropriate work experienceBefore you graduate, look into your job alternatives: You'll have a better notion of the industry or employment you might wish to pursueAcquire business and employability abilities: Work on actual projects or learn how to use the tools. Additionally, you'll learn teamwork, communication, and time management skillsCreate professional networks: A network of contacts will be formed for the future  The student can choose to apply for: A professional placementA research placement, you may be able to do a research placement if you are a high-performing student in a selected science courseAn integrated placement that is a requirement for a course  The functioning of placements During your degree, you will work for a company or organisation for a certain period of time. During your time with the company or organisation, you will be a paid employee.If your placement is for a year, it will begin when you complete Year 2 of your programme. Your degree will be extended if needed, so a three-year course will be completed in four years.Applying for placements is similar to applying for a job. Although it is a competitive procedure, our Placements Preparation Programme will assist you in identifying your abilities, strengths, and areas of interest so that you may submit the best application possible. Placements Preparation Programme includes: An online interactive course to get you started – This course is available at any moment throughout your first year of studyDiscussions with the Placements team for in-depth assistanceA series of activities, including a Careers Fair, company recruitment events, and skill development sessions How to get started Register for the Placements Preparation Program online or visit the Careers and Employability Centre. The training will assist you in identifying your strengths and gaining an advantage in applications and interviews.On CareerHub, the university's online job search tool, you can find placement and internship vacancies (both year-round and summer).
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The University of Sussex provides a safe and peaceful place for students who want to study there. They make sure the student forms a bond with their peers and create beautiful memories together. En-suite options East Slope residencesNorthfield flatsStanner Court flatsSwanborough flatsLewes Court flats Shared bathroom options East Slope residencesBrighthelm housesNorwich HouseLewes Court flats For more information, visit: https://www.sussex.ac.uk/study/accommodation/on-campus   Off-Campus Accommodation Living off-campus in Brighton & Hove and other nearby towns will allow you to experience city life while also enjoying convenient access to the university. Every type of lodging is self-catered. University-owned flats Kings Road flats In Brighton's Kings Road, which is on the coast, you can live in a single room. The Sussex campus is easily accessible by bus and train. The following is included in your rent:Water, electricity, and gas bills, as well as service chargesCleaning of shared rooms on a regular basis — you do your own laundry and clean your bedroom and bathroom.Insurance for the contents (basic cover)Maintenance, management, and security services are all available on campus. As a University campus service, have an Internet connection in the apartments. University-managed houses In Brighton and Hove, you can rent a furnished student residence off-campus.You won't need to put down a deposit or offer a guarantor, and your rent includes all utilities. All off-campus lodging is close to the campus via bus or train. Privately rented accommodation The university may offer advice and review your tenancy agreement if you want to rent a room, flat, or house from a private landlord or leasing agent.On Sussex Studentpad, you may also look for private housing. For more information, visit: https://www.sussex.ac.uk/study/accommodation/off-campus

Name: University of Cambridge
Overview: The University of Cambridge is among the world's oldest, most famous, and most respected institutions. It is a dream for many students to be a part of this institution. Established in 1206, the university is self-governed by students, comprising 31 constituent colleges divided into six schools. Over 100 departments are divided into clinical medicine, biological sciences, physical sciences, technology, arts and humanities, and humanities and social sciences.The student experience at the University of Cambridge is rich and diverse, with over 9,000 international students forming a part of the 23,000-member student community across postgraduate and undergraduate studies. The university supports students with 31 colleges, 150 schools, faculties, departments, and over 11,000 staff.Although admission to Cambridge can be difficult, students are guaranteed placements owing to its name. Several top companies visit the campus and recruit students directly. The University of Cambridge has the most decorated list of alumni globally. Alumni of Cambridge have won over 30 Nobel Prizes in physics alone. Some of their most famous alums include William Wordsworth, Sir Isaac Newton, Hugh Laurie, Charles Darwin, Prince Charles, Stephen Hawking, Mike Atherton, Rajiv Gandhi, Robert Frost, Salman Rushdie, Amartya Sen, Homi Bhabha, and Dame Emma Thompson.Tuition fees for international students start at £23,340. Some of the noteworthy financial aid from the university are Cambridge Commonwealth, European & International Trust, Trust's Scholarship, and Gates Cambridge Scholarship.
Eligibility Overview: Examinations are given a lot of weight at Cambridge University because of its high academic requirements. The eligibility requirements may change depending on whether you wish to pursue undergraduate or graduate degrees. Undergraduate: Indian students will have to present excellent grades in their 12th board exams, but that alone is insufficient. However, the following additions may boost your chances of getting admission: Ranking under 2000 in the IIT JEE (Advanced) (For the courses Chemical Engineering, Engineering, Natural Sciences (Physical)) STEP: May be required for subjects such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, and Economics.Grade 5 appeared in more than five College Board Advanced Placement Exam examinations.  English Language Requirements Candidates must submit proof of the following English proficiency score requirements:  IELTS Academic1 – minimum grade of 7.5, usually with 7.0 or above in each elementTOEFL Internet Based Test (IBT) – minimum score of 110, with 25 or above in each element
Placement: Cambridge provides world-class education with modern facilities and staff at the top of their game. They leave no stone unturned to prepare you for the corporate world. Cambridge graduates have the reputation of being some of the highest-paid employees in the UK. Emolument reports that Cambridge alumni earn an average salary of $85,481, usually with a bonus of $6,575. MBA graduates are said to be the ones who have the highest salaries.

Depending on the college chosen, you can avail of accommodation from the 29 colleges that provide housing facilities. Some housing may be on the campus, while the others may be close to the campus or in the city center. Either way, these properties are safe and functional; most importantly, they feel like home. Several colleges provide meal plan options as part of the accommodation packages. Costs can vary between GBP 340 and GBP 600 a month. Accommodations usually include a private bedroom, shared kitchen, and laundry facilities. The styles of the room may vary from traditional to modern.
Course Ranking: The University of Cambridge is one of the top universities in Europe for business studies, according to Bloomberg, a source of university topic rankings. Bloomberg has ranked the University as the best business school in Europe for the year 2020. The university is also among the top 20 for business studies, according to The Financial Times. The university is ranked 19 for 2020. Candidates should be aware that their rank has decreased slightly from previous years. According to international rating services QS, the university is ranked six and seventeen, respectively for its QS-accounting and finance and QS-global MBA programmes. You can see that the university has improved significantly in the rankings over time. The University of Cambridge has undoubtedly earned a top ranking for business and economics courses after being included among the top five institutions for four years in a row, from 2018 to 2021, by Times Higher Education. Engineering programmes at the University of Cambridge, a school that needs no introduction, have been rated among the top for the most recent academic years, 2017–2021. The university has received top marks for its engineering programmes, which cover everything from mechanical to chemical, civil, electrical, and electronic engineering. For five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, The Guardian placed the university among the finest for studying chemical engineering. The Complete University Guide lists the university as one of the finest for pursuing computer science degrees, highlighting the university's accomplishments when it comes to computer studies.

Course Description: University of Cambridge is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Cambridge was founded in 1209. Located in Cambridge,UK the university is home to about 9949 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Cambridge is ranked 12th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 4 postgraduate programs. University of Cambridge has 1 intakes in Sep. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 0 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Cambridge is around  22,000-58,000 GBP.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Cambridge include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Cambridge is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Cambridge has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: London Brunel International College
Overview: London Brunel International College is located in Uxbridge, an evolving suburb on the western side of Greater London, UK. It is a self-contained university with all the necessary items within walking distance, thus making it ideal for college students. This research university was founded in 1966 and ranked 24th for education in the UK (The Times, 2021). Ten pathway programs come under undergraduate courses, all for two semesters. International students from about 150 countries across the world come here to study. About 95% of undergraduate courses offer work placement. Some popular courses are management and commerce, business, physical sciences, graphic and design studies, international business, economics, and law. Also, there are six postgraduate programs. The University Library has about 400,000 books and e-resources for various courses. There are over 150 clubs and societies where students can get involved. There are other student-led societies at the Union of Brunel Students, along with sports clubs, like Abacus, ACS, Afghan, Conservative, Christian Union, and many more. The college offers on-accommodation. University students enjoy the facilities of social spaces, music venues, food vendors, and world-class sports and fitness equipment and amenities. All these clubs and societies help the students to know the city's culture better. Seven lodging complexes include a kitchen, laundry, and internet facilities. The fees differ for different courses, but the academic year 2020-21 ranges between GBP 14,900 and GBP 15,900, not including medical and travel insurance. As London Brunel International College is a part of the Navitas Scheme, it allows financial support to international students through the Navitas bursary and scholarship programs. It offers both merit-based and needs-based funding options for eligible students.

Name: Coventry University London International Study Centre , (STUDY GROUP)
Overview: Located in the center of England, Coventry University is a global and dynamic higher education provider and maintains a proud tradition of offering quality teaching and learning. With two campuses located in the city of London and Coventry city center, this university has been recognised with 5 stars by QS World Ranking in several categories such as teaching, facilities and employability. Coventry University provides a comprehensive range of under-graduate, post-graduate and MBA degrees. Further, this educational institution provides more than 200 caliber courses that have constantly been evolved to remain at the forefront of top-notch teaching and meet industry demands. Besides, this university is now the Top Modern University in the city for a prospective career as per Guardian University Guide 2021 for offering extensive resources and academic brilliance. With a student strength of approximately 33,000, more than 15,000 international students are registered from more than 160 countries. The Talent group of this university assists students in developing their skills, prepares them for psychometric testing, cover letter and application, interview processes etc. Moreover, approximately 97% of students from the university get employed after completing their university. As per QS- World University Ranking, Coventry University ranking ranges from 501-550 in the current year and earned TEF gold for outstanding teaching and learning. Students here get exposed to people belonging to different cultures. Further, this university offers a wide range of programmes to develop international experience, including studying or working abroad, international field trips, language classes etc. Students are offered with the International Master’s Qualifying programme to enhance student skills and research methods required during post-graduation courses. Further, students are offered high-tech facilities to get access to all the necessary means to avail of maximum benefits from the university. NOTE :  Coventry University has a long-standing connection with Study Group, which has helped international students from all around the world prepare for a successful and exciting future. The university's contract is coming to an end this year, thus the center will close on August 31, 2022.

Name: UCL institute of Education
Overview: The UCL Institute of Education is a university located in London, UK. 1826 saw the establishment of the University. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Unassigned. The main campus of the UCL Institute of Education is located in London. The University offers undergraduate program and postgraduate program. This is the institution that excels at postgraduate studies and education-related research. It is even regarded as one of the University of London's 11 constituent faculties. This institution is home to the majority of the UK's PhD research students in education, numbering about 700. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. In addition, the University has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. The University's alumni network includes 250,000 alumni from 190 different countries. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around 2137356. UCL Institute of Education offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Read more details about UCL Institute of Education on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: University of Surrey
Overview: The University of Surrey is a public research university located in Guildford, England. Formerly known as the Battersea College of Technology, it gained its university status and was renamed in 1966. The university is renowned as a pioneer in the field of mobile and satellite communications technology, with an ongoing project helping develop 5G communication platforms. The university offers over 90 undergraduate courses as well as over 100 postgraduate courses. The university also offers students a chance to pursue their doctoral studies. The top courses at the University of Surrey include MSc in 5G and Future Generation Communications System, MSc in Satellite Communications Engineering and B.Eng in Electrical and Electronic Engineering. The main campus is located on Stag Hill in Guildford and is spread over an area of 74 acres. A secondary campus was opened 1.6 kilometers away from this campus. Called the Manor Park Campus, it consists of a number of residential and academic buildings, as well as the Surrey Sports Park, the main sporting complex of the university. The university is home to the Surrey Research Park, with over 100 companies collaborating with students and faculty. Other facilities provided on campus include the University of Surrey Library and the 5G Innovation Centre. The annual tuition costs vary between GBP 15,500 - GBP 22,000 depending on the course and its length. The university has a diverse student culture, with 33% of the total students being from foreign countries. Spaces like the MySurreyNest and The Marquee encourage students to gather together to collaborate and interact with the multicultural student body. Notable alumni who studied at the University of Surrey include Ameenah Gurib-Fakim, former President of Maldives, theoretical physicist Jim Al-Khalili and former Member of Parliament Liz McInnes.
Eligibility Overview: ICSE/CBSE, West Bengal board, or another recognised state exam board completed standard XII with at least 50% overall or greater depending on the course.In order to be considered for a programme that needs a UK 2:1, the applicant must score at least 60% or 65 percent.An applicant must score at least 55 percent or 60 percent for a course that requires a UK 2:2.To be eligible for a scholarship for a programme that requires a UK first-class, the applicant must score at least 65 percent or 70%.Applicants who do not meet the prerequisites can apply to the foundational programme (for undergraduates) or the Pre-masters Preparation Program (for Master's courses). After completing the programme, students can enrol in their desired course.IELTS is not required for Indians to enrol in an undergraduate or postgraduate taught course at the University of Surrey.The institution accepts 70 percent of ISC/CBSE 12th board exam English and 80 percent of the majority of Indian state boards' 12th board exam English.
Placement: According to HESA 2018, around 94 percent of graduates from the University of Surrey are employed within six months after graduation.IBM, Boeing, Morgan Stanley, Walt Disney, and many other well-known companies are among the institution's notable partners and employers of graduates.According to Payscale, the annual pay of University of Surrey graduates is 34,000 GBP.Airbus, Bae Systems, HP, IBM, Boeing, L'Oreal, and many others are among Surrey's 2300+ placement partners. The university's MBA graduates are among the best paid, with an average salary of 92,540 GBP (128,000 USD).According to Emolument, the highest paid graduates of the university are engaged in Executive Management positions, with an average salary of 69,400 GBP (96,000 USD). For its graduates, the university hosts a number of courses on resume writing, skill development, mock interviews, and other topics.The University's placements typically begin in the summer, in June, and end in September. Students can also participate in a postgraduate placement programme offered by the university.
Accommodation: On Campus AccommodationSurrey University has about 5,000 rooms of various varieties to suit all budgets.Except for the studio apartments (band F) in Manor Park, all halls of residence at Surrey are self-catering with communal kitchen facilities. All rooms have broadband service and personal items insurance included in the price.Rooms are categorised from A to E based on pricing and amenities.Family apartments, staff rooms, and visiting rooms are also available at the university. Rooms are assigned according to term dates, which are typically 38 weeks for undergraduates and 52 weeks for postgraduates.Rent can be paid in instalments by students.The cost of living does not include a meal plan.Visit:- http://www.surrey.ac.uk/accommodation/index.htmOff Campus AccommodationThe average monthly rent is between 600 and 800 pounds.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.These contemporary apartments have 24-hour security, a bike storage area, study rooms, a laundry facility, and a private courtyard.Students will have everything they need to study, including high-speed WiFi, abundant built-in storage, and ambient lighting.Visit:- https://www.rightmove.co.uk/student-accommodation/Guildford.htmlhttps://www.accommodationforstudents.com/in/guildfordhttps://sturents.com/student-accommodation/guildford/
Course Ranking: Let's examine the University of Surrey's course rankings! The university is ranked 251-300 by QS in the Accounting & Finance category for 2019. Whereas, THE's PG Business and Economics ranking has Surrey moving up from 125th to 61st place for 2019 to 2021. The University of Surrey is one of the top 100 universities in the UK according to The Complete University Guide's accounting and finance and business & management studies (UK) rankings. The University of Surrey's standing in The Guardian's rankings for accounting, finance, and business, management, and marketing has declined over time.In its ranking of universities in engineering and technology for 2021, QS has placed the University of Surrey at position 224. Since 2018, Surrey has maintained a 126–150 level in THE's PG Engineering and Technology ranking. In addition, The Complete University Guide and The Guardian ranked the University of Surrey's engineering programmes in the top 100 in the UK. The aforementioned statistics show how well-liked Surrey's Electronic & Electrical course is in the UK.
University Ranking: Located in Guildford, United Kingdom, The Institution of Surrey is a public research university. From 2017 to 2020, the University of Surrey was ranked between 301 and 400 by Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking). In its global university rating for 2021, QS has Surrey at the 267th spot. Since 2017, THE (Times Higher Education) has consistently ranked the University of Surrey in the top 250 universities worldwide. In its ranking of the world's universities, another significant publisher, US News & World Report, has dropped Surrey's position from 409th in 2018 to 447th in 2021. This shows that Surrey University has fallen short on important metrics like the percentage of total publications cited among the top publications and the university's reputation for research both locally and globally. We can see that The Complete University Guide and The Guardian have both slipped in the UK rankings for the University of Surrey over time.University of Surrey Ranking

Name: University of South Wales - Newport City
Overview: The University of South Wales - Newport City is located at the heart of the city only 20 minutes away from Cardiff. The Halls of Residence are also situated at a few minutes walking distance. This campus overlooks the River Usk. Many courses at this university have received accreditation from professional bodies. These accreditations include CIPD, ICE, IOSH RICS, IET, HCPC, APM, ACCA, ICAEW, and IDM. The various areas in which students will find courses at University of South Wales - Newport City are Education, Psychology, Computing, Business, Teaching, Social Work, Accounting, Counselling and Therapeutic, etc. Some courses offered at this institute include BA (Hons) Education; BA (Hons) Early Years Education and Practice (with Early Years Practitioner status); MA Leadership & Management (Education); Postgraduate Diploma SEN/ALN (Specific Learning Difficulties); BSc (Hons) Criminology and Criminal Justice with Psychology; DPsych Counselling Psychology, etc. Students on this campus can benefit from several facilities at this campus - lecture theatres, Flexible exhibition space, dance studio, complimentary Wi-Fi, and many more. There is an array of University of South Wales scholarships available for self-funding international candidates. These are applicable for every year of study at this university but not applied to DBA, placement years, or English language courses. Some of these scholarships include International Office Scholarships, Chancellor's International Development Scholarship, EU Scholarship, Chevening Scholarships, etc. The University has collaborated with private provider CLV in Newport city centre to provide modern Halls of Residence to the students. The vacancy boards at this university witness over thousands of placement and job postings every year and more than 500 employers visit the university. Several noteworthy personalities associated with this institute include filmmaker Scott Barley, film director Gareth Evans, actor Ben Green, TV personality Mark Labbett, and many others.
Eligibility Overview: Academic QualificationsAn overall average of 3 Year degree (B.COM, BBA, B.SC, BCA etc.) at 60% (or CGPA of 6.0/10) from a recognised Indian university for entry to a relevant postgraduate programme.An overall average of 4- or 5-Year degrees (B.E, BTECH, B PHARM, B. ARCH etc.)  at 55% (or CGPA of 5.8/10) from a recognised Indian university for entry to a relevant postgraduate programme.50% (or CGPA 5.5/10) minimum from the following Indian universities: University of Mumbai, University of Delhi, University of Pune, Jadavpur University or University of Calcutta  English QualificationsProficiency in English is essential for study at the University. The University of South Wales recognise the following English language qualifications:HSC (12th standard) English at 65-70% or above, depending on which Board you have studied IELTS 6.0 overall with at least 5.5 in each band or equivalent (some courses require higher IELTS – please refer to relevant course page on website)USW English test (known as the Password test) – this is a free English test that can be completed in India. Please email india@southwales.ac.uk for further details.We also accept alternative English tests.
Accommodation: Halls are an important component of your student experience, and we have housing available at all three of our campuses. Name: St Mary’s University London International College
Overview: St Mary's, which was founded in 1850 and has a long history in education, has a high reputation for teaching excellence and a student-centric approach. The Privy Council granted St Mary's University College, Twickenham, full university status on January 23, 2014, and it became St Mary's University, Twickenham.The University's existing property is divided into four sections. The main campus is on Waldegrave Road in Twickenham, within the grounds of Strawberry Hill House; there is a hall of residence at 16 Strawberry Hill Road; the main sports fields are on the Teddington Lock campus in Broom Road, Teddington; and the new Naylor Library (also on Waldegrave Road) opened in the autumn of 2015.St Mary's picturesque location is ideal for studying, being close to the hustle and bustle of Central London while still providing easy access to the rest of the UK and Europe. You will be welcomed and cherished on our picturesque campus, which boasts a close-knit community.It has unrivalled sporting facilities and a wide range of sport modules to choose from. You have the option of staying on campus or with a host family, both of which are good and reasonable options. Study Abroad students can choose from a variety of modules in the fields of education, humanities, social sciences, theology, sport, health, and applied science. With a credit-bearing internship in your topic of interest, you can get international job experience.
Eligibility Overview: Entry RequirementsAcademic transcripts and certificates are copies of the originals.A copy of your language requirements in English (if needed)\A photocopy of your passportPlease click on the link below to view unique specific entrance requirements for your country.https://www.stmarys.ac.uk/international/country-information/your-country.aspx
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: HousingAt St Mary's, international students enjoy a variety of housing alternatives, both on and off campus.Whether you are looking for on-campus halls of residence or private sector housing, the Accommodation Team can assist you in locating the ideal place to live.Residential hallsStudents in their first year of college can apply to live in one of St Mary's halls of residence. All of the residence halls offer high-quality accommodations, free Wi-Fi across campus, and convenient access to campus resources.Breakfast Monday through Friday, brunch on Saturday and Sunday, and a dinner every evening are included in the pricing (term-time only). All meals are served in the campus refectory, which offers a diverse menu to suit a wide range of tastes.

Name: The University of Buckingham
Overview: The University of Buckingham was established in 1976 in Buckingham, UK. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The main campus of The University of Buckingham is located in Buckingham. The university offers over six undergraduate programs and four postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. It is advised for students to stay on Hunter Street on campus. The housing on campus offers WIFI, heating, lights, and water. Most bedrooms have a bed, mattress, drapes, desk, desk chair, desk lamp, shelves, wardrobe, vanity unit, and mini-cooler.The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around Rs. 2170565. The University of Buckingham offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Read more details about The University of Buckingham on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: International students are accepted if they meet all deadlines, present all required documentation, and complete all other conditions. Applicants who wish to study at the University of Buckingham as an overseas student must meet the following requirements:Completed Application FormOfficial transcripts of high school or collegeEnglish proficiency test scoresLetters of Reference (one for UG; two for PG)Personal StatementDetails of your work experienceCopy of passportInformal Interview (if required)International applicants are required to furnish proof of English language proficiency through any one of the following test scores

Name: University of Kent
Overview: The University of Kent in England is a semi-collegiate public research institute established in 1965 with an enrollment of about 18,865 students (around 15,295 undergraduates and 3,565 postgraduates) and a faculty of approximately 4,000 members. Offering undergraduate and postgraduate (taught and research) across eight colleges like Eliot, Woolf, Darwin, and Turing, the university allows students to pursue degrees such as BSc, BA, Fads', MSc, MA, Ph.D., etc. University of Kent disciplines include Artificial Intelligence, Anthropology, Community Care, Human Geography, and Military History. The University of Kent campuses are divided into two, Canterbury (main campus) and Medway, with two sites (Pembroke and The Historic Dockyard Chatham). To strengthen its global academic initiative, the university offers programs like study or work abroad (with over 100 international universities), Global Learning Online (virtual exchange), Global Officers Leadership Development (GOLD), and also Erasmus+. Other courses are Professional Development courses, General Interest Courses, and Summer School courses. Student accommodation for undergraduates and postgraduates on both campuses (5,400 rooms in Canterbury and 1,100 in Medway) comprises en-suite rooms, houses, and studio flats with dining services and proximity to academic and recreational facilities. With over 175 organizations, students can engage in political, professional, social, and cultural activities.The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is GBP 9,250 for UK students and begins at GBP 16,200 for overseas students. University of Kent financial aid comes from scholarships, grants, loans, bursaries such as International scholarships, the Kent Financial Support Packages, government loans, and Special EU fees.
Eligibility Overview: Students from India with a wide range of credentials and expertise are welcome at Kent University, which evaluates each application on its merit. Please be aware that specific departments may have different entry requirements. Foundational Programme Depending on the examining board they used to complete their Standard XII coursework, Indian students desiring to enrol in Kent's foundation programme must score between 50 and 55% overall. Undergraduate Students who have earned their Standard XII Higher Secondary School Certificates (Indian School Certificate, Intermediate Examination Certificate, Higher Secondary School Certificate) are eligible to enrol in undergraduate programmes at the university. Depending on the examination board and the planned programme of study, universities usually expect students to acquire a minimum of between 65% and 75% overall in their Standard XII examinations. Specific curriculum and grade requirements may be stated for some courses. Postgraduate Indian students usually need to have finished a three or four-year undergraduate degree (Honours Bachelor degree or Professional degree) at a recognised university or college to be admitted to a Kent postgraduate degree programme (Master's). Sometimes general bachelor's degrees may be taken into account. The postgraduate degree you are applying for and the university you attended will determine the specific criteria. Universities typically ask for a First Class degree, a final CGPA of 6.0/10, or 60%, for programmes that call for a 2:1. With a high Second Class degree, and a final CGPA of 5.5/10, or 55%, students from prestigious universities may be taken into considerationUniversities typically request a high Second Class degree, a final CGPA of 5.5/10, or 55%, for programmes that call for a 2:2 PhDIndian students normally need to have earned a Master's degree with a First Class designation, a CGPA of 6.0/10, or 60% or equivalent at an approved university in order to be admitted to a Kent PhD programme. English Language Proficiency:

Name: University of Aberdeen
Overview: A public research university in Scotland, the University of Aberdeen was founded in 1495 and is known as the fifth oldest university in the United Kingdom. Offering the students a flawless blend of tradition and modern academic experience, the university is dedicated to producing aware citizens who will strive to uphold their faiths and values. It stretches ceremonial purpose to its 3 colleges Kings College, Marischal College and Christs College. Organized into 12 schools offering programs pertaining to varied disciplines of Arts and Social Sciences, Business, Life Science and Medicine, Physical Sciences, and  Postgraduate Research the university operates at two campuses of its London Location. Housing two campuses in Scotland with one in Forester hill which is about 2 miles from the second and the main campus of King's College in Old Aberdeen, the university plays host to various cultural and academic conferences. It offers hundreds of courses for undergraduate, postgraduate and doctorate degrees amongst which Science, Engineering, Cultural and Language courses top the list. The research quality here at Aberdeen is recognised to be distinguished because of the resourceful and updated libraries.  A traditional and renowned university, Aberdeen ensures its students with a vibrant and successful future. With the acceptance rate of 78%, the average annual cost along with accommodation can come to around Œ£30K which can be reduced with the help of various grants and scholarships offered by the university. Courtesy of a prominent alumni network, the university promises an impressive 90% placement rate for its graduating batch.  The ancient and aesthetically architected campuses reflect the culturally rich Scottish heritage through its residential halls, libraries, laboratories, theatres, recreational halls and cultural centres. The university strives to ensure a holistic and traditional experience for its students through its focus on co-curricular and volunteering events.
Eligibility Overview: Eligibility varies based on your country of origin.Please check this link; https://www.abdn.ac.uk/study/international/inmycountry/entry-requirements.php

The university's Computer Science programme received a ranking of 29 in The Complete University Guide for the academic years 2020 and 2021.
University Ranking: Complete University Guide - University Ranking has the university at number 26. (UK). Previously, the university had rankings of 28 for 2019 and 29 for 2020. The university has been placed 20 for 2021 by The Guardian - University Rankings, which is particular to the UK. Previously, the university had rankings of 51 for 2019 and 34 for 2020. As part of their ranking criteria, The Complete University Guide takes into account Graduate Prospects, Research Quality, Research Intensity, and Entry Standards. Entry Standards, Student-Staff Ratio, Value-Added Services, and Career Prospects are the main ranking factors used by The Guardian.The university is also mentioned in the list of global universities published by US News & World Report, where it is ranked 238th for the year 2021. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each).placing first QS The university has received rankings of 207 and 178 for 2021 in the World University Ranking and THE (Times Higher Education) - University Ranking, respectively. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each.

Name: Arts University Bournemouth
Overview: Established in 1880 and situated in Poole, England, the Arts University Bournemouth provides higher education, especially in performance, design, media, and art. It is ranked as Poole and Bournemouth's second-largest university. This university has been awarded the Gold in Teaching Excellence Framework, which the government gives on the quality of teaching in universities and other higher education providers. The university accepts an IELTS Academic score of 5.0 total, with 4.5 in each band.This university offers 47 graduate research programs, short courses, foundation degrees, CPD programs, etc. Distance learning is also offered online for a few programs. The university offers more than 30 programs in film and animation, fine arts, and architecture at undergraduate, postgraduate, and Ph.D. levels. International Undergraduate and Postgraduate Scholarships worth £15,000 are offered to international studentsThe employment rate of this university is approximately 98%, with graduates finding jobs within six months of graduation, according to the most recent DLHE Survey.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: IndiaXIIth Standard (CBSE board only)A grade of at least 70% is necessary English language proficiency score: IELTS Academic 5.0 total with 4.5 in each bandTOEFL iBT with a score of 45 overall, with no less than 7 in reading, hearing, speaking, and writing.PTE Academic has a total score of 36, with at least 30 in each section.With at least 33 in each component, LanguageCert International ESOL B1 Achiever (Listening, Reading, Writing, Speaking)
Placement: All AUB students and recent AUB graduates have access to the Careers and Employability team's specialised careers site. If you sign up for the system, you'll discover: The careers team hosts a variety of events for graduates, guest speakers, and employers.Part-time work, internships, freelancing opportunities, contests, and graduate jobs are all available on the AUB job board.A variety of career materials, including recordings of previous guest speakers, CV and cover letter writing guidelines, LinkedIn tips, and advice for anyone seeking self-employment.
Accommodation: This institution is operational with two campuses, both of which are located within Bournemouth. Some of the exclusive campus facilities offered to the students include the Fusion building Atrium, library, Arne houses, agile room, etc. The students are also offered a selection of 130 societies and clubs. For undergraduate and postgraduate students, there are approximately 12 residential housing available. Last year, approximately 116 Arts University Bournemouth undergraduate courses and up to 100 student programs were available for international students.On-Campus Accommodation AUB provides students with on-campus housingStudents can live in a variety of residence halls at the universityThe halls of residence are either on campus or in the Lansdowne area of Bournemouth town centre, both of which have excellent bus and public transportation connections, allowing students to conveniently reach the university campus and the town centre On-campus housing link

Name: MetFilm School, London
Overview: Founded in 2003, MetFilm School is a private film school in London comprising MetFilm school, MetFilm Production, Metfilm Sales, MetFilm Features, and Screen Space. The cutting-edge premises and offices are situated inside the world-renowned Ealing Studios in West London. MetFilm School is at two locations: in Berlin and London and provides students with the industry-standard camera, lighting, and sound equipment used for personal and school projects. The school offers a multipurpose area for workshops, lectures, and student production with complete working sets. The school offers undergraduate courses in BA practical postgraduate courses in Directing, Screenwriting, Producing, Cinematography, Post-production, and Documentary and Factual. The college also provides certificates for one-year, part-time, and short courses in Arts, design, and Architecture in 41 subjects, Journalism and Media in 37 subjects, and Humanities. The young people course offered by MetFilm is ideal for 14-17-year-olds. The college provides weekend courses, too. The course fee ranges between EUR 15,000 to EUR 25,000 annually. The school has different offices, including a 2,000 sq. foot film stage, two instructing blocks in addition to a different studio space, more than 100 Apple Macintosh workstations, and a huge understudy standard after-creation room. It also offers a filmmaking kit including high-end digital cameras, sound recording kit, TV studio vision mixing, post-production suites, and much more. The MetFilm school has partnered with Central Studios Ealing for the accommodation of students. In addition, the school aims to provide support for those interested in pursuing higher education. It offers students accredited courses and voluntary online courses in the language of filmmaking through a virtual learning environment. MetFilm School is the first school in the UK to have an employment support team by connecting students to various opportunities within the screen industry. Also, various scholarships are offered to international students with the filmmakers to be exceptional filmmakers.
Eligibility Overview: Standard Entry CriteriaWe require an IELTS overall score of 6.5 for postgraduate programmes, with at least 6.5 in writing and 5.5 in hearing, reading, and speaking. You must demonstrate a B2 English Level (upper-intermediate) before applying for your Student Visa.
Accommodation: MetFilm School does not provide student housing, but has collaborated with Central Studios Ealing, a stylish, all-inclusive student apartment in Ealing that is conveniently located just 3 minutes walk from MetFilm School – learn more below.For students of all types, London offers a wide range of additional lodging possibilities.
