Name: University of Law - Leeds
Overview: University of Law - Leeds is a private university in the UK, formerly named The College of Law of England and Wales. It achieved university status in 2021 and is one of the largest law schools in the UK, providing unique law degrees, specialised legal training, business training and other continuing professional development courses. The university has nine campuses all over the UK and an international branch in Hong Kong. University of Law - Leeds campus is second to London in job opportunities with more than 200 law firms. The 2014 National Student Survey classified the university with the University of Exeter, University of East Anglia, and the University of Buckingham as the UK's second most successful university regarding students' satisfaction level of 92%. It is also the first for-profit educational institution in the country. The university houses 8000 students from 120+ nationalities contributing heavily to the campus diversity and community richness. University of Law courses includes contract law, Foundations of Law, Constitutional and Administrative laws, and Criminal laws. In addition, there are optional modules in areas like human rights law, family law etc.University offers training that will give the students a deeper understanding of the profession and studying law as a social institution. Furthermore, the university provides more than 250 qualified lawyers and business professionals facilitators. Students are taught using practical methods, helping them face academic and real-life barriers. Apart from delivering unique law programs, the university also offers pre-sessional English courses to international students allowing them to fine-tune their language before opting for a course. Pathways to Law is an opportunity given to students indebted to making a career in law. In addition to the stupendous law programs they offer, students also receive student services like financial aid in the form of loans and non-repayable grants.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: The candidate must have finished high school with mathematics as a required subjectFor bachelor's degree programmes in law or business, applicants must have received a minimum score of 70 per cent on the senior secondary level qualifying exam Postgraduate: The applicant must have successfully completed a bachelor's programme at an accredited universityA minimum of 50% in a related discipline, such as law or business, at the bachelor's/professional bachelor's level, is necessary English Requirements:

Name: University of Nottingham
Overview: Founded in 1881 as University College Nottingham, the University of Nottingham is a public research university and a proud member of the Russell Group association. The fifth-largest university in the UK consists of five faculties with 50 schools, colleges, and research centers offering 343 undergraduate and 368 postgraduate courses. The university is especially famous for research and ranks 8th in the United Kingdom. Other popular courses include geography, Veterinary Sciences, Pharmacy, Literature, Engineering, Computer Science, Architecture, and MBA. With a high acceptance rate of 78.5%, the undergraduate application is put up through the UCAS portal with a fee of 20-25 GBP and through Graduate Application Portal for postgraduate programs with a fee of 40 GBP along with SOP, LORs, IELTS, TOEFL, or GMAT if required by the program. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 22,540 GBP and 20,396 GBP for postgraduate programs, where the living expenses amount to approximately 9,746 GBP. To provide financial aid, scholarships like South Asia Undergraduate and Postgraduate Excellence and Chevening Scholarships waive up to the entire tuition fee. Nottingham has a placement rate of more than 80%, and there are well-paid jobs with an average salary of 90,000 GBP in Management, 88,000 GBP for MBA, and 70,000 GBP for Executive Master's.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Requirements Look at the average grades from your four highest-scoring topics for the Indian Higher Secondary Certificate (Class XII) university. The following offers advice on the minimum grade requirements for particular boards; admission criteria differ according to the programme you're applying to: Grades for the Indian Higher Secondary Certificate (Class XII) from the CBSE or CISCE Boards range from 84% to 93%Grades ranged from 84% to 93% on the Maharashtra State Board's India Higher Secondary Certificate (Class XII) examGrades ranged from 74% to 83% for the Indian Higher Secondary Certificate (Class XII) administered by the West Bengal BoardGrades range from 89% to 98% for the Indian Higher Secondary Certificate (Class XII) for all other state boards Postgraduate Requirements Candidates should hold a bachelor's degree in a related discipline, ideally from an authorised university. In the UK, this should at the very least be a "Upper Second Class (2:1)" or "Lower Second Class (2:2)" degree. Equivalency of UK and Indian Scores:Upper Second Class = 60% = GPA of 3.0/4 or 6.0/10Lower Second Class = 55% = GPA of 2.6/4 or 5.5/10 Entrance requirements for PhD Candidates should have a master's degree in a relevant field with a good standing from an accredited university. English Language Requirements

Name: Centre for Alternative Technology
Overview: Situated in Powys, Wales, the Centre for Alternative Technology (CAT) is an educational charity established in the 1970s dedicated to researching climate change. It has had over 1,795 students enrolled in its Graduate School and other courses. Some postgraduate courses include Green Building, Sustainability and Adaptation, Sustainable Food and Natural Resources, and Sustainability and Ecology.The Centre for Alternative Technology campus is situated 3 miles north of Machynlleth. CATäó»s distance learning initiative allows access to its seminars, lectures, tutorials, library resources, and tutors through Canvas or Moodle. Instead of the 18-month full-time program, students can study part-time over three years; 2 years for teaching modules and six months for the final dissertation.The blended learning initiative offers the possibility of pursuing courses online and offline. It offers numerous short courses like Cob Building, Making Frame Baskets, and Eco Refurbishment, held outside. Various webinars and online events are organized to provide valuable tips and explore the different aspects of climate change. Postgraduate Diploma and Certificate programs are available in sustainability and adaptation planning and sustainability and behaviour change disciplines.The estimated MSc tuition fee is GBP 6,890 for domestic and GBP 8,330 for international students, while the March tuition fee is GBP 12,500. Scholarships, bursaries, grants, and loans like the Rose Jessica-Maia Bursary, Vegetarian Award, The Royal Society Grants, and Find-a-Masters Scholarships are some financial aids. Accommodation is provided within the UNESCO Dyfi Biosphere; the WISE building offers twin en-suite rooms, while the eco-cabins provide bunkhouse-style accommodation.The Vegetarian Cafe provide food and space to hang out, while the eco-store keeps books, stationery, and other necessities. Becoming a residential 6-month volunteer is an excellent way to help the Gardens or Woodlands and Water teams while living on-site; short volunteer opportunities are also available.
Eligibility Overview: We require the following courses: a Bachelor's degree or knowledge and abilities equal to a bachelor's degree; For applicants whose first language is not English, an IELTS score of 6.5 (or equivalent) is necessary. MSc SEPDM requires science and a higher degree of numeracy.
Accommodation: The Wales Institute of Sustainable Education (WISE) building, a superbly constructed and award-winning green facility right in the heart of our Visitor Centre, houses CAT's accommodation.The 24 twin and double en-suite bedrooms have wonderful views of the Snowdonia National Park, and first-floor apartments have access to a common garden terrace, allowing you to fully appreciate being in the Welsh countryside. Solar-thermally heated showers and basins are provided in all bedrooms, which are heated using CAT's on-site biomass facilities.for more details click on this link-https://cat.org.uk/come-to-cat/venue-hire/accommodation/

Name: University of Salford
Overview: The University of Salford is one of the leading public research universities in Salford, Greater Manchester, UK. Established in 1967, it got university status after introducing the Royal Charter. The university is affiliated with the Association of Commonwealth Universities, North West, and University Alliance. The University of Salford enrols more than 20,000 students in various fields, including zoology, business, engineering, accounting, law, management, psychology, health, and economics. The international students are offered several English Language Programs. This university has seven schools and language centres that offer undergraduate, postgraduate, distance learning, doctorate, and other certificate programs. M.Sc in Advanced Computer Science, M.Sc in Robotics and Automation, B.Sc in Business and Management, and LLM in International Business Law are some of the university's top courses.The University of Salford also provides its students various scholarships and financial aid. The university offers excellent placement opportunities in some selected courses. The average annual salary of a B.Sc graduate in International Business is Pound 24,000.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: The Indian applicants must have passed the CBSE board with 60% marks to get admission to the University of Salford.Other board students that can apply include:50% (West Bengal), 55% (ISC, awarded by CISCE), 60% (CBSE), and 65% (all other state boards) for undergraduate study. Postgraduate: The Indian applicants must have a three or four-year degree with an average score of 55%.If an applicant has a score of 50%, he or she must submit work experience or any other qualifications. English Requirements:

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: Living in student housing is an excellent opportunity to ease into university life, meet new people, and become immersed in the student experience.Whether you're a first-year undergraduate, an international student, or a postgraduate student wishing to live in halls, Oxford has several fantastic options, including Peel Park Quarter, which was voted the second-best hall of residence in the UK by Student Hut in 2020.Campus Living Villages (CLV), one of the university's lodging partners, manages two villages: Peel Park Quarter and John Lester and Eddie Colman Courts.You have the option of living at Peel Park Quarter or John Lester and Eddie Colman Courts if you are applying for your first year at university. You can only apply for John Lester and Eddie Colman Courts if you are a returning or postgraduate student.In either case, you'll be able to enjoy student life in a spacious environment that's only a short distance from your studies. Peel Park Quater: We're happy to work in conjunction with the University of Salford to run our halls. Peel Park Quarter is in a fantastic location, just a short bus ride from Salford Quays and Manchester city centre.Student Hut ranked us the second-best student hall in the UK in 2020. In addition, there are games consoles, pool tables, study places, a gym, and two cinema rooms in this community. John Lester and Eddie Colman Court The village is in a great location, with the Frederick Road campus right outside your door and the main Peel Park campus and its amenities only a 15-minute walk away.There are a variety of room kinds to choose from, all with varying costs. We have flats that are specifically designed for first-year students, as well as flats that are more popular with returning students and post-graduates seeking a more relaxed environment.On-site amenities include common rooms, a shared kitchen, quiet study spaces, laundry facilities, and a free on-site gym reserved exclusively for John Lester and Eddie Colman residents.

Name: University of South Wales - Cardiff
Overview: Formerly known as the University of Glamorgan, the University of South Wales- Cardiff, established in 2013, is located in Wales. In 2014, it was granted the title of University of Wales by the Privy Council. The university has four campuses- Dubai, Newport, Pontypridd and Cardiff.  The university offers 500 courses including accounting, finance, films and visual effects, Renewable and sustainable energy, business and management, biological science and many more. It is the second-largest university in terms of the number of students enrolled. The university aims at spreading education to tradesmen and workers and focuses on providing students with premium education by using the latest technology, modern software and equipment. Furthermore, the university also offers foundation degrees, master's degrees, top-ups, research degrees, part-time study options and doctoral programs. University of South Wales - Cardiff campus encompasses the media hub of the university and is closer to BBCStudios and Pinewood Studios. The Faculty of Creative Industries and other courses offered by the faculty of Business and Society is found on the Cardiff campus of the university. Another important aspect of the campus is the Atrium building which is a replacement for the Caerleon campus. The university gained popularity by securing several prestigious positions. According to The Guardian 2021, it ranks 66th in the University Rankings, 21st in Accounting and Finance Rankings, 17th in Civil Engineering, 102nd University Ranking (UK) as per the Complete University Guide 2021 and many notable ranks making it stand out from the rest of the universities.The university aims at enhancing the industry knowledge, skills and potential of the student, making them ideally fit for any reputed career choice. The university's student service includes accommodation, scholarships, placement opportunities and other health services catering to all the needs of the students.

Name: University of South Wales - Glyntaff
Overview: The University of South Wales Glyntaff campus is situated in the heart of the South Wales Valleys and is only 20 minutes away from Cardiff. Several courses at this institute have an 'official’ industry approval, through accreditations from various professional bodies - Chartered Institute of Purchasing and Supply (CIPS), the British Psychology Society (BPS), Skillset Media Academy Wales, ACCA, the British Computer Society (BCS), etc. The various courses at University of South Wales Glyntaff are offered in Health Sciences; Forensic Science; Biological Sciences; Midwifery; Nursing; Geography, Geology & Natural History; Medical Sciences; Chemical and Pharmaceutical Sciences. A USW student uses industry grade technology and equipment. This ranges from a Merlin MP521 engineering flight simulator and a full-size Jetstream 31 airliner to healthcare suites, crime scene houses, and TV studios. In the last Research Excellence Framework in 2014, half of the research of this university got rated as internationally excellent or world leading. In the United Kingdom, this institute’s research in social policy and criminology ranked 8th. In the field of sports and exercise science, it ranked 15th overall. The various research areas at this university are Health And Well-Being; Crime, Security And Justice; Sustainable Environment and Creative Industries And Digital Economy. This institute also offers a range of bursaries and scholarships to support its students. Some of these include USW Welsh Scholarship 2022-23, USW Gwent Scholarship 2022-23, USW Sport Scholarships and Bursaries 2022-23. Students finishing their studies with this university automatically become a part of a global alumni community of over 250,000. About 95% of USW students either get employed or opt for further studies within six months of their graduation. Some well-renowned organisations where successful University of South Wales alumni have opted to work are Sony, BBC, the NHS, and British Airways.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?The University of South Wales has criteria that are peculiar to the country. The following are the recognized educational qualifications for Indian aspirants: Programmes for FoundationsStudents who do not meet the academic prerequisites for direct admission to a bachelor's degree programme should enroll in a Foundation Years programme. Students who have a strong command of the English language, such as an IELTS score of 6.0 or higher, are eligible for foundation courses. Undergraduate Degree ProgramsIn Grade 12, students must achieve an overall grade point average of 60-65 percent, depending on the school board. Applicants with a relevant HND from the United Kingdom or an India Diploma may be eligible for advanced entry to undergraduate degree programmes. Postgraduate StudiesStudents holding a three-year bachelor's degree in BCom, BBA, BCA, B.Sc, or other related fields must have a 60 percent or CGPA of 6.0/10 or more from a recognised Indian university.A 55 percent or CGPA 5.8/10 and above from a recognised Indian university is necessary for students with a four or five year degree such as BTech, BE, B.Arch, and BPharma, among others.Students must achieve a minimum of 50% or a CGPA of 5.5/10 in Indian universities such as Delhi University, Mumbai University, Jadavpur University, the University of Kolkata, and the University of Pune.

Name: Leeds Trinity University
Overview: Leeds Beckett University and the Leeds Mechanics Institute, established in 1824, have their campus in Leeds, in the centre of England, and include several academic and administrative buildings. Leeds Beckett University has about 13 academic schools, each providing undergraduate, postgraduate, and distance learning programmes with short courses and degree apprenticeships. It also offers courses in diverse fields like arts, design, architecture, business, engineering, psychology, etc.  The university houses about 2,900 staff members and over 28,000 students from approximately 100 countries across the globe. The Leeds Beckett University comprises two campuses that provide students with modern-day facilities and the latest technologies. They consist of state-of-the-art courses in business, finance, law, PR suites, etc.A student graduating from this university is also assured of work placements in UK-based and international companies with a reputation. Leeds Beckett University has produced graduates who have made a name for themselves in various fields and garnered fame. For example, Ricky Wilson, a renowned singer and member of the band Kaiser Chiefs, is an alumnus.   A student community filled with vibrancy is found at Leeds Beckett University. It gives students many opportunities to enjoy food, shopping, and entertainment. In other words, the life of a student at this university is filled with fun. The university is located at an excellent location, allowing students to immerse themselves in the bustling life of the UK completely.
Eligibility Overview: Leeds Beckett University predominantly teaches in English like the majority of the universities in the UK. Due to this, they require you to provide evidence of your English proficiency. Here are the minimum requirements for some popular tests accepted at Leeds.

Name: Instituto Marangoni
Overview: Founded in 1935, the Marangoni Artistic Clothing Institute is a private Italian school of fashion and design based in Milan, Italy. It has five campuses in Milan, London, Paris, Mumbai, and Shanghai, with the latest study areas for pursuing fashion design careers. The School of Fashion, Design, and Art, located in London, the United Kingdom, under the Istituto Marangoni Milano, was opened in 2003. Istituto Marangoni offers various 1-year, 3-year, and foundation programs to more than 2,500 students. The undergraduate courses include the Preparatory Course of Foundation in Fashion, B.A. (Hons.) Degrees in Fashion Design, Fashion Design and Marketing, Fashion Design in Menswear and Womenswear, Fashion Styling and Visual Merchandising, Fashion Business, Fashion Design and Accessories, etc. The courses at the post-graduation level are the Preparatory Course in Pre-Sessional for Master's Degrees in Fashion Styling, Photography and Film, Fashion Design Womenswear, Fashion, and Luxury Brand Management.The off-campus accommodation residences near the main campus provide studio, three-bedroom, 4-bedroom, and shared apartments at an average rent of 500 GBP- 700GBP. The rent includes electricity, unlimited WiFi, heating provision, and laundry facilities. Istituto Marangoni claims 80% placement rates as they host numerous practical workshops, guest speakers, and extracurricular activities.The average tuition fee is 14,500 GBP for eligible students with minimum marks in IELTS (6) and UCAS Tariff Points (80). Students get additional financial aid of 3,000 GBP- 7,000 GBP along with an exclusive scholarship of 50% tuition fees reduction for candidates in 3-year and Master's programmes.

Name: University of Liverpool - London Campus
Overview: Founded in 1881, Liverpool University is a public research university based in Liverpool, United Kingdom. It comprises three faculties: Health and Life Sciences, Humanities and Social Sciences, and Science and Engineering, with 35 departments and schools. Spread across 100 acres, the university's main campus in Liverpool City Center has 192 non-residential buildings, 68 lecture halls, and 114 teaching areas. Victoria Gallery and Museum, Art studios, Library, Liverpool University Press, Sports and Fitness Center, New Central Teaching Laboratories for physics, chemistry, earth sciences, Central Teaching Hub, and many more provide educational facilities to 33,000 enrolled students.The University of Liverpool provides over 400 undergraduate and postgraduate programs along with 100+ postgraduate research courses with English requirements such as IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (78), PTE (55), and GMAT (600). Students can get admission at the tuition charges of 17,400 GBP- 34,500 GBP and 17,000 GBP- 27,500 GBP for undergraduate and postgraduate degrees with an application fee of 25 GBP. It provides financial aid to international students under merit-based programs like the University of Liverpool First Class Scholarship (1000 GBP), Sport Liverpool Scholarships (2000 GBP), Vice Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship (2000 GBP), etc. The university claims a 94% placement rate for graduates in Computer, Engineering, Chemistry, and Architecture within the six months of degree at an average package of 35,000 GBP in firms like Coca-Cola, Tesco, Motorola, ARM Holdings, etc.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions for International Students The university offers a wide range of undergraduate programmes. The following are the admission standards and procedures for undergraduate programmes:Requirements for Admission:Official academic transcripts are required.Language proficiency score in EnglishStatement of purposeStatement of PurposeResume/CV (if required).Proposal for Research (if required).Two academic sources are provided. International Graduate Student Admissions Students at the University of Liverpool can take post-graduate teaching as well as post-graduate research programmes. In order to pursue a post-graduate degree, applicants must meet certain conditions. The following are some of the specifics:Requirements for Admission:Original transcripts and certifications from high school or college.Transcripts from the university.Degree certificates- If necessary, transcripts and certificates will be translated.Statement of PurposeA curriculum vitae (if required).Proposal for Research (if required).Two academic sources are provided.Language requirements in English
Placement: Placement at the University of Liverpool Students can integrate their academic knowledge with practical experience through placement opportunities with businesses, government agencies, non-profit organisations, and cultural providers.The workplace module provided to students is SOTA300. It also collaborates with Sentric Music and Collective Encounters to give students with incredible skills and possibilities.Within six months of graduation, 90% of its alumni are hired.After graduating from a UK-based university, all international students can take the Graduate Immigration Route to become working professionals.According to Payscale, the average pay of a University of Liverpool graduate is 35,000 GBP per year.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation On-campus housing is available.Students will have their own bathroom with toilet, basin, and shower as well as a double bed.Students will also have plenty of study room, thanks to the inclusion of a well-lit desk and chair.Share a kitchen and lounge space with four to six other students in the same year, where you'll have access to all the self-catering amenities you'll need.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.liverpool.ac.uk/accommodation/ Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus housing is available.The typical monthly rent is between 500 and 700 pounds.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.All basic services like as electricity, central heating, and unrestricted internet access are included in the fee for the student homes.There is also a laundry facility on site.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.spotahome.com/london?gclid=CjwKCAjw8O7bBRB0EiwAfbrThx7k4NS12Y66uXIEQG4hG5RrfXNajS5tqsYa85OQsncuplQe-JhOaRoCn0IQAvD_BwE&budget=79-585https://www.unitestudents.com/londonhttps://freshstudentliving.co.uk/location/london/http://ukstudentresidences.com/search-filter/?location=78&start_date=&end_date=&submit=Searchhttps://wearehomesforstudents.com/student-accommodation/london

Name: University College Birmingham
Overview: University College Birmingham is an English university located in Birmingham. Along with Newman University, it was granted full university status in 2012. In the 2022 WhatUni Student Choice Awards, the University was named 'The University of the Year,' as well as first in the 'Student Support' category. The University offers undergraduate and postgraduate programmes in both practical and scholarly subjects and specializes in hospitality and culinary arts, hairdressing and beauty, tourism, commercial enterprise, marketing, finance, business management, accounting, events management, sports management, and medicine and therapy, to name a few.For different courses, the average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ. Scholarships, work-study, and other forms of financial aid are available to students at the University. In addition, the institution has a Career Planning Service team that assists students in developing a CV and locating employment, whether it be after graduation, part-time work, summer work, or an internship.The University maintains residence halls at The Maltings and Cambrian Hall, which are close to Broad Street, the city's central entertainment area, and provide room for 872 students. A sports hall, a shop, and Joshuas are also part of the new Maltings development.Tuition fees for undergraduate international students start at £13,500, bachelor's course at £15,000, and master's course at £14,500.

Name: University of Wales, Trinity Saint David
Overview: The University of Wales, Trinity Saint David, is located in Swansea, UK. It offers UG and PG courses in education in multiple fields of study, such as Business.The estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around 13,49,749.University of Wales, Trinity Saint David offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students.In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.

Placement: By collaborating with employers and community organisations to develop skills needed for self-employment or working in the company, UWTSD provides a variety of entrepreneurship and employability enhancement options for students. In addition, many UWTSD academic courses feature work-based learning or live projects in which students are obliged to collaborate with external organisations as part of their studies. Many programmes provide a 'Year in Industry' opportunity.Companies can cooperate with UWTSD to provide flexible internships, year-in-industry, or live project positions. The following are some of the opportunities:New perspectiveEase of use with technologyThe trial period could lead to something moreHelp with projects or tasks that you are struggling withGain broad advocatesLittle / no financial cost to the company Recruiting CompaniesJCB Ford MotorsTATAJaguarVisteonMercedes Benz
Accommodation: On-campus Accommodation: At the university, all students have access to on-campus accommodation.On the Swansea Campus, first-year students can apply for one of approximately 300 rooms, which include a mix of traditional study rooms and rooms with en-suite facilitiesOn all three main campuses, on-site 'halls,' or student accommodation, are provided, with many of these rooms allocated for first-year studentsFor more, visit:  Off-Campus Accommodation: There are also studio flats, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments available.The average rent is between 500 and 700 pounds per monthMost student bedrooms include a double bed, desk and chair, wardrobes, and a chest of drawers as a bare minimumAll flats come with electric or gas central heating and toilet amenitiesThe apartments are within walking distance of shopping centres, convenience stores, and supermarketsFor more, visit:
Course Description: University of Wales, Trinity Saint David is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Wales, Trinity Saint David was founded in 2010. Located in Swansea,UK the university is home to about 4000 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Wales, Trinity Saint David is ranked 3070th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 5 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. University of Wales, Trinity Saint David has 9 intakes in Sep,Jan, Mar,Jun,Feb,May,Jul,Aug, Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Wales, Trinity Saint David is around £8,000-£16,000.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Wales, Trinity Saint David include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Wales, Trinity Saint David is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Wales, Trinity Saint David has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of Gloucestershire
Overview: The University of Gloucestershire, established in 1847, is a public university in Gloucestershire, England, in a semi-urban location. The university has three campuses, two of which are in Cheltenham (Francis Close Hall and the Park) and one in Gloucester (Oxstall).The university provides education through its eight different schools: Business and Technology School, Art and Design School, Education School, School of Liberal and Performing Arts, School of Natural and Social Sciences, School of Media, School of Health and Social Care, and the School of Sport and Exercise. The university offers 80 undergraduate, 57 graduate, and doctoral degree programs. Some undergraduate and graduate courses offered by the university are Accounting and Law, Journalism, Computing, Business Management, Humanities, Fine Arts, Geography, Social Science, Biology, Education, IT and Multimedia, Health and Social Care, and Sport and Exercise. Students at the institution have the opportunity to work in a variety of settings through its Degreeplus initiative. 95% of the graduates get employed within six months of graduation. The college offers on-campus accommodation and also aids students by assisting the university's approved landlords with private housing facilities. It has 1,380 residence halls and 1,900 self-catered rooms near the university.The cost of the programs ranges between GBP 24,603 and 25,590. The university provides scholarships to subsidize undergraduate students. These scholarships include the Care Leavers Scholarship, Partnership Bursary, Financial Assistance Fund, Music Scholarship, Emergency short-term loans, Sports Excellence Funds, and PGCE bursaries. Postgraduate financial aid is also offered to students who have completed their undergraduate degrees.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Country-specific requirements India:Undergraduate: A minimum of 65% in Standard XII or completion of an approved foundation courseMaster's degree: A 4-year bachelor's degree with a minimum of 50% or a 3-year bachelor's degree with a minimum of 55%Postgraduate (research): A minimum of 55% in a 4-year bachelor's degree or a minimum of 60% in a 3-year bachelor's degree English Language Proficiency:

Name: University of Leicester
Overview: The University of Leicester, founded in 1921, offers 350 programs through its three colleges- medicine, biological sciences and psychology, science and engineering, and arts and humanities. With an amazing infrastructure and highly-educated faculty members, the University of Leicester is a center for advanced learning. The university is ranked 23rd in the United Kingdom and 170th in the world by the Times Higher Education. The acceptance rate of the University of Leicester is 71.2% of the total candidates who applied to the college in 2021. Over 200 courses are available at the campus and others at different affiliate campuses worldwide. Some popular courses are- Nursing, MBA, Medicine, Engineering, Law, Education, and Biological Sciences. The university is also popular for its research in Genetic Fingerprinting. Besides classroom studies, Leicester also offers career counseling and a placement cell. It is noteworthy that it has partnered with several companies that provide jobs and internships to students.The estimated yearly fees lie between 28,125-32,125 GBP, including rent, food, gas, water, electricity, course material, travel, and personal expenses. Various scholarships are available for international students, which include the President's Scholarship Scheme, the College of Science and Engineering Undergraduate/ Postgraduate Scholarship Scheme, and the ULSB Scholarship Scheme.

Placement: Professional Development ServicesLeicester's Career Development Service will work with you starting in your first year to help you learn the skills that you need.Two recent awards, from AGCAS and TargetJobs, have recognised Leicester's efforts in preparing their graduates for employment.The Career Development Service collaborates closely with your department to provide individualized support for each course. This guarantees you get the best guidance and assistance for your specific interests and goals, rather than a "one size fits all" approach. You'll gain access to a variety of classes as well as one-on-one sessions with seasoned professional advisers.
Accommodation: On-Campus Support and Services Student life is all about independence, but that doesn't mean you won't need assistance from time to time. Check out the various support and services offered at Leicester accommodation.  Accommodation Leicester's Accommodation Team can be reached by email or phone 24 hours a day, or you can simply visit either The Village or The City's 24-hour reception. The team is always available to assist you, whether you've misplaced your key, have a question regarding your accommodation, or simply want a cup of tea and a chat.  Residential Consultants Residential Advisors (RAs) at Leicester are current students who work as part of the Residence Life Team to assist you with your transition. The RAs can be identified by their unique green hoodies, and they are all ready to offer assistance and guidance.  Neat and TidyYou are in charge of your own room as well as the kitchen that you share with other pupils. Leicester's  Housekeepers and Domestic Assistants clean communal areas such as shared bathrooms, entrance lobbies, stairs, and hallways. Your regular cleaner is a crucial member of the Village's 'family', and you'll get along seamlessly with them in no time. Apply here
Course Ranking: Now let's talk about the University of Leicester's course rankings! Leicester has received a THE ranking for PG Business and Economics of 401–500 for 2021. In both the UK publisher's ranking for Business and Management, Leicester has dropped down the list. However, it has consistently ranked well in both the UK publishers' rankings for Accounting & Finance.Since 2019, Leicester has maintained a 301–400 place in THE's PG Engineering and Technology ranking. Additionally, Leicester has maintained its position between 176 and 200 in THE's PG Computers ranking since 2019. Leicester is ranked in the top 100 universities in the UK for mechanical and electrical engineering by The Complete University Guide. Additionally, it dropped Leicester's computer science position outside of the top 100. The information above suggests that the University of Leicester's engineering programmes are well-known throughout the UK.

Name: University of Plymouth International College (NAVITAS)
Overview: The University of Plymouth began as a polytechnic institute in 1862 and is now a public university. In 1992, the institute was granted university status, and it was also the first modern university to open a private medical and dental school. Universities UK, ACU, EUA, CHUC, and Universities UK are all affiliated with it. GSM London, Highlands College, Weymouth College, Strode College, City of Bristol College, and Exeter College are just a some of the prestigious institutions with which the university has academic partnerships.The university's main campus is located in the heart of Plymouth. Academic buildings, libraries, laboratories, and student living halls are all included. The Faculty of Arts, Humanities and Business, the Faculty of Science and Engineering, and the Faculty of Health, as well as the University of Plymouth Students' Union, are all located on the main campus. The School of Medicine, School of Dentistry, and School of Biomedical and Healthcare Sciences are all located on the North Plymouth campus. A public art gallery, digital media facilities, and three performance rehearsal studios are housed in the 9-story Roland Levinsky Building.More than 350,000 volumes, e-books, journals, and other resources for study, learning, and teaching are housed in the Charles Seale-Hayne Library, which is open 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Cars and two-wheelers are the principal modes of transportation on campus. In addition, the campus is only a few minutes' walk from the nearest railway station.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation? According to the institution, Indian students must meet the following criteria: Admissions to the undergraduate programme: Students must fulfil the minimal qualifying requirements for undergraduate students. It's as follows: Students must hold a high school diploma (Grade 12), an Indian school diploma, or an AISSCE.In high school, students must achieve a grade point average of 60% or higher. PostgraduateApplicants must have earned a bachelor's degree or a bachelor's degree in technology from a recognised Indian university with the following degree classification:

Name: University of the West of England Bristol International College
Overview: University of the West of England Bristol is a public research university in Bristol, England. The university was initially established as a school by the Society of Merchant Venturer in 1595. In 1992 it was granted university status. The university encompasses several campuses all over Greater Bristol and houses the International college based on the university campus. The main focus of the college is to offer pathway courses to the students. UWE Bristol International College works in partnership with UWE Bristol and is integrated into the university campus. The college program includes studies pertaining to the undergraduate and postgraduate degree and offers multiple unique facilities like the production studio, library and encompasses UK’s largest robotics lab. The University of the West of England Bristol International College has three pathway options for the aspirants- Foundation certificate programs, International year one focusing on areas like - Business, Computing, Engineering and Pre-masters programs. In addition, the college offers popular majors in Business, Management and Economics, Engineering and technology, arts etc. The university has gained several prestigious titles and achieved worldwide excellence status. According to QS 2021 the university has ranked 801-1000 in World University Ranking, 1,142nd position in Global Universities according to U.S. News & World Report 2021, along with securing 69th position in Accounting & Finance Ranking, 43rd in Mechanical Engineering Ranking and 47th position in Computer Science as per the Complete University Guide 2021. Students can acquire a UWE Bristol degree by pursuing a preparation course at University of the West of England Bristol International College. The University of the West of England Bristol provides multiple courses across four faculties- Faculty of Arts, Creative Industries and Education, Faculty of Business and Law, Faculty of Environment and Technology and Faculty of Health and Applied Sciences. In addition, the college provides comprehensive support by assisting students in coping with academics, exams and providing a homely environment for international students.
Eligibility Overview: Entry requirement for UG applicants are as follows :  Higher Secondary School Certificate/Indian School Certificate (standard XII) from one of the following boards: CBSE/CISCE/WBCHSEB, with a minimum of 65 percent and a grade of C in at least five courses. Students with lower GPA may be admitted to a foundation degree programme.Applicants who have standard IIX from other state boards should contact the International Development Office English language Requirements :

Name: University for the Creative Arts International College, (HOLMES EDUCATION GROUP)
Overview: The University for the Creative Arts International College (UCAIC) is based at Epsom, which is just a short train ride from central London. This campus at Epsom boasts an outstanding range of pubs, restaurants, and shops. It also houses this institution’s Business School for the Creative Industries, the first of its kind in the United Kingdom. A majorly focused area of the University for the Creative Arts Epsom is business.The subjects offered include graphic design, advertising, business & management, fashion, and pre-degree courses. The offered courses prepare a student for entering every area of creative industries, from fashion and festivals to visual communications and advertising. University for the Creative Arts International College offers students a complete array of creative arts and business courses. This institution’s integrated first year of the 2 years postgraduate or 4 years undergraduate degree provides students with a chance to enhance their academic qualifications and English language skills. The University for the Creative Arts is a public, specialist art and design university in south England. The university was established 160 years ago. But the University College for the Creative Arts at Epsom, Rochester Farnham, Canterbury, and Maidstone was formed in 2005. This university is a partner institution of Holmes Education Group.  Besides these, in REF 204, 93% of this university’s research activity was internationally recognised for its quality. And, 64% of its research got classed as internationally excellent and world-leading for its significance, originality, and rigour.

Name: University of the Highlands and Islands
Overview: The Institution of the Highlands and Islands is a Scottish university in Perth, Scotland. Perth is home to the University of the Highlands and Islands' main campus. Students can enrol in undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programmes in various fields and online degree programmes for distant learners. University of the Highlands and Islands offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Boys and girls can stay at UHI's residence halls, which are spread across each campus. These halls include communal bedrooms, living spaces, kitchens and single en suite bathrooms. These flats also offer free Wi-Fi and laundry services. Additionally, the institution offers all the help necessary to help the students choose a comfortable place to stay in local private rental housing.Undergraduate and graduate programmes are available at the university. For different courses, the average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ. An international student's tuition fee starts from £7,440.Read more details about the University of the Highlands and Islands on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Placement: Graduate recruitment and student engagement Graduate recruitment UHI Careers is the university's devoted career service. The agency includes dedicated employees who assist all university students and graduates in obtaining acceptable employment following graduation. The service maintains a jobs database where you can post your criteria for free and have the proper students matched to your openings. Student engagement You can work with the University of the Highlands and Islands students in a variety of ways to meet your skill and employee needs. These are some of them: Student Work Placements or Internships A period of time in the workplace that a student spends as part of their education is usually related to their academic discipline. Work placements for students can last anywhere from two weeks to a year and can be done part-time or full-time. Unless the placement provider is a charity, a voluntary organisation, and allied fundraising group, or a statutory body, national minimum wage legislation applies.Student work placements are aided by a designated placement coordinator who will collaborate with the company to scope the placement and, if necessary, assist with the recruitment process. Throughout the placement, the coordinator will keep in touch with the student and the business and will pay visits to both to assess progress. Student Work Experience An unpaid length of time spent in the workplace by a student that is not directly related to their education or an accredited module or programme. Work Shadowing When a student observes a member of staff working in an organisation in order to obtain a better knowledge of what that employment entails, the activity is usually unpaid and offered on a short-term basis (i.e. 3–5 days). Employer-generated Student Project When an employer gives a student a brief for a specific project that requires certain knowledge or skills, this is known as a project brief. Student projects can be done singly or in groups, and they do not require the student or students to be on the premises of the company. Lecturers assist with projects, which can be paid or unpaid. Volunteering A period of unsupported time spent by a student on an activity that benefits society or the environment. Volunteering is an activity that a student engages in without receiving any compensation. Graduate Internship A period of work experience that a student undertakes after graduation, usually full-time and lasting for at least 6 months to a year. Graduate internships are usually offered for a set period of time and are governed by national minimum wage laws.
Accommodation: Starting university, especially if you are moving away from home, can be terrifying. We want you to make the most of your studies and social life. Finding the correct student housing will assist you in settling in quickly to life as a student.Students have a variety of housing alternatives at the institution, ranging from their own student homes to privately rented nearby housing. Campuses with dedicated accommodation are: UHI Inverness Dedicated student housing is available for people studying in or near Inverness. They also assist students looking for good, cheap places to stay in the area through their accommodation list, which contains contact information for private lodging providers who have offered rooms to students. On-campus, there is a purpose-built student house with 300 en-suite bedrooms and communal kitchen and living facilities.A single en-suite room with a shared kitchen and living area will cost £115 per week in 2022/23, while a studio en-suite bedroom with cooking facilities would cost £141.75. If you have previously stayed with us and would like to stay in a studio room in 2022/23, you will be eligible for the rate of £135 per week. Wi-Fi, heating, electricity, and secure bike storage are all included in the fee. There are also laundry facilities in the student housing and a support system for students adjusting to university life. For more information, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/inverness/ UHI Outer Hebrides The Bayhead Bridge Centre in Stornoway offers self-catering accommodations. It's a terrific spot to be, with easy access to the college and town centre, which are only a ten-minute walk away.The Bayhead Bridge Centre's rooms are modern and well-equipped, with en-suite bathrooms, a desk, and an internet connection. There is a kitchen and lounge area in each of the five bedrooms. Snooker, computer games, and a sports hall are the sports and activities facilities provided at the centre. There is also a laundry on-site, as well as a café that is open until 8 p.m. most days. For more information, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/outerhebrides/  UHI Moray Elgin, an old cathedral city with excellent sports and social facilities and convenient access to Inverness and Aberdeen, is home to the Moray College UHI campus. The student housing is conveniently positioned just a short walk from the main campus building and close to the city centre of Elgin. For more information, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/uni/elgin/  UHI North Highland Dornoch is a golfer's paradise, with the Royal Dornoch Golf Club at its heart. The town is attractive, and the beaches and shoreline make it an ideal vacation spot. The lodging is in the heart of Dornoch, just a few minutes' walk from the campus. Your golfing equipment can even be stored safely and securely at the university. For more information, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/uni/dornoch/  UHI Perth On-campus, a purpose-built student home houses 72 students in 16 shared flats with kitchen/dining and living facilities. On-site amenities include laundry, car parking (for a cost), and bicycle storage. A single en-suite room at the apartments costs £125.65 per week, while shared en-suite rooms cost £97.08 per week (based on two-person sharing). Wi-Fi, heating, electricity, and secure cycle storage are included in the price. For more information, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/uhi-perth/  Sabhal Mòr Ostaig Offers modern, comfortable lodging in beautiful settings with a view of the Sound of Sleat. There are 84 rooms in total, all of which are en-suite, three being wheelchair accessible.There is a kitchen and lounge room in each dormitory block, as well as laundry facilities on campus. Rooms are serviced weekly, and bed linen and towels are provided.The accommodation package includes full board cuisine, and the college is happy to accommodate anyone with special dietary requirements. In the campus canteen, students and employees dine together, so you'll have the opportunity to meet everyone. Upon admittance to their chosen course, all full-time students are guaranteed a spot in campus housing. The cost of accommodation for the academic year is £4,750, including all meals, utilities, and free Wi-Fi access. Students can choose from three payment options, which can be discussed with the Finance Officer after registering.Sabhal Mr Ostaig now offers self-catering accommodations. There are 17 spots available, and they will be initially granted to students in their second year and up. For more information, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/sabhal-mor-ostaig/  SAMS SAMS may accommodate up to 11 students in the Margaret Barnes Building on campus. Priority is given to first-year students who are under the age of eighteen when they begin their studies or who have special needs. For more information, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/sams/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/studying-at-uhi/first-steps/accommodation/

Placement: The placement will usually occur during the academic year (October to May), as though it were split into two semesters at the university. As a result, it should typically last between 24 and 40 weeks, with no less than 20 weeks and no more than 40 weeks.All students must attend placement during the setting's typical full-time working hours. Any exceptions to this rule will have been discussed with the university and disclosed to the placement provider before the placement begins.Each student will be assigned a mentor in the setting who will support them while they are on placement. This person should ideally be a member of staff with whom the student will likely interact daily. A University placement supervisor will pay a visit to the student and mentor in the setting (typically once during the placement) and will stay in touch and support each student. Placement Assessment: As part of the module, students will be assessed. There are three parts to the evaluation. Each component is graded solely on a pass/fail basis, and each element must be passed to pass the module. The following are the components of the evaluation:The module leader or placement supervisor and the placement host must review and agree on the placement specification created by the student. This will detail the aims and plan for the placementBefore the end of the first semester (about halfway through the placement), the student will produce a progress report that will reflect their work thus far, as well as an updated placement planA learning log will be kept as a diary of the student's actions and experiences during the placement. The remarks and input from their mentor at the placement-providing organisation will also be included. Students are asked to submit one entry every 3 to 4 weeks during their placement. At the end of the placement, this will be evaluated
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: For all overseas students in their first year of study, Glyndwr University provides on-campus housing, which is included in their tuition fees.The residences are well-kept and safe. Upgrades are available for an additional fee if a student wants to stay somewhere a little more upscale.There are two types of housing options available at the university:Wrexham villageStudent village Wrexham Village accommodation features: Choose from 321 private en-suite guestrooms, including single en-suite and single+ en-suite suites (slightly larger room includes a 4ft bed - subject to availability)There is free WiFi throughout the property, as well as connecting ports in the bedrooms and common areasIn the communal kitchen/living areas, there is a flat-screen TVAccess with a swipe card is secureOn-campus security and maintenance are available 24 hours a day, seven days a weekOn-campus parking is free and secureCoin-operated laundromat on-premiseThe staff is kind and personable, with an open-door policyClose proximity to public transportation – railway and bus stations are only a few minutes' walk awayNearby are a shopping centre, supermarkets, and the town centre Off-Campus Accommodation: To assist you, the Residential and Campus Life team at Wrexham Glyndwr University maintains an online web register called Student Pad, where you can look for suitable rental properties in and around the Wrexham area. Only landlords recognised with the Landlord Accreditation Wales Scheme certificate will be included on Student Pad to improve our service to students. Every council in Wales supports this LAW programme, which encourages professional landlords and agents to rent out good quality housing while also acknowledging the needs of students and their responsibilities as landlords. The Residential and Campus Life team is always available to offer advice and information to students who choose to live in private housing. Still, it's important to note that the tenancy contract is between the student and the landlord when they rent a house. As a result, students should try to address difficulties with their landlord or the city council directly. For more advice and information on off-campus accommodation, contact us at accommodation@glyndwr.ac.uk.

Name: Cranfield University

The university's buildings and infrastructure are created with sustainable materials, aiming to make zero net carbon emissions in university activities by 2030.

Name: University of Arts London
Overview: Formerly called the London Institute from 1986 to 2004, the University of Arts London (UAL) is ranked second globally in the 2021 QS World University Rankings for Art and Design. UAL consists of six elite colleges, namely the Camberwell College of Arts, Chelsea College of Arts, London College of Fashion, London College of Communication, Wimbledon College of Arts, and Central Saint Martins. Regarded as Europe's largest specialist art and design university, UAL offers undergraduate and post-graduate programs along with pre-degree courses and short courses in 18 subjects. Popular subjects include animation, 3D design, communication, and graphic design, fashion making and pattern cutting, fashion design, fine art, textiles, and a few more. The university offers professional artists, designers, technicians, and theorists as teaching faculties and is the home of 36 out of 77 Royal Academicians who are UAL alumni. Rated by Ofsted as Outstanding in 2017, UAL homes 18,000 students from 130 countries around the world. Each college has its focus and philosophy, and UAL has more than 200 researchers currently working on different subjects across the six colleges. Major research subjects include craft, design curation, museum studies, graphic narratives, fine art, archival studies, sound art, fashion, costume design, and many more. UAL offers multiple facilities for a smooth student life inside the campus, including libraries, art shops, seven professional galleries, and 13 dormitory-style residence halls for students' accommodation. UAL has collaborated with prestigious universities like Falmouth University, Arts University Bournemouth, Ravensbourne, and others for better student outreach. The estimated tuition fee for new students in the undergraduate course is Œ£9,250 and for international students are Œ£22,920. Notable alumni of UAL include Indian fashion designer Sunnet Varma, British journalist Christopher Lamb, actor Paul Bettany, and many others.

Name: University of Plymouth
Overview: Established in 1862 as a polytechnic institute, Plymouth State University gained university status in 1992. The university is a three-time winner of the Queen's Anniversary Prize and is located in Plymouth, New Hampshire, USA. The main campus has a countryside setting with 47 buildings, spreading across 170 acres.Plymouth ranks among the top 50 public universities nationally and is the first to have a private medical and dental school. The three faculties of Arts, Sciences, Business, and Education, offer 53 undergraduate majors and 60 minors in subjects like Anthropology, Interdisciplinary Studies, Information Technology, Management, and Business. More than 60 postgraduate programs in Accounting, Clinical Mental Health Counseling, Integrated Arts, Language Education, Organizational Leadership, and Business Administration are also provided, along with 14 doctoral degrees. On-campus accommodation in residence halls like Francis Drake, Radnor, Gilwell, Mary Newman, etc. is provided with study rooms, lounges, games, kitchens, cable TV, restaurants, laundry, wardrobes, rental insurance, and dining facilities for students in a double or triple room sharing option at 11,580 USD per year. With an overall graduation rate of 54%, the average salary of a Plymouth University graduate is around 63,517 USD.Plymouth is one of the most affordable institutions in the US, with an average undergraduate tuition fee of 23,902 USD, while postgraduate programs vary. With an acceptance rate of 85%, the fee for Common Application is 50 USD. Scholarships based on merits are awarded by the university, where Presidential Scholarships, Dean's Scholarships, Aspire Scholarships, and Promise Scholarships are some of them.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants must have received a 60 percent or above on the High School Certificate (year 12), the Indian School Certificate (year 12), or the All India Senior School Certificate Examination (also known as the Delhi Indian School Certificate Examination Year 12). Please keep in mind that entrance requirements can change.Applicants must have earned a bachelor's degree or a bachelor's degree in technology from a recognised Indian university with the following degree classification:Degree categorization in IndiaAlternative term for Indian degree categorizationGPA equivalent of a Bachelor of Technology degree in the United Kingdomsixty percent to one hundred percentFirst class 7.0 and higher 2:1 (55–59%)First division first class/second division6.0–6.9 2:2
Accommodation: We want you to have a great time living and studying in Plymouth, make lifelong friends, and feel well supported during your time here. We have a large selection of halls to choose from, all of which create a safe and welcoming atmosphere for our students.Our halls are offered in conjunction with UPP, the UK's leading provider of on-campus residential and academic accommodation infrastructure, and your accommodation licence will be with the University.They build and maintain the structures, while the University provides a variety of services for you, such as social events to foster excellent communities, welfare assistance, and 24-hour security to keep you safe.Our residence halls are either on campus or in the adjoining student village, and are only a short walk from both University facilities.for more detail click on this link-https://www.plymouth.ac.uk/student-life/services/accommodation
Course Ranking: Consideration has been given to business courses, engineering courses, and computer courses. Numerous programmes offered by the university's business programmes have received top 80 rankings. programmes such PG Business and Economics, Business and Management Studies, and others. The University of Plymouth is a well-liked option among applicants seeking to apply to engineering courses when we talk about taking engineering degrees there. Many of the university's engineering programmes rank in the top 50 on the ranking list. For pursuing the computer science programme at the university, the university has been ranked 45 by The Complete University Guide in 2021 when it comes to computer courses.
University Ranking: The Complete University Guide and The Guardian both gave the university good rankings, putting it in positions 71 and 53 for 2021, respectively. As part of their ranking criteria, The Complete University Guide takes into account Graduate Prospects, Research Quality, Research Intensity, and Entry Standards. Entry Standards, Student-Staff Ratio, Value-Added Services, and Career Prospects are the main ranking factors used by The Guardian. Additionally, the university was given a ranking of 534 by US News & World Report's Global Universities (2021). In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). The university has received top rankings from THE (Times Higher Education) and QS World University Ranking, which place it between 401 and 500 and 651 and 700 respectively for 2021. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Research, Teaching and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Citations per Faculty at 20% and Faculty/Student Ratio each.

Name: Alliance Manchester Business School
Overview: Alliance Manchester Business School is located in Manchester. With an acceptance rate of 45%, Alliance MBS ranks among the top 50 business schools globally. The top courses offered are Business, MBA, Marketing, Accounting, and Finance, with 14 undergraduate, 16 postgraduate, and a full-time, flexible MBA program of 18, 15, or 12 months.The average tuition fee for undergraduate degrees is 19,500 GBP, 24,000 GBP for Engineering, 46,000 GBP for Medical Sciences, and 19,500 GBP for graduate programs.Scholarships based on performance in academics and sports are awarded along with some program-specific ones for financial aid. MBS provides mock assessments, career fairs, and internships to prepare students for job opportunities. With a high placement rate of 77%, the average salary for graduates is 100,000 GBP.

Accommodation: On-campus Accommodation: Living on campus protects international students and gives peace of mind to their families back home; university halls are self-contained communities where students may rapidly establish friends and feel at ease. Manchester Student Homes operates on behalf of the city’s universities to help students find University-approved accommodation in the private sector, and it provides useful general housing advice and listings of available properties

Name: University of South Wales - Treforest
Overview: The University of South Wales is a public university that was established in 2013 after the merger of the University of Wales and the University of Glamorgan, Newport. It houses three campuses in Newport, Cardiff, Pontypridd. It holds an affiliation with University Alliance and Universities UK. The Treforest campus, Pontypridd, offers courses in Accounting and Finance, Art, Business and Management, Chiropractic, English, Criminology, etc. Other courses include – Law, Maths, Public Services, History, Computing, Engineering, Sociology, and Psychology. Besides academics, the University houses 100+ societies and clubs, allowing students to develop non-academic skills, provide opportunities to volunteer events, etc. Moreover, students can opt for the fully-furnished University of South Wales Treforest accommodation. Scholarships such as International Office Scholarships and Chancellor's International Development Scholarships are available to support students’ education financially. It provides research opportunities to students across different academic and creative fields. This includes- crime, security and justice, health and wellbeing, creative industries research, etc. According to the Guardian - University Rankings 2021, the University of South Wales ranking is 66th. According to the Young University Rankings of Times Higher Education 2021, it ranks between 301–350th. Working professionals can opt for flexible online courses in Health, Sport, Engineering, Buddhist Studies, and Business. Besides, international students can also apply for pathway courses in Business and Social Science, Computer Science, Creative Industries, etc. Based on the DLHE survey, 2018, approximately 95% of graduates found employment opportunities or pursued higher education within six of their graduation. Moreover, according to the National Student Survey 2021, it is among the top 15th universities in the United Kingdom and the best in Wales for student academic satisfaction. The University of South Wales provides the Career and Employability Service to students to find the right employment opportunity and other career-related support. Individuals who had graduated from this University include some of the notable names - Roger Cecil, Randii Wessen and Jamie Robinson.
Eligibility Overview: The requirement for each program differs from each other. The requirements are as follows :  Foundation Entry Requirements Students who do not meet the academic prerequisites for immediate entry into year one of a Bachelor's degree can enroll in Foundation Years. Undergraduate Entry Requirements Depending on whatever Board you studied, an overall average of 60-65 percent or above in the 12th Standard is required.Students with a relevant UK HND or India Diploma may be eligible for advanced entry into certain undergraduate degree programmes. Postgraduate Entry RequirementsFor admittance to a relevant postgraduate programme, an overall average of 60 percent (or CGPA of 6.0/10) of a three-year degree (B.COM, BBA, B.SC, BCA, etc.) from a recognised Indian university is required.For admittance to a relevant postgraduate programme, an overall average of 55 percent (or CGPA of 5.8/10) from a recognised Indian university (B.E, BTECH, B PHARM, B. ARCH, etc.).University of Mumbai, University of Delhi, University of Pune, Jadavpur University, or University of Calcutta must have a minimum of 50% (or CGPA 5.5/10) from one of the following Indian universities: University of Mumbai, University of Delhi, University of Pune, Jadavpur University, or University of Calcutta. English QualificationsThe ability to communicate in English is required for university education. The following English language qualifications are accepted by the University of South Wales: English at 65-70 percent or higher in HSC (12th standard), depending on which Board you studied.IELTS 6.0 overall, with at least 5.5 in each band, or equivalent (certain programmes demand a higher IELTS – please see the relevant course page on the website for more information).The USW English test (sometimes referred to as the Password test) is a free English test that may be taken in India. Alternative English tests are also accepted.
Accommodation: Halls are an important component of your student experience, and we have housing available at all three of our campuses. If you don't want to live close to campus, there are excellent transportation options. So, whether you choose to live on campus or in the city, you can select what's best for you. https://www.southwales.ac.uk/student-life/accommodation/

Name: Anglia Ruskin University
Overview: Anglia Ruskin University was founded in 1858 in England as the Cambridge School of Art. Students from 185 nations are enrolled in undergraduate and postgraduate (taught and research) programs taught by four faculties focused on Arts, Business, Health, and Science.You can pursue degrees like BA, BSc, LLB, MA, MSc, MPhil, PhD., etc., in areas such as Optometry, Film and Media, Computer Games, Law, Animal, and Environmental Sciences.The Continuing Professional Development courses comprise workshops, short courses, and standalone modules on art, health, science, design, computing, etc. Degree apprenticeships allow professional skill development through partnerships with 330 employers. There are several Erasmus+ and non-EU study abroad/exchange programs to participate in. The estimated annual undergraduate tuition fee is GBP 9,250 for UK and EU and GBP 13,900 for international students. The postgraduate tuition fee is GBP 8,100- GBP 16,700 for UK/EU and GBP 13,900- GBP 16,700 for international students. Furthermore, the tuition fee is GBP 4,500 and GBP 13,900 for UK/EU and international students, respectively, for postgraduate research programs. ARU Bursary, Alumni Scholarship, GREAT Scholarship, Maintenance loans, and Adult Dependent Grant are some of the financial aid options available.

Name: CU Coventry
Overview: The CU Coventry is a subsidiary part of Coventry University and has been operational since 2012. It was previously known as Coventry University College, and the campus is located in Coventry city. Coventry Institution is a research university in the English city of Coventry with more than 700 programs, including undergraduate and post-graduate and top-up, foundation, and pre-sessional English options. This university manages its other higher education institutions such as CU Coventry, CU London, and CU Scarborough. Coventry University provides top-notch education and focuses on applied research. In 2012, CU Coventry was introduced as a campus offering full-time and part-time professional courses in marketing, accounting, and legal studies. It is a self-contained entity with its own set of rules, facilities and staff, but it validates and awards its programs. The courses provided at Coventry University are exclusively designed for the benefit of students. This educational institution won the TEF Gold for outstanding learning and teaching. As per the Guardian University Guide in 2020, this university is ranked at 15th position in the UK. Besides, this institution received many awards for excellent performance. From this university, international students can pursue more than 400 graduate and undergraduate programs in different fields such as law, health, engineering, science, arts, etc.  The CU Coventry employment rate is nearly 97%, with students getting employed immediately after completing their graduation. Moreover, the Talent Team of this university assists students in writing a Curriculum Vitae, preparing for psychometric testing, cover letter and application, assessment centers, and interview process. In the current year, this university offers more than 189 undergraduate and 174 post-graduate programs. For international students, CU Coventry extends a range of vocational and career-centric degrees. This educational institution makes higher education affordable and accessible for aspiring students.

Name: University of Exeter
Overview: Established in 1955, the University of Exeter is a public research institute that started as the School of Science and Art in 1851. Situated in Exeter, Devon, South West England, UK, it has three campuses- Streatham and St Luke (In Exeter); Penryn and Truro (In Cornwall).With more than 25,000 students enrolled in various undergraduate, postgraduate, and PhD courses, the University of Exeter has only a 6.7% acceptance rate for international applications and an application fee of GBP 20. Eligible students must possess IELTS (6.5 and above), PTE (58 and above), GMAT (590 and above), and TOEFL (88 and above). The tuition fee for postgraduate is GBP 18,000, whereas undergraduate lies between GBP 18,000 to GBP 35,000. Students must accumulate at least 180 credits (maximum 150 at Level 1) for proceeding with a degree with a 3 stage program. The University of Exeter offers scholarships to international students based on academic merit, intellectual ability, and personal achievement. With high placement records in science, law, journalism, arts, and sports, University of Exeter students get a complete package of $133,000 annually.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: The following are the minimal program-specific eligibility requirements that international applicants must achieve before applying to Exeter: Undergraduates: International Baccalaureate Diploma with A Level Grade 12 in a relevant subject from one of the following educational boards: ICSE/CBSE with a minimum aggregate score of 80 per centORWest Bengal Board with a minimum aggregate score of 70%ORRegional boards with a minimum aggregate score of 85 per cent can be examined individually.Maharashtra Board junior year of college (Mumbai or Pune) Graduate: Master's degrees: A bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a recognised university with a grade equal to a second-class honours degree in the United Kingdom (2:1 or 2:2)Degrees in research: Master's degree in a relevant field and a compelling research proposalSome programmes require the GMATBusiness programmes require the GRE English Requirements:
