Name: Aberdeen university
Overview: The University of Aberdeen, established in 1495, is an ancient university in Aberdeen, Scotland. The public research university maintained its position in the top 200 universities globally and was titled the Scottish University of the Year in 2019. Aberdeen has its main campuses at Old Aberdeen and Foresterhill and satellite campuses spread across the UK and an international campus in Qatar. With an acceptance rate of 78%, the institution has over 15,000 students. Comprising three colleges, namely Christ's College, King's College and Marischal College, subdivided into 12 schools, offer over 370 undergraduate and 150 postgraduate programs in disciplines like Business, Management, Social Sciences, Research, Medicine, Nursing, Law, Engineering and Computer Science. Theology, Archaeology and Architecture are highly ranked and sought after courses. Undergraduates apply through the UCAS portal, whereas postgraduates through the University's Application Portal at an application fee of 20 GBP. Academic transcripts, LORs, scores of TOEFL, IELTS etc. and program-specific documents are also submitted. The average undergraduate tuition fee ranges from 17,200 to 19,700 GBP and from 20,000- 30,000 GBP for postgraduate courses. International students are awarded merit and need-based scholarships like Global Scholarships worth 2,000 GBP and Scotland's Saltire Scholarships worth 8,000 GBP for postgraduate students. The Students Union Building is the residential hall at the King's College campus in Old Aberdeen which provides on-campus accommodation in self-catered rooms with facilities like WiFi, laundry, social spaces, study zones and recreational areas at the annual rent of 5,500-7,800 GBP. The campus is equipped with a library, Elphinstone Hall for gatherings and meetings and Aberdeen Sports Village, which provides sports facilities. The student union, Aberdeen University Students Association, has over 120 clubs and societies. Aberdeen organises a summer internship program to prepare students for placements and employment. Graduates are offered well-paid jobs at an average salary of 60,000 GBP.

Name: New England College
Overview: Founded in 1946, New England College is officially accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education. The college's location is near Henniker, New Hampshire, and is mainly a liberal arts college. Moreover, the college has also received affiliation from The New Hampshire College & University Council (NHCUC). Currently, New England College offers a diverse range of educational services across five academic schools. These include the College of Pharmacy, College of Arts and Sciences, and Health Sciences, College of Engineering, College of Business, and School of Law. The college provides more than 500 courses, including bachelor's, master's, doctoral and associate degrees. The subjects focused here mainly include Business, Art and design, Government, Humanities, IT and Science. The programs enable the students to partake in challenging community tasks, helping them explore their fields of specialisation. New England College believes in an open environment with a diverse background of students. They have encouraged international applicants with a significant acceptance rate of 99%. The student-faculty ratio maintained in the classes is about 12:1, which shows that the students receive a quality education from the tutors. While the average student retention rate from the freshmen year has been about 57%, the college is still developing with the latest courses and benefits. However, the New England College tuition fees might be unaffordable for the international students, ranging from $35,000-$40,000. However, the college offers student loans and scholarship programs for needy students every year. With more than 1,000 internship programs, the college looks after the employability requirements of the students while going through the academic courses. The Office of Career and Life Planning (CLP) is dedicated to helping young graduates find appropriate employment after completing their degrees.

Name: University of Chichester - Bishop Otter
Overview: Having celebrated its 180th anniversary in 2019, the University of Chichester boasts of a long history of higher education. It is set across two campus locations, and one of them is the Bishop Otter campus. The University of Chichester Bishop Otter campus was founded by William Otter, Bishop of Chichester, in 1839. The Privy Council approved the title 'University of Chichester' on 12th October 2005. The University of Chichester Bishop Otter campus features a Learning Resource Centre (LRC) that provides the students with an array of resources. Some of these include Support and Information Zone (SIZ), Costa café and general meeting areas, Equipment Loans, Mac and PC suites, etc. This campus is also home to The Show Room, which is a 250-seat theatre featuring technologically-advanced light and sound equipment principally used by Dance and Theatre Departments. Other facilities at this campus include two multi-purpose gymnasiums; Biomechanics, Physiology and Psychology laboratories; Sports Performance and Rehabilitation Uni (SPRU); Sports Injury Clinic and others. The Bishop Otter Campus houses most of the academic areas of this university - Law, Theatre and Dance, Humanities, Sports, Art, and BSc (Hons) Psychology programmes. In November 2013, this university was awarded the European Commission HR Excellence in Research Award. This institute welcomes postgraduate candidates in several subject areas for research, including Dance, Theatre and Fine Art; Sport, Exercise and Physical Education; Engineering and Design; History and Politics; Business Studies, etc. As per the 2021 Guardian League Tables, the University of Chichester ranking was 29th as a University in the United Kingdom. The Alumni Community is a society that is open for all past students and graduates of the University of Chichester. This university offers its students an Exchange opportunity for a full academic year or one semester.
Eligibility Overview: English Language Requirements Information The information below should help you understand whether you need an English Language qualification and what qualifications we will accept as confirmation of your English level at the University of Chichester.IELTS 6.0 (undergraduate) (with none of the four components lower than 5.5)IELTS 6.5 for postgraduate students (with none of the four components lower than 5.5)Some programmes require a higher overall score or a specific component score; check the course material on the website for more information.

Name: University of St Andrews
Overview: The third-oldest university in the English-speaking world, the University of St Andrews in Scotland, was founded in 1413. Known for its research in Medicine, Science, Religion, and Arts, it has an enrollment of 10,119 students (7,985 undergraduates and 2,133 postgraduates), coming from over 130 nations. There are four faculties divided into several academic schools and departments such as Biology, Philosophy, Music, and International Relations, offering Undergraduate and Postgraduate subjects like French, Divinity, Film Studies, Neuroscience, etc. There are various libraries on campus, such as the Main Library, JF Allen Library, and the Library at the Gateway, which house many printed and e-resources. Several non-degree programs are available, like summer school, upskilling courses, evening language courses, and Open Association.The university provides over 4,000-bed spaces as accommodation, and residence halls have catered/self-catered single and shared rooms with dining facilities. Some options include University Hall, David Russell Apartments, and John Burnet Hall.  More than 150 student organizations are engaging in artistic, cultural, academic, and religious activities for extracurriculars. Students can also partake in over 50 sports clubs and 100 competitive sports teams. Placement reports show that approximately 94.9% of the undergraduates have found employment post-completion of the program.The estimated undergraduate fee is GBP 1,820 for Scotland, GBP 9,250 for UK and GBP 25,100- GBP 32,910 for EU and international students. Financial aid is available in scholarships, bursaries, grants, etc., like Government Discretionary Funds, vacation grants, Fife Dux Scheme, BA International Honors Scholarship, Duncan Trust, and more.
Eligibility Overview: UndergraduateFrom the 2023-24 academic year, to make a competitive application, St. Andrews recommends  submitting applications by 30 November by following the steps below:Choose a course and make sure that you have met or are on target to meet the admission requirementsRead the guide for applicants to learn about each stage of the admissions process PostgraduatePostgraduate candidates will be expected to hold a good second division (2.1) or first division UK Bachelor's degree with Honours, or the overseas equivalent, in a relevant subject, or a relevant postgraduate qualification.Typical Indian degree equivalents with first-class grades of 60% to 80% (minimum) or 7.0-9.0 CGPA, depending on the institution attended. English Language RequirementsAll incoming students must demonstrate that they are proficient enough in English  to succeed at St. Andrews.As evidence of English language competency, St. Andrews accepts a variety of language exams and credentials. If you attended school outside of the UK or speak English in addition to your native tongue, your application should also contain information regarding your level of English competence.
Accommodation: On-CampusSt. Andrews offers a wide range of lodging options with more than 4,000 beds to accommodate all tastes and price ranges. Prospective students can be confident that they will locate appropriate housing during their study. Guide for Residents 2021–2022The Residents' Guide is intended to address all your practical concerns, including information on what is supplied in your room as well as facts about the common areas and amenities available. It also includes a map showing the locations of each residence in St. Andrews. Check it here.
Course Ranking: The Complete University Guide (University Rankings) and The Guardian (University Rankings) have given the university's business programmes good marks. According to The Complete University Guide's subject rankings, the university's Business & Management Studies (UK) programme has been rated the best for the previous five years, from 2017 to 2021. For four years in a row, from 2018 to 2021, The Guardian named the Business, Management & Marketing programme among the second best. The Engineering and Technology course has been ranked 343 by QS Subject Ranking for 2020 when we talk about engineering courses. For five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, The Complete University Guide has ranked the University of St. Andrews' Computer Science programme among the top five.
University Ranking: The university has received top ratings three institutions by The Complete University Guide (University Rankings) and The Guardian (University Rankings), respectively. For the years 2018, 2020, and 2021, the university has held the third-place position in The Complete University Guide. The university was ranked second by The Guardian for the years 2020 and 2021 and third for the three years between 2017 and 2019. As part of their ranking criteria, The Complete University Guide takes into account Graduate Prospects, Research Quality, Research Intensity, and Entry Standards. Entry Standards, Value-Added Services, Student-Staff Ratio, and Career Prospects are the main ranking factors used by The Guardian. The university is placed 96 for 2021 in the QS - World University Ranking. The university is ranked between 201 and 250 in THE (Times Higher Education) - University Ranking for 2021. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Research, Teaching, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Citations per Faculty at 20% and Faculty/Student Ratio each.

Name: University of Kingston International Study Centre
Overview: The Kingston Technical Institute, Kingston University London, gained university status in 1992. Comprising four schools, namely The Kingston School of Art, the Faculty of Science, Engineering, and Computing, the Faculty of Business and Social Sciences, the Faculty of Health, Social Care and Education, and various research centres and institutes. More than 130 undergraduate and 200 postgraduate programs are offered, amongst which MBA, Computer Science, Engineering, Arts, Business and Marketing are the top courses. Admissions take place through the UCAS portal for undergraduates with an application fee of 20-25 GBP. Previous academic transcripts resume, LORs, English Language Proficiency tests scores and program-specific documents are also to be submitted. The average tuition fee ranges from 15,300-23,500 GBP, for which scholarships worth 5,000 GBP are awarded to international students. On-campus accommodation in 5 residential halls, namely Walkden hall, 75 Penrhyn Road, Clayhill hall, Middle Mill hall and Seething Wells hall having 2,005 fully-furnished rooms at 536-1,320 GBP per month, is provided. The amenities available include electricity, hot water, laundry, free bus service inside campus, car and bike parking, Wi-Fi and security. The Union of Kingston Students, the student government, looks after student affairs and consists of more than 90 clubs and societies and 40 sports clubs. Around 95% of Kingston University London graduates secure well-paid jobs within six months of graduation with an average annual salary of 32,584 GBP. The Executive MBA program places students in annual packages of 92,800 GBP.

Name: Buckinghamshire New University
Overview: Buckinghamshire New University (BNU) is a public university founded in 1891 as the School of Science and Art. It has campuses located in High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire; Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire; Uxbridge, Greater London; and Great Missenden, Buckinghamshire. Housing over 8,000 students, the university is famous for its specialist courses such as Air Transport with Commercial Pilot Training for a professional pilot's licence. It is one of the few universities to offer a degree in Policing and those in Music Management and Film and Television Production and Animation and Visual Effects. Other popular programs include finance, behavioural sciences, acting, animation, artificial intelligence, computing, business management and information technology, costume design and making, criminology, cybersecurity, graphic design, data science, education studies, and so on for undergraduates. Applied forensic psychology cognitive behavioural therapy, cybersecurity, film production, human resource management, international, screenwriting etc., for postgraduate studies. BNU also offers part-time professional development certificate courses. The yearly tuition may range from GBP 12800-18000. Students can avail several scholarships such as the UK Academic Achievement Scholarship, Clearing Access Bursary, The Foundation Bursary, and The Gateway Scholarship for financial aid. Bucks New University offers options for accommodation at halls of residence, managed houses and the student village, with 396 rooms in the Brook Street Halls, 410 student rooms in the Hughenden Park Student Village, and at the Windsor House. The cost of living ranges from GBP 4,800-8000. The amenities provided by the university include facilities such as a fitness center, labs, drama studios, sports hall, music recording studios, Café, conference rooms, and a motion capture system along with a green screen. As a Placements Plus university, BNU offers several opportunities for work with their Skills for Work training, Nursing and Operating departments work closely with NHS during their degree. About 98% of the graduates find employment or opportunities for further study within 15 months of graduation.

Course Ranking: According to The Complete University Guide's Accounting & Finance Ranking for 2021, BUCKS is placed 102nd overall. It was given a 2020 ranking of 87. Additionally, The Complete University Guide ranked Bucks at 115th for 2021, a significant dip from its rating of 93rd for Business & Management Studies for 2020. This illustrates how poorly BUCKS has done regarding important criteria, including graduation prospects, degree completion, and strong honours (per cent of students who earned a first- or upper-second-class honours degree upon graduation).Conversely, The Guardian's Accounting & Finance Rankings have moved BUCKS up significantly from 98th for 2020 to 25th for 2021. The Guardian has also elevated BUCKS' ranking in the Business, Management, & Marketing category from 116th for 2020 to 53rd for 2021. This illustrates how BUCKS has excelled in key areas like admittance requirements, value-added services, job prospects, and student-staff ratio.Additionally, BUCKS is ranked 43rd out of 2020 in The Guardian's Mechanical Engineering rating. In its list of universities for computer science for the year 2021, The Complete University Guide has BUCKS at position 109. The aforementioned statistics show how well-known Buckinghamshire's Mechanical Engineering programme is in the US.

Name: University of Law - Guildford
Overview: The University of Law Guildford campus is situated at the historical site of Braboeuf Manor, named after the Brébeuf Norman family. It is only a 20-minute walking distance from the town centre and Guildford's train station. More than 90% of the tutors at the University of Law Guildford are qualified lawyers. Based within 23 acres of beautiful parkland, this campus offers students a computer suite, welfare officer, free Wi-Fi, free counsellor, library, etc. Some University of Law courses at the Guildford campus include LLB Law with Business, LLB Law with Criminology, LLM Employment Law, LLM International Arbitration, LLM Mediation and Alternative Dispute Resolution, and many more. Students get exposed to various activities at this institute's multiple clubs and societies. These include Photography society, Drama society, Dance society, Golf, Tennis, Rowing and many others. According to the 2020 National Student Survey, this institute ranked first among universities in terms of overall student satisfaction in England. It also received an overall 5 Star rating from QS World University Rankings and five stars in Online Learning, Teaching, Inclusiveness, Employability, and Academic Development. This institute extends an array of scholarships and bursaries that are awarded depending on merit or need (or a combination of the two). Some international scholarships include ULaw China Scholarship, ULaw Malaysia Scholarship and ULaw Canada Scholarship. Since 2001, this university has been offering pro bono services. Some schemes that have run at the University of Law Guildford include Brighton Leasehold Advice Clinic (BLAC), Brent Community Law Centre (BCLC), Citizens Advice Bureau, Guildford Employment Rights Advice Line Direct (GERALD), Legal Advice Centre (LAC), etc. This institute boasts of having one of the most significant legal alumni groups in the United Kingdom – the Alumni Network spans 103 nations. Through alumni, this institute stays connected to more than 11,800 organisations and businesses.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: The candidate must have finished high school with mathematics as a required subjectFor bachelor's degree programmes in law or business, applicants must have received a minimum score of 70 per cent on the senior secondary level qualifying exam Postgraduate: The applicant must have successfully completed a bachelor's programme at an accredited universityA minimum of 50% in a related discipline, such as law or business, at the bachelor's/professional bachelor's level, is necessary English Requirements:

Name: University of London International Programmes
Overview: The University of London International Programmes is located in London, UK. The university was established in 1836. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. Courses in Business Administration, Business economics, finance, geology, and information systems are available. There is both on-campus & off-campus lodging available. The residences include shared apartments, studio apartments, and apartments with three, four, or more bedrooms. The typical monthly rent is from £500 to £700. The student housing is wholly equipped, and the rent includes power, central heating, and unrestricted internet access. There is also a laundry facility on site.In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. University of London International Programmes offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition fee, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, is around ₹4,35,000. Read more details about the University of London International Programmes on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate applicants from India must achieve a grade point average of 70% or above in four subjects. A 70 percent total average in all disciplines in year XII is also acceptable. Postgraduate students must have completed a 3-4 year bachelor's degree with honours from an Indian university.For University of London admissions, candidates must provide papers such as letters of recommendation, statements of intent, IELTS/TOEFL scores as proof of ELP, and academic transcripts.The following is a list of general English proficiency tests, as well as the minimum scores required for admission to the University of London:

Name: Amity University - London Campus
Overview: The Amity University - London Campus is located in London, UK. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students.The main campus of Amity University - London Campus is located in London. The university offers over 2 undergraduate programs and 2 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ from course to course. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, are around INR 10,30,480. Amity University - London Campus offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.

Name: University of Roehampton
Overview: The University of Roehampton is a public university spread over 54 acres of parkland campus, based in South-West London, UK. It came into existence after the merger of four teacher training colleges founded in the 19th century and holds affiliation with the European University Association and the Universities UK.The highly-ranked university comprises four colleges and six departments offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctorate programs. Both domestic and international students can pursue courses in disciplines like education, law, science, humanities, business, media, creative writing, photography, and social sciences. Besides career-oriented degree programs, you can study short professional development courses in different streams.Additionally, a career adviser team provides necessary support and guidance and helps students make an informed career choice. The support of placements and teaching from industry experts gives a head-start to your career.The impressive alumni network of Roehampton University includes famous names such as Joey Barton (footballer), Rita Ramnani (actress and dancer), Darren Shan (author), and Deepak Tripathi (historian).Sports courts, gyms, shops for essentials, catering outlets, and venues hosting regular events like live music and club nights are some options to rejuvenate the senses in leisure hours. Due to the central location, you can reach theatres and cinemas, the best museums in London, and Wimbledon All England Tennis Club in just a few minutes.The average tuition fee for the university is £13,930. Besides academic support, the university offers students well-being, financial, and mental health support.
Eligibility Overview: For international admissions, the university accepts IELTS, PTE, and TOEFL iBT as proof of English proficiency.

Name: University of the West of Scotland
Overview: The West of Scotland University was established in 2007 in Paisley, Renfrewshire, UK after Bell College merged with the University of Paisley. The university inherits excellent colleges and universities like the University of Paisley, Galloway College of Nursing, Bell College of Technology, Dumfries, and Craigie College of Education. More than 11,160 students attend the University of the West of Scotland. The University of the West of Scotland has five campuses in different locations, such as London, Ayr, Lanarkshire, Paisley, and Dumfries.According to the Times Higher Education, the university is currently one of the top 3 universities in the world. Computing, education, business, creative industries, engineering, health, physical sciences, chemical sciences, and biological sciences are the subjects covered by the University of the West of Scotland. MBA, M.Sc. in Information Technology, M.Sc. in Public Administration, B.Sc. in Physics, and M.Sc. in Chemical Engineering. Research degrees are also offered by the university.University students get employed in reputed companies like Dell, Amazon, Toyota, and Motorola. Les Hutchison and Lesley Dalziel are famous alumni of this university.The university offers on-campus accommodation in residential halls and flats. The average monthly on-campus accommodation cost is 89 pounds per week. However, students can also opt for off-campus housing.Various scholarships and financial aid are provided to international students at this university, including the Commonwealth Shared Scholarship Scheme, Postgraduate Fee Offer, UWS Global Scholarship, and many more.

Name: Kaplan International College London - University of Birmingham
Overview: Kaplan was founded in 1938 by educational pioneer Stanley Kaplan. Kaplan International has a strong partnership with universities in the UK, U.S. and Australia, enabling them to open up educational opportunities for students across the globe. Kaplan is one of the world’s largest and most diverse education providers—with 12,000 employees working across 28 countries—serving individuals, businesses and universities worldwide. Kaplan International London is situated in the world’s top academic city (ranked by QS). London offers students iconic venues, including entertainment, restaurants and bars, shopping, major tourist attractions and more. KIC London is ideally located just a short walking distance from the London Bridge station. Kaplan International London helps enhance the employability of the students by emphasizing building the CV and expanding the professional network. The college prepares students not only for a degree at the university but also for their successful careers. Kaplan offers excellent value-for-money accommodation for students in London. Students will enjoy shared social spaces and quiet study areas, as well as their private bedrooms. Students studying at KIC London will be able to stay in comfortable, modern accommodation that is close to their classes. Kaplan also provides full welfare and accommodation support for international students at all study centres, helping international students transition to their student life abroad. The student services team at Kaplan International College (KIC) London is dedicated to making the student’s experience studying in the UK safe, fun and rewarding.

The following are typical requirements:Academic: a minimum of 12 years of formal educationUKVI IELTS 4.0 to 5.5 or approved equivalent in English.We may be able to accept an alternate proof of English language, such as a high school English certificate or KITE, if you have an English level equivalent to IELTS 5.5 in all skills or higher.

Name: Canterbury Christ Church University
Overview: Founded in 1962, Canterbury Christ Church University is a top-tier public university for higher education in Canterbury, England. The University has affiliations with the Cathedrals Group, MillionPlus, and the Universities at Medway, as well as the Church of England. Spread across 76 hectares of land, the University's main campus has excellent architecture at North Holmes in Canterbury, and other campuses are located around the city. The University provides a range of courses through its five colleges: education; business; law; engineering; science; arts, health, and human development. It provides a wide range of undergraduate degrees, graduate degrees, and doctoral degree programs in multiple disciplines such as humanities, creative arts, social sciences, business, law, health, medical sciences, social work, education, and applied sciences. The top courses offered by the University are M.B.A., M.S., M.A., B.E., B.H.M., etc. The University has multiple facilities on its campuses for its students, including a sports center, housing facility, offices of the students' union, food outlets, and more than 100 student clubs and societies related to academics, recreational activities, and cultural and political interests. It also provides job opportunities, workshops for placements, resume writing classes, group discussions, and mock interviews for the students.The University offers on-campus housing facilities with various amenities to its international students in 10 residential halls and apartments. It also provides accommodation scholarships to its students. The hostel and meal expenses cost approximately GBP 5,711 per year. The institution charges a tuition price for its programmes that ranges from £10,646 to $21,775. The University offers several types of awards, grants, and scholarships to international aspirants as well as domestic students.
Eligibility Overview: English Proficiency Required For International Foundation entry all applicants will need a minimum of IELTS 5.0 or equivalent, with no less than 5.0 in Writing and no less than 4.0 in all other bands.If you have taken an IGCSE exam in English and have a Grade C, this will also usually be acceptable for most undergraduate courses.

Name: Sheffield Hallam University
Overview: Sheffield Hallam University is in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England. The 14th Largest university in the United Kingdom was founded in 1843; the university operates from two centers, the City Campus and the Collegiate Crescent Campus. With the motto promoting the significance of Learning and Serving, the university ensures the transformation of its students into ethical world leaders with the potential to analyze and serve the global world. The academic departments at the university are organized into the College of Business, Technology, and Engineering, College of Social Sciences and Arts, College of Health, Wellbeing and Life Sciences, and many other advanced Research Centres. By offering more than 700 programs under various disciplines, the university has become a popular choice for students seeking admission in undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. Its academic strength lies in the popular courses in the Business, Engineering, and Computer Science programs.With abundant opportunities for internships and other student projects attached to most of the courses at the university, the students are guaranteed to experience and learn the work culture outside of its premises. It remains connected to hundreds of other universities and organizations to ensure a good 96% placement rate and holistic development for its students.The average annual cost, which includes the living charges, can come to around GBP 20,000, but with many grants and scholarships offered by the university, it can be brought down to accommodate the budget for international students.

Placement: Many of the courses provide the opportunity to participate in a work placement, allowing you to apply what you've learned in a real-world setting. The university provides over 20,000 placements with each year and partners with over 1,000 employers to help you discover the ideal experience.Graduates have worked for companies such as Sony, Rolls-Royce, Volkswagen, the National Health Service, Siemens, and Disney. 15 months after graduating, 84 per cent of students who take a placement year at Sheffield Hallam are employed in a high-skilled position or pursuing further education.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Living in residence halls is a lot of fun and one of the finest ways to meet new people. When you apply through Sheffield Hallam, you can take advantage of the following advantages: There are 15 distinct properties to choose from, all of which are within walking distance of both campuses and range in price and amenitiesThere are no hidden fees and the rent is all-inclusiveA room in one of our halls with other Hallam students is guaranteedAn application process that is quick, simple, and flexible, with no commitment to take any room offeredVarious support services are available both at the halls of residence and from the university For more information, visit: https://www.shu.ac.uk/study-here/accommodation
Course Ranking: Now let's talk about Sheffield Hallam University's (SHU) course ranking! Since 2019, THE has continually ranked SHU among the top 500 of its PG Business and Economics rankings. According to The Complete University Guide's rankings for accounting & finance and business & management studies, SHU is among the top 100 universities in the UK. Another significant publisher, The Guardian, raised SHU's ranking in its Accounting & Finance Ranking from 87th place for 2017 to 50th place for 2021. In a same vein, The Guardian improved SHU's ranking in its Business, Management & Marketing ranking from 69th for 2018 to 42nd for 2021. Furthermore, THE's ranking for PG Engineering and Technology has moved SHU from position 401-500 for 2018 to position 601-800 for 2021. Since 2017, SHU has been ranked by The Complete University Guide in the top 100 universities in the UK for electrical and electronic engineering and mechanical engineering, respectively. SHU was named among the top 100 universities in the UK by The Guardian for both mechanical and electronic engineering. The aforementioned statistics show how well-known SHU's Electrical & Electronic engineering department is in the UK.
University Ranking: Sheffield Hallam University (SHU), a public university in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, United Kingdom, was established in 1843. In its global university rankings for 2020 and 2021, QS (Top Universities) has placed SHU between 801 and 1000. SHU has also been ranked at 801–1000 in THE's (Times Higher Education) best university rankings since 2017. In its ranking of the world's universities, another significant publisher, US News & World Report, has moved SHU from 1150th place in 2018 to 1288th place in 2021. This shows that SHU has not performed up to standard in regard to important criteria, including the reputation of its research on a worldwide and regional level, the number of publications mentioned among the best, and the percentage of all papers cited among the best. Since 2017, The Complete University Guide has ranked SHU among the top 100 universities in the UK. SHU has been placed at position 67 in its 2021 university rating. In contrast, The Guardian's rating of UK universities has moved SHU up one spot, from 86th in 2017 to 47th in 2021. This shows that SHU has improved on important ranking criteria like admittance requirements, the student-staff ratio, employment opportunities, and value-added services.

Name: St George University of London
Overview: St. George University is an open research university located in London, England. It provides formal training to doctors and is known to be the only university specialising in Medicine and Health Care. The Complete University Guide ranked this university as first for graduate prospects. The university is home to more than 5,500 students and over 800 faculty members who are well-experienced and skilled in their respective subjects. The university also provides students great opportunities to practice and sharpen their skills. St. George University offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional degrees to all its students in medicine and healthcare. The university provides various scholarships and financial aid to students facing financial hardships. Some scholarships provided to international students include Global Health M.Sc International Student Scholarships, St. George Postgraduate Scholarships Schemes, and Physician Associate Studies MPAS Scholarships. The university is also known for providing excellent placement opportunities to its students, due to which more than 95% of the graduates get employed within six months of graduation. Name: London School of Economics and Political Science
Overview: The London School of Economics and Political Science is a public research university located in London, England. The university was founded in 1895 and has since gone on to become an iconic institution in the field of economics, law and social sciences. The university has 27 faculties offering 41 undergraduate courses and 191 graduate courses. The university is a member institution of the University of London, awarding degrees of the same before issuing its own degrees from 2008. The top courses at London School of Economics include BSc in Economics, BSc in Politics and International Relations and MSc in Economics. The university's campus is located at Houghton Street and Clare Market in Westminster. It is home to the British Library of Political and Economic Science, which is the world's largest library for political science. Other noteworthy facilities on campus include lecture theatres, study spaces and a 200 seater auditorium. The average cost of tuition at the college varies between GBP 20,000 and GBP 35,000 per annum depending on the course chosen and its duration. The university has a vibrant student community thanks to its location in central London. The Saw Swee Hock Student Centre offers student facilities like gyms, cafes and dance spaces to promote collaboration and interaction. The Students' Union offers support and other services on campus to benefit the student community. The multicultural mix of students helps develop students into global leaders of the future. A number of alumni from the London School of Economics have gone on to win Nobel Prizes and become heads of state. The most famous names on the list include Clement Atlee, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, economist and Nobel laureate Amartya Sen and Jomo Kenyatta, former President of Kenya.
Eligibility Overview: For UG applicantsFor PG Students We typically require a bachelor's degree conferred after a minimum of three years of study with a Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 3.5/4, 5.5/7, 6.5/8, 7.5/9, or 8/10 to be considered for admission to a taught master's course (first-class equivalent).We typically require a bachelor's degree conferred after a minimum of three years of study with a Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 3.3/4, 5/7, 6/8, 7/9, or 7.5/10 to be considered for admission to a taught master's course (upper second class equivalent). We demand a 65 percent grade when just a percentage grade is available.For Research programmes (MPhil/MRes/PhD)We generally require a master's degree with a CPA/GPA of 3.3/4, 5/7, 6/8, 7/9, or 7.5/10 to be considered for admission to a research programme.

Name: University of the West of England
Overview: The University of the West of England, established in 1992, is a public university on Frenchay's main campus. The other three campuses are the City campus, Glenside campus, and Gloucester campus. The university offers over 600 undergraduate, graduate, professional and doctoral courses under five faculties. The courses include business and law, environment and technology, arts, creative industries and education, health, applied sciences, and associate faculty. The popular undergraduate and postgraduate courses include Accounting, Banking, Finance, Business and Management, Applied Sciences, Biomedical Sciences, Creative Technology, Digital Marketing, Data Science, etc. The campus has facilities like an optometry & skill centre, skill & simulation centre, virtual environment radiotherapy training facilities, library, and study areas. The campus has sports facilities and is the central hub of sports and fitness activities, offering services and classes for students and staff. The university health centre provides fully equipped health care to promote healthy living in and around the campus. Study spaces are available on campus with well-equipped workstations, study spaces, and learning zones. The University of West England provides on-campus housing facilities through 12 residence halls with excellent facilities. The university offers off-campus accommodation. The accommodation is available on the Frenchay campus and the Glenside campus. Name: International College of Portsmouth
Overview: The International College of Portsmouth is a college located within the campus of the University of Portsmouth in England. The college was founded in 2009 and is part of the renowned Navitas Group that provides support for higher education. The college offers a number of undergraduate and graduate programs for international students, with a number of pathway programs allowing students to be eligible for university education in the future. The best courses at the International College of Portsmouth include Engineering University Foundation, Mathematics University Foundation and Business and Management Pre-Masteräó»s Postgraduate Pathway. The college campus is located in the middle of the University of Portsmouth campus. It is easily accessible thanks to its proximity to rail and other modes of public transport. Students also get access to state of the art facilities of the University of Portsmouth, including the Future Technology Centre, library and media and performing arts spaces. The college also has a renowned faculty which has received the Teaching Excellence Frameworkäó»s Gold rating. The tuition fee varies between GBP 8000 and GBP 15,000 per annum depending on the course chosen and its duration. The college is also well known for helping boost the salaries of graduates of its various programs, being ranked number one in the United Kingdom. The college has an active student community, many of whom reside on the campus residences. The community is diverse, with a large number of international students from over 100 countries pursuing an education here. Students can join the various student clubs and organizations of the University of Portsmouth, allowing them to expand their network and interact with fellow peers and faculty. They can also enjoy socializing with fellow students and faculty in the city of Portsmouth, known for its student friendly setting.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions RequirementsAs a student from abroad, you must:Show evidence of adequate academic English proficiency, often at CEFR level B1. Portsmouth College advises a minimum IELTS score of 5.5 overall (with no component lower than 5) for student visa applications in order to excel academically.When submitting your application, be sure to show that you are qualified to study at the Level 3 level in the subjects you've chosen by providing proof of your credentials and meeting any requirements specific to those subjects, such as submitting a portfolio of your work if you're applying to one of the Art courses.Complete a Skype interview successfully with the College to discuss and evaluate your subject choices.

Name: Aberystywth University
Overview: Situated in Aberystwyth, Wales, Aberystwyth University is a public research institute that was established in 1872. Three faculties, namely the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences, Faculty of Earth and Life Sciences and Faculty of Business and Physical Sciences, offer several undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Some courses are Art History, Media and Communication Studies, Tourism Management and Zoology. There are two Aberystwyth University campuses; the Penglais campus and the Llanbadarn campus, and a research centre called the Gogerddan campus. Several online and distance learning courses allow students to pursue flexible Law, Information Studies, and Biological Studies programs. Aberystwyth University provides short online Lifetime Learning Courses concerning Literature, Modern Languages, Psychology etc. Through the online Continuing Professional Development courses, students get an opportunity to develop employment-relevant knowledge and skills. The university's pathway and foundation courses, such as International Foundation Certificate, Fast-Track Foundation Pre-Masters, and Pre-sessional English courses, prepare students for its undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Summer courses are an excellent way of pursuing courses and simultaneously experiencing life in the UK. Scholarships, loans, awards and bursaries like Academic Excellence Scholarships, Departmental Awards and Margaret Evelyn Lynne Williams Bursary are financial aids. 98% of Aberystwyth University Computer Science undergraduates found employment post-degree completion.

Name: University of Glasgow
Overview: Established in 1451 in Scotland as a public research institute, the University of Glasgow stands as the 4th oldest university in the English-speaking world. Comprising four colleges, namely the College of Arts, College of Social Sciences, College of Medical, Veterinary & Life Sciences, and College of Science & Engineering, the university has an enrollment of over 29,000 students and a teaching faculty of over 3,400 members (including research staff). The University of Glasgow degree programs (undergraduate, postgraduate and postgraduate research) include Celtic Civilization, Finance, Psychology, Theatre Studies, English Literature, etc.Students can also opt for short online courses in Creative Writing, Languages, Literature and Film, Philosophy, etc., free Massive Online Open Courses, and the 10-week Robert Burns online courses. The Study Abroad program, in conjunction with 300 partners, allows students to spend two weeks to a year in another country. The estimated undergraduate tuition fee for Scotland and EU students is GBP 1,820. Regarding financial aid, UK students can avail themselves of the RUK Access Bursary. Some other financial aid includes Kennedy Scholarships, Graham Trust Bursary Scheme, and Clark (Mile-End) Bursary Fund. Interestingly, it is also home to Scotland's oldest public museum, The Hunterian.

Placement: A placement year is probably the best method to improve your degree and considerably raise your chances of landing a decent job or PhD position. Not only will you gain valuable experience and training, but UoG's placement students earn an average income of £12,000-14,000!Finding a job may seem challenging at first. Nonetheless, the placement team will be by your side every step of the way.  Beginning the Placement The student and the firm can negotiate the start date of the placement, but most start in July or August. Accommodation arrangements should be made well in advance of the commencement date. It's possible that the placement will be a continuation of a project started by a previous year's student, in which case you may arrange to take over their housing. Alternatively, the employer may be able to provide temporary housing for the first few weeks while arrangements are made. In any situation, it is the student's responsibility to contact the firm and make the required accommodations arrangements. If complications emerge, get advice from your academic supervisor.
Accommodation: The University of Glasgow residences for undergraduates and postgraduates consist of catered and self-catered options comprising suites, apartments, houses, and flats, all equipped with dining services. Some popular residential accommodations are Brooke House, Winton Drive, Lister House, and Dumfries Hall.Why choose UoG's On-Campus Accommodation? When it comes to finding a place to reside during their time in Glasgow, students have a plethora of choices. However, UoG believes that staying in university housing is the best option for the majority of students. Read on to know why.If you are a full-time student at the university, you are guaranteed accommodationStaying in University accommodation, sharing a residence with students from the same institution, or possibly even the same programme, is the only way to receive the whole "University of Glasgow Experience."Undergraduates and postgraduates are not housed in the same block.Your accommodation fees include access to one of the best university sports facilities in the UK.You have access to dedicated University support 24 hours a day, seven days a week, and direct access to University Student Support Services through Residence staff.You will not be held liable for the complete accommodation contract if your circumstances change and you formally drop out of your studies.You can choose from a variety of flats and rooms available at various prices.Apply here

Course Description: University of Glasgow is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Glasgow was founded in 1451. Located in Glasgow,UK the university is home to about 7239 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Glasgow is ranked 136th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. University of Glasgow has 5 intakes in Sep,Nov, Jul, Jan, Jun. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Glasgow is around 18350.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Glasgow include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Glasgow is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Glasgow has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of Liverpool - Kaplan
Overview: Established in 1881, the University of Liverpool is an internationally renowned Russell Group university. It is the original ‘redbrick’ university and has campuses at three locations. This university’s prime campus is based in the heart of Liverpool. It also has campuses in Suzhou (China) and Leahurst (Wirral). This institute is officially recognised or chartered by the Privy Council. Some undergraduate courses (2022 entry) offered at this university include Accounting and Finance BA (Hons), Actuarial Mathematics BSc (Hons), Aerospace Engineering MEng (Hons), Anatomy and Human Biology BSc (Hons), Biochemistry BSc (Hons), Avionic Systems MEng (Hons) and several others. The postgraduate courses at this institute are segregated into various departments - Archaeology Classics and Egyptology, Communication and Media, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering and Electronics, Dental Sciences, Health Data Science, Irish Studies, etc. The University of Liverpool extends specialized entrance support to international students. Moreover, the student-to-staff ratio of Liverpool is considered the 8th best within the Russell Group. About 94% of these university’ graduates either receive employment or opt for higher studies within 6 months of graduating. This institute extends more than 100 postgraduate research opportunities. Around 81% of this institute’s research was rated internationally excellent and world-leading. Postgraduate research students receive help regarding covering their costs and fees with a Postgraduate Doctoral Loan valued up to £27,265. Some notable University of Liverpool alumni include singer Andy Brown, BBC TV and radio presenter Victoria Derbyshire, former Poet Laureate Professor Dame Carol Ann Duffy DBE, actor Anton Lesser, BAFTA-winning actress Anna Maxwell Martin, and many more. This university is associated with 9 Nobel Prize winners. A graduate of this institute joins a vast global family of over 230,000 alumni that includes 35 alumni associations and networks on a global scale.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions for International Students The university offers a wide range of undergraduate programmes. Placement: Placement at the University of Liverpool Students can integrate their academic knowledge with practical experience through placement opportunities with businesses, government agencies, non-profit organisations, and cultural providers.The workplace module provided to students is SOTA300. It also collaborates with Sentric Music and Collective Encounters to give students with incredible skills and possibilities.Within six months of graduation, 90% of its alumni are hired.After graduating from a UK-based university, all international students can take the Graduate Immigration Route to become working professionals.According to Payscale, the average pay of a University of Liverpool graduate is 35,000 GBP per year.

Name: The College, Swansea University
Overview: The College, Swansea University is a joint venture between Navitas and Swansea that was launched in 2018 and is located on the bay campus of Swansea University. Students applying here will find plenty of academic pathways leading to UG and PG degrees. Candidates can choose from several Pre-Master programs in business and management, humanities, education and training, engineering and technology, computer science and IT, etc.The institution offers a personalised education philosophy to its students that help them reach their maximum academic potential. The admission process is pretty simple and students can apply online using its official website. However, certain supportive documents like passport, academic qualifications, English proficiency test results, etc. need to be submitted. One can also apply for the Bay Campus accommodations which are secure and just a few minutes’ walk from the campus. The College, Swansea University students are also provided with personal tutors to help them clarify doubts regarding the courses they opt for. Apart from academics, students get to stay involved in lots of campus activities as well. They get access to over 120 sports and cultural societies including, gym facilities, a 50-metre Welsh National Swimming Pool, etc. within the campus. The average cost of tuition is around £15,054 per year. However, it also offers several academic, music, and sporting scholarships and bursaries to its students. It also organizes career fairs where students get access to popular organisations, helping them build their careers.
Placement: Swansea aims to link students with businesses from all industries for 4-week graduate-level internships through its Paid Internship Network. All positions are posted on Employment Zone, and its SEA Specialists assist with internships to make sure that the company and the students benefit fully from the opportunities. Employers may apply for subsidies to help pay for students' salaries, and students are paid as per the Living Wage Foundation rates.
Accommodation: On-CampusAccommodation on Bay Campus offers a high-quality en-suite study bedroom, just a short walk from The College academic building, and is safe, secure, and convenient during your studies at Swansea. Swansea endeavours to place students studying at The College in the Rod Jones Halls of Residences if space permits. Clun, Cynffig, Dulais, and Tawe are the four blocks that make up this structure.

Name: Loughborough University
Overview: Loughborough University, founded in 1966, is a public research university in Leicestershire, in the East Midlands of England. The institution ranks among the top 10 universities by all national league tables.Having four colleges divided into ten schools, 20 departments and 100 research groups, Loughborough offers numerous undergraduate, doctoral and postgraduate programs in various courses like Engineering, Architecture, Computer Sciences, Biology, Economics, Management, Accounts, Mathematics, Languages, Media, and Psychology. The University observes an acceptance rate of nearly 68%. The admission process requires filling out forms through the UCAS portal with a fee of 20 GBP for undergraduates while directly on the university portal for postgraduates with LORs, IELTS, TOEFL, or GMAT scores if required. The average undergraduate tuition fee ranges from 18,650 - 23,100 GBP and 19,100 - 27,500 GBP for postgraduates depending on the particular program. Financial aid is provided through numerous scholarships under which international students are automatically registered for international scholarships that waive off 25% of the tuition fee for the first year. There are performance and sports scholarships awarded in addition to other merit-based ones. Graduates from Loughborough have a high placement rate with an average starting salary of 27,000 GBP. Engineering and MBA are high-paying degrees with an average salary as high as 60000 GBP. The students are even given chances to meet employers at career fairs like the Spring fair week.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: For Undergraduate:Standard XII school leaving qualifications are the basis for most offers.  The university normally asks for scores in the range of 78% - 88% average performance from the best four subjects when awarded by CBSE, ISCE, or West Bengal Exam BoardsFor other state boards, the university would expect a score of 83% to 93% on the best four subjects Note: Some courses may require specific topic marks in Standard X or XII. For Postgraduate: Institutions that are part of the Indian Higher Education Institutions Ranking Framework require 55%-65% marksFor other Indian Institutions, the marking range is 60%-70% English language proficiency requirements: Candidates must submit proof of the following academic and English language proficiency requirements:

Placement: During their placement, the majority of students are paid, and some even get permanent jobs after graduation. Placements and internships may also provide additional benefits such as improved professional skills and career confidence, improved topic awareness and understanding, a stronger CV, and increased graduation opportunities. The skills you gain on placement can be applied to your studies, and many of our students say that completing a professional or industrial placement has improved their University grades.  They provide placement opportunities in different countries as well as the opportunity to spend 3-12 months at an international university if you are interested in travelling while studying. You'll have access to a plethora of different work experience and internship opportunities in addition to placements — there are so many ways to improve your CV as a student at Loughborough. A placement is an excellent method to strengthen your professional network and sometimes even gain permanent employment after graduation, in addition to giving vital professional experience and improving your comprehension of taught theory in a practical situation. An offer of a graduate job might be a great motivator to return to final year studies.

Name: Royal central school for speech & Drama
Overview: The Royal Central is considered an international leader in professional training specifically under the fields of Drama, Theatre and Performance. Established in 1906, it became a part of The London University in 2005. The college is accredited under the Conservatoires UK and Federation of Drama Schools.The Royal School is located at Eton Avenue, London, NH3 3HY, UK. Swiss Cottage campus and Central Bankside studios at the 4-8 Emerson street, which is a 10 minutes walk from the London Bridge. The students can take up courses with subjects like Acting and Performance; Collaborative theatre; Theatre Production; Writing; Crafts; Design; Teaching; Coaching; and Management Research.The school provides full-time as well as part-time degrees in multiple fields of performing arts. It offers undergraduate degrees in Acting; Drama; Applied Theatre and Education; and Theatre Practice covering a total of 15 courses. The Postgraduate degree courses include Classical Acting; Contemporary; Advanced Theatrical Practices; Directing and Teaching; Scenography; Writing for Stage and Broadcast Media covering a total of 14 courses.The institute provides various short term courses such as Diploma, online learning course, evening course, short summer course and Saturday youth theatre.The college also provides PhD degrees and other research programmes. The Royal Central has on-campus accommodation facilities. There are intercollegiate halls, private halls of residence and private rented accommodation. The average cost of studying at the Royal School would be $29,229 - $50,000 for a year, which includes tuition, food, accomodation, books etc. it might vary depending on the course one opts for, accommodation and spending habits of the individuals. The college also holds open days, organises free auditions and interviews. Students willing may visit the website for more information. The college is also a member of the Federation of Drama Schools. There are embassies and organisations that provide scholarships to deserving candidates.

Placement: Central's purpose is to provide industry contacts for all students, and our one-on-one, tailored approach sets us distinct from other higher education or theatre training institutions.Students at Central can participate in a wide range of placements with an ever-growing number of partner organisations. Students who complete these assignments graduate from Central with a vast network of industry contacts, allowing them to develop their careers faster.Our vast roster of visiting professionals, who teach particular skills and lead or work alongside students on creative projects, benefit courses that do not include internships. Accommodation: As a Central student, you have the choice of staying at one of the following places:Privately rented lodgingMany Central students choose to share a flat or house with other students or London-based professionals. Typically, each student would have their own room and share public spaces such as the kitchen, bathroom, and living room, as well as the cost of bills. Some students choose to live on their own, although this can be costly.Intercollegiate Halls of the University of London• Student HallsCentral receives room allocations each year as a University of London institution. The halls are located in the heart of London (near Marble Arch, Kings Cross, St Pancras, and Euston) and offer both catered and non-catered rooms.• Private Residence HallsPrivate halls are student housing run by for-profit businesses. All bills are usually included in the rent, and accommodations range from studios to single en-suites to twins. Most have community rooms as well as onsite amenities such as a gym.Homestaying with a Resident Landlord (Host family)This sort of housing is occasionally chosen by students as a more flexible and cost-effective alternative to renting. Typically, a student will have their own room and share the rest of the facilities with the Landlord or host family.

Name: University of Worcester
Overview: Established in 1946, the University of Worcester is a Public Research University with an urban setting in Worcester, England. It has 4 campuses. St. John's Campus is the main campus. The other campuses are City Campus, also known as Worcester Business School, The Riverside and Worcester Arena, an Arts Space & Exhibition Building, and the Lakeside Campus (10 minutes walk from the main campus) used as an Outdoor Education Centre. Some of the famous courses here are Nursing, Psychology, Sports Sciences, Education, Computing and Business. The College provides undergraduate, postgraduate, doctorate and online courses. They are also involved in researching in unique fields like Plant Science, History and English Literature. This university has the most celebrated Library in the country, known as The Hive. An annual fee structure here would come to around 9,250 GBP, and for international students, it may cost approximately 11,400 GBP. They also provide scholarships for students like Academic Achievement Scholarships, Choral Scholarships, Sports Scholarships. The university also offers student exchange programs across the world. Worcester Students' Union is the body that represents the students of this university. They also have an official Student's Union Newspaper-The Voice. In addition, they organize various clubs, societies and volunteering opportunities. The university is also active in sports. Other facilities for the students studying in this university include physiology labs, performance analysis suites, a 3D motion capture laboratory.

Name: Kingston University London
Overview: Located in South West London, England's Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames, Kingston University London is a public research university. Its foundations date back to the 1899 founding of the Kingston Technical Institute. Prior to 1992, when it was granted university status, the organization was known as Kingston Polytechnic.There are four campuses there, and they are in Roehampton and Kingston. The university has four faculties: Kingston School of Art, Faculty of Business and Social Sciences (which combines Kingston Business School and the School of Law, Social and Behavioural Sciences), Faculty of Health, Social Care and Education, and Faculty of Science, Engineering and Computing. It specializes in the arts, design, fashion, science, engineering, and business. The CNAA has authorized the MBA programme at Kingston Business School. The university received The Guardian University Award for outstanding teaching in 2017.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student are around 2309110 INR. Kingston University London offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Kingston University London on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet to be considered for admission are: For Undergraduate: Minimum 70 per cent in Standard XII Higher Secondary School Certificate (CBSE, CISCE, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, and West Bengal boards).Higher Secondary School Certificate (Standard XII) (other state boards) a minimum of 80% For Postgraduate Taught: SEC Courses:Bachelor's degree with a minimum CGPA of 6.5 out of 10 (2:2 equivalent)Bachelor's degree with a minimum CGPA of 7.5 out of 10 (2:1 equivalent)All other Courses :Bachelor's degree with a minimum CGPA of 6.0 out of 10 (2:2 equivalent)Bachelor's degree with a minimum CGPA of 7.0 out of 10 (2:1 equivalent)For specific courses, work experience will also be required For Postgraduate Research : A good postgraduate Master's degree English language proficiency requirements are: For undergraduateIELTS: Minimum score of 6.0 - 6.5For postgraduateIELTS: Minimum score of 6.5
Placement: Many of Kingston University's postgraduate programmes provide the option to add a professional work placement year. The opportunity to acquire the skills that companies want is provided by the placement year, which is a great method to gain worthwhile job experience. Both domestic and foreign full-time students have access to the placement option.  According to reports, six months after graduating from Kingston University, about 95% of alumni are employed or enrolled in further education. Graduates typically make around 33,000 GBP per year, according to Payscale. KUL graduates with jobs in executive management and change may expect to make about 61,000 GBP annually on average.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Your whole experience may be significantly impacted by where you reside while attending university. The university can assist you with your questions about whether you decide to live in university residence halls, rent privately, or live at home. Residence Halls It may be a lot of fun and a fantastic opportunity to meet other students living in the halls. In mixed-gender flats, you will live among students from all backgrounds, cultures, and courses.Our residences are conveniently placed near campus amenities and have quick access to Kingston Town Center and Central London. There are 2,252 rooms available, so you may find something to fit your preferences and price range. Look through the extensive selection of rooms to pick the one that's best for you: Chancellor's Hall You'll be walking distance from your lessons because Chancellors Hall is on the Kingston Hill Campus.Chancellors Hall's student accommodations are being renovated by the institution. The spruced-up halls will provide contemporary, fashionable rooms in a green setting. A recent renovation project involved 280 bedrooms with en suite bathrooms. For more information, visit: https://www.kingston.ac.uk/accommodation/halls-of-residence/chancellors-hall/  Clayhill The ideal home away from home, Clayhill, is situated in Surbiton's lush residential neighbourhood.The hall has 715 en-suite bedrooms in a convenient and enjoyable student living complex and is our largest hall of residence. Four students share a kitchen in each apartment. For more information, visit: https://www.kingston.ac.uk/accommodation/halls-of-residence/clayhill/  Middle Mill On the Knights Park site, Middle Mill Hall is ideal for Kingston School of Art students. The town centre of Kingston, where you can find local shopping and transportation to central London, is about 15 minutes walk from the hall.Middle Mill is one of our smaller halls of residence, having only 204 bedrooms. Being close to the Hogsmill River gives it a tremendous sense of community. For more information, visit: https://www.kingston.ac.uk/accommodation/halls-of-residence/middle-mill/  Seething Halls Seething Wells is adjacent to the Surbiton town centre and train station and is situated right on the River Thames. You won't even think you're in London because there is so much greenery nearby! The hall is housed in a historically significant listed building on an old waterworks site. In the 1990s, it underwent a transformation into student housing. With roughly 750 fully renovated en-suite rooms, the renovated residence halls will provide contemporary, elegant accommodations in an environmentally friendly setting. For more information, visit: https://www.kingston.ac.uk/accommodation/halls-of-residence/seething-wells-hall/  Walkden Hall Walkden Hall is situated on our lush Kingston Hill campus, so your classes are just steps away from your door, making it easy to get out of bed in the morning. Modern and chic study spaces are available in the freshly painted halls. 160 bedrooms with en suite bathrooms that recently undergone renovation. For more information, visit: https://www.kingston.ac.uk/accommodation/halls-of-residence/walkden-hall/   Off-Campus Accommodation  Private Accommodation In your search for the ideal student residence, be sure to consider the many private housing alternatives in and around Kingston. Types of rented accommodation Shared houses/flats In this scenario, you rent a room in a home or apartment and share the living room, bathroom, and toilet with other occupants. Studio Flats Studio apartments typically consist of one room with a kitchen and separate bathroom. Usually, these cost more money.For students only, many private providers have constructed blocks of studio apartments. With these advances, you will benefit from some independence while still being surrounded by other students. Ask the provider what steps they take to promote a feeling of community within the building to help ensure that you don't feel alone. Bedsits A bedsit is a space with some kind of self-contained amenities, typically a tiny kitchen or a separate laundry area. Typically, individuals who live in the same building as you share bathrooms and toilets. Family Home Here, you share a home with the proprietor. Bills are included in the rent, making this the most affordable choice. Meals are served differently depending on who you share them with. Before you inspect or commit to anything, ask the resident owner/occupier what they would expect of you because house rules and regimes can also differ greatly. For more information, visit: https://www.kingston.ac.uk/accommodation/private-accommodation/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.kingston.ac.uk/accommodation/

Sc in Telecommunications System, and M Pharma.Aston has formed a partnership with other research centres and universities for sponsored research programs. Name: University of Central Lancashire (UCLAN)
Overview: The Institution of Central Lancashire is the United Kingdom's 19th largest university. It is a multi-campus international university in Preston, Lancashire, United Kingdom. Preston (main campus), Burnley (research centers), Westlakes (nuclear and energy-related research programmes), and a satellite campus in Larnaca, Cyprus, are the university's three sites. It is a public university that provides a variety of programmes, including Undergraduate Studies, Postgraduate Studies, Postgraduate Research Degrees, Degree Apprenticeships, Professional Development, and a variety of Short Courses are among the options available.Teaching Excellence Framework Assessment has given the university the Silver Quality Award. There are 350 undergraduate programmes, 200+ postgraduate programmes, 33-degree apprenticeships, and 189 approved short courses in sectors such as mechanical engineering, digital marketing, social work, and cyber security, among others. Students can enroll in the course full-time, part-time, or online. Humanities, Management, Science, Accounting, Architecture, Biology, Business Studies, and other courses are among the most popular. They're also interested in new fields like fashion and forensic science. University of Central Lancashire students in Cyprus can earn a double degree from the University of Central Lancashire in the UK and the University of Central Lancashire in Cyprus. A UG degree will cost roughly 12,700-13,700 GBP, while a PG degree would cost around 13,200-15,200 GBP. Furthermore, both universities and the government offer scholarships and bursaries to students. On Preston Campus, there are seven halls of residence for full-time students. Engineering Innovation Centre, Teaching and Exhibition Space, 4 Flight Simulators, and other specialized labs are among the University of Lancashire's other facilities. The UCLan Career Services prepares students for their placement. They assist students with CV writing and interview preparation, as well as hosting career fairs and workshops. Within six months of graduation, 95.5% of UCLan graduates are employed or continuing their education.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements:  For Undergraduate : 50% overall scoreIf a certain topic is necessary for admission to a degree programme, it must be completed with a grade of 55%.3% margin to be considered by UCLan staff based on the institution's reputation, work experience etc.65% or 70% in Year 12 English – dependent upon State Board For Postgraduate : 75% in Year 12 English OR 70% average grade in Year 11 and Year 12 English provided Year 12 is not below 65%.58% in bachelor's degree.
Placement: Faculty of Science and TechnologyWork placements are an excellent method to improve one's employability while gaining valuable experience. It's also a terrific method to put one's talents to the test and stand out while applying for graduate positions. The university provides an optional work placement in the industry to enhance your job experience. The length of this varies by programme and can range from a year, 6-12 months, or shorter work placement of between 10-15 weeks. Business Administration with Professional Placement  The Master of Business Administration with Professional Placement is an internationally recognised business management degree. It's a rigorous two-year curriculum that focuses on leadership and strategic management, which sets it apart from other master's programmes. What pupils will discoverLearn how to establish a new business and hone your entrepreneurial skills.Take on a project work in business management on a topic that interests you and is relevant to your future career.Analyze the primary difficulties that the world's largest firms face using the most up-to-date business management concepts.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The University provides several accommodation options that provide excellent value for money in a safe, active, and inclusive hall community. They also offer advice and assistance to students who want to live in private student housing and offer a variety of self-catering halls with en-suite flats or communal facilities to choose from. The rent includes gas, electricity, water expenses, and free internet and Wi-Fi. In addition, we maintain a 24-hour security presence with CCTV. Each hall has on-site personnel available to assist with questions outside regular business hours. The halls provided by the University are : Derwent HallDouglas HallPendle Hall Ribble hall For more information, visit: https://www.uclan.ac.uk/accommodation
