Name: London Business School
Overview: London Business School is a prestigious postgraduate business school and a constituent college of the University of London. London Business School, or LBS, was established in 1964, and since then, it has been a leading institution in the field of business, management, and finance. A changemaker institution, LBS wants to innovate how the world conducts business. LBS strives to transform careers and empower people with a global outlook and provocative thinking curriculum. Some top programs at London Business School are Executive MBA, M.A. in Finance, Global Masters in Management, and Ph.D. in Accounting, Strategy, and Entrepreneurship Ph.D. program. London Business School has two campuses. The flagship campus is located in London, near Sussex Place in Marylebone. The other campus is an international campus located in Dubai. The London Campus houses the famous Sainsbury Wing, where most MBA buildings are located. The Dubai Campus recently introduced two new programs, the Executive Education Programme and the Executive MBA. LBS offers the esteemed Wheeler Institute Internships that facilitate the development of applied research. The average tuition fee at London Business School is 50,000 GBP. International Students have access to merit-based grants and financial aid. LBS does not provide its student's on-campus housing and accommodation facilities. Students live in neighboring private residential buildings and apartments and residence halls in the International Students House, London.
Eligibility Overview: Academic RequirementsA bachelor's degree or a comparable qualificationA minimum of two years of work experience is required for an MBANo work experience is necessary for MIM/MSGMAT Score = 600+English RequirementsStudents must take the following tests to demonstrate their ability in the English language:IELTSPTETOEFL
Placement: At London Business School, 97 per cent of career outcomes are reported. Students use a thorough career development curriculum to help them explain the value of their skills to potential employers. Within three months of graduation, 94% of graduates obtained an offer of employment.Early Careers Recruitment Evenings, Tech and Start-Up Evenings, and Buy-side Networking Evenings are just a few of the career development events that are held to help graduates enhance their careers.Students can also work with global companies, including Amazon, American Express, BCG, Blackstone, Google, J.P. Morgan, and McKinsey & Co., on research and other initiatives.The average wage of graduates of London business schools is 140,000 GBP, according to payscale. Amazon, Goldman Sachs, and BCG are all notable employers of London Business School grads. Beijing and Dubai are two cities that come to mind.
Accommodation: Although LBS does not provide on-campus housing for overseas students, you can stay in private student housing in the UK near the school.Limited off-campus housing is available specifically to students of the institution in London's accommodation halls.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.All basic services like electricity, central heating, and unrestricted internet access are included in the fee for the student homes.Information about how to apply for off-campus housing, as well as the amenities provided. Halls and apartments are only offered to students after they have accepted an offer of admission.Executive education students will stay in a hotel suite that is strategically located and elegantly decorated to accommodate their needs.Executive students staying at the school for an extended period of time can stay in the hotel's guest suites.Ensuite bathrooms, laptop safes, and an exclusive Executive Education Business Lounge are among the hotel's amenities.The typical monthly rent is between 500 - 700 pounds.For more visit:
Course Ranking: For the new generation of businessmen, London Business School is renowned for its Master's, Executive, and PhD programmes. We have discovered that the LBS MBA programmes have received high marks from reputable ranking publishers when we thoroughly examine the business course rankings. Most publishers have placed their MBA programme among the top 10 programmes, but since 2017, QS has placed its Accounting & Finance programme outside of the top 20.Along with its MBA programme, the university's Master's in Management and Master's in Finance programmes are among the top. In 2020, Financial Times ranked its Masters in Finance programme as the best. Additionally, its two-year MBA programme was named first in 2019 by Forbes. Through international exchanges, students also get the opportunity to learn from the top 30 business schools here.
University Ranking: With a history of more than 50 years, London Business School (LBS) has established a reputation for providing master's programmes in business, management, and finance. The business programmes given by LBS are renowned worldwide, despite being ranked over 100 by major rating publishers. The Financial Times has named London Business School as Europe's top business school for three years, from 2014 to 2016. Recruiters view LBS alumni as having a high employability rate. Three months after graduating, 94% of MIM students received an offer. Anyone considering studying in LBS can enrol in courses in Economics, Accounting, Marketing, Entrepreneurship, Economics, and Management. However, with a 25% acceptance rate, LBS is selective in who it admits.London Business School is one of the select few business schools with accreditation from the esteemed AACSB, EQUIS, and AMBA. The main campus of London Business School is in London, while a second campus is in Dubai. Therefore, those students who prefer to stay in the UK and pursue higher education abroad can also enrol at LBS while studying in Asia. However, those who wish to take business courses in the UK may wish to consider the programmes provided by London Business School.

Name: Norwich University of the Arts
Overview: Norwich University of the Arts (NUA) was established in 1845 in Norfolk, United Kingdom; it is a public university specialising in media, arts and design education. Over 2,000 students are enrolled in undergraduate and postgraduate courses and can earn degrees like BA, BSc, MA and MArch. Some prevalent disciplines offered are Communication Design, Textile Design, Fashion, Fine Art and Interior Design. NUA offers bespoke and exclusive sessions, multidisciplinary workshops and campus tours for high schools and colleges to introduce Creative Higher Education. The Norwich University of the Arts campus is located in Norwich and comprises several creative spaces within 11 buildings. The university's main facilities include the Ideas Factory, East Gallery, Media Resource Centre and Duke Street Lecture Theatre. The NUA research program is centred around three themes: Human Interfaces, Created and Contested Territories and patterns and Chaos.NUA provides on-campus student accommodation in en-suite and single bedrooms at All Saints Green, Beechcroft, Duke Street Riverside, Benedictaous Gate etc. Private accommodation is available in rented (often shared) flats and houses. The NUA Students Union runs over 30 clubs and societies like Pride, rugby and Yoga and Wellbeing. The university has a student employment rate of 94%.The estimated cost of attending is GBP 9,250, GBP 8,500 and GBP 5,400 for full-time domestic undergraduate, postgraduate and research students, respectively. Financial aid options include scholarships, loans, bursaries and awards like Maintenance Loans, NUA Chancelloräó»s Scholarship, Heathfield Accommodation Bursary and The Helen Hoyte Prize.

Name: Oxford Brookes University
Overview: Formerly known as Oxford Polytechnic, Oxford Brookes University is a public research institution located in Oxford, England. The institution received its university status through the Further and Higher Education Act 1992. Oxford Brookes University has an international reputation for research excellence. The university offers graduate, master's, and professional degrees across various disciplines and more than 18 schools. Some top programs at Oxford Brookes University are B.A. in Education, B.A. in Economics and Econometrics, M.S. in Biological Sciences, and M.A. in Accounting and Finance.The University has more than 18,000 students and boasts 11 National Teaching Fellows in its award-winning faculty. Globally renowned for Research Excellence, the institution believes in a learning system that allows its students to learn beyond the classroom.Students are sent to work in industrial workshops to give them the experience of working in a professional setting. Further, the institution has an extensive placements division which equips the students with the best internships. Oxford Brookes University continues to strive for excellence with a high graduation rate. The average tuition fee at Oxford Brookes University is 12,100 GBP. International students have access to grants.

Placement: Work internships are a fantastic opportunity to put what you've learned in class into practice, and Oxford Brookes assists students in identifying the finest options for them. When searching for jobs, having a good work placement on your CV might help you stand out. When our work placement students graduate, many of them are given a job with their placement company.  The ability to spend a year in the industry through our work placement scheme is a significant part of all undergraduate courses. A year in industry is optional, but highly recommended, and occurs in the third year of a four-year programmeTo add value to a degree, the placement should be of a proper level of responsibilityThe position must be full-time (at least 37.5 hours per week) and for a minimum of 48 weeksThe remuneration must be appropriate for the placement role and must not be less than the country's minimum wage The advantages of taking a placement year: Before you graduate, you must complete a year of paid, full-time work experience in a graduate-level position. This is a terrific addition to your CV and will help you stand out while applying for graduate jobsA graduate employment offer from your work placement employer - which many of our students receive each yearAn opportunity to improve your analytical and communication abilities, which are in high demand among businessesExtensive experience in a field or employment function that supports your future professional goals and is of interest to youWorking in a competitive and fast-paced setting allows you to gain confidenceAbove all, placements will improve your skills, allowing you to earn a better degree and, as a result, raise your chances of landing a suitable graduate position in your chosen field How can the university help: The Skills for Placement Module will be taken during your second year of study. This module will assist you in your hunt for a work placement position and teach you tactics and skills that will help you succeed in interviews and assessment centres. A specialist placements team housed inside the Business School can also provide additional assistance. Throughout your work placement year, the Business School will provide you with ongoing support from your individual Placement Tutor.

Name: London Film School, London
Overview: Established in 1956, London Film School is situated in Covent Garden, London. It is the oldest film school in the UK which offers various full-time programs in filmmaking, screenwriting, and PhD courses to qualifying students. The school has a fully equipped design studio with drawing boards, model-making facilities, a visible reference library, a materials library, and a computer suite. Every course develops the students' artistic voices, producing over 180 films annually; thus, students graduate with a longer-term cinema experience in the palms of their hands. Some of the highest courses include MA in Filmmaking; the two years include Directing, Producing, Editing, Cinematography, Sound, Production Design, and Writing. The one-year MA screening program and MA International Film Business prepare students for a career in programming, exhibition, and distribution. The London Film Faculty admits around 220 students annually. The school provides ample facilities to its students, with a library with an extensive collection of films plus a small group of core books. The total cost of living is about EUR 60,137 annually. The university offers scholarships and loans to international students to study in the U.K. The course fee for a two-year course is EUR 19,500 annually. The institute arranges workshops and summer courses with short-term accommodation. The students registered at the university can explore different job opportunities based on their interests and qualifications.

Name: University of Liverpool
Overview: The University of Liverpool is an internationally renowned Russell Group university. It is the original ‘redbrick’ university and has campuses at three locations. This university’s prime campus is based in the heart of Liverpool. It also has Suzhou (China) and Leahurst (Wirral) campuses. Candidates must submit their IELTS or TOEFL scores to prove their English proficiency. However, the scores depend on the course you opt for. Typically courses require an IELTS score of 6.0 and above.The university offers plenty of scholarships to international students, like the University of Liverpool Humanitarian Scholarship for Masters Programmes, Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship, Sport Liverpool Scholarships, Chevening Scholarships, and the University of Liverpool International College Excellence Award.About 94% of these university graduates either receive employment or opt for higher studies within 6 months of graduating. This institute extends more than 100 postgraduate research opportunities. Around 81% of this institute’s research was rated internationally excellent and world-leading. Postgraduate research students receive help covering their costs and fees with a Postgraduate Doctoral Loan valued at £27,265. This university is associated with 9 Nobel Prize winners.
Eligibility Overview: All undergraduate applicants must have a good general education, which includes acceptable levels of literacy and numeracy, which are typically equivalent to a grade 4 or C at GCSE in English and Mathematics.Additional criteria for individual programmes may exist, and these are specified on our online course pages.All students applying to the University of Liverpool must demonstrate that they are proficient in English and that they meet the university's standards. The University accepts the qualifications listed on our Undergraduate and Postgraduate pages, and they are regarded to meet a minimum CEFR B2 level in each component (speaking, writing, listening and reading).This is the minimum level acceptable for degree level study in order to secure a visa to enter the UK via Student Route.for more information click on this link-https://www.liverpool.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/applying/entry-requirements-and-qualifications/

Name: Hertfordshire International College
Overview: The Hertfordshire International College (HIC) is a modern college that was established in the year 1952. The college is known for offering students with dynamic educational experience. Located on the University of Hertfordshire campus in Hatfield, UK, the Hertfordshire International College is home to many students from different cultures and communities. The HIC provides its students with various English programs, with 13 undergraduate and seven postgraduate courses. Art & Design, Healthcare, Animation, Law, Medical Sciences, Journalism & Media, Engineering, etc.Computer Science is among the top undergraduate courses, whereas Tourism, Business Management, and Fashion are the top postgraduate courses. Thus, four types of English language programs help the students communicate in one language. The average tuition fees for international students are 13,000 pounds. The University of Hertfordshire has two campuses: the College Lane and the deHavilland Campus. The College Lane campus is the main campus. The University of Hertfordshire provides scholarships and financial aid to its international students. The Hertfordshire International College also shares some scholarships for its students, including Dean Scholarship for Legal Excellence and Dean Scholarship for Business Excellence. The college provides on-campus accommodation to its students in the various residential halls. All students below the age of 18 are reserved for on-campus housing. The average payment fee required for on-campus accommodation is 8,594 pounds. The college has got excellent placement opportunities. Within six months from graduation, college students get employed in companies like Microsoft, Tesla, and KPMG.

The 'Workplace Preparation' module is meant to help you get ready for your new job. The University's specialised Placements Team and Careers and Employment Service are available to assist you in your search. The University has connections with various organisations in many sectors that can provide relevant possibilities. You can also find a placement through personal relationships or networking services like LinkedIn, but you must ensure that the University accepts it beforehand.Individuals with a master's degree in International Relations are well-prepared for work and frequently work in the following fields:Policy: Graduates may wish to work in government, think tanks, or non-governmental organisations (NGOs) in policy research and creationVocation: Graduates frequently wish to apply what they learned in the course in a more vocational environment, such as journalism, human resources, or marketing, in both the public and private sectorsResearch: Graduates may wish to pursue a career in research in the public sector, such as polling, market research, or research and development, or in the commercial sector, such as polling, market research, or research and development

They navigate their way around, responding to the industry needs with their skills. The university is also in an exciting partnership with the media and Television industry like the BBC and other studios. Name: University of Bath
Overview: The University of Bath received its royal charter in 1966 and is one of the top 10 universities in the UK. The public research university in Bath, Somerset, has its beautiful main campus on Claverton Down. A two-time winner of the Queen's Anniversary Prize, Bath is especially famous for research, and 87% of it has been termed world-leading.Four faculties - Engineering & Design, Humanities & Social Sciences, Management, and Science- offer over 300 courses at different levels. The popular ones are - Mechanical Engineering, Physical Sciences, Mathematics, Technology, Management, Psychology, and Architecture. To help students with the language, various courses ranging from 5 - 30 weeks are there in the English Pre-sessional program. The acceptance rate of Bath is 15%, with an application fee of 25 GBP and 60 GBP for undergraduate and postgraduate programs, respectively, along with LORs, IELTS, TOEFL, or GMAT, if required.The average undergraduate tuition fee ranges from 18,000 to 22,000 GBP and from 19400 to 23,800 GBP for postgraduate programs. The on-campus accommodation cost ranges from 2,736 - 8,300 GBP for undergraduate while from 4,940 - 11,026 GBP per year for postgraduates. The Chancellor's Scholarship worth up to 2000 GBP, The International Baccalaureate 50th Anniversary Scholarship worth 8000 GBP, and the Sports and Creativity Scholarships worth 5,000 GBP per year are some of the scholarships awarded.The University of Bath ranks 4th for graduates' employment within six months of graduation, with an average salary of 35,000 GBP.

Placement: It is ranked 5th by The Times and The Sunday Times Good University Guide 2020 for graduate prospects, noting that 87.5% of University of Bath’s students are in professional jobs or graduate-level study. According to PayScale, the average graduate salary of a University of Bath graduate is 35,000 GBP annually.The highest-paid former students of Bath University are the ones who are presently working in the field of Compliance, AML, KYC & Monitoring with a salary of almost 80,000 GBP.
Accommodation: Operating as a single-site campus, the University of Bath offers a unique experience of connecting with a multilateral student community. As per THE Student Experience Survey 2018, the university ranked 3rd for its campus environment. Some other key aspects of the University of Bath campus include:The university comprises 38 buildings which include 10 West the hub of psychology and The Institute for Policy Research.Student Entrepreneurship Lab is part of the academic programs and an initiative of the University of Bath on Business.Exhibitions, theatres, and other art and cultural activities at the University of Bath are organized by Edge, the center of Arts and creative aspects.Sports Training Village(STV) includes a swimming pool, athletic tracks, courts, and pitches and provides all sorts of sports facilities to the university students and staff as well.Popular in architecture and enriched in History, Bath is an excellent choice for students to roam and explore its ancient galleries and museums. Bus stops are just a walking distance from the Bath University students’ accommodation.
Course Ranking: The university's top courses include pharmacy and pharmacology, business and management (accredited by the AMBA), architecture and civil engineering, economics, computer science, electronic and electrical engineering, mechanical engineering (accredited by the IMechE), mathematics, statistics, and operational research, education, Molecular Biosciences, Biosciences, Physics and Astronomy, Politics, Sport, and Social Policy and Administration.When discussing the University of Bath's course rankings, it should be noted that the university has received rankings for its business, engineering, and computer science programmes. One of the top universities in the UK for business studies is the University of Bath. The university was ranked in the top three for business and management studies and in the top five for accounting and finance studies by the Complete University Guide. The university has also been listed as one of the top three universities for accounting, finance, business management, and marketing degrees in the Guardian subject rankings for 2021 and 2020.When it comes to the engineering programmes offered by the University of Bath, the institution has a stellar reputation. For five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, The Guardian topic rating and The Complete University Guide have placed a number of engineering degrees in the top 15. This can only reflect on the excellent education offered at the university.The University of Bath has received outstanding marks from The Complete University Guide for its computing programmes, holding down the seventh spot for 2021. The university's PG Computers course received a ranking from THE Times Higher Education between 310 and 400 for 2020 and 2021.

Name: Kaplan International College London - University of Bristol
Overview: Kaplan International College London, University of Bristol is a world-class institution which provides a Bristol degree that helps students impress their future employers. The University offers a range of pathway courses to the students who aspire to build a future by studying in the United Kingdom. It secured the 70th rank in the QS World Ranking and 8th in the UK according to the Shanghai Academic Ranking 2020. The university has 2-terms, 2.5-terms and 3-terms pathways programs along with its own bachelor’s and master's degree courses. The students will get a guaranteed entry to the Bristol program of their choice if they pass their pathway courses at the required level with good attendance at Kaplan International College London. Their International Foundation Program is a 1 year course that is designed to prepare the applicants to qualify for entry to an undergraduate degree at the University of Bristol. It focuses on developing the academic and language skills before the degree, so that the student can be completely prepared for undergraduate study. Kaplan International College London, University of Bristol welcomes students from over 150 countries around the world. In addition, the university provides the students a warm and culturally diverse environment. Thus, the university helps the students develop their communication skills and build a prosperous future in their career.

Name: University Academy 92, (NAVITAS)
Overview: The University Academy 92 is an educational institution located in Old Trafford, Greater Manchester, England. It was founded by Lancaster University and legendary footballers of Manchester United. The study curriculum in this university aims to develop personality and character and assist students in acquiring necessary skills and a successful career. There are offices of reputed companies such as KPMG, Microsoft, Bruntwood, etc. It offers a wide variety of training programmes on various subjects such as accounting and finance, business studies, sports management, computer science, sports management, accounting and business etc. As already mentioned before, the University Academy 92 is the effective result of years of partnership between the Class of 92 and Lancaster University to enhance the personality of young people both personally and academically. The institution is directed by Navitas, a global education provider to support international students that will help them gain access to their preferred educational institution. The university campus offers multiple learning environments provisioned with advanced technology to improve students’ learning. Further, this university provides scholarships to students, which begins from 20% cost of training for Universe Group students annually. This applies to students registered a minimum of 6 months before the start of the course. Speaking about the University Academy 92 ranking, Lancaster University earned 10th position in the UK by Guardian (2021), and Times and Sunday Times (2021) and 8th in the Complete University Guide (2021). Moreover, Lancaster holds 136th position in The World University ranking (2021) and 135th in QS World University ranking. Further, this educational institution offers advice and support to international students to escalate their potential. From application to visa submission, arrival to accommodation, the team of professionals is dedicated to fulfilling student requirements. In case more detailed information regarding admission is required, aspiring students can sign up for free consultation with any of the specialists.

Name: University of Chichester - Bognor Regis
Overview: Located in Chichester in West Sussex, UK, the university was founded in 1839, got its university status in 2005. The university currently has 16 departments and offers a variety of courses. Culturally, the University of Chichester - Bognor Regis is a mix of modern and history. The University of Chichester - Bognor Regis offers courses in various disciplines, including Law, Business, History, Fine Art, Mathematics, Dance, Acting, Criminology and Sociology, Sports, Theatre, Music and others. The institution also offers both undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. The undergraduate courses available at the university are BA (Hons) Business Management, BSc (Hons) Computer Science, BA (Hons) Event Management, BSc (Hons) Digital Marketing and others. Apart from these postgraduate courses available at the university are MSc Data Science and Analytics, MSc International Business, MSc Digital Marketing, Master of Business Administration, and MSc International Business and Finance. PhD courses are also available at the University of Chichester in Management, Tourism and other disciplines. As per THE World University Rankings data, the University of Chichester has a 6% international student population, with a female to male ratio of 63:37. Also, there are 4,311 FTE students with 14.2 students per staff. According to Guardian University Guide, the university ranked within the top 30 in the UK, and according to REF 2014, 90% of the university's research output is “internationally recognized”. At Bognor Regis, 3 residence halls are available for students: Barbara Smith Halls, Longbrook Hall, and Charlotte House. The University of Chichester has a high employability rate. According to DLHE 2018, 96.5% of graduates are employed 6 months after graduating. Apart from good education quality, Bognor Regis has a strong cultural presence, which allows recreation for students.

Name: University of Warwick
Overview: The University of Warwick, situated on the outskirts of Coventry between the West Midlands and Warwickshire, England, is a private research university founded in 1965. Warwick ranks among the top 10 universities nationally, having an acceptance rate of 14%. The three main faculties are Science, Technology Engineering and Mathematics (STEM), Arts and Social Sciences, with 29 academic departments and over 40 research centers offering 120 undergraduate and 85 postgraduate programs.Computer Science, Engineering, MBA, Law, and Management are some of the top courses at Warwick. The Centre for Lifelong Learning provides short-term courses, and the one-year International Foundation Programme for international students is top-rated.The undergraduate application is put up through the UCAS portal with a fee of 20-30 GBP and through Graduate Application Portal for postgraduate programs along with LORs, IELTS, TOEFL, or GMAT if required by the program. With an average undergraduate tuition fee ranging from 21,220 to 27,060 GBP and 7,700 to 46,610 GBP for postgraduate programs, Warwick offers many scholarships like Albukhary Undergraduate Scholarships and GREAT Britain Scholarship, both worth 20,000 GBP. Having been ranked 6th highest-earning graduates in the UK, students are met with great job opportunities with an average salary of 96,000 GBP for Executive Masters and 86,000 GBP for MBA.
Eligibility Overview: International Foundation Programme (IFP)We ask applicants to complete Grade 11 Standard (10+1) with at least an 80 per cent overall average to be considered for our IFP, and we are glad to consider students from all state boards.UndergraduateWe require you to complete Grade 12 Standard (10+2) with an overall average of at least 85 per cent, and we welcome students from all state boards.PostgraduateWe require a least First class or upper second class with a minimum of 60-80 per cent depending on your institution for applicants interested in our Postgraduate Taught or Research degrees. Applicants who have completed a five-year LLB from a recognised Indian college will be accepted with a minimum of 55-60%, depending on the institution.MBAA minimum of four years of post-graduate management experience is required. English Requirement

Name: Queen Margaret University
Overview: The Queen Margaret University is a university located in Edinburgh, UK. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. The main campus of Queen Margaret University is located in Edinburgh. The university offers over 6 undergraduate programs and 3 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around INR 18,11,334. Queen Margaret University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Name: Glasgow Caledonian University - Glasgow
Overview: Glasgow Caledonian University (GCU) is a public university in Glasgow, Scotland. The university offers multiple postgraduate and undergraduate programs in nursing, midwifery, law, business, renewable energy, fashion, tourism, journalism, engineering, psychology, physiotherapy etc. and houses around 20,000 students from various corners of the globe. The college is highly selective, with an acceptance rate of 23.61%. The university has three campuses: Glasgow, London and New York. The main campus is in Glasgow city-center. The university collaborates with international universities and holds the Florence Network and the Talloires Network membership. GCU has a variety of scholarship programmes for international applicants, including merit-based country scholarships, alumni scholarships, joint scholarships etc. Furthermore, the university has worldwide recognition as it has acquired many prestigious ranks. According to Times Higher Education rankings, GCU ranked 601–800th in the World University Rankings 2020, 44th in the University Impact Ranking 2019, and is in the top 150 universities in the Times Higher Education’s 200 under 50 league. Glasgow Caledonian University - Glasgow has launched a new Global MBA programme. All the programs are designed as per the needs of the students and focus on three significant areas: inclusive societies, healthy lives, and sustainable environments. Besides providing various opportunities, the university offers multi-cultural on-campus accommodation for international students. It provides 24-hour on-campus security, healthcare, extra support, and attention to international students via visa and community building services.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: For Undergraduate : Minimum 60% in each subject from XII Standard examsAdvanced entry to Level 2 or 3 can be considered with equivalent study from Bachelor's degree For Postgraduate taught : Four years Bachelor's degree (50% minimum; second class average over course duration)Three years Bachelor's degree (60% minimum; first-class average over course duration) English Requirement :Can accept 70% in standard XII English as evidence of English language
Placement: Students in various undergraduate programmes (mainly BEng programmes and BSc Computing/Networking programmes) can participate in a year-long Industrial Placement. These placements can be used as part of their final dissertation assignment for some postgraduate programmes. These internships are credit-bearing and count toward a student's degree when they graduate. Students have found these placements to be quite beneficial in gaining experience. They are occasionally offered a graduate position within the company immediately or after completing their Honours year. The University also urges the students to participate in a summer or short-term placement.  Student placements can serve as an extended interview for companies, and students can see where they might fit into a particular industry and in what capacity. Paid or unpaid, short-term or long-term placements are available.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Caledonian Court is the ideal location to live in if you're seeking a community that feels like a home away from home. Making friends with individuals from other countries is easy when you live at Caledonian Court, where the international community comprises students from nations like Nigeria, China, Greece, France, Germany, and the United States. The institution does not provide designated postgraduate or family housing. For more information, visit: https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/accommodation

Name: University of Huddersfield
Overview: Established in 1825, the University of Huddersfield is a public research university in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, England. Officially, it gained recognition as a university in 1992 to inspire and create global professionals. The University of Huddersfield offers more than 200 courses in undergraduate and postgraduate and some short courses in various disciplines. Popular majors at Huddersfield University are Business Management, Finance, Engineering & Technology, Law & Administration, Education, Biological Sciences, Architecture, Performing Arts & Design, Psychology, and Social Sciences. The Main Campus of the University is nestled in the southeast of the center of Huddersfield city, known as Queensgate Campus. In addition, they operate two more campuses named Oldham, located in Greater Manchester, and Barnsley, South Yorkshire.The student-faculty ratio at the University of Huddersfield is 22:1. The Career & Employability Services provides students with various career opportunities to learn the practical knowledge of their academics in the form of on-campus part-time placements, work-study programs, volunteering, internships, on-campus job fairs, and work placements in highly reputed firms. Hudgens is an accommodation service that has collaborated with some local private landlords to provide students with off-campus accommodation. Huddersfield University has two major residence houses: the Storthes Hall Park Student Village & Ashenhurst Student. The Storthes Hall Park Village has a capacity of 1,300 students.The annual estimated cost of attendance for undergraduate & postgraduate programs is $17,870 and $17,683, excluding other overheads. The university offers many scholarships to International Students like postgraduate scholarships, Southeast Asian Scholarships, Chevening Scholarships, and Commonwealth Scholarships.
Eligibility Overview: Academic RequirementsIn order for your application to be accepted, you must meet both basic admission requirements and any course-specific requirements. Many foreign qualifications are accepted, and information on the various ones necessary can be found on the University's International information section.
Accommodation: On-CampusIn the 2021 National Student Housing Survey, Storthes Hall Park was recently named for Best Value. Storthes Hall offers the ideal blend of home and study thanks to its idyllic countryside location.Since the rooms are larger than usual, you will have more area to make it your own. Each room has an ensuite bathroom, and 5-8 students share a large flat. Huddersfield provides more than just a room at Storthes Hall; It also has an active events calendar centred on your time as a student at DIGS. Visit the nearby Huddersfield woodlands, stop by the on-site social hub, The Venue, for food and drinks, or relax at the on-site gym and wellness classes. Everyone can find something here!
Course Ranking: The University of Huddersfield's PG Business & Economics programme remains at the same spot as in 2021. In 2022, it falls between positions 201 and 250. However, The Guardian and The Complete University Guide gave the university's business programmes high marks in 2022. In 2022 and 2023, the Accounting & Finance course is ranked at #69 and #72, respectively. The Accounting & Finance programme will be ranked #50 by The Guardian in 2022.THE has ranked the PG Engineering & Technology course between positions #401 and 500 for 2022. Since 2020, this course has held the same position in the rankings. The Guardian ranks highly the University of Sheffield's Engineering programme in 2022. In 2022, the Mechanical Engineering course is ranked #17, while the Electronic & Electrical Engineering programme ranks #25. The university's PG Computer Science program's standing in the current THE rankings has dropped. In contrast to the previous two years, 2020 and 2021, when this course was ranked #501-600th, it is now listed at #601-800th in 2022.
University Ranking: The University of Huddersfield is ranked between 601 and 800 in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings for 2022. Since 2018, it has consistently been ranked in the same range, from #601 to 800, according to the Times Higher Education rankings. In terms of global universities, the University of Huddersfield is ranked at 1095 in the world in 2022, according to U.S. News & World Report. Read: Admissions to the University of Huddersfield.The University of Huddersfield is ranked between 701 and 750 by QS from 2019 to 2022. However, Huddersfield University's QS ranking is 651–700 for 2023. This demonstrates that the University of Huddersfield's position in the most recent QS World University Rankings has significantly improved.The University of Huddersfield has a ranking in the 100 best universities in the UK for 2022 by two well-known rating publishers in the UK, The Complete University and Guide. The Complete University Guide's 2022 UK rankings place the University of Huddersfield at number 53. The University of Huddersfield, on the other hand, will rank #54 according to The Guardian in 2022.

Name: Bangor University International College,(OXFORD INTERNATIONAL EDUCATION GROUP)
Overview: Bangor University International College is an on-campus college for international students to introduce their academic careers at Bangor University. The college offers various preparatory programmes such as International Bachelor’s Degree, International Year One, and International Incorporated Masters. After completing these courses, students can directly continue their chosen degree courses without losing a year with Bangor University. One of the integral parts of Bangor University is the Research Institutes and Centres. These establishments promote and facilitate postgraduate teaching and interdisciplinary research work. The university also offers various student amenities, including sports, libraries, accommodation, learning facilities, etc., to ensure a balanced academic life. This educational institution offers various national and international scholarships to assist students needing funding. Some of the Bangor University International College scholarships include Bangor International scholarship, Sports scholarship, Country scholarship, etc. Bangor University presently has a strength of approximately 10,000 students, with its faculties spread across 14 colleges. The international student support department conducts social programmes that involve events, concerts, etc., allowing students to take a break from the rigours of academic life. The university's department of skills and employability services provides comprehensive resources to help students develop interpersonal skills to improve employability. Furthermore, this university offers undergraduate and postgraduate schemes twice a year that benefits students who may be professionally engaged at that moment. This educational institution has received several prestigious awards and recognitions in education and employment, student satisfaction, and academic culture.

Accommodation: According to a poll done by WhatUni in 2019, the organisation is ranked Top 5 in the UK for student accommodation and offers housing options to its applicants both on campus and nearby. All international first-year students are guaranteed a place in university housing. While most candidates are offered a place in one of the university's two student villages, Ffriddoedd or St Mary's, the university also has a postgraduate hall called Neuadd Garth on College Road. The on-campus accommodation options are all en suite and include a subscription to the residence gym and Campus Life.Ffriddoedd Village:- Includes roughly 2,000 rooms, most of which are en-suite.Neuadd Reichel, the standard hall, includes 120 rooms with communal kitchens and bathrooms.The main university building is around a 10-minute walk away.This location, which includes 9 en-suite residence halls with shared kitchens for 8 students, is slightly more expensive than the other group, which has 5 en-suite residence halls with shared kitchens for 8 students. There are shops, laundries, and common rooms in this community, as well as Bar Uno café bars and the Canolfan Brailsford sports facility.St Mary's Village- This hotel contains roughly 600 rooms, including en-suite rooms, budget rooms, 5 studio flats, and townhouses.The Bryn Eithin is the village's only standard hall, with common facilities and kitchenette.Cemlyn, Cybi, Penmon, Ffordd Tudno En-suite Rooms and Studios, and St Mary's Quad are the five resident halls that make up this community, which includes roughly 300 en-suite bedrooms and 30 studios.There is a café, laundromat, common room, fitness facility, and other amenities in this community.

Name: University of Kingston
Overview: The University of Kingston is one of the highly ranked public research universities, set in an urban campus in Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames in South West London in England. The university was initially established in 1899. The University of Kingston, abbreviated as KUL, has around 18,070 students studying, with 16.5% of the student body from 140 countries. Students are admitted to the university in September and January. They offer both undergraduate and postgraduate programs. The programs are divided into 22 undergraduate, 149 postgraduates and 5 foundation programs. The university has 4 campuses in and around Kingston upon Thames, and the academic structure is divided into 4 faculties. For every 17 students, there is a teacher to coordinate and guide them. To recognize the university's exceptional teaching to the students, the university has received The Guardian University Award for teaching excellence. The tuition fee may come around 15,300 GBP - 23,500 GBP. In addition, the first-year international students receive a scholarship amount of 5000 Euro. There are also other scholarships, bursaries and discounts provided to the students. Design, Fashion, Journalism, Pharmacy and sport sciences are some of the highly known fields in this university. Industry Experience is given to the students by the university, proving it to be helpful for their career. The Union of Kingston Students is the representative body of the students, which is a charitable organization. There are 6 halls of residence provided by the universities, with 70% of them having ensuite facilities. All the rooms are offered with needed facilities providing a comfortable living. Free bus service is also available between halls and campuses. The cost of living in the city would amount up to 6,500 - 10,000 GBP.
Course Ranking: Let's discuss about the Kingston University course rankings. The university's subject rankings have been modified for the QS World University Ranking 2023. Kingston currently has positions 263 for undergraduate programmes and 289 for graduate programmes. The Kingston is ranked among the top 100 institutions in the world for arts and design by QS World University Ranking. Over 18,000 students attend this university to pursue undergraduate and graduate degrees.The subject ranking for clinical medicine at Kingston University is 945, according to US News 2022. KUL is now the ideal choice for overseas students who want to study MBBS in the UK. According to the most recent Guardian University Ranking 2022, Kingston University is among the top 50 universities in the UK.

Name: Bath Spa University
Overview: Bath Spa University was established as an institution in 1852 as a public higher education and research university in the United Kingdom. The university provides education through its eight different schools that offer a wide range of full-time and part-time undergraduate and postgraduate programs. The university has three regional campuses: Sion Hill, Corsham Court, and Locksbrook. It has many facilities and services, including financial advice, psychological counseling, and health care services.Some of the popular undergraduate and postgraduate courses offered by the institution are writing, acting, art and design, Business and Management, Biology, Computing, Creative Writing, Psychology, Education, Environment, English Literature, Fashion Design, Film, Food and Nutrition, Geography, History, Marketing, Media, Music, Politics, and Theatre. It also offers graduate research programs such as MPhil and Ph.D. in Art, History, Media, Health, etc. It also has a student services committee to assist students with jobs, internships, cover letters, and resumes.  The university provides on-campus en-suite residences in Newton Park Garden Halls, Green Park House, Waterside, and Charlton Court. The on-campus residences and buildings are divided into traditional dormitory-style private or shared apartments or suites with basic amenities. The yearly hostel and meal expenses are approximately 2,700 GBP.The university's courses may range between 13,500 GBP and 18,000 GBP. The university provides financial aid in various forms, such as scholarships, bursaries, government loans, external support scholarships, and an opportunity to work on campus.

Name: Edinburgh Napier University
Overview: The Edinburgh Napier University is a public institution for higher education established in 1964 in Edinburgh, Scotland. It was founded as Napier Technical College, and the university status was granted in 1992.The University comprises three main campuses: the Sighthill Campus consists of Schools of Applied Sciences and Health & Social Care, including hospital wards, clinical skills suites, etc. The Merchiston Campus contains Arts and Creative Industries, Schools of Computing, Engineering, and a Built Environment. And the Craiglockhart Campus comprises law and business schools. The University offers 153 undergraduate programs, 162 postgraduate programs, ten distance learning programs, Diploma programs, 41 e-learning programs, short courses, and graduate apprenticeships. The University provides these programs in various fields of study such as law, accounting, education, arts, engineering, applied sciences, business, management, tourism, social service, health, and computer science. Also, the University offers programs in creative fields such as music, graphic design, filming, acting, communication, publishing, and product design. The per-year fee of the programs ranges between GBP 11,553 to 17,330. The per-year accommodation and meal expenses amount to GBP 7,606. The University offers scholarships such as South Asia Scholarship and Scotland Saltire Scholarship that provide aid, including scholarships, waivers, bursaries, discounts, and grants.The University also has academic partnerships with various universities in Singapore, China, Sri Lanka, Myanmar, and several other countries. The University takes part in Santander University SME Internship Program to provide internships to its students. The University also partners with several industries to provide jobs and internships to the students.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: To apply for our bachelor's courses, you should have completed the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) with an overall 60% or above in the Intermediate (10+2) (XII Standard) exam. Advanced entry to year twoStudents with grades over 75% and above in year 12 of CBSC, ISC and State Education boards across India may be offered year two entry. Specific subject requirements may apply. Postgraduate: You will be eligible to apply if you have gained one of the following:A bachelor's general/pass (3 years) degree with 60% or aboveA bachelor's special/honours degree (3 years) with 55% or aboveA bachelor's degree (4 years) in a professional subject with 55% or aboveFor MBA (1 year), the requirements are:A bachelor's general / pass (3 years) degree with 60% or aboveA bachelor's special / honours degree (3 years) with 55% or aboveA bachelor's degree (4 years) in a professional subject with 55% or aboveFor MBA (Leadership Practice) (2 years), the requirements are:A bachelor's special/honours degree (3 years) with 60% or aboveA bachelor's degree (4 year) in a professional subject with 55% or above English Requirement: Undergraduate:On a case-by-case basis, if you scored 70% or more in English in the Indian HSC Intermediate (10+2) (XII Standard) exam, you may be eligible for undergraduate studies without taking another English test. State-specific requirements may apply. Postgraduate You must have received a 70% or above in English in the Indian HSC Intermediate (10+2) (XII Standard) test, and you must have finished an undergraduate degree taught and examined in English within the last two years. If you graduated more than two years ago, your application would be considered case-by-case. State-specific requirements may apply.

Course Ranking: Publishers are big fans of both technical and business courses. In its PG Business and Economics ranking for 2020 and 2021, THE has ENU ranked between 300 and 400. Since 2017, it has also been ranked by The Complete University Guide in its lists of the top 100 UK programmes for accounting and finance as well as business and management studies. The subject rankings have significantly improved for ENU. It improved 10 points in the category of Account & Finance from position 45 in 2020 to position 35 in 2021. In the same way, it rose from 58th place in 2020 to 49th place in 2021 in the ranking of Business & Management Studies. The Guardian's rankings for accounting and finance as well as business, management, and marketing also place ENU outside of the top 100. Both rankings show tremendous improvement for ENU. It has moved up from 89th to 77th place in Accounting & Finance. has also improved significantly in Business, Management, & Marketing, moving up from 69th position in 2020 to 35th rank in 2021. The Complete University Guide and The Guardian rankings for ENU's Civil Engineering degree have likewise significantly improved over time.
University Ranking: Edinburgh Napier University (ENU), a public university located in Edinburgh, Scotland, was established in 1964. The ENU is listed below the top 1000 institutions in the world when we look at the university rankings provided by well-known publishers. From 2017 through 2021, THE (Times Higher Education) maintained ENU's position in its global university rating between 601 and 800. In a similar vein, from 2018 to 2021, QS (Top Universities) ranked ENU between 801 and 1000 in the globe. We can infer that ENU's performance has been consistent across all parameters. When compared to other UK universities, ENU has consistently performed below the top 100. Since 2017, with the exception of 2019, The Complete University Guide has included ENU among the top 100 educational institutions in the UK. Additionally, three times in the past five years, The Guardian, a reputable publisher in the UK, has ranked ENU among the top 100 universities in the country. The university moved up significantly, moving from 105th place in 2020 to 62nd place in 2021. Conclusion: ENU has improved in terms of a number of ranking criteria, including entry requirements, the student-staff ratio, value-added services, and career possibilities.

Course Description: Edinburgh Napier University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Edinburgh Napier University was founded in 1964. Located in Edinburgh,UK the university is home to about 5600 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Edinburgh Napier University is ranked 943th in Top Universities by US News. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 2 undergraduate and 6 postgraduate programs. Edinburgh Napier University has 2 intakes in Sep,Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Edinburgh Napier University is around Pound 12.62 K - 13.9 K.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Edinburgh Napier University include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Edinburgh Napier University is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Edinburgh Napier University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of The Arts London
Overview: The University of the Arts London is a collegiate institution of higher education established in the year 1986, in London and is affiliated with the University of U.K. It operates different schools from 6 locations across London, and each campus comprises academic, recreation, and accommodation facilities. The University of the Arts London provides 101 undergraduate programs, 117 postgraduate programs, and 1126 short certificate diploma courses. The university also provides short courses and pre-degree courses in 18 subjects. The courses are offered in various disciplines of design, arts, performing arts, and fashion. Some programs provided by the University are M.A. Arts and Science, M.A. Psychology for Fashion Professionals, B.A. 3D Design, B.A. Acting, etc. The course fee ranges between GBP 15,404 to 22,144 per year. The University also provides various scholarships to its international students. A fee waiver of GBP 5,000 is offered to full-time Masters course students. The University has various amenities such as cafes and canteens, art shops, and professional galleries. Other facilities available in the University are libraries, medical centers, printing facilities, binding services among others. There is a Language Centre at the University that provides classes in English language and foreign language courses to international students. The university offers on-campus housing facilities to its students. There are 13 residence halls in dormitory-style in different parts of London. The accommodation and meal expenses amount to GBP 7,702. The University conducts various events and workshops on the courses prospects and these events and workshops are organized by the Careers and Employability Service. The University also arranges job fairs to provide students with full-time jobs, part-time jobs, and freelance opportunities.

Name: University of Manchester
Overview: The University of Manchester in Manchester, England, was established in 2004 by merging the University of Manchester Institute of Science and Technology and the Victoria University of Manchester. Being the third-largest university in the United Kingdom, Manchester is ranked 27th globally. Manchester's three faculties are further subdivided into schools: The Faculty of Biology, Medicine, and Health deals with health-related programs, The Faculty of Science and Engineering has the School of Engineering and the School of Natural Sciences, and The Faculty of Humanities has four academic schools focusing on Art, Languages, Business, Law and Architecture.With 260 undergraduate, 200 postgraduate, and numerous certificate courses, Manchester has an acceptance rate of 56.1%. Nursing, Development Studies, Pharmacy & Pharmacology, Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry, Material Sciences, and MBA are highly ranked courses. The average undergraduate tuition and fee range from 15,848 GBP to 20,272 GBP and from 20,272 GBP to 26,745 GBP for postgraduates, varying according to the program. The cost of living here is approximately 9,793 GBP. Around 100 merit and need-based scholarships are awarded to students by the university. International students are guaranteed university accommodation and have UK scholarships like GREAT Scholarships covering their tuition fees and living expenses. The University of Manchester boasts a 94% employability rate with an average salary of 95,632 GBP in LLM, 83,406 GBP in Executive Masters, and 74,783 GBP in MBA.

Name: Kaplan International College London - Cranfield University
Overview: Kaplan International College London - Cranfield University, founded in 2006, is a renowned institution and the only wholly postgraduate university in Technology and Management in the UK. Students get a wide range of programmes to study here and can specialize in Engineering, Science, Technology, etc. It is located in Wharley End, about 10 minutes away from the M1 motorway. Furthermore, Kaplan International College London - Cranfield University also provides teaching and research, industrial-scale facilities, knowledge in aerospace, environment and water, etc. It welcomes international students from above 100 countries, and the current number stands at more than 2,000, as per data. Also, the connection with well-recognised companies like Rolls-Royce, Unilever, Airbus, GlaxoSmithKline, etc., provides numerous employment opportunities to the fresh graduates.

Overview: Bournemouth University was founded in 1992 as one of the top public universities in Bournemouth, England. The institution is accredited by and has affiliations with the Association of Commonwealth Universities and the esteemed Florence Network.The institution offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral degrees. Some of the top courses at Bournemouth University are BA in Marketing Communications, BSc in Economics, MPhil, and PhD. Accounting, Finance & Economics. Work placements, including full-time internships and work shadowing, are critical to Bournemouth University's curriculum. Through its annual Career Fair, BU offers career advice to its students. The average tuition fee at Bournemouth University is 13,500 GBP. International students can apply through financial aid and merit-based grants. The institution also provides student counselling, chaplaincy service, and medical assistance.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: The students' eligibility at Bournemouth University is determined by their chosen courses. The requirements for entrance differ from country to country. The following are the entry requirements for various courses for Indian students: Undergraduate: Only students who have completed the 12th standard, commonly known as the intermediate level, with a grade of at least 65 per cent are eligible to apply for undergraduate courses. The percentage necessary may increase depending on the course's value around the world. Postgraduate: Students must hold a graduate degree from an accredited institution. They must also have an Indian Bachelor's (Honours) degree if they study in India. They must also have received the required percentage for admission to BU. Research Programme: To enrol in a research programme at Bournemouth University, you must have a postgraduate degree.  English Requirements:

Course Description: Bournemouth University  is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Bournemouth University  was founded in 1992. Located in Bournemouth,UK the university is home to about 2600 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Bournemouth University  is ranked 789th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 4 undergraduate and 4 postgraduate programs. Bournemouth University  has 4 intakes in Sep,Jan,Feb,May. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Bournemouth University  is around £6,500-£12,000.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Bournemouth University  include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Bournemouth University  is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Bournemouth University  has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of East Anglia
Overview: The University of East Anglia institution is a public research university located on 320 acres in Norwich, Norfolk, United Kingdom. It was founded in 1963. The university has 26 schools of study and four faculties- The Faculty of Arts and Humanities, Science, Medicine and Health Sciences, and Social Sciences. Healthcare centre, a 24-hour library, concert venue, Lower Common Room, University Sport spark, Sainsbury Center, an artificial lake called Broad, Ziggurats, INTO Centre, The Square, etc. are essential sites on the campus. More than 16,800 students (2,800 international) are enrolled in 280+ undergraduate, 380+ postgraduate, and 165+ Ph.D. courses in the university. The application fee of 20 GBP (single course) and 25 GBP (multiple courses) is valid for students having a minimum score of 6 in IELTS, 50 in PTE, and 79 in TOEFL. The on-campus accommodation service is 100% provided to international students in several residential complexes. Various room options like En Suite, Standard Single, Standard Twin, Two Bedroom Unit, and others are available at an average weekly cost of 115 GBP. Along with high job placement rates, students get paid internships through My Career Central and Grad Central online.The tuition fee for postgraduate and undergraduate courses is 17,600 GBP- 35,000 GBP and 17,000 GBP- 21,700 GBP respectively followed by 2000 GBP to secure admission. The University of East Anglia gives local and international students financial assistance under scholarship programs such as Charlie Dimont Scholarship, UEA International Postgraduate Excellence Awards, International Excellence Scholarship, etc.
Eligibility Overview: International students must meet different qualifying standards depending on their nation. Depending on the courses that the applicants desire to enrol in, these criteria may change. The following is a list of the eligibility requirements for Indian students: Undergraduate Students must receive a grade of 70% or above on the Higher Secondary School Certificate-Standard 12 to be taken into account for first-year admission to a three-year Bachelor's degreeDirect admission to Bachelor's degree programmes will be considered for International Baccalaureate holders with 32 to 35 points Postgraduate Postgraduate education will be considered for those with an Indian bachelor's degree and at least a 52% averagePostgraduate research MPhil/PhD studies will be considered for holders of Indian Master's degrees. In rare circumstances, some applicants for science jobs may be accepted at the Bachelor's level English Proficiency Test Score:

Name: University of Hull
Overview: The University of Hull is a public research institution in East Yorkshire, England. Founded in 1927 in Kingston upon Hull as University College Hull, it has grown to become a highly ranked research university in the United Kingdom. The university has four different faculties: Faculty of Science and Engineering, Faculty of Arts, Culture and Education, Faculty of Business, Law, and Politics, and Faculty of Health Sciences. The best programs at the University of Hull include BA (Hons) in Business Management and Accounting, M. Eng in Mechanical Engineering, and M. Eng in Chemical Engineering. The university has a main campus located in suburban North Hull. It consists of several academic buildings and residence halls, allowing students to stay on campus and access excellent facilities to further their education. Notable alums who have attended the University of Hull include former Deputy Prime Minister John Prescott and Member of Parliament Tom Watson. Renowned poet Philip Larkin worked at the university's Brynmor Jones Library as the Head Librarian.Over 100 student clubs and organizations on campus enable students to develop holistically during their education. The university also has over 50 sports clubs allowing students to participate in and maintain physical fitness. Other student-friendly features on campus include bars, career service centers, and restaurants.The average annual tuition costs for completing a course here can go up to GBP 18,000, depending on the program one has chosen.

Name: CU London - Dagenham
Overview: Owned and supervised by Coventry University, CU London is a higher education institute that has been offering students necessary courses since 2017. Coventry University is considered one of the more modern universities in Midland, with approximately 15,000 international and EU students. CU London is an essential part of Coventry University Group and offers a flexible education style that fits students’ requirements.The post-graduation programs at this university include engineering, environment, health and life sciences, computing, arts and humanities, business and law etc. Besides providing academic facilities, this university also provides students with transferable skills which will make them flexible in their careers. Accredited and approved by Coventry University, students of CU London will receive recognition and degrees from this university. The Dagenham campus of this university is located in East London and offers everything students require to fulfil their academic goals. CU London makes higher education accessible and affordable for international students by providing affordable courses with multiple admissions throughout the year. Classrooms and IT suits are fully equipped for interactive learning sessions and advanced open breakout spaces on this campus. Moreover, the Customer Service Desk department is always available to provide necessary assistance to the students at any time. In this institution, students are taught by experienced professors and make prepared with the necessary skills for the job market. The employment rate of this university is nearly 97%, and students are employed within six months after graduation.

Name: University of Sunderland ONCAMPUS Centre
Overview: One can trace the formation of the University of Sunderland back to the formation of the Sunderland Technical College in 1901. It got its university status following the Further and Higher Education Act, 1992. Officially recognized by the Privy Council, the university has affiliations including the Association of Commonwealth Universities, EQUIS, Universities UK and Coalition of Modern Universities. With the help of its four campuses, the University of Sunderland offers educational services to more than 16,979 students. It is known for its diverse range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs. The ONCAMPUS Centre of the university has been a new and unique addition. The students who do not have the necessary eligibility to apply for the university can undertake a preparation course in the ONCAMPUS Centre. The purpose is to offer preparation courses right on the university's campus, so the students feel like they are attending the university classes. After completing this course, the students will be eligible for the Year 1 of a relevant undergraduate degree program. Some of the standard courses in the center include Business, Economics and Finance management, Engineering, Humanities and Law, Social science and Life science. Moreover, the University of Sunderland ranking shows its 1st position in the “University of the Year for Social Inclusion”, according to The Times & Sunday Times Good University Guide 2021. Currently, the tuition fees structure set for the international students might be unaffordable, ranging between $20,000 and $25,000. However, the university offers scholarship programs for deserving students every year. The university appoints a Placement Team for the students, and they can discuss their placement opportunities with them. In addition, the official website offers the contact details for placement in different faculties, and students can opt for these opportunities once they are in their second year of academics.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?The institution has programme and course requirements, thus each course or major will have its own set of academic requirements at all levels. However, international students are expected to have the following minimum qualifications:Undergraduate candidates must have a high school diploma or certificate with a grade 12 average of 75-90 percent or better.A first-class undergraduate degree from a recognised institution or its local equivalent is required for postgraduate candidates.Candidates for the MBA programme must have a three-year bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline with a minimum of 50-55 percent.Language Proficiency in EnglishIf an international candidate is applying to the institution from a country where English is not the first language, they must pass any of the relevant examinations in order to be considered for admission.IELTS overall score of 6.0 / each section score of 5.5 or aboveAbove 180 Cambridge CPEAbove 170 on the Cambridge CAEWhat documents are required for the application process?International students should have the following documents on hand in addition to their academic transcripts and certificates:Report on English ProficiencyEssay for UCASStatement of purposeRecommendation Letters (LORs)CV of a studentOther course-specific documents, such as a portfolio or a research statementa copy of your passportFinancial records
Placement: Placements at the University of SunderlandWithin six months of graduation, the University of Sunderland boasts a 93.4 percent undergraduate placement rate and a 95.3 percent graduate placement rate.Recent university business graduates work for firms like Facebook, Microsoft, IBM, Accenture, Marriott Hotels, Viacom 18, Nissan, Adidas, and others.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.The University includes four residence halls, all of which are within 1.5 miles of the city center.Students can choose their housing based on the course they are taking.International students will feel at ease in the residence halls, which are provided with all necessary amenities.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.sunderland.ac.uk/about/accommodation/
