Name: University of Law - London Bloomsbury
Overview: The University of Law is a private university in the UK offering unique law degrees and other legal training in law, business criminology, and policing. It is the first for-profit educational institution and the largest law school in the UK. The university has nine branches all over the UK and an international branch in Hong Kong and was granted university status in 2012.  The University of Law: London Bloomsbury is located in the heart of London and is the largest campus out of all other campuses. It offers courses across multiple disciplines such as Law, Professional Skills, and legal practice. In addition, the Bloomsbury campus encompasses the university's Legal Advice Centre; by using the law clinic department, they advise the clients on family law matters and employment.  The campus also hosts programs like the Master of Laws program, assisting students in developing skills in legal subject areas. The program enhances the student's career in the field of law. Other programs include the Street Law Program, and forums like Technology and Innovation Forum, Medical Law & Ethics Forum, etc. are available to the students.  The University of Law was awarded a Silver Rating in the Teaching Excellence Framework in 2019 and received five stars in QS Stars, providing unique program strength, facilities, graduate employability, social responsibility, and other parameters. In addition, London Bloomsbury campus students receive sessions from highly-skilled industry professionals helping them achieve the zenith of their careers.  Apart from offering copious course materials, multiple electives, and online resources, the University of Law - London Bloomsbury provides various student services like Employability programs and scholarship programs (like Daniel Turnbull Memorial Scholarship). Pro bono placements where the students get to work in not-for-profit organizations to get an idea of the profession. The university has multiple accommodation options for international students.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility requirements an applicant must attain in order to be considered for admission are as follows : For Undergraduate Students :  Only the Birmingham, Bristol, Guildford, Leeds, London Bloomsbury, Manchester, and Nottingham campuses are open to 17-year-olds.There are several courses which the university offers with different eligibility requirements. For Postgraduate Students :  Each of the postgraduate programmes has its own set of admissions requirements. English Language Proficiency :  Most programmes IELTS score required is 6.5 overall with no bands below 6.0Certain programmes demand a score of 7.0 overall with no bands below 6.5
Placement: The courses, in conjunction with the experienced Employability Service, seek to help the students become employable, ensuring that the goal of employment is ingrained in the teaching. The University is a five-star university in terms of teaching, employability, online learning, academic development, and inclusiveness, according to QS. Experts are accessible to help you at any time with career planning, applications, CVs, cover letters, and anything else they might require help with.The Employability Service staff will assist the students in search for internships, part-time jobs, volunteer opportunities, and graduate positions. They can count on the expert Employability Services team to assist them with everything from work experience opportunities to skill development guidance. The students can schedule appointments with the career counsellors on campus or over the phone for support and advice. Law :  The University provides a number of services to assist students, the students get their career off to the best start, whether it's career information from the Student and Professional Employability Programmes, a one-on-one interview with a career adviser, practical legal experience through the pro bono activities, coaching, or simply scanning the vacancy database for a job. Business :  The personnel of the University of Law Business School does more than only assist students in finding a career as a business graduate. They train pupils for a career in business. And you should continue to encourage the pupils throughout their careers. Regardless of their background or education, whether they study full-time or part-time, on-campus or online, whether they're looking for their first business graduate job, a career change, or to advance in their current position, the University has the skills, services, and passion to help them achieve their goals.

Name: Middlesex University
Overview: The history of Middlesex University dates back to 1878, when St. Katherine's College was founded in Tottenham. Later, in 1973, Middlesex Polytechnic was formed in addition to seven other colleges. Finally, in 1992, it got its university status, including Middlesex University as it is known today, with campuses in Dubai, Malta, and Mauritius.Middlesex University provides Bachelor's degrees in Business and Management, Natural Sciences, Social Sciences and Management, Life Sciences and Medicine, Arts and Humanity, and Engineering and Technology. The University provides Bachelor's, Masters and Doctoral degree programs. It offers courses across six schools: Science and Technology, Media and Performing Arts, Health and Education, Law, Art and Design, and Business. There are 8,159 international students with a Student/Faculty ratio of 17.Graduate courses of Middlesex University are offered in Natural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Sciences and Management, Life Sciences and Medicine, Engineering and Technology, and Business and Management. The University has over 25,000 students from 140 countries. Middlesex University's ranking stands at 701-750 per QS World University Ranking 2022. It earned Silver Award for outstanding teaching and is also the Top 3 modern university in the UK according to Times Higher Education Young University Rankings 2021. Some of its courses are also well ranked across the globe.Besides on-campus courses, Middlesex University offers 11 distance learning courses and three blended learning courses. So, students can choose their desired method from its range of disciplines to join the University of its vibrant, diverse, and inclusive culture.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Entry Requirements Students from the United States who wish to pursue an undergraduate degree must have completed one of the following courses:High school graduation with a minimum GPA of 3.2 and SAT scores of 550 on each section, or an ACT composite score of 23.High school diploma with a minimum GPA of 3.2 and 3+ on at least two advanced placement exams is required.A diploma from the International Baccalaureate and SAT scores of 550 on each subject or an ACT total score of 23A year of college or university studies with a minimum GPA of 2.8

According to Emolument, Middlesex graduates working in Compliance, AML, KYC, and Monitoring earn an average of 80,000 GBP per year.

Name: Birmingham City University
Overview: Birmingham City University, formerly known as The City of Birmingham Polytechnic, was founded in 1971 by merging five colleges. The institution received its university status in 1992 through the Further and Higher Education Act. With a student base of more than 24,000 students from over 80 countries, Birmingham City University is one of the most diverse places to study. Consisting of four faculties, the institution offers bachelor's, master's, doctoral, and professional degrees to its students. The institution also offers several distance learning courses. Some of the top courses at Birmingham City University are BA Acting, BSc Architectural Technology, and Ph.D. Business Research, Ph.D. Law. The university offers work shadowing to its students to help them advance their careers. The maximum tuition fee at Birmingham City University is 9,000 GBP. International students can apply through financial aid and merit-based scholarships and bursaries.Birmingham City University has two flagship campuses: the City Centre Campus (Eastside Campus) and the City South Campus. The City Centre Campus is home to important administrative buildings, Millennium Point, University House, Parkside Building, Curzon Building, and the Joseph Priestley Building. The City South Campus houses the Seacole Building, the Bevan House, Ravensbury House, and the Faculty of Health, Education, and Life Sciences.
Eligibility Overview: For Undergraduates:The Indian Certificate of Secondary Education (Standard XII) is required for the majority of our programmes, with a minimum average of 55% depending on the test board. However, some courses may demand a higher grade. For Postgraduate: Holders of a three- or four-year Bachelor's degree with a 55% overall (50% from top colleges) will be considered for direct admission to Postgraduate Diploma, MBA, or Master's Degree programmes, while certain programmes will demand a higher grade.
Placement: The job experience you will gain while on placement can be quite beneficial when looking for full-time work. In fact, many of the students wind up working as permanent workers for the company where they completed their placements following graduation. You may be expected to complete a placement as part of your course, or you may choose to do so on your own time while at university. These experiences are often shorter and will complement your programme, allowing you to balance learning and gaining the necessary experience.  Your instructors and the Careers Team will provide you with complete assistance for any placement through lectures, seminars, workshops, and one-on-one guidance. You will receive the following assistance: How to obtain a job and where to look for oneWhich alternatives for placement are best for youPreparing for interviews, CVs, and applications
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The institution includes a number of halls of residence that provide on-campus and inner-city housing options, with amenities such as three-quarter beds, en-suites, and even gyms. Residence halls can be found all across the city. They are close to a variety of facilities and amenities. Take your time to pick the perfect one for you. The halls provided are: Jennes CourtThe heightsLakesideBentley HouseBeech gardens For more information, visit:  https://www.bcu.ac.uk/student-info/accommodation

Name: Le Cordon Bleu - London
Overview: Le Cordon Bleu is the largest internationally renowned network of culinary and hospitality institutions with over 20,000 students of more than 100 nationalities in its 35 institutes worldwide. Opened in 1933, Le Cordon Bleu London is situated at the heart of the city's West End, next to the British Museum. As a pioneer institution of the French culinary technique, Le Cordon Bleu London offers a wide variety of programs such as Le Grand DiplíÇme, Cuisine and Ptisserie Certificates and Diplomas, Fast Track Diplomas, Culinary Business Management Diploma, Short-term courses in pastry and wine, and Cake Decorating and Bakery Programmes in cuisine, pastry and confectionery, hospitality management, and gastronomy and nutrition. The school also provides accredited as well as non-accredited online learning opportunities. The 9-12 months Grand Diploma fee with culinary management is about GBP 37,000-45,000, and the Gourmet and Short Cookery courses can range from GBP 75-850. Students can avail scholarships from The James Beard Foundation Scholarship Programme, providing financial assistance to individuals pursuing their career in the culinary arts. The students at Le Cordon Bleu London are responsible for finding their own housing and accommodation. However, the UrbanNest student accommodation in partnership with the university can provide housing assistance. The school has two kitchens with large overhead mirrors and monitors used for demonstration, three cuisine kitchens and three ptisserie kitchens for practical classes. The school provides premium quality ingredients for each dish, and to maintain the quality of training, and one teaching chef is assigned only 16 students in the practical classes. Le Cordon Bleu London helps the students translate their skills into employment from international five-star hotel groups and Michelin-starred restaurants, such as The Ritz London, Hilton, Marriott, and Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts.
Eligibility Overview: General Admission RequirementsAt the start of the programme, you must be at least 18 years old. To possess a general or technological baccalaureate or its equivalent (France), a High School Diploma (USA), a High School Certificate (Japan), or a GCSE (Greater Britain) (United Kingdom).
Placement: A Global CareerThe University helps you lay the groundwork for a global career with their comprehensive culinary arts, wine, and management courses.With the skills, talents, and motivation you'll gain at Le Cordon Bleu, you'll be able to meet the difficulties of your future profession and choose from a wide range of different and interesting job opportunities around the world.
Accommodation: Off-Campus HousingIn general, London can be divided into two parts: north and south, or east and west. Renters believe North and West London to be more desirable, making competition fierce and housing more expensive. Some of London's best up-and-coming neighbourhoods can be found in East or South London, which are currently undergoing waves of gentrification.When it comes to living in London, picking where to live is always a difficult decision, but in most situations, budget will be the decisive factor. The farther you live from Zone 1, the lower your rent will be.Check full details here: https://www.cordonbleu.edu/london/accommodation/en#accommodation

Course Description: Aston Business School is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Aston Business School was founded in 1947. Located in Birmingham,UK the university is home to about 1719 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Aston Business School is ranked 631th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 6 undergraduate and 2 postgraduate programs. Aston Business School has 6 intakes in Aug, Jan,Jun,Sep,May,Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Aston Business School is around £21967 GPB Approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Aston Business School include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Aston Business School is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Aston Business School has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: The University of Bradford
Overview: The University of Bradford is located in Bradford, West Yorkshire, England. It was established in 1966. From over 110 countries, students choose Bradford for their education. The university's acceptance rate is 52%, affiliated with EQUIS, AMBA, and AACSB. The university offers CPD, foundation, undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, and online programmes. The academic structure comprises five faculties. The institution is known for its famous courses like Politics, Physiotherapy, and Pharmacy. In addition, it is proud to be the first British university to have a Department of Peace Studies. It is a public research university with 9,770 students, and over 22% of the student population are international students. An average tuition fee depending on each course would sum around 15,000 - 22,000 GBP. In addition, international students receive many scholarships as financial help like Vice-Chancellor Award for Indian Students, Chevening Scholarship, Full bright Scholarship, Queen Elizabeth Commonwealth Scholarship and many more. The university has a high-tech Forensic Examination Suite, Child Simulation Suite, The Amp and other facilities to experience practical learning. With JB Priestley Library, which has a wide range of resources in books, journals, and e-books, open 24 hours, students can explore and learn. The university houses 25 sports clubs and over 81 student societies. There is also the University of Bradford's Sports Centre. The students are provided with residence facilities inside the campus. They can choose to live in Townhouses and Apartments. The average cost of living in this city will approximate around 2,200 GBP. The University of Bradford has about 94% placement rate and is placed in various reputed companies like BBC, Cummins, Ford Motor Company etc.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: Indian School Certificate / Higher Secondary Certificate / Standard 12 UCAS Tariff points: 136+ = 80% 120-135 = 75% 96-119 = 70% Postgraduate: Bachelor degree UK 1st Class = 70% UK 2:1 = 65% UK 2:2 = 60% English Requirements:

Name: Heriot Watt University
Overview: Heriot-Watt University is the United Kingdom's eighth-oldest higher education institution, with five global campuses, 150 international partners, and over 30,000 students studying in 150 countries. The university has three campuses in Scotland and one each in Malaysia and Dubai. Each of Heriot-Watt's campuses provides a unique study environment near the lively and bustling cities of Edinburgh, Dubai, and Kuala Lumpur. Heriot-Watt University was recognized by the Scottish Council of Development and Industry for its international focus and accomplishments in physical sciences, mathematics, business and management, engineering, and the built environment. Heriot-Watt University allows you to become a global student through its campuses and academic disciplines. The Heriot-Watt University is world-leading for its teaching and research excellence due to its new ground-breaking facility. UG and PG students have access to exceptional resources, like the new Bloomberg network and other helpful industry partners, while staff pass on their knowledge and advice.Besides, Heriot-Watt University produces job-ready graduates who have successful professional careers after completing graduate-level and PG courses.
Eligibility Overview: Students from other countries make up a sizable portion of the student body at HWU. Even if the acceptance rate appears to be quite high, it is not impossible to get into HWU. The college only qualifies students with high motivation and those that are eager to achieve something in the world. The key to getting into HWU  is adhering to the deadlines and ensuring you fulfil all the prerequisites. Eligibility criteria differs from course to course. However, most majors require an overall grade 12 score of 70%, with at least 70% in the applicable disciplines. An example table with requirements for a few courses is shown below.  ENGLISH LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY  Students from non-English speaking countries must demonstrate their ability through English proficiency tests. Below is a list of test requirements accepted at Heriot-Watt. Those who do not meet the English Language criteria can enrol in a pre-sessional academic English course to help them meet the requirements for full-time study at the university.

Placement: Heriot-Watt University has strong ties to business and industry to help students make a real impact. Companies frequently approach them directly, seeking students for work placements or employment. They provide a wide range of specialized programs, and all their degrees are designed to be as individually tailored to your interests and career goals as you can manage. Graduates at Heriot-Watt University can expect to earn some of the highest starting wages in the UK. The university was ranked #35 in the UK (out of 131 universities) for campus placements in 2020. Cisco, Deloitte, KPMG, and IBM were among the top recruiters, with salaries ranging from 30,000 to 70,000 GBP for Heriot-Watt business graduates. In 2019, Heriot-Watt University hosted over 70 employer events on campus, including networking mixers and job fairs. More than 9000 internships and graduate employment vacancies are promoted through career services, and nearly 95% of HW graduates get employed in prestigious companies after six months. Heriot watt, listed among the top 350 universities worldwide, is establishing global learning standards. According to Emolument, with an average income of $180,000, the Executive MBA is the best-paying degree at Heriot-Watt University. Below is a list of other typical salaries that HWU graduates earn.
Accommodation: There are 200 self-catered rooms and flats on the Scottish Borders Campus, and the University also leases residences off-campus and in the town centre. Although the Orkney Campus does not provide housing, the institution's accommodation service helps you discover flats and houses in Stromness.The university campuses are located in some of the fascinating locales around the globe, including the United Kingdom, Dubai, and Malaysia. Each provides excellent facilities, a secure environment, a global community and an international welcome. The institution maintains a residence life centre to assist new students in adjusting to campus life. The team puts on a lot of social activities to help you meet people, develop meaningful relationships, and fully appreciate college life. The residences include classic en suite rooms, non-en suite rooms, and modern studio apartments and flats. You will find more information on the same here.

University Ranking: The Complete University Guide - University Ranking and The Guardian - University Rankings have ranked Heriot Watt University as one of the world's best universities. The Complete University Guide ranks the institution as number 34, while The Guardian ranks it as number 45. Entry Standards, Student Satisfaction, Research Quality, Research Intensity, and Graduate Prospects are among the ranking criteria utilised by The Complete University Guide. Entry Standards, Student-Faculty Ratio, Value-Added Services, and Career Prospects are the primary ranking factors considered by The Guardian. Heriot Watt University is ranked among the top universities in the world by QS World University Ranking, THE (Times Higher Education) - University Ranking, and US News & World Report - Global Universities, according to the Heriot Watt University world ranking. The QS ranking for Heriot Watt University in 2023 is 281. For 2023, THE (Times Higher Education) - University Ranking has ranked the institution between 501 and 600 QS places a heavy emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%), followed by Faculty/Student Ratio (20%) and Citations per Faculty (20%), whereas Times Higher Education (THE) places equal emphasis on Teaching, Research, and Citations (30%). As part of their ranking methodology, US News & World Report considers Global Research Reputation, Regional Research Reputation, and Number of Publications Cited (12.5% each) among other ranking parameters and has ranked Heriot Watt University 725 for 2023.

Name: University of Westminster
Overview: The University of Westminster was founded as the Royal Polytechnic Institution in 1838. It was the first Polytechnic to start operating from London. The transition of the Royal Polytechnic Institution to the University of Westminster happened in 1992. Westminster University offers a wide range of courses designed to meet the current needs of the industry. Most of the programs are covered by faculty who are already leading practitioners in their fields.The general acceptance rate is 72.5% which is termed as lightly selective. The Grade Point Average is 3.55, which is a B+ performance.Westminster University has an international eminence and stands among the highly ranked universities in the world. More than 700 students from over 50 countries have been offered scholarships.The three campuses of Westminster University offer an array of facilities and services like a 24-hour library, state-of-the-art science laboratories, advanced IT services, film and TV studios, audio recording studios, and recreational facilities.
Eligibility Overview: The college had different eligibility requirements for undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Undergraduate Requirement You usually need to possess one of the following to be admitted to Year 1 of a Bachelor's degree (Level 4).HSC XII: Boards from the CBSE, ICSE, Kolkata, or Tamil Nadu with a global average of at least 70%HSC XII: West Bengal board with a cumulative average of at least 58%HSC XII: Gujarat or Maharashtra boards with a cumulative average of at least 75%HSC XII: All other state examinations with a cumulative average of 80% or higherA recognized international foundation program offered by a UK school or an Indian school using an approved UK curriculum. Although there are different entry requirements, we typically request between 60% and 65% Postgraduate Requirement Typically, you'll require one of the following:3-year Bachelor's degree with honors from an accredited institution that must have a minimum grade point average (CGPA) of 6.0 out of 10.0 or an overall average of at least 55%A three-year Bachelor's degree in science from an approved institution, with a minimum overall grade point average (CGPA) of 6.5 out of 10, depending on the institution, of 58%A 4-year Bachelor's degree in engineering or technology from an accredited institution with a minimum overall average of 55% or a CGPA of 6.0 out of 10.0, depending on the institution English Language Proficiency  The following are the minimum requirements accepted at the University of Westminster.

Name: Royal College of Arts London
Overview: The Royal College of Arts is a research-oriented public university in London, United Kingdom. It was founded in 1837 as the Government School of Design but gained the Royal status of a university in 1967. The Royal College of Arts offers a broad range of postgraduate courses in different study areas to students from more than 60 countries. Some top-rated courses are Service Design, Animation, Architecture, Communication, Arts & Humanities and Healthcare & Design. The Royal College of Arts Campuses is divided into three campuses at different locations: Battersea, Kensington and White City. The student-teacher ratio at Royal College of Arts is 10:1. RCA offers various career and placement opportunities to its students to sharpen their skills and personality through on-site learning, on-campus part-time jobs, internships, exhibit work, paid internships, and job opportunities. Royal College of Arts does not provide students with any on-campus accommodation facilities. Still, all the students have access to the University of London Housing Service, which helps students search for suitable accommodation as per their needs & budget. The estimated yearly cost of tuition at the Royal College of Arts for an international student is 29,000 GBP, excluding additional overheads. The fee structure is different for every program, while most programs have a similar cost of attendance in the University. The College offers scholarships to deserving students to provide them with financial support. These scholarships are majorly offered to international students like scholarships, bursaries, foundation funds and external funding.
Eligibility Overview: All applicants must have an excellent undergraduate degree in a related field, as well as IELTs of 5.5 overall and 5.5 in all elements (or equivalent from another approved testing provider).Students of all ages are encouraged to apply, and we value both past academic and professional experience.Applicants for any of the specialisations should be able to demonstrate the necessary technical skills for this level of study.
Accommodation: Studying at the RCA allows you to live in the heart of a city that is known worldwide for its creativity, culture, inspiration, and innovation. Our Student Support staff can assist you in finding homes in or near London, as well as providing answers to general questions about private housing and organisations.The majority of students prefer to reside outside of downtown London since it is less expensive (Zone 1 on the tube map). Hammersmith, Shepherd's Bush, Clapham, and Battersea are regarded more inexpensive neighbourhoods if you want to live close to the RCA campuses.for more information click on this link-https://www.rca.ac.uk/study/the-rca-experience/accommodation-in-london/

Name: University of Law - Birmingham
Overview: University of Law Birmingham campus is located in the city's heart, making it easier for students to find work and accommodations. Mainly because of the availability of plenty of law firms in the city, the place is considered a great source of exposure for the students coming to study here. Over the years, this particular campus has gained enormous popularity. The University of Law Birmingham faculty members are experienced and always keen to help students. This is how the university has bagged 2nd position in the UK regarding overall student satisfaction in the National Student Survey. A minimum score of 6.5 in IELTS is mandatory to be considered for admission.Apart from its excellent faculty, the institution’s USP is its high acceptance rate and high-value scholarship offerings. From library to accommodation, medical service, and access to student clubs, the institution provides several facilities to its students. One can also opt for online programs through its online school called ULaw Online. University of Law Birmingham alumni network is widespread, comprising more than 71000 students from over 103 countries. Some popular names include Sayeeda Warsi (Member of House of Lords of the United Kingdom), David Gauke (Former Lord Chancellor), etc.

Name: University of South Wales
Overview: Cardiff, Wales's capital city, is home to the University of South Wales, one of the UK's top research institutions. USW offers over 500 undergraduate and postgraduate courses with faculties of Business and Society, Computing, Engineering and Science, Creative Industries, and Life Sciences and Education. It is known for its pioneering business clinic, which has collaborated with companies like BBC, IBM, and Rolls-Royce to help students develop strategic partnerships and business networks for career development. USW is also known for its research in specialist areas such as sustainable energy, educational development, mobile communications, humanities, and innovation for technology and start-up companies. It was claimed to have world-leading research output by the Research Excellence Framework. The yearly tuition fee is about GBP 1400 for an undergraduate degree and GBP 1500-1600 for postgraduate and research programs. For financial aid, students can avail of scholarships such as the Chancellor's International Development Scholarship, Chevening Scholarship, and Commonwealth Scholarships for up to GBP 2500.About 95% of USW graduates find employment or opportunities for further studies within six months of graduating.

Name: University of Wales
Overview: The University of Wales, situated in Cardiff, Wales, was founded in the year 1893, by the Royal Charter. It was established as a federal university comprising three colleges- Bangor, Aberystwyth, and Cardiff. Cardiff University is the first university which was established in Wales. It provides various study programmes for master's and bachelor's degrees. Some streams are business and management, health studies, music, sports, art and design, education, communication studies, computing and information technology. It also offers courses in psychology, linguistics, architecture, medicine, humanities, hospitality and tourism, engineering, etc.Along with that, the university offers around 38 scholarships for students. Also, the students can attend validation programmes that are curated by the collaborative centre. Then, the University approves the similar programmes which are offered for higher education in the United Kingdom. Students can also apply for online education from the university. After completing the course, students receive certification from the University of Wales. The average cost of living in Cardiff, Wales, covers all the important expenses such as accommodation fees, food, etc. is around $11 261. The university also provides on-campus accommodation for its students, costing around $9,384 per annum. The university cooperates with its students to complete all the necessary data for visas. It also offers online study programmes for its students.
Eligibility Overview: We welcome international student applications and evaluate them according to the same academic standards as all other candidates. All overseas students whose first language is not English must get a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 in both written and spoken English (or equivalent).

Name: INTO London
Overview: Regulated by the Office for Students (OfS), INTO London World Education Centre is located in the heart of London, also known as the World’s number 1 city for students as per the QS Best Student Cities 2019. Right from classrooms to the learning resource center, the INTO London Study Centre provides students with a wide range of outstanding facilities. As per INTO’s Student Experience Survey 2019, about 98% of students were satisfied with the institute’s laboratory qualities. INTO London courses are aimed at helping international students progress to undergraduate and postgraduate degrees in the United Kingdom. It also provides many English language courses for professional, academic, and everyday usage. The International Foundation programme prepares a student to get direct entry into the first year of an undergraduate degree. During this programme, students develop relevant subject-specific skills and knowledge and also improve their English language abilities. Students can pursue this course in Art and Design, Social Sciences and Media, Science and Engineering, and Business, Management and Law. The International Year One programme is equivalent to an undergraduate degree’s first year of study. During this programme, students enhance their academic research skills, besides building their English language capabilities. On finishing this programme, students will be ready to progress to their higher education degree in advanced years. This means that they can complete their degree in the same time period as direct entry students. The Pre-Master's programme of INTO London provides academic preparation for postgraduate level study in the UK besides focusing on enhancing English language skills and is a guaranteed route to progress into a post-graduate course in the UK. Irrespective of a student’s financial condition or background, students can be eligible to receive funding towards their tuition fees through an array of scholarships on offer. The various scholarships available include Student Engagement Ambassador Scholarship, Academic Merit Scholarship, Regional Scholarship, and Art and Design Portfolio Scholarship.
Eligibility Overview: At least two subjects must be taken at A Level, if you're an A Level student.Applicants with four or five AS Levels in Year 12 do not have a significant advantage. Most courses will want any students who've taken GCSE to have at least two GCSEs, typically maths and English.

Name: Bangor University
Overview: Bangor University is a public institution established in 1884 in Bangor, Gwynedd, UK. Currently, the university has over 50 specialist research centers in arts, humanities, and sciences, and the following three colleges house 14 academic schools, namely the College of Arts, Humanities, and Business, the College of Environmental Sciences and Engineering, and the College of Human Sciences.The university offers over 250 undergraduate and over 150 postgraduate courses in over 40 subjects. Also, as per the Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021, 85% of its research is world-leading or excellent internationally. The university provides students with internships and volunteering services to gain experience in their relative fields. Also, students can enroll themselves in free writing and skills workshops to achieve their dream job.Bangor university is among the top 25 UK universities for job prospects by 2020. Over 93% of Bangor graduates get jobs within a year of course completion at handsome salary packages in reputed companies worldwide.Additionally, the college offers Pre-sessional English Programs for students who do not meet the language requirements. They can take the classes before joining their desired course.

Name: University of Buckingham - Crewe Campus
Overview: Probably the smallest one with approximately 2700 students, the University of Buckingham is the only independent university in the United Kingdom with a Royal Charter. In partnership with Apollo Hospitals Group, this university acquired the former campus of Manchester Metropolitan University at Crewe. The University of Buckingham Crewe campus is close to both Manchester and Liverpool. The Times and The Sunday Times Good University Guide 2021 ranked this university among the top 20 in England for Student Satisfaction and Teaching Quality. University of Buckingham Crewe campus offers an array of programs - BSc Biomedical Sciences (3 years, including Integrated Foundation year), CertHE Medical Sciences (Pre-Med, 1-year), BSc Podiatric Medicine (2-year degree), Certificate in Medical Foundation Studies (1-year), BSc Biomedical Sciences (2-year degree), and MB ChB Medicine (4.5-year degree). The average cost of tuition per year at this institute lies between £21,500 and £22,000. Summing this up with the annual cost of living and application fee, the total amount payable for the students ranges between £33,500 and £34,000. In addition, there are a number of University of Buckingham scholarships offered to deserving candidates based on different programmes. A few of these include the High Achiever Scholarship, International Foundation Progression Scholarship, University of Buckingham Bursary, Vice Chancellor’s Regional Scholarship, Buckingham Postgraduate Discount, Ondaatje Scholarship, etc. Graduates from this institute have pursued further studies at some of the leading universities, including London, Oxford, Harvard, and Cambridge. Some notable alumni of this institute include a leading Formula One motor-racing driver, a graduate who became the head of his country’s civil service, a female law graduate who became the first British lawyer to become a French Advocate, and an individual who secured a position as the Minister of Sabah.

Name: University of Bolton
Overview: The University of Bolton is an excellent choice for students looking to study in London in a contemporary, modern college. Established in 1825 as the Bolton Mechanics' Institute, the institute was awarded University status by the Privy Council in 2004. The University of Bolton is nestled comfortably in the heart of Greater Manchester.Apart from its educational programs, the research opportunities offered by the University of Bolton are highly recognized. The University's Research and Graduate School assists students in conducting all types of research. All programs at the University of Bolton are known for their industry-relevant and vocational focus.The campus has the most modern facilities among universities in the area, with up-to-date technology and resources. The campus has a 25-meter swimming pool, climbing wall, and sports hall. The campus has at least 120 nationalities present on the ground, making it a culturally rich, diverse, and inclusive community. The University of Bolton has excellent career prospects and offers a wide range of services to help you advance to your dream career.The tuition fee for the University of Bolton is approximately €12,000, making it one of the most affordable universities in the UK.The University of Bolton has a global appeal in many ways. For one, almost 25% of the student population represents various ethnic minorities. With students from over 60 countries worldwide, the University of Bolton is cosmopolitan. In addition, the university has affiliations with multiple institutions around the world.

Placement: The University of Bolton's careers and employability service is regarded as one of the most successful university employability programs in the North West. Emolument reports that the average salary for Bachelor of Science graduates is around $44,000. The university has a dedicated Career Services team to help with placements and internships. Some services available includeApplications and resume assistanceAssessment centersPsychometric testsInterview practiceCareer counseling and adviceThe career services staff is available to assist students in locating and preparing for graduate programs, full-time jobs, internships, and placements. Many top-ranked UK colleges offer this service; however, it is frequently underutilized. At Bolton, on the other hand, student career advancement is prioritized. Undergraduates and postgraduates alike have access to a variety of employability support alternatives that are tailored to their specific requirements and professional objectives. Networking: A placement or internship gives you a foot in the door and the chance to meet and network with people who can assist you with your long-term professional goals. The university urges you to get a job as a graduate student as soon as possible. To make this happen, you receive plenty of assistance from the career services team. Many companies utilize work experience as a recruiting strategy. Students working with them (especially on placements or internships) are increasingly used as part of a company's recruitment strategy. Recruiters are far more inclined to hire a student they've seen 'in action' than one they've merely seen in an interview environment.
Accommodation: The University of Bolton recommends Orlando Village as the preferred and only Halls of Residence. International students like the facility because it has 381 single study, self-catering rooms. It's a 10-minute walk from our campus and close to bus and rail stations. Please visit www.orlandovillage.co.uk for a complete overview of what is included in the Halls of Residence, contract, processes, and how to apply.The University of Bolton has recognized and recommended Orlando Village as the sole place to stay. The halls are purpose-built and divided into eight blocks, each with eight six-bedroom flats. The rooms are self-catering and include a communal kitchen, WC, and washing machine. Orlando also has a common building called 'The Hub' that is accessible for student use and has a television, tennis, football table, and pool table. This is also where the laundry facility is located and is an excellent place to socialize. Off-campus Accommodation: The Bolton area has many properties, from private houses to private residence halls. Making arrangements for this accommodation would entail contacting the property's landlord. Because there are so many third-party private accommodation sites, you may find that searching the internet with phrases like 'Student Accommodation Bolton' is the ideal place to start.
Course Ranking: Since 2017, Bolton University has been ranked by The Complete University Guide in the bottom 100 accounting and finance programmes in the UK. From 2017 to 2021, it ranked Bolton University between 110 and 120 in its Business & Management Studies rating. Additionally, Bolton University was ranked by The Guardian in its Accounting & Finance Ranking for 2017, 2019, and 2020 as one of the top 100 universities in the UK. The university rose significantly in The Guardian's rankings from 64th in 2017 to 31st in 2019, however it fell to 45th in 2020. This demonstrates how Bolton University has advanced in important areas over time.Bolton University is ranked among the top 100 universities institutions in the UK for civil engineering, electrical and electronic engineering, and mechanical engineering by The Complete University Guide. In addition, The Guardian's rankings for mechanical engineering, electronic & electrical engineering, and civil engineering place Bolton University in the world's top universities in the UK. The information above shows how well-known Bolton University's civil engineering programme is throughout the UK.
University Ranking: Greater Manchester, UK is home to the public institution known as the University of Bolton. According to the UK university rankings, the University of Bolton is a well-known institution of higher learning. Course Description: University of Bolton  is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Bolton  was founded in 1982. Located in Bolton,UK the university is home to about 2750 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Bolton  is ranked 2387th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 5 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. University of Bolton  has 2 intakes in Sep,Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Bolton  is around £11,250 (Approx).For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Bolton  include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Bolton  is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Bolton  has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of York International College
Overview: Established in 1963, University of York International College is a collegiate research university and has expanded to more than 30 departments and centres, encompassing multiple subjects. It is a collegiate university, and every student in this college is enrolled in one of the university’s ten colleges. Currently, the university comprises more than 30 research centres and academic departments. This university is now approved by the Privy council. This institution offers a wide range of post-graduate, undergraduate and research programs in various fields like law, mathematics, languages, philosophy, archaeology, sciences, psychology, arts, sociology etc. This university has associations with several notable research-oriented institutions worldwide. Moreover, it is a significant part of 24 established research-intensive universities. Apart from this, this university has outstanding student exchange programs and research associations with multiple other universities worldwide. In addition, this institution efficiently provides exceptional professional training and offers exclusive employment opportunities in well-known organisations. The University of York International College provides various courses for international students at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels who do not meet the admission eligibility requirements. While pursuing the course, students can stay in university accommodation and can easily access the classes. In addition, students can conveniently join through individual university partnerships, country-specific government initiatives, third-party providers, or independent applicants. Here, students can explore teaching through different tutorials, specialised lectures, seminars, laboratory and practical work. As per Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2021, this university holds a position in the top 45 for Humanities and Arts. With a graduate employment rate of more than 94%, students are employed within four months of graduation. Also, this university provides 1-year paid internship in their respective field and offers a hands-on professional experience for contemporary workspace.
Eligibility Overview: The following tests are accepted for entry into degree-level courses:International English Language Testing System (IELTS) (Academic and Indicator)C1 Advanced (Certificate in Advanced English)C2 Proficiency (Certificate of Proficiency in English)PTE AcademicTOEFL IBT (internet based and special home edition) (TOEFL MyBest score is not acceptable for meeting the English language requirement)Trinity Integrated Skills in English (ISE) IIIGCSE/IGCSE/O level English Language (as a first or second language) with Grade C or grade 4DuolingoLanguageCert.We must be able to verify your test within two years of completion, but you may have completed the test up to two and a half years prior to the start date of your course. You cannot combine scores from more than one sitting of the test or multiple different tests.
Accommodation: Moving to a new nation might be intimidating, but with all of our housing options located on or near our compact and secure campus, you'll quickly feel at ease in York.Types of rooms and their costsWith ensuite and communal bathrooms, we offer a variety of self-catered and catered lodging options.for more information click on this link-https://www.york.ac.uk/study/accommodation/international/

Name: Liverpool John Moores University
Overview: Liverpool John Moores University, a public research university located in Liverpool, England, is one of the largest and most well-known colleges in the United Kingdom. Liverpool John Moores University is highly ranked for teaching and researching sports and exercise sciences.The university is a member of the University Alliance, the North Consortium and the European University Association and hosts students from over 100 countries.The university offers around 212 undergraduate and 120 graduate degrees, full-time, part-time, and distance learning in 27 subjects. Some of the widely chosen majors by the students are in the fields of Civil Engineering, Accounting and Finance, Business with Marketing and Computer Science.The approximate international fee will cost up to GBP 12660. There are several financial aids provided to students in the form of scholarships like International Achievement Scholarship, LJMU Regional UG Scholarships, Achievement Scholarships etc.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Candidates must have at least a 65% overall grade in either the Higher Secondary Certificate, Standard 12 Examination, Indian School Certificate (Year 12), or the All India Senior School Certificate Examination (60% in Maths and your chosen subject). As an alternative to IELTS, the university accepts the following Standard XII English state boards with a score of 70% or higher:CBSECISCE (ISC) Students applying from Gujarat, Haryana, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh must submit a UKVI-approved SELT, even if they have completed their Standard XII coursework through CBSE or ISCE Boards. Postgraduate Direct admission to Postgraduate programmes will be considered for holders of a Bachelor's degree with a pass rate of 53%. As an alternative to IELTS, the university accepts the following Standard XII English state boards with a score of 70% or higher:CBSECISCE (ISC) Students applying from Gujarat, Haryana, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh must submit a UKVI-approved SELT, even if they have completed their Standard XII coursework through CBSE or ISCE Boards. English Proficiency Test scores:

Name: Queen's University Belfast
Overview: Founded in 1845, the Queen's University Belfast is a public research institute in Belfast, Northern Ireland. Over 24,000 students from 153 countries are enrolled in 200+ undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs taught by 15 schools (3 faculties), namely the School of Law, Queen's Management School and School of Psychology. Some of the courses offered are Anthropology, Economics and Accounting, Irish, Social Work etc. The Queen's University Belfast campus is located in the heart of Belfast, and the McClay Library houses 1.2 million volumes, manuscripts, journals, periodicals, 2,000 reader seats and computer facilities. Some academic facilities include the Ewald Microscopy Facilities, EEECS LEGO lab, Astrophysics Research Centre Teaching Observatory, Sonic Laboratory etc. The university offers various postgraduate research programs in areas like Aerospace Engineering, Cognition and Culture, Philosophy, Translation etc. Short Open Learning courses such as Japanese Culture Experience, Ulster's Victorian Railways, The Blackbird Book club etc., are excellent ways to enhance knowledge. INTO at Queen's is a collaboration that serves as a foundation education program for university degree programs. These include academic and English courses like IN sessional English, Aerospace Engineering, Management, Summer Schools etc. The study abroad program, comprising the Erasmus program, Summer/Winter Schools, Study Abroad etc., allows overseas students to study at Queen's for a semester or year. The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is GBP 4,530 for Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland students, and GBP 9,250 for England, Scotland, Wales and the Islands students. Financial aid options include scholarships, loans, bursaries etc., like the Rob Saunders Rugby Scholarship, Queen's Loyalty and Scholarship, Early Bird Reward. Accommodation is available at residences like Grant House, Elms BT1, College Gardens and Willow Walk, comprising 3,400+ rooms (mainly en-suite). There are over 200 student clubs and societies engaged in sports, cultural, artistic and academic activities. 98% of Queen's University Belfast students find employment within six months of graduating.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?There are programme, course, and country-specific requirements at the university. For example, Indian applicants must meet the following criteria: Admissions to the undergraduate programmeA grade 12 average of 70-85% or better in the best of five academic subjects, as determined by CISCE, CBSE, any state board, or equivalent, is necessary.In addition, a minimum score of 75% in each of the required subjects is required.The results of JEE Mains and JEE Advanced are also taken into account. In such instances, the percentage of students in class must not fall below 60%.Students studying medicine and dentistry must have a minimum of 90 percent overall, with 90 percent in Chemistry and Biology.Admissions to Postgraduate ProgramsIndian PG applicants must have a bachelor's degree with an average of Upper Second Class Honours or Lower Second Class Honours in the United Kingdom.4.0 on a 6.0 point scale, meaning an A, B, or Good.7.5/10.0 or 6.5/10 CGPA (good)Percentage A minimum final average of 60% or a second division pass is required.Requirements for English Language ProficiencyQUB accepts 70% in Core English in Grade 12 from the following boards for most bachelor's programmes, barring Pharmacy, Dentistry, and Medicine.State boards in West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Gujarat issue the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC).The Council for Indian School Certificate Examinations issues the Indian School Certificate (ISC) (CISCE).The Central Board of Secondary Education conducts the All India Senior School Certificate Examination (AISSCE) (CBSE).International UG and PG students can also submit any of the following exam scores:TOEFL iBT is a computerised version of the TOEFL exam.Overall score: 8017th year of writing20 minutes of speaking18 minutes of reading17 minutes of listening IELTS6.0 out of 10At least 5.5 for each element

Name: Kaplan International College London - University of Westminster
Overview: Kaplan International College London - University of Westminster is a part of the prestigious Russell Group university. The University ranks 70th in the QS World Ranking and 12th in the United Kingdom according to the Shanghai Academic Ranking 2021. The University has high rankings for the wide range of courses on diverse subject areas. The University of Westminster partners with Kaplan International College London to provide exclusive and flexible pathway programmes on several business courses to a number of undergraduate and postgraduate students. The college provides Foundation Certificate in Business and Graduate Diploma in Business through year one BSc, BA, MA, MSc, and MBA degrees respectively. There are a wide range of diverse subjects like Social Sciences, International Economy, Business and the Business Environment, Business Enterprise, Statistics for the Social Sciences. Foundation Mathematics and Applied Mathematics. Students who pass the pathway courses at the required level with good attendance at Kaplan International College London are guaranteed to get an entry to the Bristol program of their choice in Westminster. In addition, the Bristol degree brings better employment opportunities to the students as it impresses the employers. Kaplan International College London - University of Westminster provides the students exceptional learning and research experience. It welcomes students from more than 150 countries which allows the students to enjoy a global community of diverse cultures from all around the world and develops their international communication skills.
Eligibility Overview: For our UK route courses, you must meet specific entry requirements. All of our courses require at least 11 years of study, with some requiring much more. For our courses, you must also have a specific degree of English language proficiency. You'll need to demonstrate proof of your English skills using a UKVI-certified Secure English Language Test or an approved equivalent if you need a visa. If you do not require a visa, we may be able to accept scores from alternative English tests. For International Year-One the requirements are :  Academic: at least 12 years of educationEnglish language: UKVI IELTS 4.0 to 5.5 or accepted equivalent For Foundation Certificate the requirements are :  Academic: at least 11 years of educationEnglish language: UKVI IELTS 4.0 to 5.5 or accepted equivalent For Pre-Master's the requirements are : Academic: at least 3 years of higher education or equivalentEnglish language: UKVI IELTS 4.5 to 5.5 or accepted equivalent For Pre-Doctorate the requirements are : You will typically need to have a bachelor’s and a master’s degree, or equivalent.Minimum IELTS 6.0 in all skills for a 1-term course, or minimum IELTS 5.5 with no less than 5.0 in any skill for courses with extra Preparatory English, or accepted equivalentAcademic transcripts (plus certified translations if the original transcripts aren’t in English)

Name: Manchester Metropolitan University
Overview: Manchester Metropolitan University is a highly-ranked public university located in Manchester, England. The institution was recognized by the University Alliance and received its university status in 1992. Besides, the university also has alliances with the European University Association, Association of Commonwealth Universities, and North West Universities Association. Some of the top programs at Manchester Metropolitan University are B.A. International Fashion, MSc Artificial Intelligence, M.A. Applied Criminology, and MPH Global Public Health. The Postgraduate Internship Programme is a brilliant opportunity for students who wish to explore their careers.The average tuition fee at Manchester Metropolitan University is 11,650 GBP. International students can apply through financial aid and merit-based grants.
Eligibility Overview: You must have both:passed Standard XII with a good gradeHigher Secondary School Certificate You should have the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) at level 6.0, with no scores less than 5.5 in any section. The University may accept equivalent qualifications.They will accept the following XII standard English State Boards with a score of 70% or above as an alternative to IELTS:CBSECISCE (ISC) They will accept the following XII standard English State Boards with a score of 80% or above as an alternative to IELTS:MaharashtraTamil NaduWest Bengal You will need a visa to study in the UK unless you:are a British citizenare a citizen of a European Economic Area (EEA) member state or Switzerlandhave a visa to stay in the UK for another purpose that allows you to study. This might be because you are the husband, wife, partner or child of someone in the UK and have a dependent visa.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation 2022-23 The rooms that are showing on the booking portal are reflective of current availability.If you do not see something that you want to book, you are welcome to continue to access to the portal but there is no guarantee on what will become available.Check here: https://www.mmu.ac.uk/study/accommodation
Course Ranking: Man Met is a well-known provider of over 300 courses, including UG, PG, and research-level courses in Accounting & Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, and Humanities & Arts. The PG Business & Economics courses at Man Met are ranked by THE in the range of 301-400 in 2021, up from 251-300 in 2020. Accounting & Finance is ranked #61 in the Complete University Guide, and Business & Management Studies is ranked #66. Accounting and finance courses are ranked 72nd by The Guardian, while business, management, and marketing courses are ranked 90th. The THE rates Manchester Metropolitan University in the range of 251-300 for PG Engineering and Technology degrees in 2021. While Mechanical Engineering is ranked #56 in 2021 by The Complete University Guide, Electronic & Electrical Engineering is ranked #57. Electronic and Electrical Engineering is ranked 48th in the Guardian's assessment of engineering programmes for 2021, while Mechanical Engineering is ranked 58th. THE ranks Man Met's computer science courses between 301 and 400 as of 2020. Since 2020, Computer courses have consistently ranked at number 70 in The Complete University Guide.
University Ranking: Out of 130 other universities in the United Kingdom, Manchester Metropolitan University is ranked #54 by The Complete University Guide - University Ranking 2021. According to The Complete University Guide, this university is ranked according to a number of criteria, including entry standards of 128/208, student satisfaction ratings of 4.04/5, research quality ratings of 2.74/4, research intensity ratings of 0.24/1, degree completion rates of 85% and graduate outcomes of 64.1%, for a total score of 608/1000. Therefore, a total score of 61% indicates that Manchester Metropolitan University has a rank that is above average. From The Guardian Manchester Metropolitan University has experienced varying success in national university rankings over time. The position was #60 in 2017, #76 in 2018, and #73 in 2019, a drop of 3 points. In 2017, the rank was #60. Rank for 2020 increased by 6 points, and in 2021 it finally stabilised at #70, dropping by 9 points from 2020. Since 2017, Manchester Metropolitan University's position in the THE - University Rankings has varied between 601 and 800. The average scores in each of the pillars according to THE's ranking criteria are shown for this university. Manchester Metropolitan University receives a score of 67.5 for its global outlook, 54.8 for its number of citations, 33.8 for its industrial outcome, and 19.2 for its teaching. Manchester Metropolitan University is not among the top 500 universities in the world, hence there is no overall ranking. The QS - World University Rank range for this university increased from 751-800 in 2020 to 801-1000 in 2021. In comparison to 2019 and 2020, US News & World Report's rating of the world's universities has decreased, falling to #877 from #931. The ranks have changed significantly during the last three years.

Name: Cambridge Judge Business School
Overview: Cambridge Judge Business School is located on Trumpington Street in Cambridge, UK. The admissions are highly competitive and selective, with an acceptance rate of 21%. CJBS offers postgraduate, doctoral, and professional courses in full-time and part-time mode, amongst which MBA and Master of Finance are the most popular. The eligibility criteria include a 2:1 honors undergraduate degree, a high GMAT score, a minimum of 7.5 in IELTS or 110 in TOEFL, essays, and work experience of at least three years for most programs. Merit-based scholarships like the Cambridge Judge Scholarship Programme worth up to 73,000GBP waives off the tuition fee, and need-based funds like Helping Hands provide financial aid of around 2,500 GBP. CJBS has an impressive graduation rate of nearly 93%, with an average salary of 93,009 GBP for MBA graduates.
Eligibility Overview: Candidates must take either the GMAT or GRE to apply to Cambridge Judge Business School:To apply to Cambridge, Students must take either the GMAT or the GRE. University doesn't ask for a precise score range, but this year's average GMAT score is about 687, with a median of 700. (mid-80 percent range is 630-740)WF1-T3-68 is the University GMAT institution code. At the time of application, students' GMAT or GRE scores must be current (scores are valid for five years)Students must have an excellent 2:1 Honours degree from a UK university or an equivalent from an international institutionUniversity can still examine your application if you don't satisfy this condition, but we'll need to see a strong GMAT or GRE score. Although a master's degree is not required, students can include information about it in their application if they have oneBy the commencement of the intake, students are applying, and you must have a minimum of two years of work experienceSix years of work experience is the current class average

Name: University of Chichester, (HOLMES EDUCATION GROUP)
Overview: The origins of the University of Chichester trace back to 1839. Then, on 12th October 2005, the Privy Council approved the title 'University of Chichester'. This university is set across two campuses. This includes the Bishop Otter campus and the Bognor Regis campus. Both these campuses boast ample facilities, with the latter housing a new state-of-the-art Tech Park. A wide array of subject areas is available for students to choose from. This includes over 20 different subject areas that range from Engineering to Acting. The Academic Board agrees to the Standard Undergraduate Semester Pattern one year in advance. This applies to non-standard programme dates, including the University of Chichester postgraduate courses.  Around 15% of its total submissions were classed as world-leading. In November 2013, this institution achieved the European Commission HR Excellence in Research Award. This institution holds a Silver TEF Award. Research candidates can register themselves for either a PhD or an MPhil degree. There are several research areas available for potential postgraduate candidates. This includes Music, Business Studies, Psychology, Social Policy, and theology. Students dealing with engineering and creative technology education get exposed to superb facilities through teaching labs featuring brand-new apparatus and equipment.Additionally, this university’s employability rate is generally on the higher side. For example, as per DLHE 2018, 96.5% of graduates find employment six months after graduation.

Name: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine
Overview: The London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine is a university located in London, UK. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Medicine. The main campus of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine is located in London. The university offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs.  The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around 2582523. London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.  Read more details about the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: English language proficiency requirements are:

Placement: Around 81 per cent of LSHTM graduates are working, with the rest 9 per cent continuing their education. Graduates work in fields such as academia/research, medical practice government-aid agencies, and non-governmental organizations/charities. Kenya Medical Research Institute, World Health Organization, Public Health England, Imperial College London, United Nations, and others are among LSHTM's top recruiters. In the United Kingdom, the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine is a well-known postgraduate, continuing education, and research institute. The college is one of the greatest UK institutions for international students, with numerous staff members working all over the world. The college's core activities are based in London, with MRC units in Gambia and Uganda.
Accommodation: There is no specific Accommodation office at LSHTM. The Student Advice staff can provide advice on housing alternatives and point students to other information and resources, but the university cannot find or secure housing for students. University Halls of Residence They are student halls of residence, with rooms assigned to several University of London (UoL) member institutions, including LSHTM. LSHTM has 35 rooms available in the following halls: College HallInternational HallThe Garden Halls LSHTM students are only eligible to apply for rooms in halls that have been designated for LSHTM. Other room types or rooms in other UoL halls that are not part of LSHTM's quota are not available for application. For more information, visit: https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/study/new-students/accommodation/university-intercollegiate-halls-residence  Private Halls of Residence Privately-owned student halls range from the most basic and affordable (sometimes run by a humanitarian organisation) to the most luxurious, resembling a boutique hotel. The university has compiled a list of the majority of student halls in London. The halls provided are:Luxury hallsCharity halls For more information, visit: https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/study/new-students/accommodation/private-halls-residence  Private Accommodation For LSHTM students, private housing is the most popular option. In general, you must be in London to obtain private housing; paying for a hotel before visiting the city and seeing the property is not recommended. As a result, if you intend to hunt for private lodgings, make sure you have short-term lodging secured for at least the first couple of weeks. For more information, visit: https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/study/new-students/accommodation/private-accommodation  Short term Accommodation The word "short-term" can refer to anything from one night to three months. For more information, visit: https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/study/new-students/accommodation/short-term-accommodation  Students with disabilities Any student who requires special facilities as a result of a disability is encouraged to contact the Student Advice team. For more information, visit: https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/study/new-students/accommodation/students-disabilities  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/study/new-students/accommodation

Name: Cardiff University
Overview: Cardiff University is located in wales and has a student population of 33,260 (23,755 undergraduates and 9,505 postgraduates) from 130 countries. the three colleges, Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences, Physical Sciences and Engineering, and Biomedical and Life Sciences, are divided into several academic schools. Students can pursue BA, BSc, BEng, MA, MSc, LLM, MBA, PhD and other degrees from over 300 undergraduate, 200 postgraduate taught and several postgraduate research courses like Astrophysics, Computing, Environmental Hazards, French and Occupational Therapy. Owing to the university's international partnerships in 35 nations and the Erasmus+ program, students get an opportunity to study abroad. It also organises summer schools for students wishing to study in the UK. Students from the UK and EU would need to pay an estimated undergraduate tuition fee of GBP 9,000. Financial aid for undergraduates and postgraduates includes scholarships, bursaries, grants, loans and student employment; Jameel Scholarships, Alumni Discount Scheme, Uni staff Jobshop, Maintenance loans, Next Step Bursary etc. are some options.  97% of Cardiff University graduates have been known to find employment. Cardiff University provides short online courses through FutureLearn, continuing professional development training courses to support career advancement and part-time courses for adults in languages, law, politics, and business.
Eligibility Overview: While particular qualifying requirements for each programme differ, the general guidelines for Cardiff University courses are listed here.Language in EnglishThe University requires a minimum IELTS score of 6.5. Depending on the course, the number could be significantly higher. If you do not meet the IELTS requirements, another option is to enroll in the University's full-time English for University Study programme.Courses for UndergraduatesA minimum of 78-81 percent in the best four subjects in the XII grade exams is required (excluding Hindi and Physical Education).Taught Postgraduate CoursesA minimum of 55-60 percent in a graduate degree from a recognised university is required.Courses in Postgraduate ResearchStudents must have prior research experience in addition to a master's degree from a recognised university. A bachelor's degree with a passing mark of 55-60% is also required.
Placement: We arrange internships and placements for current students and recent graduates.We source work experience opportunities for current students and recent graduates of the University across a wide range of companies and sectors.For More Visit:https://www.cardiff.ac.uk/jobs/placements#:~:text=We%20organise%20both%20placements%20and,recent%20graduates%20of%20the%20University.
Accommodation: Those looking for student accommodation can apply for shared, en-suite, studio rooms and houses with catered and self-catered options. Some student residences with dining services are Cartwright Court, Talybont Gate, University Hall and Hodge Hall. Hang-out spots on campus include Y Plas, The Lounge, Great Hall and The Taf. There are over 60 sports clubs to join revolving around tennis, swimming, martial arts etc. and approximately 200 societies concerning academics, culture, art, politics and more. The Science Library, Aberconway Library, Trevithick Library, Health Library and others contain over 1.2 million printed and 375,000 online resources across the Cathays Park and Heath Park campuses. On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.Cardiff University provides on-campus housing for its students, with a variety of options to suit different preferences and budgets.Catered or self-catered housing is available to undergraduate and postgraduate students.On-campus housing can be found here.https://www.cardiff.ac.uk/study/accommodation/residences?gscope1=1&sort=metat&collection=website-residences&f.Audience|A=postgraduates&form=residences Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.Room Rental, Non-ensuite Rooms, Ensuite Rooms, Shared House, Studio Flats, and more residential options are available.The average rent is £90-£150 per week.Water, electricity, 24 hour Wi-Fi, and gas are all included in the all-inclusive utility payment.Furnished room, double glazing, modular kitchen, garden, and other amenities are available.Some lodgings provide amenities such as a free on-site gym, a games area, a cinema room, and a variety of social spaces.Off-campus housing linkhttps://www.accommodationforstudents.com/in/cardiffhttps://www.crm-students.com/student-accommodation/cardiff/https://www.rightmove.co.uk/student-accommodation/find.html?locationIdentifier=REGION^281
Course Ranking: Cardiff has received top 50 rankings from QS (Top Universities) in the categories of communication and media, psychology, and architecture. Additionally, Cardiff's programmes for pharmacy, English literature, geography, accounting & finance, and sports-related topics have been listed among the top 100 programmes by QS. Cardiff University's engineering programmes are well-liked in the UK. For five years starting in 2017, The Complete University Guide has ranked its civil engineering, electrical and electronic engineering, and mechanical engineering degrees among the top 50 courses in the UK.Cardiff University is ranked 170 in the QS WUR Ranking by Subject, 182 for postgraduate studies, and 305 for undergraduate studies by global ranking partner QS. According to US News, Colorado University is ranked 96 in the arts and humanities, 178 in clinical medicine, 209 in engineering, 117 in social science, etc. The Guardian has ranked the civil, mechanical, and electrical engineering programmes at Cardiff among the top 50 in the UK.
