Name: Royal Holloway, University of London - Egham
Overview:
Located in London, the Royal Holloway, University of London was formed as a merger between Bedford College and Royal Holloway College in 1985. The college received an AACSB accreditation and its affiliation from the University of London. Officially recognised by the Privy Council, the college is known for its educational services across undergraduate and postgraduate programs. 
With 11,124 students, 16% of them being international, Royal Holloway, University of London has recently drawn vast attention. The college imparts education through several schools, including Schools of economics, electronic engineering, computer science, law, criminology, humanities, fine arts and others. The students can complete multiple undergraduate and postgraduate courses and degrees from here. The college has collaborated with other institutes and government bodies for contributing to academic research. Moreover, its efforts towards participating in commercialised projects have allowed the students to learn practical aspects of the business.  
Spread across 135 acres, the Egham campus is about 7 miles from Heathrow Airport. The college and its courses are highly research-driven. The Royal Holloway, University of London ranking shows its 499th place in "Best Global Universities". The management has generated a general student retention rate of 77% from the freshmen year to the final year. It has tried to balance the classes with 1,770 established staff members across the college's academic, administrative, and support areas. The college is strict when accepting new applicants, evident from its acceptance rate of 16.98%. The fees structure required to enrol here might seem unaffordable to the international students, ranging from $30,000-$35,000.
The alumni of the college have mostly been capable of getting employed within six months of their graduation. The college mainly offers micro-placements and internships to help students get first-hand employment experience before graduating and entering jobs.

Name: American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine
Overview: The American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine (AUC School of Medicine) is one of the oldest medical schools. The Accreditation Commission accredits it on Colleges of Medicine (ACCM). This institute operates based on a rolling admissions policy, offering three start dates—September, January, and May. Hence students get the freedom to begin their journey at a time of their choice. AUC graduates are eligible for licensure in all 50 US states, Puerto Rico, and Canada. Candidates need a minimum of 75 in TOEFL or 6.5 in IELTS for admission and other requirements. This medical school offers scholarships recognizing volunteerism, academic excellence, and other attributes. Some of their scholarships include Academic Merit Scholarship, Dean's Academic Scholarship, Trustee's Academic Excellence Scholarship, etc.There are over 7800 alumni of this institute, and its graduates are practising throughout Canada, the United States, and globally.
Eligibility Overview: What are the Pre-requisites?AUC requires a bachelor's degree with a solid science background. Students must take college biology and general chemistry for two semesters (eight credit hours, including labs). Applicants must also have completed two semesters of organic or biochemistry, as well as one semester of general physics, mathematics, or statistics.Part of the med school criteria for non-native English speakers or applicants who graduated from schools whose education was not provided in English, or as asked by the Admissions Committee if deemed appropriate to assess achievement at AUC School of Medicine. One of two exams is available:The AUC School of Medicine recommends scores of 6.0 in all areas on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS).The AUC School of Medicine recommends a total score of 75 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL).
Accommodation: AMERICAN UNIVERSITY OF THE CARIBBEAN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE HOUSINGLodging at the American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine (AUC) takes great satisfaction in assisting students in locating safe, comfortable, and study-friendly housing.Living on campus at AUC has many advantages, one of which is convenience. Students who live in one of the campus's 80 furnished apartment units have easy access to AUC facilities and amenities including the on-campus gym, basketball court, and Wi Fi. Campus living also provides students with the opportunity to meet with like-minded classmates from all over the world, forming a unique communal experience that is impossible to duplicate off campus. Relax without the anxieties that traditional lodging might bring, and instead focus on being a student.Check: https://www.aucmed.edu/student-life/housing

Name: University of Law - Nottingham
Overview: Established as The College of Law of England and Wales in 1962, the University of Law gained its status in 2012. It was the first for-profit academic institution to receive it. It has campuses in – Birmingham, Leeds, Manchester, London Moorgate, Bloomsbury, Nottingham, Guildford, Bristol, and Hong Kong. The University of Law Nottingham campus offers undergraduate and postgraduate courses in BSc in Accounting with Finance, Bar Practice Course, SQE2 Preparation Course, etc. Students can apply for scholarships such as Bar Practice Course Awards and Career Changer Scholarship to finance their education. Additionally, the University allows students to search for affordable housing accommodation through an online accommodation portal, Studentpad. Undergraduate students can also opt for University of Law Nottingham accommodation at Straits Village. It is close to Nottingham, the ULaw campus, and other public amenities.It received the highest 5-star QS rating for teaching quality, employability, inclusive environment, online learning facility, law, and academic development. Approximately 90% are experienced lawyers and business professionals. Individuals can opt for undergraduate and postgraduate courses in LLB Law Online, Postgraduate Diploma in Law – conversion, etc. Moreover, the University has a dedicated online campus, ULaw.The University of Law has a Pro Bono program, which provides 3,700+ opportunities for students to gain hands-on working experience. Graduates can join the University’s alumni network of 80,000+ members, representing 103 countries, to tap into employment opportunities and enjoy other benefits. Its alumni network is one of the largest in the United Kingdom.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: The candidate must have finished high school with mathematics as a required subjectFor bachelor's degree programmes in law or business, applicants must have received a minimum score of 70 per cent on the senior secondary level qualifying exam Postgraduate: The applicant must have successfully completed a bachelor's programme at an accredited universityA minimum of 50% in a related discipline, such as law or business, at the bachelor's/professional bachelor's level, is necessary English Requirements:

Name: London School of Commerce
Overview: The London School of Commerce is a university founded in 1999 in London, United Kingdom. The main campus of the London School of Commerce is located in London. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The University offers academic courses like MBA, MBA for executives, MSc Information Technology, MSc International Hospitality Management, MSc International Tourism Management, BA (Hons) in Business Studies, BSc (Hons) in Computing and PhD. In addition, the University has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. While attending the London School of Commerce (LSC), students are free to make housing arrangements, and LSC offers housing alternatives and help. All suggested student residences are located close to the school in South London neighbourhoods. More than 30,000 graduates are connected to LSC Connect as worldwide alumni. The goal of LSC is to prepare each student to become a well-rounded global citizen who, at graduation, will act as a worldwide catalyst for economic, social, and cultural change. The estimated average tuition and fees for an international student, excluding miscellaneous expenditure, are around Rs. 65,076. London School of Commerce offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Read more details about the London School of Commerce on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet to be considered for admission are: A 2.2 degree from a recognised university (equivalent to a UK Bachelors (Hons) degree) is requiredTo apply, you must be at least 21 years oldStudents who are at least 21 years old and have appropriate job experience or a professional qualificationEnglish language proficiency test requirementsMinimum IELTS score of 6.0 overall, with a minimum of 5.5 in all other components, or comparable recognised English language qualification
Accommodation: Every effort is made to satisfy the needs of all kids. The college has a relationship with a housing provider, and comprehensive information will be provided. Approved premises are inspected and monitored on a regular basis to guarantee that the highest requirements are met.All of the recommended student houses and accommodations are located in South London residential neighbourhoods with convenient access to the School. The usual commuting time in London is 30-45 minutes, so it'll take you about that long to get to London Bridge. Homestay For students arriving in London for the first time, a homestay is a popular option. The homestay hosts are quite welcoming and can assist you in orienting yourself. A homestay is a good option for students who wish to spend a lot of time with their host. You'll enjoy a private or common study area, as well as shared laundry facilities. Bed, breakfast, and the main evening meal are included in the homestay, as well as complete meals on weekends. You will also have access to laundry facilities, which are usually available once a week for a modest fee. All bills are included in the price, but keep in mind that you are living in someone else's home and must follow their regulations. Price (per week): Single room - £110 - £150, Shared room - £90 - £120 Shared student flats and houses Students who seek more independence might consider shared student flats and houses. You'll have a single or shared study room, as well as shared kitchen and laundry facilities. Bedding sets can be purchased separately. A new duvet, pillow, sheet, duvet cover, and pillowcase are among the items. There will almost always be a communal living room; however, this is not always the case. Many of our student houses and flats offer internet connection, and student rooms will include a study area with a desk and chair. You'll be completely self-sufficient, cooking and cleaning for yourself. You'll most likely be sharing with other students from your school, although you can ask to stay with friends if you like. All bills are included in the pricing (up to a maximum amount per student). Price (per week): Single room - £75 - £100, Shared room - £55 - £75Other Costs: Bedding pack - £50, Tenancy Agreement - £35 Private Lodgings This is comparable to a homestay, however, it is designed for students who want to be more self-sufficient. You'll enjoy a private or common study area, as well as shared laundry facilities. You will not be served meals, but you will have access to a kitchen. Other students, as well as the accommodation provider's family, may live in the home. You may have access to laundry facilities, which are usually available once a week for a modest fee. All bills are included in the price, but keep in mind that you are living in someone else's home and must follow their regulations. Price (per week): Single room - £75 - £95, Shared room - £65 - £85 For more information, visit: https://www.lsclondon.co.uk/accommodation/

Name: Campbell College
Overview: Cambridge School of Visual & Performing Arts (CSVPA) is a sister school of Cambridge Arts and Sciences Ltd. This co-educational, international school is owned by Cambridge Education Group and offers day and boarding services. It is based in the vibrant cosmopolitan city of Cambridge. Students can opt for Foundation, Undergraduate, Extended Diploma, Postgraduate, English Language and Online courses from this institute. CSVPA received accreditation from the Independent Schools Inspectorate. It was awarded ‘Excellent’ in five areas out of nine, including boarding. Additionally, it achieved ‘Good’ in all other areas. This institute offers personalized portfolio advice and assistance. It extends one-on-one drama and music lessons weekly and personalized audition preparation. Besides a personal, dedicated workspace, students receive various other facilities from CSVPA. For instance, this institute provides an iMac to those pursuing BA Graphics & Illustration. Fashion students receive their own mannequins. The average tuition fee at this university per academic year is $29,000 to $30,000. The class sizes at Cambridge School of Visual & Performing Arts are small. On average, it does not exceed 15 students to 1 teacher ratio. Students also get to access the institutes’ studios seven days a week. The lecturers offer quality one-on-one time to them by being present in the studio from Monday to Friday. Over the last three decades, CSVPA has grown their portfolio to include master's degrees as well. It also got linked with leading institutions which include Trinity College London and the University of the Arts London Awarding Body. It also got associated with Cosmopolitan, Harper's Bazaar, Esquire, publishers of ELLE, ELLE Decoration, and Hearst Magazine.

Name: University of Stirling
Overview: The University of Stirling is a public university located in the Scottish city of Stirling. The university was founded in 1967, becoming the first university to be opened in the 20th century in Scotland. The university has five schools and a separate graduate school. Together, they offer numerous programs for undergraduate, graduate and doctoral studies. The top courses at the University of Stirling include MSc in Business and Management, BSc in Computing Science and MSc in International Accounting and Finance. The university has a single campus located within the estate of the Airthrey Castle. It is considered one of the most beautiful campuses in the world thanks to its scenic setting and location below the Ochil Hills. The campus has numerous infrastructure across the campus to serve the academic requirements of students. Facilities include the Robbin's Centre Student's Union and MacRobert Arts Centre. The library offers students with the latest academic literature from various sources around the world. The library is home to the Postgraduate Research Zone and Institute of Advanced Study. The annual tuition fee for international students varies between GBP 17,000 - GBP 21,000. The university is home to a multicultural and vibrant student community. Students can join over 60 student clubs and associations on campus, promoting holistic development and networking outside of academics. The university is designated as Scotland's University for Sporting Excellence by the government. It has one of the best sports programs in the United Kingdom, with world class facilities allowing athletes to train for international events. The main sports on campus are football, swimming and triathlon amongst others. Notable alumni to have graduated from the University of Stirling include Olympic swimmer Craig Benson, former Home Secretary John Reid and Sir Alex Ferguson, the former manager of Manchester United FC.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?There are programme and course-specific requirements at the university. Basic eligibility is also determined by the country in which you completed your education; for example, Indian candidates must meet the following basic eligibility standards to be considered for admission:Undergraduate AdmissionsFor immediate admittance into the first year of a UG study, a cumulative score of 65 percent in Grade 12 is required.For advanced second-year enrollment into a UG course, a cumulative score of 75 percent in Grade 12 is required.Advanced admission requires a score of 35 in the IB or GCE A-Levels ABB.Admissions to the Postgraduate ProgramTier-1 universities, such as the University of Delhi, the University of Mumbai, the University of Calcutta, and others, average 50%.Tier-2 universities had an average score of 55 percent.Language Requirements in EnglishIf English is not their first language, international students must demonstrate a minimum level of English competence. If the following conditions are not met, the institution will only accept IELTS Academic and Pearson PTE Academic in addition to UKVI authorised SELT exams, including 'IELTS for UKVI.'UndergraduateIf studied within the last 5 years of the course start date, students who scored 70% in English in Grade 12 from the following exam boards are not required to submit IELTS.CBSEISC/ICSEState Boards in the Metropolitan Area (Delhi, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal)If studied within 5 years of the course start date, students who score 80 percent in English in Grade 12 from any other state boards will not be required to submit IELTS.PostgraduateIf studied within 5 years of the course start date, students who score 70% in English in Grade 12 from the following exam boards will not be required to submit IELTS.CBSEISC/ICSEState Boards in the Metropolitan Area (Delhi, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal) Students who match the above criteria but have Grade 12 scores that are 6-10 years old must also submit an official letter from their university or college stating that the student's medium of instruction (MOI) was English and that they graduated within 5 years of the course start date. Because English language requirements vary per course, applicants are encouraged to check the individual course pages for the particular grades required for their chosen course. In general, Indian candidates must achieve the following scores:IELTS: 6.0 overallPTE: 60 in total

Course Description: University of Stirling is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Stirling was founded in 1967. Located in Stirling,UK the university is home to about 4420 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Stirling is ranked 653th in Top Universities by US News. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 1 undergraduate and 5 postgraduate programs. University of Stirling has 5 intakes in Sep,Jan, Mar, Apr, Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Stirling is around £16,887 GBP.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Stirling include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Stirling is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Stirling has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: De Montfort University
Overview: Founded as the Leicester School of Art in 1870 and now known as De Montfort University ( DMU), the university has evolved and added a lot of courses- Engineering, Building, and Machine Drawing throughout the years. This public university is located in Leicester, England. The college's acceptance rate is 80%, which means that if a student perfectly fits into the eligibility criteria, it is not very difficult for them to get in. Spread over six faculties, the university provides about 227 undergraduate and postgraduate courses in the various fields of- Nursing, Architecture, Data Analytics, Contour Fashion Innovation, Engineering, Education, Law, etc. The campus consists of numerous buildings- 1600 learning zones spread across all library locations, over 700 computer stations, laptops, free wi-fi, and power outlets for desktops. More than 150 student societies are based on academics, games and activities, cultures, religious beliefs, food, film, media, etc. The fees vary depending upon the course, but the average fee for the academic year 2021-22 is 18000 USD.

Placement: DMU Works programme includes placements, which are a popular and successful aspect of the programme. All students are eligible to participate in a long or short placement to obtain professional skills in the workplace. From a business insight visit to a sandwich year placement working for an employer, they have all kinds of placement opportunities ready in place for you. You can also enrol in their Enterprise Placement Year programme, which allows you to work on your own business idea for a year while earning credit for your degree. Placements can have a significant impact on an individual's employability. DMU's short-term assignments allow you to be more flexible. Students might spend 2 to 10 days learning from industry experts in a commercial or technical setting. All students can volunteer with DMUlocal to get essential employment experience, and business school students can participate in a 12-week programme too as a part of their course.
Accommodation: Why live on campus? Montfort's rebuilt campus is easily accessible from all of its accommodations. Because it is on the outskirts of the city, all of Leicester's attractions are within walking distance.It's critical to find the perfect area to live while attending university. Montfort recognises that this may be your first time living alone, and you will want to live in a place where you feel safe, secure, and happy. This is why, for all incoming UK, EU, and foreign students who desire it, they aim to provide DMU-sourced housing close to the city centre and campus.DMU has a range of halls to choose from, with contract lengths ranging from £95 to £154.50 per week to meet your needs. All the halls are self-catered, so you can come and go as you choose.Apply here

Name: The University of Liverpool
Overview: The University of Liverpool is a university located in Liverpool, UK. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Engineering. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. An international student's estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures, is around 26,39,275 INR. The University of Liverpool offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about The University of Liverpool on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: What qualifications are required for admission?UndergraduateRequirements in SchoolSuccessful completion of standard X and XII (Higher Secondary School Certificate) examinations with minimum grades of 70 to 85 percent, depending on the course and test board.All of our programmes are in the AAA – BBB category on the English A level. Please review the chart below to see how Indian State board results and STD XII ISC/CBSE scores compare to English A level grades for the purposes of making an offer.The percentage will be calculated using the best of four core subjects combined (including English).Taught at the postgraduate levelAcademicObtaining a Bachelor's degree from a recognized university with at least a first division (high second division from some universities).Three-year Bachelor's degrees, such as B Coms, can be accepted, however the information covered in these degrees may not be sufficient for our more specialized programmes, such as MSc Finance.Postdoctoral ResearchAcademicStudents interested in pursuing a research programme should typically complete a Masters degree and obtain strong grades (1st class or 60%+) before enrolling in a research programme.Language requirements in EnglishYou must demonstrate your ability to communicate in English in order to study at the University of Liverpool. If you need a visa to study in the United Kingdom, you must show proof of English proficiency.English as a Second LanguageISC, CBSE, or other State Boards grant STD XII grades of 70% or higher (when education has been completed in English medium)
Placement: Placement at the University of LiverpoolStudents can integrate their academic knowledge with practical experience through placement opportunities with businesses, government agencies, non-profit organisations, and cultural providers.The workplace module provided to students is SOTA300. It also collaborates with Sentric Music and Collective Encounters to give students with incredible skills and possibilities.Within six months of graduation, 90% of its alumni are hired.After graduating from a UK-based university, all international students can take the Graduate Immigration Route to become working professionals.According to Payscale, the average pay of a University of Liverpool graduate is 35,000 GBP per year.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation On-campus housing is available.The University of Liverpool provides on-campus housing to its students.Students can choose between self-catering and catered accommodation, or they can reside in one of two Student Villages in Liverpool's primary student suburb area.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.liverpool.ac.uk/accommodation/find-accommodation/ Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The typical monthly rent is between 500 and 700 pounds.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.These flats are provided on a room-by-room basis, and the rent includes gas, water, electricity, a television license, and Internet access.There are a lot of takeaways and shops nearby, as well as iconic Liverpool landmarks within walking distance.Off-campus housing information can be found here.

Name: CU Scarborough
Overview: CU Scarborough is one of the newest campuses of Coventry University, which was opened in 2015. As part of the Coventry University Group, the university focuses on providing high-quality education at a reasonable tuition cost. This campus is located in the North Yorkshire coastal town of Scarborough, England. It is a modern and open-plan campus that expands yearly as new facilities are being built and installed for an increasing number of students. CU Scarborough is renowned for giving qualifications at the end of every academic year. The university believes that students should be able to attain quality education without putting their careers and lives on hold. Thus, the courses offered at CU Scarborough are available in 6 blocks; the students can start during any block and take 3-6 modules in a year. Each module begins with a new topic, making it easier for students to focus. CU Scarborough tuition costs have been devised keeping in mind the needs of international students. Thus, the university offers competitive prices and allows payment in instalments to release the financial burden. A student can opt for full-time or part-time courses in acting, applied psychology, cyber security, health and social care, sports and leisure management, etc. A sports scholarship of £1400 is offered to all students to help them attain their sporting and academic goal. The university was shortlisted for University of the Year by The Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2021. It was awarded Gold for Teaching and Learning Excellence by the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) 2017. 97% of the recent graduates from this university either get employed or pursue further education.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: UndergraduateInternational applicants for undergraduate programmes must have an overall Grade 12 exam score of at least 60%. Top up CourseA two- or three-year full-time university degree with a minimum of 60 per cent or a three-year full-time university degree with a minimum of 55 per cent is required for international students to be eligible. PostgraduateStudents must be eligible for postgraduate study for a three-year undergraduate degree with a 60 per cent or a four-year undergraduate degree with a 55 per cent passing grade. MBA Admission requirements include a minimum of two years of management, professional, or administrative experience as well as a 4-year UG degree with 60% in a related discipline. English Requirements:   Additionally, you can attain a University-approved English result from one of the below home countries:India – HSSC 60% or above at undergraduate levelIndia - HSSC 65% or above at postgraduate level

Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students. The main campus of Glasgow Caledonian University - London Campus is located in London. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Unassigned. The university offers over 0 undergraduate programs and 12 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, are around 23000. Glasgow Caledonian University - London Campus offers students scholarships, work-study, and various funding. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Eligibility Overview: For our Master's Degrees  which are comparable to a UK 2:2 honors degree at GCU London, we accept a wide range of international qualifications as eligible admission criteria. Qualifications that aren't stated will be considered on an individual basis. If English is not your first language  you will be required to demonstrate your English ability prior to beginning your study by obtaining an English language certification. Although the minimum prerequisites are listed below, greater levels may be necessary for particular courses.1. TOEFL internet-based test overall score of 78 with minimum element scores of reading 18, listening 17, speaking 20, and writing 172. Placement: Students in various undergraduate programmes (mainly BEng programmes and BSc Computing/Networking programmes) can participate in a year-long Industrial Placement. These placements can be used as part of their final dissertation assignment for some postgraduate programmes. These internships are credit-bearing and count toward a student's degree when they graduate. Students have found these placements to be quite beneficial in gaining experience. They are occasionally offered a graduate position within the company immediately or after completing their Honours year. The University also urges the students to participate in a summer or short-term placement.  Student placements can serve as an extended interview for companies, and students can see where they might fit into a particular industry and in what capacity. Paid or unpaid, short-term or long-term placements are available.

Name: University of Central Lancashire
Overview: The University of Central Lancashire, known as UCLan, is a public institution in Preston, North West of England (UK). It is one of the largest universities in the UK, offering over 300 undergraduate and 200 graduate programs in popular fields such as science, humanities, and management, among others.UCLan also offers foundation programs, professional development, language courses, and degree apprenticeships to domestic and international students. The university entertains applications based on merit with an acceptance rate of over 22%.The college offers holistic and professional research opportunities ranging from training, funding, dissemination and governance and making students job-ready. Additionally, support services like airport pick up, free orientation programme, and free English language support in the first year make the life of international students smooth and easy-going.Sports enthusiasts can benefit from the exceptional sports facilities offered by the university like cycle hire, three grass rugby pitches, a final whistle café, an Astroturf indoor training facility, a cricket pitch, and a 1.5 km cycle circuit, including a junior track, four tennis courts, etc.Graduates quickly find high-paid jobs as per their expectations owing to the university's link with more than 125 global institutions.
Eligibility Overview: International undergraduate applicants must have a high school diploma, certificate, or equivalent course experience to be eligible for admission. Students from English-speaking countries or who have completed a course taught in English are exempt from taking English language tests. Other international candidates, however, will be required to submit English language test results regardless of whether they apply for undergraduate or postgraduate programmes. Students interested in postgraduate programmes must have a bachelor's degree or must have completed an equivalent course. The home country also determines the eligibility requirements for the degree programmes.  To be eligible for UG and PG programmes, Indian students must meet the following criteria:

All full-time students admitted to the Preston campus are guaranteed on-campus housing.  Students studying at the Burnley campus get private accommodation offered by the Student Accommodation Service. The estimated rent per room varies from INR 7,979.8 to 13,612.6 (GBP 85 to 145), including utility bills.

Course Ranking: The UCLAN for PG Business and Economics has decreased over time, going from 401-500 for 2019 to 501-600 for 2022. Since 2017, the Complete University Guide's accounting and finance and business and management studies rankings have placed UCLAN among the top 100 universities in the UK. UCLAN was ranked by The Guardian in the top 100 for both business, management, and marketing as well as accounting and finance. UCLAN improved significantly in The Guardian's Business, Management & Marketing ranking from 65th place for 2020 to 22nd place for 2021 before falling once more to 38th place in 2022. This shows that UCLAN has done well in regards to important factors including the student-staff ratio, admittance requirements, employment prospects, and value-added services.Both UK publishers ranked UCLAN in the top 100 universities for various engineering courses. According to data on engineering rankings, UCLAN's civil engineering programme is extremely well-liked in the UK. The Complete University Guide has listed UCLAN among some of the list of 100 universities in the United Kingdom for computer science since 2017.
University Ranking: The University of Central Lancashire (UCLAN), founded in 1828, is a public university located in Preston, Lancashire, United Kingdom. Since 2018, UCLAN has been listed in the top 1000 universities in the world by QS (Top Universities). In a similar vein, THE (Times Higher Education) has ranked UCLAN in its top universities since 2019 at 801-1000. The ranking of UCLAN among the world's universities has dropped, from 984 for 2020 to 1175 for 2022, based on US News & World Report, another important magazine. This shows that UCLAN hasn't done well on important criteria like publications cited among the top publications and regional and global research reputation.According to two renowned UK publishers, UCLAN is among the top 100 universities in the country. UCLAN has dropped from its ranking of 70th in 2021 to 89th in The Complete University Guide's 2022 university ranking, which is a significant improvement from 102nd for 2019. Since 2017, UCLAN has been listed by The Guardian as one of the top 100 institutions in the UK. According to The Guardian's rating of universities for 2022, UCLAN is ranked 97th overall.

Course Description: University of Central Lancashire is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Central Lancashire was founded in 1828. Located in Preston,UK the university is home to about 6000 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Central Lancashire is ranked 1239th in Top Universities by US News. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 1 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. University of Central Lancashire has 2 intakes in Sep, Mar. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Central Lancashire is around £11,950-12,950.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Central Lancashire include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Central Lancashire is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Central Lancashire has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Ulster University, London Campus
Overview: Ulster University, London Campus is a reputable university with a long and illustrious history. It was established in 1968 and was earlier known as the New University of Ulster. The merger of this educational institution with Ulster Polytechnic resulted in it becoming Ulster University. The QS World University Ranking and THE (Times Higher Education) University Ranking have ranked Ulster University between 601 and 650 and 601 and 800, respectively. As for the course fee, the cost of studying at this educational organization ranges from 15 to 16 lakhs per annum. There are a total of 65 scholarships available for students at this University.Ulster University offers 433 undergraduates and 322 postgraduate programs in terms of admission. The basic requirement for enrolling in any institution course is a score of 6.0/7.0 and above in the IELTS examination or 55, 61, or 66 above in PTE.The institution also provides students with job placements in prestigious brands such as Apple, PWC, Praxis, CITI Bank, Accenture, etc.
Eligibility Overview: The University accepts a variety of international credentials. These are evaluated individually for content and level and against relevant recommendations from the British Council and the United Kingdom's National Academic Recognition Information Centre (NARIC UK)Academic Requirements To be considered for undergraduate programs, you must have completed the equivalent of three CCC A-levels. Some programs, however, will demand better grades and specific topics. Please see the online prospectus for the precise entry criteria for your selected program of study.
Placement: Ulster University also provides students with job placements with prestigious brands. The university considers it a responsibility to ensure you are rewarded with an excellent career post your studies there. They provide support from friendly, impartial advice about your goals to CVS and interview preparation.

Name: University Academy 92 Global (UA92)
Overview: University Academy 92 Global (UA92) is a renowned higher education institution in Old Trafford, England. UA92 is in collaboration with the Class of 92 and Lancaster University, focussing solely on the development of the students both academically and professionally. In addition, the university aimed to offer various training on business and work in partnership with top-notch companies, including Microsoft, KPMG, Lancashire Cricket Club and Trafford College. University Academy 92 Global (UA92) popular majors in the fields of Accounting and Business, Computer Science, Journalism, Media and Communication, Physical Education etc. certificates in Higher education are also offered to the applicants. After completing graduation, students receive diplomas from the University of Lancaster. Each student will be provided with a personal development coach to give structured methods for preparing them for the job. Students will receive unique education in UA92 as it combines with the academic rigour of Lancaster, one of the topmost ranked Universities. The University Academy 92 Global (UA92) degree the student will receive will be awarded by Lancaster University. UA92, apart from providing academic assistance, also offers unique and practical advice to their students to maximise their potential. From guiding for study applications to arrival and accommodation, the university takes care of all the needs of international students. Students also receive financial aid like scholarships starting from 20% of the annual cost of training for students who enrolled six months before their studies.
Eligibility Overview: Certificate of Completed Secondary Education GPA 3.5-4.0 or Diploma of Completed Specialised (Vocational) Secondary Education. At least two Sri Lanka A-levels with grades (C,C), (B,S) or higher. Successful completion of Senior Middle School 3 with 60% average

Name: Royal Holloway, University of London - Central London
Overview: Royal Holloway, University of London - Central London is formed by the association of two colleges, Bedford College and Royal Holloway College. Royal Holloway was founded by Thomas Holloway and Elizabeth Jesser Reid. Between two colleges, Bedford College was founded in 1849, and Royal Holloway College was unveiled in 1886. Later in 1985, these two colleges merged, and in 1990, they became part of the University of London. Royal Holloway offers both bachelors and master’s degree programs. It offers these across 6 schools, namely School of Life Sciences and the Environment, School of Law and Social Sciences, School of Business and Management, School of Humanities, School of Performing and Digital Arts, School of Humanities and School of Engineering, Physical and Mathematical Sciences. Royal Holloway also has 26 departments of studies, among those most sorted subjects are Drama, Mathematics, Geography, Psychology, Modern Languages, Media Arts and Music. The university also offers financial aid for its undergraduate and postgraduate students. A few undergraduate Royal Holloway scholarships are Sanctuary Scholarship, International Future Leaders Scholarship, Rising Stars Scholarship, Music Scholarships, and Sports Scholarships. Apart from these scholarships, undergraduate Bursaries are also available at the university. For students in postgraduate degree courses, a few available scholarships are Royal Holloway Principal's Masters Scholarship, RHBNC Trust Scholarship, Bedford Society Access Scholarship, Computer Science Scholarship and others. Royal Holloway ranks at 334, according to QS Global World Rankings 2022. Also, as per THE World University Rankings 2022, it is ranked 351-400th. As per the same, it was ranked 51-75th in European Teaching Rankings 2019. Apart from those, in UK league table rankings, Royal Holloway is ranked 22nd as per The Guardian University Guide 2022 and 24th by The Complete University Guide 2021. As of February 2021, Royal Holloway has a total student population of 11,124, with 1,883 students outside the EU. Some of the famous alumni of the Royal Holloway, University of London are KT Tunstall, Mark Strong, George Eliot, Sophie Christiansen and others. Royal Holloway also has a very high research output from a high employability rate as per topuniversities.com.

Name: University of Sussex International Study Centre
Overview: The University of Sussex was established in 1959, located in East Sussex, England. One of the first universities in the UK following the second world war, it received its Royal Charter in 1961. It has a bunch of affiliations from Universities UK, BUCS, Sepnet, SeNSS, Association of Commonwealth Universities, and NCUB. With more than 17,319 students, the University of Sussex maintains 12 schools and research institutes. About 24% of the students represent international students. It has 1,803 teaching staff and over 300 non-teaching staff. The International Study Centre is mainly a study group dedicated to helping international students with their academic development. It has collaborated with the University of Sussex to reach a maximum number of international students. The USP of this centre is to help improve the students' English, their study skills, and their overall career development. Some of the popular Pre-Masters Courses include Business Management, Finance, Film and media, Computer science, Engineering, Applied science, English language courses, etc. The University of Sussex's acceptance rate is currently 83%, which helps invite more international students to the International Study Centre division. Moreover, the classes maintain a student-faculty ratio of 14:1, keeping the classes smaller. It has enabled the International Study Centre to attract students and retain them with their unique courses. However, the tuition fees structure set for the international students might seem unaffordable, currently ranging from $20,000-$30,000. However, students can apply for scholarship schemes every year. The placements team of the university is dedicated to initiating one-on-one sessions with the students. They help them understand their interests and skills and thereby choose the appropriate career path based on the same. It also arranges career fairs with direct placement opportunities.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Standard 10+2 with a minimum of 65 per centAcademic IELTS 5.5 overall for UKVI (min 5.5 in writing)
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationThe University of Sussex provides a safe and peaceful place for students so that they can form a memory of a lifetime. Naming few of the campus housing options are: East Slope ResidenciesNorthfield flatsStanmer Court flatsSwanborough flatsLewes Court flats For more information, visit: https://www.sussex.ac.uk/study/accommodation/on-campus  Off-Campus Accommodation Living off-campus in Brighton & Hove and other nearby towns allows you to have a taste of city life while also benefiting from convenient transportation to the University.  All accommodation is self-catered. University-Owned Flats 1. Kings Road flats In Brighton's Kings Road, which is on the coast, you can live in a single room. The Sussex campus is easily accessible by bus and train. The following is included in your rent:Water, electricity, and gas bills, as well as service chargesCleaning of shared rooms on a regular basis — you do your own laundry and clean your bedroom and bathroom.Insurance for the contents (basic cover)Maintenance, management, and security services are all available on campus. As a University campus service, have an Internet connection in our apartments. University-managed House In Brighton & Hove, you can live off-campus in a furnished student house.You won't have to pay a deposit or offer a guarantor because your rent covers all bills. All off-campus lodging is close to a bus or train station that connects to campus. Privately Rented Accommodation The university can provide advice and examine your tenancy agreement if you want to rent a flat, room, or house from a private landlord or leasing agent. For more information, visit: https://www.sussex.ac.uk/study/accommodation/off-campus

Name: SOAS University of London
Overview: SOAS University of London is a constituent college of the University of London. Short for School of Oriental and African Studies, this public research university was founded in 1916 to promote the understanding of cultures from the Middle East, Asia and Africa. It has since become a leading institute in education in these regions. The university has three faculties offering around 350 undergraduate courses and 100 single-year master's and doctoral programs. The top courses at SOAS University include LLM in International Law, MSc in Politics of the Middle East and MSc in International Politics. International students' average tuition costs per annum ranges between GBP 16,000 and GBP 18,000.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants holding a second-class upper (or equivalent) bachelor's degree from a reputable institution will be considered for admission to a SOAS master's degree.Applicants for research positions are typically expected to have earned a Master's degree from a reputable university.You should also verify the individual programme of study for any academic prerequisites; please see the postgraduate prospects or postgraduate admissions pages for further information.Language Proficiency in EnglishApplicants whose primary language is not English will typically be required to show proof of English ability. For further information, please see the English language requirements page. For those who do not meet the exact entry requirements, SOAS offers English summer courses ('pre-sessionals') to give students the opportunity to strengthen their language skills before beginning academic studies.
Accommodation: SOAS has a variety of lodging options, ranging from 2 minutes to 45 minutes away from the SOAS campus, all of which are near to amenities and transportation. We have halls of residence with 24-hour security and rooms in shared flats or houses in our inventory. There are many different types of rooms to meet different budgets and needs: twin, single, double, studios, and flats, as well as adapted, couple, and family lodging. We have ensuite and non-ensuite rooms, as well as self-catered and catered options. Students have the option of living with host families.for more detail click on this link-https://www.soas.ac.uk/accommodation/

Name: University of Portsmouth
Overview: The University of Portsmouth was established in 1992 as an open university in Portsmouth, Hampshire, UK. Earlier, the university was developed as a public library and a community college known as the Portsmouth Polytechnic. Later, with the help of the Further and Higher Education Act, this university got its current status. At present, it is considered to be one of the top 100 educational institutions across the world. The university's strength lies in pharmacy, software engineering, property development, sports science, geology, environmental sciences, architecture, accounting, finance, and many more. The university offers over 350 undergraduate and postgraduate programs and over 65 research degree courses—M.Sc. in Construction Project, M.Sc. in Data Analytics, B.Sc in Computing, B. A in Hospitality Management, MBA, and M.Sc in Advanced Manufacturing Technology are some of the university's top courses.  The university provides excellent placement opportunities for its students, but only a few courses offer placement. Cartoon Network is one of the top companies that recruit students. Grayson Perry, Tim Peake, Ben Fogle, and Simon Armitage are some notable alumni of Portsmouth University.The University of Portsmouth offers on-campus accommodation to its students in the residence halls, which have all the necessary facilities. There are different rooms, and the students can choose their space depending on their budget. The university is also known for offering various scholarships and financial aid to its international students, including the Hani Zeini Scholarship, Narotam Sekhsari Scholarships, Inlaks Scholarships, Gates Millennium Scholarships, and many more.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: Students should have successfully passed Grade 12 with an average of at least 75% on state board exams or 70% on CBSE/ISC exams. The university prefers appropriate levels of A (GCE advanced level). Admission requires an International Baccalaureate with a minimum score of 24. Postgraduate: A bachelor's degree with at least second-class honours is required of all applicants. For some courses, work experience may be necessary. Since the majority of the university's courses are career-focused, there may be distinct or higher score requirements for these. PhD: Candidates need to hold a master's degree with honours. To their individual departments, they must also submit a research proposal. English Requirements:

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: When you rent an apartment, you get the keys to your home and can enter a new social circle. If you are a unique, full-time undergraduate applicant, the university will guarantee you a room in the residence halls if you make us your firm first choice and adhere to our deadline for housing.Some of the perks of living in halls:Near the campus, all residence halls are in Portsmouth's city centre. It would be best if you arrived on time, regardless of how early your first lecture isEvery room has a bed, a desk, storage, and lots of outlets for your phone, laptop, and other necessitiesYou will always be connected because you have free WiFi and internetGas, electricity, heating, water, and basic insurance are all included in the price of your stayMost of the rooms include private bathrooms with a shower, basin, and toiletAll of the single rooms are exclusively yours for the whole of the academic year, including the Easter and Christmas break Off-Campus Accommodation: To assist you in adjusting to renting in the private sector, universities provide a wealth of support. University offers drop-in sessions, housing events, online tools, and a student matching service. You have complete control over your living arrangements when you rent privately. Parking spots are hard to come by in Portsmouth, so you should leave your car at home.From the scenic seaside to the city centre and beyond, Portsmouth features a variety of attractive and energetic neighbourhoods. Exploring is straightforward because the city is small and can be covered in an hour by foot or 20 minutes by bike. If you share a house or apartment, you will often live with 3 to 5 other individuals. For rent and bills combined, you should budget £390–£520 per person each month. Your weekly costs will be between £25 and £40, and your rent will be between £80 and £95.University Studentpad service can help you locate rental homes. Name: University of Dundee
Overview: Established in 1881, the University of Dundee is a public research university at Dundee, Scotland. During its initial days, Miss Mary Ann Baxter and John Boyd Baxter donated £140,000 for establishing the college in Dundee, which marked the establishment of the university. The present campus of the university has been developed in the last 50 years. The university has consistently ranked among the top universities, and currently, according to QS World University Rankings, the University of Dundee ranks at 322. Courses at the University of Dundee include undergraduate and postgraduate including research degrees. It comprises 10 schools: School of Business, School of Humanities, School of Science and Engineering, School of Life Sciences, School of Social Sciences, and others. The university currently has a total undergraduate student population of 12,000, and approximately 22% of the student population is international, representing 145 countries. According to touniversities.com, the University of Dundee has a high research output, with a Student/Faculty ratio of 14. Additionally, according to Times Higher Education 2020 World University Rankings, among the student population, 63% are women, and 37% are male. Also, as per the 2014 Research Excellence Framework (2014), 76% of the University of Dundee’s research work was described as ‘internationally renowned’ or as ‘world leading’. The University of Dundee offers scholarships for its deserving students. A few of the scholarships are the Global Citizen Scholarship, Global Excellence Scholarships, EU Scholarship and others. There is a total of £5.3 million total scholarships to fund the education of Dundee students. Notable alumni of the University of Dundee include Sir James Black, a 1988 Nobel Laureate, Economist Ronald Coase, a 1991 Nobel Laureate, B.C Forbes, Sir Robert Watson-Watt and others. Thus students can choose from a range of courses to study at this university, which has ranked 4th in the UK for graduates entering professional occupation by the Graduates Outcome Survey.
Eligibility Overview: Admission requirementsTo be considered for a seat on the International Incorporated Bachelor's (IIB) or International Incorporated Master's (IIM) programmes at International College Dundee, you must meet our English language criteria. Both courses require an IELTS score of 5.5 or higher, with 5.5 in each component.If you do not meet these English Language criteria, we recommend that you take a pre-sessional English course before beginning the first stage of your selected IIB or IIM programme.Check: https://www.dundee.ac.uk/international-college-dundee/entry-requirements
Placement: None
Accommodation: Accommodation at DundeeAll of our student housing is self-catering, with single bedrooms that have an en-suite shower and toilet. We can discover the right location to live for you among our nearly 1600 bedrooms spread across four campuses.Accommodation applications will open in May. We will contact you through email if you have firmly accepted Dundee as your first option on UCAS. Invitations are sent out based on the date and time you selected Dundee as your preferred destination.Check: https://www.dundee.ac.uk/accommodation
Course Ranking: It has been considered the business courses, engineering courses, and computer courses. For five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, The Guardian and The Complete University Guide ranked engineering courses in the top 40 courses for popular programmes. According to The Complete University Guide's rankings for pursuing Computer Science, the university is placed 25 for 2020 and 33 for 2021 when it comes to computer courses.
University Ranking: The University of Dundee is a research university in Dundee, Scotland, that was initially established as a university college in 1881. When it comes to the University of Dundee ranking, The Complete University Guide and The Guardian have placed the institution among the top 20 universities for 2021. As part of their ranking criteria, The Complete University Guide takes into account Graduate Prospects, Research Quality, Research Intensity, and Entry Standards. Entry Standards, Student-Staff Ratio, Value-Added Services, and Career Prospects are the main ranking factors used by The Guardian.Other ranking organisations have placed the institution based on their own criteria. US News & World Report's Global Universities put the university 312 for 2021, Times Higher Education (THE) - University Ranking placed it between 201 and 250, and QS - World University Ranking placed it at 319.Regarding their separate ranking criteria, Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to teaching, research, and citations at 30% each, but QS places the greatest emphasis on academic reputation (40%) followed by faculty/student ratio and citations per faculty at 20% each. In addition to other ranking factors, the US News & World Report's approach for ranking includes 12.5% each of the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation.

Name: BPP University
Overview: BPP University is a private institution established in 1992 and provides education and training in various subjects such as accountancy, law, financial services, management, nursing, data, technology, etc. Students can also opt for professional and academic degrees, apprentice courses, etc.BPP University offers more than 500 professional courses in various undergraduate and postgraduate streams to upskill students and professionals and aid their professional development. Apart from training students, the university also trains professionals. BPP University trains employees of the top nine global banks in finance and compliance. The apprentice program at the university helps students earn while they learn. It trains domestic and international students and provides the required industry exposure and degree courses.The BPP University fee is £17,000 approximately for international students. The UK government also provides student loans and financial aid to all students studying in the UK. Apart from that, the college also provides scholarship programs and other grants to support students financially. BPP University's placement record is excellent as well. As per the Graduate Outcomes survey, 2018-19 session, 97.1% of students find employment within 15 months after passing. KPMG, EY, Lloyds Banking Group, and Deloitte are some of BPP University graduates' top employers.
Eligibility Overview: BPP ensures high quality of education and expects highly of its students as well. Along with English Language Proficiency, a few other academic requirements are necessary for admission.

Undergraduate Minimum 12 years of schooling with consistent good grades. 
Postgraduate Proof of undergraduate qualification
Placement: BPP University has departments solely responsible for assisting graduates and students with placement. The university's employability service focuses on giving graduates the necessary tools, assisting them in creating their CVs, and establishing connections with employers. For their graduates, they offer both career and pro bono services. The career services department assists students with job applications, mock interviews for practice, and advice on their resumes. Students can access career services from the start of their course until 18 months after graduation. The BPP Pro Bono service aids students in gaining the necessary hands-on experience in their field of study and makes them more marketable. The service instils in graduates a sense of social responsibility and trains them to provide services to the community. This in itself is a reflection of BPP’s values and culture.  Compared to the Russell Group of 24 top universities, BPP University ranks first in the percentage of UK postgraduate students who found employment and are in highly skilled occupations. The university also has an attractive employment rate of 97.1%. According to Emolument, MBA graduates at BPP University make an average salary of $89,000, making it the best paying degree available. Name: Ulster University, Birmingham Campus
Overview: The University of Ulster, one of Northern Ireland's top-ranked public universities, was established in 1968. The university is a member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities and the European University Association.The University of Ulster has six campuses spread over Belfast, Jordanstown, Derry, Birmingham, London, and Coleraine. Every campus is designed to offer the latest in terms of research, teaching, and support facilities. Apart from programs that begin at the undergraduate and go all the way up to the post-doctorate levels, the university also offers several short courses and e-learning opportunities for distance learners and working professionals.Over 27,000 students are hosted at Ulster University across its different campuses. The university campus invites students from other countries and backgrounds, making this a great learning arena for students of varied backgrounds. The university offers abundant student support with just under 2,000 staff for student learning and counsel.
Eligibility Overview: Most courses demand an IELTS 6.0 or similar English level, with no band score below 5.5. This criterion can be met by passing Trinity ISE level III (with a pass in each component). We will accept IELTS Indicator for September 2022 entrance. Some of our classes require a higher grade. As a result, it's critical to examine particular course requirements. If you meet the English language requirements for your selected program, you will also meet the UK Visa and Immigration (UKVI) minimum English language requirements for a Student Visa. If you do not meet the English language requirement, we may make you a conditional offer, requiring you to meet the prerequisite before the course begins.
Placement: Ulster University offers Handshake, a career platform that unifies students and employers for better networking opportunities.

Name: Keele University
Overview: Founded in 1949, Keele University is a public research university located in Keele, Staffordshire, England. The Royal charter granted the institution its university status in 1962. Keele University is the largest campus in England and has some significant prominent buildings, including a science park. Keele is highly esteemed for its depth in teaching and learning and innovative research to solve the world's urgent issues. Some top programs at Keele University are BA Media and Sociology, MRes Philosophy, BSc Public Health, BA Philosophy and Politics, LLM International Law, MScCell and Tissue Engineering. Nestled in the countryside of Staffordshire, Keele University has a campus spread across 625 acres. Currently, more than 10,000 students are enrolled in the Keele Campus. Besides, the campus houses important red-brick administrative buildings, business enterprise parks, laboratories, recreation centres, residence halls, and the Keele Hall. Keele University operates through the Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences, and Faculty of Natural Sciences. Keele University sources internships and other learning opportunities for its students. The average tuition cost at Keele University is 15,100 GBP. International students can apply through student loans and merit-based scholarships. The Student's Union is the social and cultural hub of Keele University. It organizes campus activities and social events throughout the year. Student sports at Keele University are top-ranked. Muggle Quidditch is one of the most popular student events at Keele. Besides, the institution also has its very own publication titled Concourse. The institution allows its students to nurture their passions through state-of-the-art fitness centres, dance studios, climbing walls, etc. Keele University Housing operates five residence halls that support on-campus housing. Keele University's top priority is the well-being of its students, as it promises a life-changing experience.

Placement: According to independent market research firm High Fliers, 34% of graduates hired by companies for their 2021 intake will have gained work experience while still in school, with many accepting employment offers after completing work placements or internships. Wherever possible, Keele University encourages students to participate in placements as part of their degree. A placement strengthens the abilities and qualities through your degree and increases your chances of finding a job after graduation. Advantages of an internship as a part of a college degree are: Enhances the abilities and qualities you acquired via your degreeIncreases your likelihood of landing a graduate employment significantlyEnables you to put topic knowledge theory into action in the actual worldEnables you to research and evaluate potential career paths
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation With quick access to the campus's centre and academic buildings, Keele offers more than 2,800 rooms. We offer a wide variety of room types to accommodate different needs, and we are close to medical facilities, sports facilities, bars, restaurants, and cafés. The whole housing stock is on campus. Residence Halls Barnes Hall Barnes is a short stroll from our Keele Business School and the centre of campus. It is situated at the top of campus, between the David Weatherall building (Medical School) and the Sports Centre. There are two laundromats, a common area, and a bar in Barnes Hall. It provides a variety of traditional rooms, shared apartments, and deluxe en-suite rooms and has over 1,000 student accommodations. For more information, visit: https://www.keele.ac.uk/accommodation/ouraccommodation/barnes/  Lindsay Hall The centre of campus and the science teaching facilities are just a short stroll from Lindsay Hall, which is situated on the south side of the university. The Lindsay Café Bar, known for its pub quizzes and social activities, is located there and has its common area and laundromat. It offers a variety of rooms, including en-suite, classic, and classic plus rooms. For more information, visit: https://www.keele.ac.uk/accommodation/ouraccommodation/lindsay/  Horwood Hall Horwood Hall is near Keele Hall, its lakes and woodland, the Students' Union, the Health Center, and the campus centre. It provides classic plus rooms, communal flats, and houses in addition to having its laundromat. For more information, visit: https://www.keele.ac.uk/accommodation/ouraccommodation/horwood/  Holly Cross and The Oaks With a view of the surrounding countryside, Holly Cross and The Oaks is located on the south side of campus, close to Lindsay Café Bar and science teaching facilities. Additionally to beds with private bathrooms and shared kitchens, it features a common area and laundromat. For more information, visit: https://www.keele.ac.uk/accommodation/ouraccommodation/hollycrossandtheoaks/  Note: All lodging offers free Wi-Fi, after-hours assistance, and round-the-clock campus security. For general enquiries, visit: https://www.keele.ac.uk/accommodation/
Course Ranking: Since 2017, The Complete University Guide has put Keele among the top 100 universities for both business and management studies and accounting. The Guardian's Accounting & Finance Rankings have significantly raised Keele's standing from 90th in 2017 to 34th in 2018. The Guardian's ranking for business, management, and marketing has seen a considerable increase in Keele's position, which has risen from 95th for 2020 to 50th for 2021. This shows how well Keele has done in regards to important factors including the student-staff ratio, admittance requirements, value-added services, and career possibilities. The Complete University Guide has listed Keele as one of the top 100 computer science universities in the UK. The aforementioned statistics show how well-liked Keele's Accounting, Finance, and Business courses are in the UK.
University Ranking: Staffordshire, UK-based Keele Institution (KU) is an open research university that was established in 1949. The Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking) for 2020 places Keele between 601 and 700 in terms of global universities. A significant improvement from 801-900 for 2019 is this. From 2018 to 2020, the institution was regularly ranked by QS (Top Universities) at 601-650; however, for 2021, Keele's standing dropped to 701-750. Since 2018, THE (Times Higher Education), a significant ranking source, has put Keele between positions 501 and 600 in their best university ranking. In its ranking of the world's universities, US News & World Report has also dropped Keele from the 864th spot for 2020 to the 908th spot for 2021. In terms of UK universities, Keele has retained its position. The Complete University Guide no longer lists Keele as one of the top 100 universities in the UK as of 2017. In its list of the best 100 universities in the UK, The Guardian has also ranked Keele among them.
