Course Description: Keele University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Keele University was founded in 1949. Located in Keele,UK the university is home to about 1850 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Keele University is ranked 719th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 5 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. Keele University has 2 intakes in Apr,Sep. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Keele University is around £14700-£24200 Pounds approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Keele University include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Keele University is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Keele University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: City University of London
Overview: City, University of London is a public research institution serving as a constituent college of the University of London since 2016.  This institution’s campus is in Central London and other locations in the West End, East End, City, and Islington. This university houses five schools. This includes The City Law School, the School of Mathematics, the School of Health Sciences, Computer Science and Engineering, the School of Arts & Social Sciences, and Cass Business School. The city houses approximately 20,210 students from over 160 nations. Out of these, 46% are enrolled at the postgraduate level. The staff at City come from around 75 countries. Currently, this institution houses 250 Indian students. The City University of London offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral-level degree programs along with diplomas and certificates. Over two-thirds of the programs at this institution are well-recognized by professional bodies. Moreover, this university features an online career network where former students assist current students. As per REF 2014 reports, 75.7% of City research got rated as internationally excellent 3* (52.4%) and world-leading 4* (23.3%) quality. Besides this, 40% of the institute’s research staff got rated as excellent, with the eligible academy staff generating 3* and 4* research. In RAE 2008, this was valued at 25%. According to REF 2014 results, the City, University of London ranking is at the 50th position out of the 154 reviewed institutions.Furthermore, the academic structure of City is backed by interdisciplinary centres, its Graduate School, and the Department for Learning Enhancement & Development. There are around 40 academic departments and centres within the different schools of this institution. This university's campus features a well-stocked library, a typical lecture theatre, and a student centre.
Eligibility Overview: The admittance requirements at City, University of London vary depending on the subject. There are, however, some criteria that are universal throughout all courses. Applicants can consult the course pages or contact the university for specific course prerequisites.Courses for undergraduates include:The entry criterion for undergraduate courses is a minimum of two A-level or equivalent passes, as well as the fulfilment of various specific course prerequisites. All undergraduate applications, both domestic and international, must be submitted through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service).Postgraduate programmes include:Applicants for City's postgraduate programmes should generally have a university Honours degree or comparable qualification in a relevant subject. Applicants without an Honours degree or equivalent may be accepted for a Masters or Postgraduate Diploma provided they have appropriate experience and/or professional qualifications. Furthermore, the university accepts a number of pre-Masters programmes, including those offered by Kaplan International College London and INTO City, University of London.Most postgraduate degree applications are submitted using a dedicated online mechanism to City (typically to the individual department that runs the course). Please consult the City's individual course pages for more information.Language requirements in English:Applicants must show that their ability to comprehend and express themselves in English is sufficient to profit from and fully engage in their degree. Furthermore, as part of the visa application procedure, students who require a student visa must demonstrate their English competence. Each course has its own set of English requirements. As a result, applicants should check individual course pages for specifics on courses that have particular criteria.The English language requirements are as follows:IELTS 6.0 is necessary for undergraduate students (IELTS 6.5 for Business and IELTS 7.0 for Journalism and Law courses)IELTS 6.5 is necessary for postgraduate students (IELTS 7.0 for Business, Journalism and Law courses)
Placement: City University of London's Professional Liaison Unit connects students with firms in the UK for internships, work-based learning, and permanent job opportunities. Graduates of CUL's Cass Business School are among the top five earning Business School graduates in the UK. They make around 50,500 GBP each year on average. According to data from the Higher Education Statistics Agency, the median salary of Mechanical Engineering graduates (B. Sc) from CUL is 16,200 GBP (HESA). The average annual wage for nursing graduates (B. Sc) was reported to be 34,000 GBP.
Accommodation: The institution has ten housing structures or halls. Five are for undergraduates and four are for graduate students.In the residence halls, international students and first-year students are guaranteed a spot.Lift, 24-hour CCTV and security, 24-hour reception, bike storage, laundry, Wi-Fi, mailboxes, community spaces, games and film rooms, yoga rooms, study area, and common room are just a few of the amenities available.A bed, desk, wardrobe, bookcase, desk chair, waste bin, and drawer are among the room's amenities.Students with impairments, medical issues, or special requirements can live on campus.Students can also choose to live off campus in privately owned housing.

Name: University of Lincoln
Overview: Located in Lincoln, England, the University of Lincoln was founded in 1891 and gained the status of a public university in 1992, which was opened by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. Over 165 undergraduate degree courses, 180 postgraduate degree courses, 51 doctoral programs, and postgraduate diplomas and certificate courses are available at the University. Most programs at the university are accredited by the Chartered Management Institute (CMI). The University comprises four colleges: the College of Science, the College of Arts, the College of Social Sciences, and the Lincoln International Business School. The top courses offered at the university are Bachelor of Laws, B.A. Criminology, B.Sc. Chemistry, B.Arch., B.A. Business Management, M.Sc. Computational Physics, M.A. Journalism War and International Human Rights, etc. The fee for courses ranges between GBR 14,000 to 16,000 per year. The University also provides country-based scholarships valued at GBP 5,000 to postgraduate students from different countries. Financial aid available to international students are scholarships, grants, jobs, and graduate fellowships. The University offers various opportunities to help its students develop the skills and qualities employers seek. It has also developed innovative partnerships with various organizations to provide students with career opportunities and networking.
Eligibility Overview: For UG StudentsCandidates must have received at least 70% in their CISCE or CBSE Class 12th (for courses requiring IELTS 6.0).Qualifications at the A-Level level. This varies depending on the course.Depending on the course, candidates need have between 27 and 34 International Baccalaureate (IB) points.For PG StudentsCandidates must hold a bachelor's degree from a recognised Indian (or UK) university with a minimum of 50% marks.English Language Requirements

Name: University of Essex
Overview: The University of Essex was established in 1963 as a public research institution in Essex, England and is a global education pioneer and recipient of gold in the Teaching Excellence Framework or TEF. The institution is among one of eight young university members of the Young Universities for the Future of Europe alliance. The university offers several undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral degrees in various fields, including accounting, journalism and human rights, management biochemistry, etc. Some top programs at the University of Essex are LLB in Law, M.A. in Audiovisual and Literary Translation, and M.A. in Writing. Besides, the university has partnerships with more than 300 institutes spread across the globe. The average tuition fee at the University of Essex is 12,950 GBP. International students are awarded national scholarships on a merit basis. The University of Essex has a massive population of International students.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate:Most undergraduate bachelor's degree programmes will account for an average of 60% of the best four subjects from Indian high school diplomas. You will not generally need a separate English language test score if you get 70% in English from a CBSE or CISCE exam board qualification. Postgraduate Taught:Most Postgraduate Taught Masters will consider applicants with a Bachelor's degree with a 50 per cent or 5.3/10 from a Band 1 or Band 2 university and a 55 per cent or 5.8/10 from all other schools. Postgraduate Research:Most PhD programmes demand an undergraduate degree equivalent to a UK 2:2 and a master's degree with a good grade, as well as a well-developed research proposal in a topic where we can provide supervision. English Requirements:

Placement: You are responsible for your placement opportunities, but the Placement staff and your Department will be there to support and assist you throughout the process. They can help you with CVs, applications, and interview methods, among other things. Contact the Placements Team at placements@essex.ac.uk for more information.Many large corporations and organisations advertise work placements with good development possibilities around the country, and many small and medium-sized businesses (SMEs) are also increasingly hiring placement students.The following are examples of different sorts of placements: A placement year (equivalent to a year of academic study, completed between the penultimate and final years of your undergraduate programme) contributes toward your degreeTermly assignments (equal to a 12- to 15-week academic term that might be part-time or coupled with academic studies) may be appropriate for specific modules in your degreeExtracurricular vacation placements/internships (short-term positions conducted during vacations) that do not count toward your degree but provide a good experienceInitiatives (negotiated pieces of work, either group-based or individual, usually carried out in the third year of undergraduate study) Average Salaries:

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: The university provides on-campus housing to all first-year undergraduate and postgraduate students at two of its locations, the Colchester Campus and the Southend Campus.International students are given award-winning student housing around the country.Accommodation for first-year students and their partners is not guaranteed.It offers a variety of lodging alternatives, including single-gender flats, twin sharing rooms, shared and self-contained lodging, and short-term vacation lodging with self-catered options.North Towers, Wolfson Court, The Meadows, University Quays, and other residence homes are offered on the Colchester campus.Laundry facilities, a gym, cabled and wireless internet access, a kitchen, a microwave, mattresses, chairs, and other amenities are available in student accommodation.For more, visit: Off-Campus Accommodation: The Students' Union offers SU Homes, a property-finding service that specialises in assisting students in finding local, private housing. Rooms in shared houses, resident landlords, letting a complete property, and purpose-built student housing are all possibilities. SU Homes does not charge any administrative costs, and your money is maintained in a government-approved deposit plan. Colchester Borough Council has recognised all of the properties they operate within Colchester. Before granting a tenancy agreement in private housing, all landlords must verify that your immigration status allows you to rent in the UK. Finding a place to live might be difficult, but it's also exhilarating to be self-sufficient and live with your friends, taking advantage of the chances that await you. The goal of the university is to make the process of selecting a house as simple as possible. From locating the property that will become your home to signing the contract and moving in, University can assist you at every step of the way. For more, visit.

Name: KAPLAN International College London
Overview: Kaplan International College London is within a short distance from London Bridge station. Students can opt for a pathway course at this institution to prepare them for a university degree. This college offers several options for studying undergraduate and postgraduate pathway courses. Students who have completed their high school but do not meet the university entry requirements can opt for the Undergraduate Foundation certificate at this institution. This will help them get an entry to an undergraduate degree. The Undergraduate International Year One option is for those who have completed high school with good grades but still don’t qualify for a UG degree. This option combines university preparation with a 1st-year degree. The Undergraduate: International Year One with Internship programme is an integrated course offering valuable work experience and helping students develop important soft skills and overall employability. This institution offers a Postgraduate: Pre-Master’s programme for those holding a bachelor’s degree or equivalent but who do not meet the entry requirements for a master’s. There is also a pre-doctorate course at KIC London for students willing to study for a doctoral degree in the United Kingdom. Depending on the varied nature of a student’s research interest, this course provides immense help to the students. The partner universities of KIC London include Cranfield University, Queen Mary University of London, University of Bristol, University of Birmingham, University of York, University of Westminster and City, and the University of London. The University Placement Service of Kaplan International College London guarantees a spot at a UK university to students who pass the pathway course but don’t meet their chosen degree’s progression requirements.

Name: London College of communication
Overview: The London College of Communication is a part of the London University of Arts. This highly reputed college offers courses in media, including graphic design, animation, film, sound arts, advertising, and photography. Courses are available at the postgraduate, graduate, and undergraduate levels.The college has approximately 5000 students spread across three schools on the Elephant and Castle campus. These are screen, digital, and media schools. Having been known under various names, the college received its current title in 2003.London College of Communication offers immense opportunities for students at every level. Besides teaching the latest techniques and methods, the college also ensures you have ample opportunity to refine your skills in the newsrooms, galleries, darkrooms, and studios. Most college students contribute significantly as broadcasters, journalists, photographers, designers, and filmmakers. It is common for students to be commissioned to prestigious projects in companies like Nokia, Nike, and the National Trust.Apart from its famous and well-received courses, the college is known for its cutting-edge workshops, studios, and digital facilities. The college’s best-known alums include Paul Anderson, John Lloyd, Martin Brunt, Althea McNish, Charles Saatchi, and Sukumar Ray.Tuition fees for undergraduate courses for international students: £23,610. UAL's Colleges and Institutes offer full-time, part-time, or online taught master's programmes tuition fee remission of £5,000.

Name: University of Buckingham - Main Campus
Overview: Founded in 1973 as a university college, raised to university status in 1983. During its foundation, Margaret Thatcher played the overseer's role and later helped give it the university status. The institution is a non-profit private institution located in Buckingham in the United Kingdom. It offers both undergraduate and postgraduate courses as well as research degrees. Courses at the University of Buckingham – Main Campus include bachelors, masters and PhD. Disciplines available at the institution include Social Sciences, Law, Life Sciences, Business and Economics, Psychology, Computer Science, Social Science, Clinical Pre-Clinical and Health and Arts and Humanities. From the available courses, most sorted courses at the university are MSc in Applied Computing, MSc in Accounting and Finance, MBA, Master of Surgery, MA United Nation Studies, MA Security and Intelligence Studies, MA Biography, MA Philosophy by Research, MSc (Research) in Cyberpsychology and others. The fee structure at the University of Buckingham varies with courses. For example, in BSc in Biomedical Sciences, the total fee for an international student is £41,746, whereas, for domestic students, it is £27,831. Similarly, for MBA, the full-time fee for international students is £18,976, and for UK candidates, it is £12,650. Out of the total students at the University of Buckingham, 34% are international students. The Female to Male ratio at the university is 53:47, with 18.9 students per staff. The university also offers financial aid for deserving students. These aids might also be available as per the availability. Furthermore, the student:academic staff ratio at the university is 10.5:1. Thus, with a small class size, the University of Buckingham – Main Campus provides a range of courses for its students. Some of its notable alumni are Brandon Lewis, Graham Ross, Abimbola Craig, Darren Henley and others.

Name: Architectural Association School of Architecture
Overview: The Architectural Association School of Architecture in London, England, was established in 1847. The public institute is the oldest architecture school in the UK and has an urban campus in Bedford Square, London and a satellite campus in Hooke Park, which spreads over 350 acres. AA is an independent school and doesn't follow the state-funded university system, therefore avoiding university rankings. Undergraduate programs in the form of a Diploma are offered, consisting of a Foundation Course of one year and 5-year courses in Architecture. The school also has 11 postgraduate programs in various areas like Housing and Urbanism, Landscape Urbanism, Environmental Design, Emergent Technologies, Master of Architecture, Master of Arts and Master of Fine Arts. Day-release courses like garden conservation, environmental access and building conservation are also popular. Programs like Projective Cities and Interprofessional studio have recently been added to the curriculum. Being one of the top architecture schools globally, AA graduates get well-paid jobs with an average annual package of 45,595 GBP.On-campus accommodation is not provided to students, but housing advice through the University of London Housing Services about the nearby, relevant housing options is offered. The college has its publications, which have a vast collection of architectural literature, and publishes artists, AA Files and the AA Book.The average tuition fee for foundation and diploma courses is 22,000 GBP and ranges from 26,896 GBP to 36,540 GBP for postgraduate programs. Merit and need-based scholarships like AA Scholarships and Mark Fisher Scholarship are awarded to provide financial aid.
Eligibility Overview: The AA is interested in hearing from students who can show initiative in engaging in the extremely public forms of presentation, discussion, and debate that pervade the AA School, the architectural community, and the rest of the world. We're searching for self-motivated students with the desire and determination to carve out their own path through a school that promotes a variety of teaching methods and objectives.The AA is the UK's oldest independent architectural school and is a private Higher Education Institution (HEI). Because the AA is not a member of UCAS, all applications must be submitted directly to the school. For all prospective students, the method is the same.
Placement: In 1847, the Architectural Association was established. The AA is administered by its members and is dedicated to achieving public benefit through architectural learning, teaching, discussion, and promotion. The AA School is the heart of the AA, with 850 students and employees. Many of the world's finest architects, academics, critics, and educators have graduated from the school, making it a global leader in architectural education. For more over 160 years, the Architectural Association School of Architecture has retained its independence.
Accommodation: The AA does not have its own housing, but it does provide students with a housing service beginning in September. During this time, an AA student is present to answer questions about costs and location, and the Accommodation Office usually has a number of options.The Hooke Park location in Dorset is used for sustainability and woodworking research, and a small number of students has been permitted to live and study there since 2010.

Name: Regents University, London
Overview: Established in 1849, Regent's University in London is a cosmopolitan university, occupying a rich and diverse history and a long practice of education and achievements. The university is situated near Regent's Park which spans 410 acres and includes a lake and canal. Regent's faculties are known for their significant research and published work. Annually, the university enrols 7000+ students belonging to over 170 countries. The university offers 63 undergraduate certificate programs, 19 postgraduate diplomas, and certified programs. The programs offered by the University are categorized under Business and Management, Fashion and Design, Creative Arts, Liberal Arts and Humanities, Psychotherapy, and Social Science. The university also provides full-time, short courses, and foundation courses. Some of the top programs offered by the university in undergraduate classes are BA in global management, acting for stage and screen, fashion marketing, and film & screen. And postgraduate courses in MSc. Marketing and Analytics, MSc. Finance and Administration, MA International Business, and MA International Fashion Marketing. Regents' university provides decent on-campus placement opportunities and offers internship programs to prepare students for competitive interviews and professional setups. There are on-campus and private accommodations to ensure a secure and convenient stay in London. The hostel expenses per year of the university are around EUR 5,460. The fees of the course offered at Regents University range from EUR 14,000-25,000. The university provides various options to avail scholarships, loans, bursaries, and rewards to international students.

Name: Roehampton University
Overview: The University of Roehampton is a public university located in Roehampton, London. The university was officially renamed Roehampton University in 2004. The university has four colleges: Whitelands College, Digby Stuart College, Southlands College, and Froebel College.The university offers more than 100 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs. The best programs at the University of Roehampton include BSc in Anthropology, MFA in Dance, and MSc in Global Finance Management. The average tuition fee for international students varies between GBP 12,500 and GBP 14,500, depending on the course and duration. Faculty members are happy to teach interactive courses encouraging students to think critically and get the most out of their studies. In addition, the university has its own Careers Team that provides individualized, in-depth career advice and coaching. Within six months of graduation, 92% of Roehampton alums were employed or enrolled in further education.
Eligibility Overview: The university accepts applications from academically qualified students from all over the world. EU and international candidates must provide numerous supporting papers in addition to a comprehensive application. Academic qualifications (certificate and transcript), a legitimate English language qualification, a personal statement, and two references are frequently included. English language Proficiency requirements are :

Placement: The University of Roehampton's Careers Team assists students, and alumni members find suitable employment opportunities. The Careers team also provides access to the online job portal Career-Link, CV help, and organizes career events and workshops.  Graduates from the University of Roehampton earn between $49,000 and $57,000 USD per year, depending on their major.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation :  The university has various on-campus housing options for undergraduate and postgraduate students, with rooms available for both new and existing students. The facilities provided are as follows :  Some of the greatest value and most economical options in London may be found in the halls of residenceAll of the private and secure rooms are located on campus, with 24-hour security and a variety of catering outlets and businesses at school and in the surrounding areaWhen students apply, dedicated housing staff will assist them in finding what they desire, providing advice and assistance as well as assisting them in settling inWhen the applicants join, the pleasant College staff, which includes dedicated wardens and flat reps, will care about themIdeally located in south-west London, near Putney and Clapham, and with easy access to central LondonThe university has a free, dedicated student bus service to Barnes Station and Wimbledon, as well as bike storage and e-bike rentals on-site Off-Campus Accommodation :  Many existing students (those in their second and subsequent years) reside off-campus. A large range of student-friendly housing is available for rent near Roehampton University. The list of properties is available online, and it only includes listings from reputable landlords who have adhered to the University's code of conduct. Off-Campus Accommodation Officers can assist the applicant in locating housing and resolving any concerns that arise before or during the tenancy. For more information, visit: https://www.roehampton.ac.uk/accommodation/off-campus/
Course Ranking: Let's now discuss the University of Roehampton's course rankings! Since 2017, Roehampton has consistently been among the top 100 universities in The Complete University Guide's Accounting & Finance Ranking. However, it has gradually slipped Roehampton's position in its Business & Management Studies ranking from 84th rank in 2018 to 105th rank in 2021. Let's examine the ranking offered by The Guardian, a significant UK publisher. Since 2018, it has positioned Roehampton among the top 100 universities in the UK in its Accounting & Finance Rankings. The Guardian's ranking for business, management, and marketing has similarly gradually slipped Roehampton, dropping it from 71st in 2018 to 116th in 2021. The statistics above show how well-liked in the UK the accounting and finance programmes offered by the University of Roehampton are.

While Roehampton's ranking in The Guardian has gradually dropped from 90th in 2017 to 116th in 2021. Name: University of Creative Arts London
Overview: Established in 2005, the University of Creative Arts is a public arts and design university located in Canterbury, London. This university is one of the top 40 institutions in England. It welcomes international students from around 91 countries across the world. The University of Creative Arts provides various undergraduate, graduate, and postgraduate courses. MA in Animation, BA in Computer Animation and Arts, B.Sc. in Creative Computing, and MA in Games Design are some of the university's top courses. The university has 4 campuses in Epsom, Rochester, Farnham, and Canterbury. The Canterbury campus is the main campus located very near the city center. Around 97% of the University of Creative Arts students are employed within six months of graduation in reputed companies. They earn an average salary of 18,000 GBP.The University of Creative Arts also offers on-campus accommodation to its students in the eight residential halls. However, the students can also opt for off-campus accommodation depending on their budget. The university offers scholarships and financial aid to its international students. The International Foundation in Art, Design, and Media is the costliest course in the university, with an average cost of attendance being 19,000 GBP. Elfriede Windsor Scholarship, Sir Ray Tindle Scholarship, and Nick Jack Scholarship are some of the university's financial aid. The students can apply for such scholarships after reading the terms and conditions.
Eligibility Overview: Academic prerequisites:We normally require the following qualifications for our International Foundation in Art, Design, and Media:Indian HSC/Standard XII with a 50 percent or better overall average (all boards including CBSE and CISCE).We normally require one of the following qualifications for our Bachelor's programmes:HSC/Standard XII in India with a 60 percent or above total average (all boards including CBSE and CISCE).A transcript from a recognized Indian university demonstrating satisfactory completion of Year 1 of a Bachelor's degree.We normally require the following qualifications for our Master's programs:Completion of a Bachelor's degree (minimum three years) from a recognized university with a grade of 55 percent.We require the equivalent of a UK 2:1 Honours degree in Architecture for the MArch. At the time of application, the exact grade required will be confirmed.Language requirements in English: IELTS scores of at least 6.5 are necessary. Please see this page for the minimum requirements for your course.ORA minimum of 70% in English is required in Indian Standard XII from a NARIC recognized board (excluding Punjab or Haryana boards).A UCA-approved English test is required for research degrees. Undergraduate Admissions at the University for the Creative ArtsUndergraduate degrees in business, creative education, fashion and textiles, media and journalism, architecture and interior design, and other fields are available at the University for the Creative Arts. The university has set particular dates and application procedures for both domestic and international undergraduate applicants.Requirements for Admission:The institution's official academic transcripts, certificates, or grade recordsDocumentation of work experience based on the degree programme chosen Visa to study in the United KingdomCertificate of Health InsuranceGoals and ObjectivesGraduate Admissions at the University for the Creative ArtsStudents from all around the country and the world can earn graduate degrees in subjects including Business Administration, Graphic Design, Digital Media, and Fashion Business and Management at the institute. An honours degree or comparable qualification in the topic or a related discipline is required for the programmes.Requirements for Admission:Transcripts AuthenticatedPortfolioCV/ResumeExperiential LearningInterview for AdmissionGoals and ObjectivesRecommendation Letter
Placement: Placements at the University for the Creative ArtsWithin six months of graduation, 96.9% of graduates from the University for the Creative Arts are employed. Graduates earn an average of 18,000 GBP per year. Students receive career services from the university three years after graduation. Companies such as Burberry, Michael Kors, Pandora, L'Oreal, and Urban Outfitters have approached the University about hiring graduates from its business school.The university's Career and Employability office assists students by setting up appointments, attending lectures, workshops, and events, and publishing job openings, among other things.

Name: Birkbeck, University of London
Overview: Birkbeck, University of London, is a public exploration college in London. The university offers over 150 MA, MSc, and master's in law courses, most of which are tutored degrees. Additionally, they also provide research degrees. The cost of tuition for bachelor's and master's programs is around EUR 14,280-18,780 per annum for international students. The on-campus accommodation expenses per month are about EUR 800-1,600. The university provides postgraduate financial support and Ph.D. funding through student scholarships.The university has a professional recruitment service linking students and graduates with top UK employers, allowing them to gain valuable work experience.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsAdmission to degree programmes requires that applicants be at least 18 years old.The entry requirements for all courses can be found in the online course listings.If you have recently completed a qualification with a UCAS tariff equivalence, you will get a UCAS tariff score (including A-levels, IB, GNVQs and BTEC programmes). Name: The University of Edinburgh
Overview: Located in Edinburgh, UK, the University of Edinburgh is an open university founded in 1582. It is the sixth oldest university in Scotland. The university was established as the Tounis College, but later on the name changed to the University of Edinburgh. It is known to be the fourth Scottish University which was established by the Royal Charter. Currently, it is one of the best open universities in Scotland. The University of Edinburgh is home to more than 44,000 students and over 4,500 faculty members. The university is divided into three colleges, namely, College of Medicine and Veterinary Medicine, College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Science, and College of Science and Engineering. This university is also known for offering not only offline courses but also around 70 online courses. The courses offered at the university include 300 master's degrees and 180 research degrees. The University of Edinburgh consists of five major campuses, which include Western General, King's Building, Easter Bush, Central area, and Bio Quarter. The Central area campus is considered to be the oldest site. The university students get enrolled in various fields, including humanities, healthcare, arts, social science, veterinary, engineering, chemistry, physics, management, medicine, and many more. MBA, M.Sc in Management, M.Sc in Finance, MBChB in Medicine, and BEng in Chemical Engineering are some of the university's top courses. This university is a member of the Coimbra Group, Russell Group, and the LER Universities. Therefore, the students get ample opportunities to work with the professional members of the group and gain some knowledge in that field. The university provides on-campus accommodation. However, the student can also opt for off-campus accommodation. The University of Edinburgh has got great placement opportunities. Bill Gates, A.P.J Abdul Kalam, and Neil Armstrong are some of the notable alumni of this university.

Name: University of Leeds
Overview: The University of Leeds was established in 1904 as part of the Russell Group of universities, a public research university in West Yorkshire. The student community of over 39,000 is comprised of 27,000 undergraduates and 11,000 postgraduates (36,000 full-time and 2,000 part-time students). The University of Leeds campus spans over 100 acres and houses four libraries; the Laidlaw Library, Brotherton Library, Health Sciences Library, and Edward Boyle Library. Student housing is available for undergraduates and postgraduates. They can live in flats, suites, and studios, all fully equipped and near the campus. Some on-campus residences are Lupton Residences, Central Village, Grayson Heights, and Lyddon Hall. The 300+ student clubs and organizations allow students to engage in extracurricular activities. At the same time, The Edge sports center is equipped with courts, a swimming pool, and a climbing wall for physical activity. There are numerous eating joints on and around campus, including the Refectory, Hugo, and Common Ground.International students can pursue degrees such as BA, BSc, MA, MBA, and LLM in Environment and Business, Classical Civilization, Fashion Marketing, International Business Law, and Gender Studies.The estimated undergraduate fees for UK and non-UK EU students are GBP 9,250, while the cost for international students depends upon the course taken. Financial aid for UK/EU and international students is available through scholarships, loans, and bursaries in Leeds Financial Support, Cash Awards, Means-tested Scholarships, and plus Programme.

Name: Brunel University London
Overview: Located in the Uxbridge town, west London, Brunel University is a public research university founded in 1966. The name of the university was derived from the name of a Victorian engineer, Isambard Kingdom Brunel. The university enrolls more than 11,000 students, including around 5000 international students from different parts of the world. They also have a great team of a faculty member of around 1500. This university is known to provide more than 200 study programs to students in the field of Journalism, Digital Media, Civil Engineering, Sociology, Law, Anthropology, Design, History, and so on. Brunel University offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral courses through three colleges: Arts and social sciences, Engineering, Design, and Physical Sciences, Health & Life Sciences. M.Sc in Data Science and Analytics, M.Sc in Engineering Management, MBA in Healthcare Management, M.Sc in Finance and Accounting, B.Sc in Computer Science, and Law LLB are some of the top courses that are offered by the university. The university is also known for offering various scholarships and financial aids to international students. Some of which includes Commonwealth Shared Scholarship, International Excellence Scholarship, College of Engineering, Design, Physical Sciences Academic Excellence, and many more. This university provides on-campus accommodations to its students in its 33 residential halls. The rooms include all the facilities that are needed by a student. However, the students can also opt for off-campus housing with the help of Brunel Students Letting. The average living cost, including the tuition fees, placement fee, and additional cost, is approximately 28,830 GBP. Brunel University is also known for offering excellent placement opportunities to its students. Around 95% of the courses come with scope for placement. In addition, Heathrow Airport, Telefonica Europe, Network Rail, Tata Beverages, and many more companies offer jobs and internship opportunities to the students. Most Brunel University graduates receive an average annual salary of 34,000 GBP.
Eligibility Overview: The admission criteria for most foreign qualifications can be found in a dropdown box on each course page. Before you can register at Brunel, you'll need to give your complete official transcript and certificate. These documents must be provided before we may give your CAS to students who require a visa to study in the United Kingdom. You can upload the documents as part of your application if you have previously completed the qualification. If you are still working on your qualification, simply include an interim transcript with your application and provide the entire paperwork after you have completed it.As part of their application to Brunel, all applicants must demonstrate their ability to communicate in English. We accept a wide variety of English language credentials, and the particular prerequisites for each course are listed on the course page. We can accept an academic qualification as evidence of your English Language proficiency in place of an English Language test in some countries; check what qualifications and grades are acceptable by selecting your nation.
Accommodation: for on and off campus information click on this link-https://www.brunel.ac.uk/life/accommodation

Name: Staffordshire University
Overview: Staffordshire University, a public research university located in Staffordshire, England, is highly noted for its science departments. It is a government university affiliated with MillionPlus, the Association of Commonwealth Universities and Universities of the UK. The university provides various undergraduate, postgraduate, professional and distance learning programmes. In addition, six departments offer various professional courses. In partnership with listed colleges in George Town, Penang and Malaysia, the university students can complete a part of their studies at this university and the other in the listed college. Some of the preferred majors are in the field of computers, psychology, and MBA. The overall fee structure in this university comes to around 10,900 GBP. The university provides various funds and allowances like Exceptional Learning Support Fund, the Hardship Fund, and the Student Experience Fund to assist students financially. The students engage in annual varsity matches organised by the Student Union.The university owns Unitemps, the official recruiting agency, through which various businesses recruit students from the university. The university offers short-term shift employment and internships, of which 90% of students are recruited as full-time employers.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: A minimum grade point average of 65 per cent or higher in grade 12A score of at least 28 points in IBCompletion of an international foundation year from a UK institution that is relevant Postgraduate: Courses that require a 2:1 degree: Students must have a first-class degree and a minimum GPA of 6.5 on a 10-point scale, or 60 per cent, to qualify Courses that require a 2:2 degree: Students must have a second-class degree and a minimum GPA of 6.0 on a 10-point scale, or 55.5 per cent, to qualify English Requirements:

Name: Nottingham Trent University
Overview: Nottingham Trent University is a public research university located in Nottingham, England. Its first college, the Nottingham Government School of Design, was established in 1843. Since then, it has grown to become the 9th largest university in the United Kingdom. The university has three colleges: College of Business, Law and Social Sciences, College of Art, Architecture, Design and Humanities, and College of Science and Technology.They are further divided into ten schools, offering 393 undergraduate and 416 graduate courses. The best courses at Nottingham Trent University include LLM in Law (General), MFA in Fine Art, and Masters in Architecture (M.Arch). The average cost of tuition at Nottingham Trent University comes to GBP 13,450 per annum for international students.

Name: University of Law - London Moorgate
Overview: Established in 1962, the University of Law gained its university status in 2012 and is the largest law school in the UK. The university is a for-profit private institution in the UK. Located at 15 locations in the UK and Hong Kong, the University of Law at London Moorgate is a recently refurbished campus. University of Law, London Moorgate offers undergraduate, postgraduate, SQE, and online courses. The primary aim of the institution is to provide education based on a realistic and contemporary context. The campus is located near the train stations and underground stations.  For undergraduates, the University of Law offers courses in Law and Business. A few of the most sorted undergraduate courses are LLB Law, LLB Law with Criminology, LLB Law Senior Status, LLB Law Business, BA Business Management, BSc Business Management, BSc Finance and Accounting, BSc Business Management with Law, and others.  Similar to the undergraduate degree, post-graduation is offered in both Law and Business disciplines. Popular postgraduate courses at The University of Law include Executive LLM, LLM Corporate Governance, LLM Master of Laws (General), MSc Legal Technology, Graduate Diploma in Law, MSc Business Intelligence and Analytics, MBA leadership, MSc Digital Marketing, MSc Digital Sales and Management, MSc International Marketing and others. The University of Law has partnered with several institutions from America and the Caribbean, South Asia, Africa, the EU, and Wider Europe, East Asia, and Southeast Asia. University of Law - London Moorgate is equipped with several facilities like Library, Wi-Fi, Legal Tech Hub, Café, a Counselling service, and others. The University of Law - London Moorgate has qualified tutors, with 90% of the teachers being experienced lawyers. It has received five stars from the QS World University Rankings, with 94% of the students employed after 15 months of graduation.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility requirements an applicant must attain in order to be considered for admission are as follows : For Undergraduate Students :  Only the Birmingham, Bristol, Guildford, Leeds, London Bloomsbury, Manchester, and Nottingham campuses are open to 17-year-olds.There are several courses which the university offers with different eligibility requirements. For Postgraduate Students :  Each of the postgraduate programmes has its own set of admissions requirements. English Language Proficiency :  Most programmes IELTS score required is 6.5 overall with no bands below 6.0Certain programmes demand a score of 7.0 overall with no bands below 6.5
Placement: According to QS, the University is a five-star university in terms of teaching, employability, online learning, academic development, and inclusiveness. The courses, in conjunction with the experienced Employability Service, seek to help the students become employable, ensuring that the employment goal is ingrained in the teaching. Experts are accessible to help you at any time with career planning, applications, CVs, cover letters, and anything else they might require help with. The Employability Service staff will assist the students in search for internships, part-time jobs, volunteer opportunities, and graduate positions. They can count on the expert Employability Services team to assist them with everything from work experience opportunities to skill development guidance. The students can schedule appointments with the career counsellors on campus or over the phone for support and advice. Law :  The University provides several services to assist students. The students get their careers off to the best start, whether it's career information from the Student and Professional Employability Programmes, a one-on-one interview with a career adviser, practical legal experience through the pro bono activities, coaching, or simply scanning the vacancy database for a job. Business :  The personnel of the University of Law Business School does more than only assist students in finding a career as a business graduate. They train pupils for a business career. And you should continue to encourage the pupils throughout their careers. Regardless of their background or education, whether they study full-time or part-time, on-campus or online, whether they're looking for their first business graduate job, a career change, or to advance in their current position, the University has the skills, services, and passion for helping them achieve their goals.

Name: Loughborough University London
Overview: The Loughborough University London is a university located in London, UK. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Engineering. The main campus of Loughborough University London is located in London. The university offers undergraduate programs and postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses.  Loughborough University London offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Name: University College London
Overview: University College London is a public research institute in London, United Kingdom. With an enrollment of 42,000 students from over 150 countries and the University also has a faculty of 13,000 members. Prospective students can choose from 400 undergraduate and numerous postgraduate research and teacher training programs taught by 11 faculties (Laws, Life Sciences, Arts & Humanities etc.). There are course-specific requirements like GRE scores, GMAT scores, IELTS/TOEFL scores and more. A candidate's GPA will also need to meet university's standards to get admission.The undergraduate tuition fee is GBP 9,250 for UK students. Students can apply for financial aid like bursaries, scholarships, grants and loans like Maintenance loans and grants, William D. Ford Federal Direct Loan Program, Postgraduate Master's Loan etc. There are 26 residence halls (catered and self-catered accommodation) for undergraduates and postgraduates; singles, doubles, studios, flats etc., are available. Langton Close, New Hall, Garden Halls and Prankerd House are some residences. Over 300 student societies provide a chance to participate in cultural, artistic, sports, religious, academic and other activities. According to placement records, UCL postgraduate students earn a median salary of GBP 30,000, and research students earn GBP 39,000.

Name: University of Law - Chester
Overview: One of the longest-established specialist providers of legal education in the United Kingdom, University of Law traces its origins back to 1876. The University of Law Chester campus is only 10 minutes from the city centre of Chester in the heart of the North West of England. It is based inside a multi-million pound Queen’s Park site of the University of Chester. Students at University of Law Chester campus have an Associate Student status at the Student’s Union of the University of Chester. This implies that these students can use their facilities and join in with their societies. This campus is set in 14 acres of beautiful parkland and is characterised by facilities such as free Wi-fi, a library, a free counsellor, etc. The average cost of tuition payable per year by this institute’s students lies somewhere between £11,000 and £11,500.00. Summing this up with the cost of living applicable per year, students need to pay an estimated total University of Law fee between £23,000 and £23,600. Selected individuals pursuing their studies in postgraduate law at this campus and demonstrating academic promise, are committed to the legal profession and require financial help can avail the Rice-Jones Scholarship. This institute received 5 stars this year in QS World University Rankings overall and for the subject of Law. It was also awarded 5 stars in Teaching, Academic Development, Employability, Online Learning, and Inclusiveness. As per 2018/19 Graduate Outcomes data, about 94% of postgraduate students got employed in Highly Skilled Occupations 15 months after their graduation. This institute runs a vast and varied legal Pro Bono programme which extends more than 3,700 opportunities every year. This enables students to put the learned skills into practice and gain experience.

Name: University of Aberystwyth
Overview: Established in 1872, the University of Aberystwyth is a public research university located in the urban city of Aberystwyth in Wales in the United Kingdom. The University has three campuses. The main campus is in Penglais Hill, and the other two campuses are in Llanbadarn and Gogerddan. They offer a bachelor's degree, a master's degree, pre-professional courses, single honours, integrated master's degrees, certificate programs, and many more. Students can undertake these courses full-time or part-time or even opt for distance learning. They also offer free UG and PG courses in Arts and Design, Creative Writing, Photography, and Philosophy. The University of Aberystwyth has three academic faculties and 17 departments. Some famous courses in this University are politics, biology, computer science, agriculture, business, science, social studies, health, medicine, and MBA. 92% of the students are either employed or are studying further after graduating from this University. International students are also offered on-campus part-time jobs.Students are offered seven residence halls with options like studios, studio flats, standard bedrooms, and apartments for accommodation. The cost of living is comparatively lower than in other cities. Accommodation costs for living on-campus will come to around 3,721 - 6,360 GBP. An average tuition fee may come somewhere between 13,600 and 16,800 GBP. International students can claim scholarships like International Excellence Scholarships, Chevening Scholarships, and Commonwealth Scholarships. The University of Aberystwyth has been awarded a Gold Rating from Teaching Excellence Framework for its quality of teaching.

Name: Swansea University
Overview: Swansea University is a research-driven institution that has contributed since 1920. It is a renowned academic institution of the highest calibre, ranked among the top 25 and 300 universities worldwide and among the top 30 universities in the United Kingdom (Times Higher Education Rankings 2020). In addition to winning a gold medal from the national Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) for its outstanding teaching and learning outcomes, the institution was named the Welsh University of the Year for 2019 and 2020. This university is among the top 10 in the UK for graduate employability (Destination of Leavers from Higher Education 2018).One of the UK's most research-intensive universities, Swansea University, has seen a 70% growth in research income during the past ten years. On its Singleton Park and Bay campuses, the university has eight colleges: the Swansea University Medical School, the College of Science, the Hillary Rodham Clinton School of Law, the College of Human and Health Sciences, and the College of Arts and Humanities.Swansea University has earned the endorsement of numerous organisations, including the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants, Chartered Financial Analyst Institute, British Computer Society (BCS), British Psychological Society (BPS), Chartered Institute of Management Accountants, Royal Aeronautical Society, Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC), Bar Council of India, and Solicitors Regulation Authority.

Course Description: Swansea University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Swansea University was founded in 1920. Located in Swansea,UK the university is home to about 4075 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Swansea University is ranked 464th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 1 undergraduate and 7 postgraduate programs. Swansea University has 2 intakes in Sep, Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Swansea University is around GBP 9000  Approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Swansea University include Loughborough University Alumni Bursary School Of Business,Teesside University Global Scholarship,Rhodes Scholarships at Oxford University for International Students,Media Communication Head Of School Masters Scholarship.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Swansea University is the post-study work opportunities in UK. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Swansea University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of Sussex, Falmer (STUDY GROUP)
Overview: Founded in 1962 and situated at Falmer on the outskirts of Brighton, the University of Sussex, Falmer is a research university offering students to learn from some of the recognised and erudite professors in the UK. Students can opt for an on-campus programme or start from virtual learning. Aspiring students willing to be admitted to this university can choose from a wide range of flexible courses, including more than 500 undergraduate and post-graduate programmes. With more than 5,600 international students from more than 165 countries, the University of Sussex offersthis institution offers over 2,000 scholarship programmes for master's degree applicants and 10+ scholarship programmes for PhD students. Besides, there are 23 PGCE programs for master's degrees and three placement and sandwich degrees.Over these years, these scholarships are customised so that the students are recognised for their unmatched academic skills. A substantial portion of the scholarship covers approximately 50% reduction of tuition fees for undergraduate and postgraduate applicants.Also, this university is well-known for its humanities, social science courses, etc., and maintains 12 research groups and schools. Students can change their chosen degrees during the pathway program assisted by expert professionals. With an acceptance rate of nearly 83%, wherein around 5,700 aspiring students have secured admission, this university offers 500 undergraduate, post-graduate, and PhD courses. According to the Research Excellence Programme, approximately 75% of research activities are considered ‘leading and internationally excellent.
Eligibility Overview: Sussex has academic requirements that are unique to the country. For Indian students, the following are the prerequisites for any UG programme:The following Indian Higher Secondary Certificates are recognised, with an average score of 80% in Grade 12:ISC (Indian School Certificate of Education) is an acronym for Indian School Certificate of Education (CISCE)SSC (Senior School Certificate Examination) is an all-India examination (CBSE)Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC): (Maharashtra)Depending on the course, the university offers two levels of English: standard and advanced. Most degrees have a standard requirement, however the Social Work BA and Primary and Early Years Education (with Qualified Teacher Status) BA have an advanced requirement.The following are the minimum scoring requirements for the two levels:

Placement: The university's online job search tool, CareerHub, assists students in finding placement and internship opportunities. EY, Ola UK, American Express, UN World Food Programme, BBC, Ford, Deloitte, Jaguar, The Royal Bank of Scotland, Barclays, and others are among the companies that recruit graduates from the University of Sussex.LLM graduates at the University of Sussex earn an average of 92,316 GBP (114,000 USD) per year, according to Emolument. Graduates of the university earn a starting salary of 70,452 GBP (43,000 USD). Financial services graduates are the most paid, with a salary of roughly 62,883 GBP (87,000 USD) each year.
Accommodation: Students can choose from 10 residence halls at the university, including five with en suite facilities and five with shared bathrooms.Bed, mattress (not beddings), wardrobe, mirror, blinds, drawers, chair, desk, shelves, and lamp desk are examples of room furniture.Laundry, social room, fridge, microwave, common areas, security services, Wi-Fi, and other amenities are available.Students who are disabled or physically challenged are given special consideration.

Name: University of Buckingham - London Campus
Overview: Established as the country’s non-profit private university situated in Buckingham, England, the University of Buckingham is the oldest of the country’s five private universities. Initially, it was founded as the University College of Buckingham but later received university status in 1983. This university offers master’s degrees, doctorates, and baccalaureates through five schools. This university is a proud member of the Independent Universities Group. The undergraduate programs of this institution involve nearly 1,315 students and 1205 students under post-graduate programs. Additionally, two widely known research centres are situated within the campus of this university, such as the Centre for Education and Employment and the Centre for Security and Intelligence Studies. Students are offered with multiple job opportunities to work with professionals and obtain practical knowledge regarding their field. The campus comprises more than 100 other nationalities, enhancing the horizon, and students learn essential things from each other. This institution is recognised and awarded with a QAA quality mark for successfully meeting the standards specified by QAA. Besides, the University of Buckingham was felicitated with Gold for first Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF). The students of this university can continuously access job vacancies, e-learning, career opportunities, and tools throughout their university period. This university also has postgraduate programs like postgraduate certificates, short courses, and graduate diplomas. Besides, some of the master's degrees offered here include MSc, MBA, MA, and LLM. In London campus, a different seminar is organized and delivered by experts. Here, students have the exposure to explore various opportunities and topics. This institution also offers multiple Master’s degree programs in London campus in humanities subject as a significant part of Humanities Research institute. As per the Complete University Guide, this university holds a ranking of 115th in the current year.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admission to the University of Buckingham Psychology, business, computing, humanities and social sciences, law, medicine, and health are among the undergraduate degree programmes offered at the University of Buckingham.Requirements for Admission-Transcripts from high schoolOne letter of recommendation from your present or previous schoolStatement of purposea copy of your passportScores on English proficiency testsGraduate Admissions at the University of BuckinghamThe University of Buckingham provides over 100 master's degree programmes, doctorate level programmes, postgraduate certifications, and graduate diplomas in fields such as psychology, business, computing, humanities and social sciences, law, medicine, and health.Requirements for Admission-Transcripts from collegeTwo letters of recommendation from your present or previous college/universityStatement of purposea copy of your passportScores on English proficiency tests
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.During the academic year, students are required to live in or near Buckingham, and unlike some institutions, they are able to provide housing for all incoming students for the first four terms of their studies. Everything is within walking distance, including study and lecture rooms, the library, computers, social facilities, and lodging.On-campus housing information can be found here.http://www.buckingham.ac.uk/life/accommodation

Name: University of Derby
Overview: The University of Derby is a publicly owned institution for research and higher studies in Derby, England, and provides research-oriented educational courses in both online and offline modes. The University of Derby ranks number one in the UK Social Mobility Awards. The university's academic structure is divided into five colleges and different schools. The University of Derby offers over 300 programs in arts, business, humanities, education, science, social sciences, law, engineering, management, public care, health, tourism and hospitality, nursing and natural sciences, and over 100 short online courses to facilitate a flexible learning mode for working professionals.With an acceptance rate of 80%, the university welcomes around 3500 international students from over 100 countries. The cost of studying at the University of Derby is approximately INR 17 Lakhs.The university offers financial aid through university bursaries, alum discounts, Derbyshire bursaries, and other international student scholarships.
Eligibility Overview: The university has a programme, course, and country-specific requirements for international students.  UG Eligibility Requirements:The following are country-specific requirements for Indian applicants:Indian students must achieve a minimum grade point average of 70% in Grade 12A minimum of 75% in English from the CBSE, CICSE, and Maharashtra boards PG Eligibility Requirements:Students must have a bachelor's degree from a NARIC-accredited institution or a government-recognized university. The university accepts the following degrees:Bachelor of Arts/Science (special degree/honours) from a recognized universityBachelor of Education (a four-year integrated programme) from UGC-accredited universitiesA Bachelor of Engineering/Technology (IIT or Tier-1 university or Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore) is required English Language Proficiency Requirements:

Course Ranking: Derby was listed at positions 401–500 in THE's (Times Higher Education) PG Business and Economics ranking for the years 2020 and 2021. In The Complete University Guide's Accounting & Finance Ranking, Derby University has improved significantly. It was ranked 90th in 2018 but has now climbed to 50th in 2021. This demonstrates Derby's success in relation to important ranking criteria such graduate prospects, degree completion, and high honours. The Guardian's Accounting & Finance Rankings have decreased Derby's place from eighth for 2020 to seventy-first for 2021. This illustrates Derby's poor performance according to The Guardian's primary rating criteria. The Guardian for Accounting & Finance Rankings bases a lot of its decisions on factors including the student-staff ratio, admittance requirements, future employment prospects, and value-added services. The University of Derby has been ranked among the top 100 universities in the UK for various engineering degrees by The Complete University Guide and The Guardian. According to the aforementioned statistics, Derby University's engineering, business, and accounting programmes are well-liked in the UK.
University Ranking: The University of Derby is a university located in Derby, Derbyshire, UK, and was established in 1992. Times Higher Education (THE) has regularly placed The University of Derby between 801 and 1000. The University of Derby is in the top 100 universities in the nation, according to major UK publications, when we look at its standing within the UK. Since 2017, Derby has continuously been ranked between 91 and 100 in The Complete University Guide. The University of Derby was placed 99th in its university ranking as of 2021. The Guardian has placed Derby amongst some of the 100 best universities during the previous five years in the UK. The Guardian's university rankings for 2021 show Derby in 56th place, a significant decline of 30 points from the previous year. The University of Derby has not scored well on important ranking criteria such value-added service, career possibilities, student-staff ratio, and admittance standards, as evidenced by this.

Name: University of Law - Manchester
Overview: Established in 1962, the University of Law is primarily a for-profit private university in the UK extending law degrees, professional development courses, and exceptional legal training for the British barristers and solicitors. It is considered the UK’s largest law school. This university has nine campuses, and one of them is in Manchester. In addition, this university has an international branch in Hong Kong. This university aims to impart knowledge to the students in a realistic and contemporary manner involving interactive engagement and practical ideas. The practice-based training of this university offers a wide range of career options and the university’s legal database. In addition, students of this university can explore a vibrant social life as significant members of the Student Association. They can join the Student Association Events Committee, delve into new programs, and enjoy activities including sports, dancing, theatre, and quizzes. At the University of Law, approximately 8,000 students are enrolled. Among these students, nearly 7,000 are registered in post-graduate programmes, while the remaining are enrolled in undergraduate courses. In addition, there are students in this university who come from 120 different nationalities across the world. Besides, the Student Employability programme and Employability Service Team work with the students to increase their employability. Since its establishment, there have been nearly 64,000 alumni, and all are well-established in their respective fields. In addition, large groups and workshops are conducted on the Manchester campus, where students can acquire knowledge collaboratively, making academics more effective and engaging. Besides, the employability service possesses career consultants who can provide suggestions on CVs and application forms and prepare students for different job interviews. Apart from these, selected candidates can avail Rice-Jones Scholarship for a postgraduate law degree at Manchester and Chester campuses.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: For Undergraduate Students :  Only the Birmingham, Bristol, Guildford, Leeds, London Bloomsbury, Manchester, and Nottingham campuses are open to 17-year-olds.There are several courses which the university offers with different eligibility requirements. For Postgraduate Students :  Each of the postgraduate programmes has its own set of admissions requirements. English Language Proficiency :  Most programmes IELTS score required is 6.5 overall with no bands below 6.0Certain programmes demand a score of 7.0 overall with no bands below 6.5
Placement: The courses, in conjunction with the experienced Employability Service, seek to help the students become employable, ensuring that the goal of employment is ingrained in the teaching. The University is a five-star university in terms of education, employability, online learning, academic development, and inclusiveness, according to QS. Experts are accessible to help you at any time with career planning, applications, CVs, cover letters, and anything else they might require help with.The Employability Service staff will assist the students in search for internships, part-time jobs, volunteer opportunities, and graduate positions. They can count on the expert Employability Services team to assist them with everything from work experience opportunities to skill development guidance. The students can schedule appointments with the career counsellors on campus or over the phone for support and advice. Law : The University provides several services to assist students, the students get their career off to the best start, whether it's career information from the Student and Professional Employability Programmes, a one-on-one interview with a career adviser, practical legal experience through the pro bono activities, coaching, or simply scanning the vacancy database for a job. Business : The personnel of the University of Law Business School does more than only assist students in finding a career as a business graduate. They train pupils for a career in business. And you should continue to encourage the pupils throughout their careers. Regardless of their background or education, whether they study full-time or part-time, on-campus or online, whether they're looking for their first business graduate job, a career change, or to advance in their current position, the University has the skills, services, and passion to help them achieve their goals.
Accommodation: Off-Campus Accommodation  The typical rent is between 600 and 700 pounds per month.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.The apartments are fully furnished and with an open floor plan kitchen/living room layout, double windows, and gas central heating.Each property provides additional privacy and exclusivity in a lovely, cosy living environment, as well as onsite administration and security.

Name: University of Suffolk
Overview: The University of Suffolk is situated in Suffolk, East Anglia, United Kingdom. More than 9,500 students (8% international) study in six faculties having a different schools, namely, School of Law and Social Sciences; School of Psychology and Education; School of Health Sciences; School of Arts, Design, and Humanities; The Suffolk Business School; School of Science, Technology, and Engineering. It offers more than 100 undergraduate and postgraduate degrees in Humanities, Arts, Mathematics, Law, Science, and many more. Students with minimum marks in IELTS (6) and TOEFL (68) can apply online with an average tuition fee of 12,000 GBP and 13,300 GBP for classroom-based and laboratory-based courses, respectively. The University of Suffolk provides financial aid to eligible international students under Student Finance England (SFE) with scholarships up to 4,000 GBP. The university offers exceptional placement services to its students
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Academic Requirements:You must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Undergraduate: Students must have a high school diploma or certificate from a recognised college or schoolFor Indian students, an All India Senior School Certificate, often known as an Indian School Certificate, is required from CBSE, CISCE, or state boardsThe majority of programmes demand an SAT or ACT score Graduate: A three-year or four-year bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a recognised institution or university is needed for studentsA GMAT or GRE score may be required for some courses, such as Business or Management English Requirements: You must meet the below-mentioned English language proficiency score requirements:
