Placement: This charter highlights the university's shared commitment to high-quality practice placements.The term 'learner' is used in this charter to refer to all students enrolled in professional qualification courses in health care or social care at the University of Suffolk. Supervisors are included in the term 'Mentor'.These are the standards that learners can expect from the placement areas: Before the start of the placement, a placement profile/induction pack will be made accessibleYou will be offered a pre-placement visit when you contact the placement locationWithin the first week (4-5 days) of practice, meet with the allocated mentor/associate mentorMentors in nursing and midwifery will be required to hold approved teaching and assessing qualifications and be included on a live mentor register. All midwifery and nursing mentors in final placements will have been trained to be 'Sign-Off' mentors by NMC guidelinesThe learner can expect to be: on the first day of practice:Oriented towards the direction of the placement areaFire, CPR, and applicable health and safety policies/procedures are also coveredInformed of the educational resources availableThat an initial meeting will be held during the first week of the placement, at which time proposed dates for mid-point and final interviews will be discussed. As specified by the documentation, the mentor will provide written and spoken commentsThe mentor will clarify roles and responsibilities within the first week of the placementTo be given the necessary contact information for the specified practice/academic linkAny difficulties with practice will be resolved as soon as possible, adequately documented, and forwarded to the academic link or the allocations office if necessaryBefore the completion of the placement, all documentation will be completed and signedOn the duty roster/equivalent, those practise hours will be noted
Accommodation: The university's four campuses in Ipswich, Bury St Edmunds, Great Yarmouth, and Lowestoft have high-end architecture. Some important buildings at the University of Suffolk are the "East Contemporary Art Collection", which contains 160 works from 115 artists, a six-story James Hehir Building including Cult Cafí©, accommodation residents, 24/7 libraries, and research areas, and many more. Additional facilities include fitness centres, modern sports centres with 3G football pitches, counselling and wellness centres, and more than 100 student clubs and organizations with various athletic opportunities. The on-campus accommodation with 590-bed spaces is available in Athena Hall, located at the Ipswich campus. Being within walking distance from the town center and Ipswich Train Station, Athena Hall offers self-catering cluster flats and studio room options. Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Studio ensuites are available for 42 weeks, 48 weeks, and 50 weeks tenure with cost ranging from 130 GBP to 180 GBP per week that includes internet, kitchen (microwave, fridge with freezer, sink), study rooms, laundry, and bike storage facilities. On-Campus Accommodation: For first-year students or those studying at the University of Suffolk for the first time, Athena Hall, the on-campus halls of residence, is advised. It was designed and built expressly for students, and the University of Suffolk was involved in its creation and planning to ensure that it met university requirements.Athena Hall does not require accreditation because it is an on-campus residence hall, although it does meet the requirements. With a seaside setting and proximity to the University, Ipswich Town, and the railway station, Athena Hall is ideally situated to make the most of student life.Utility bills and broadband charges are included in the rental price of Athena Hall rooms. Rent is usually provided weekly to make comparing prices between houses easier, as well as a total contract price so you can see how much it will cost in total for the life of the tenancy. Off-Campus Accommodation: University appreciates that on-campus housing is not suitable for all students at the University of Suffolk. As a result, they launched the Accreditation Scheme to provide students with more options when deciding where to reside. University students were the driving force behind the Accredited Accommodation Scheme. The Accreditation Scheme includes privately owned and managed buildings and they only market those inspected by Ipswich Borough Council to ensure they satisfy university quality and safety criteria.If you're on a tight budget or searching for a house with specific features, such as being in a particular area or having parking, accredited off-campus housing can be an excellent alternative to on-campus living. Members of the Accreditation Scheme will be able to advertise to students through the University of Suffolk only if their electrical wiring and gas inspection certificates are up to date, providing an incentive for the home to be kept safe and well maintained.Utility expenditures and broadband charges are included in the rental price of accredited off-campus housing (unless otherwise stated). Rent is usually provided weekly to make comparing prices between houses easier, as well as a total contract price so you can see how much it will cost in total for the life of the tenancy. Off-campus housing is within walking distance of the college, as are the town centre and other amenities.

Name: University of Bristol
Overview: A public red brick research institute in England, the University of Bristol, was founded in 1876. It consists of six faculties (Arts, Health Sciences, Engineering, Science, Social Sciences and Law, and Life Sciences) with 25 academic schools. The undergraduate enrollment is around 20,311, while the postgraduate registration is approximately 4,939 for taught and 2,263 for research courses. Students can choose from 314 undergraduate courses such as Accounting and Finance, Chemical Physics, Dentistry and English and 234 postgraduate programs like Aerosol Science, Religion and Theology, Sustainable Futures and Translation. Some degrees offered by schools like the School of Humanities, the School of Biochemistry and the School of Education include BSc, BA, MSci, MSc, MPhil and PhD. The University of Bristol schools are situated in two locations; the main Clifton campus and the Langford campus. Students can visit one of the nine libraries like the Education Library, Queen's Building Library and Wills Memorial Library to access millions of printed and e-resources. Part-time undergraduate and postgraduate courses, taster courses, Bristol Futures open online courses, and workshops are also organised. Study abroad programs allow students to spend a semester/ year in another country like France, Egypt, the USA and Hong Kong, while other such initiatives include overseas summer/short-term programs, the European Liberal Arts Network program and Erasmus+. The undergraduate tuition fee is GBP 9,250 for UK students. Financial aid options are scholarships, loans, bursaries, grants and hardship funds like Accommodation Bursary, maintenance loans, Financial Assistance Fund, Ahmad Tea Scholarship, Alumni Grants etc. Residential accommodation is open for undergraduates and postgraduates and includes shared rooms, en-suite rooms, studio rooms, adapted rooms etc.; some residences are Badock Hall, Culver House and Hillside Woodside. For extracurricular activities, there are 350 societies and 70 sports clubs to join. Placement reports show that University of Bristol graduates earn an average starting salary of GBP 45,000 and upwards.
Eligibility Overview: International students are invited to apply to the University of Bristol, and they accept a wide range of qualifications for undergraduate and postgraduate studies.Please select your country for information on our average entry criteria, scholarships, and education reps if you studied at a school, college, or university outside the UK. Please contact them for assistance if your country or qualification is not listed.Each course has its own set of requirements. For further information on specific prerequisites, please see their undergraduate or postgraduate programme lists.Check here: http://www.bristol.ac.uk/international/countries/

Name: Arbutus College
Overview: Situated in Canada’s suburban Vancouver city, Arbutus College is a private training institute incorporated in 2002. The institute has Cypress Mountain, Grouse Mountain, and Stanley Park in the vicinity that offers excellent outdoor activities and experience while studying. The aim of the institute is to make the prospective students thorough professionals of the future workforce. The college offers 40 different programs at various levels in the form of certificates, diplomas, and co-ops in many study areas. These areas include marketing, translation, hospitality management, international trade, business management, and academic English. While the duration of the programs ranges from 2 to 32 months, the English language programs are of 4 to 48 weeks. As per statistics, 85% of graduates get employment within 3 months of completing their studies. The institute boasts of student enrolments from more than 20 different nations. Arbutus College admissions take place on twelve dates. This includes the months of January, February, April, May, June, July, September, October, and November. This gives prospective students the benefit of choosing their enrolment time and date. The college’s programmes are recognised by The Forum for International Trade Training (FITT), Canadian Institute of Management and American Hotel and Lodging Association (AH&LA). It offers various programs with mandatory practical exposure along with theoretical tools and frameworks. This is necessary for navigating a competitive recruitment procedure and successfully transitioning from university to a workplace. Additionally, there are dedicated career advisors that assist students in searching for jobs and help them in writing resumes and preparing for interviews, etc.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Achievement - high school graduation is required.English Proficiency - IELTS 5.0, TOEIC 780 + Essay, TOEFL IBT 64, TOEFL PBT 510, or comparable or greater proficiency (alternatively, the applicant can take Arbutus' English Proficiency Test).The admissions team can arrange you an English Proficiency Test.
Placement: According to statistics, 85 percent of graduates find work within three months after finishing their studies. Around 96 percent of students in co-op programmes are placed in higher education or co-op jobs.

Name: VanWest College - Kelowna
Overview: VanWest College Kelowna is located in the beautiful location of Kelowna, Canada. The college is a privately owned Canadian college with its two campuses located in Kelowna and Vancouver. It was established in 1988. The educational institution offers Post Secondary, Post- Baccalaureate and English as second learning (ESL) programs which are taught by industry professionals. The programs are designed to improve the employability skills, business knowledge and communication skills of the students so that they have the necessary skills to work in a Canadian workplace. The students will also spend 50% of their program time in a paid co-op which will help them to adapt the Canadian work culture and prepare them for better opportunities. VanWest College Kelowna is committed to assist international students from across the world who wish to pursue their education in Canada by offering them an ambience conducive to learning. The student services team is committed to helping international students from every step of the way from assisting students for the visa process, finances, on-campus accommodation and employment services. VanWest College Kelowna organizes a variety of activities to suit people of all nationalities and interests, including shopping, live entertainment, and sporting events. Additionally, it organizes other activities, including Summer water leisure, and weekend trips to different landmarks, including wineries, Big White Ski Resort, and Crystal Mountain Ski Resort.

Name: St Lawrence College - Kingston
Overview: St. Lawrence College was established in 1967 as a public college of applied arts and technology at three locations in Ontario, Canada. One of the campuses of this institute in the province of Ontario is present at Kingston. St. Lawrence College – Kingston campus witnessed some significant renovations like a new 80,000 square-foot Student Life and Innovation Centre home to a new fitness center, gymnasium, etc. This college offers several programs according to several study areas. These areas of study include Business, Applied Arts, Health Sciences, Justice Studies, Skilled Trades and others. A few St. Lawrence College programs students can opt for are Bachelor of Science - Nursing (Honors) – BSc, Behavioral Science, Brick and Stone Masonry – Apprenticeship, Advertising and Marketing Communications (AMC), Autism & Behavioral Science and many more. SLC has an extensive program of Scholarships and Bursaries that assist students in paying for their college, and the amount for the same lies between $500 and $3,000. In 2020, this institute will offer more than 500 bursaries to its students. For the Bachelor of Business Administration program, the average tuition costs for one academic year at St. Lawrence College – Kingston range from $21,700 to $21,730. For the Certificates & Diplomas, it lies between $16,650 and $16,680. Students opting for the Level 1 and Level 2 of English as a Second Language (ESL) need to pay somewhere between $6,000 and $6,100. For Level 3 and Level 4, this amount lies between $6,800 and $6,850. As per ranking agency Webometrics for 2020, SLC ranked 116 among the top Canadian colleges. The career management center of this institute conducts several placement drives and career fairs for the students. In recent years, the top employers of SLC graduates have been Queen’s University, Empire Life, the Department of National Defense, Kingston Health Sciences Center, and the City of Kingston.

It is advised so that you don't fall short in any way in demonstrating your admissions worthiness English Requirements:

Name: Manitoba University
Overview: The University of Manitoba, founded in 1877, is a public research institution in Manitoba, Canada. It has since become the 17th largest university in the country, establishing itself as one of the premier research universities in the region.The university has 24 faculties across different fields, offering over 100 undergraduate programs. Many of these programs can be followed by graduate and postgraduate studies offered by the university..The tuition costs can come up to CAD 15,000 per annum.The university also promotes several sports, with the Manitoba Bisons representing them at national collegiate events, known for its ice hockey program.The University of Manitoba has numerous alumni who have gone on to excel in their respective fields, including physicist Dr. James Peebles and politicians Vic Toews and Steven Fletcher.

Course Ranking: Take a look at where the University of Manitoba (U of Mcourses )'s are now! According to the QS rankings for 2022, the University of Manitoba's Global MBA programme is ranked at position 251+. In contrast, the Times Higher Education rankings for 2022 place the Business and Economics programme in the #401–500 range. According to THE, the Business and Economics programme was in the same place in 2021 as it was in 2022.According to Times Higher Education rankings, the Engineering and Technology programme is ranked between positions #401 and 500. The university's standing for courses in engineering and technology was 401–500 last year as well. However, according to THE rankings, the university was rated between position #301 and #400 from 2018 to 2020. Therefore, it can be said that from 2018 to 2022, the university's ranks have declined. The Life Science programme has maintained the same position in the Times Higher Education rankings since 2019 at #401-500.
University Ranking: In 1877, the University of Manitoba was founded. Since its founding, it has fostered learning and inspired creativity via excellent teaching and research. It is one among the 15 top research universities in Canada. When it comes to the University of Manitoba ranking, it will be 387th in the world among universities in 2022 according to U.S. News & World Report.In 2023, the University of Manitoba is ranked in the 651-700th category, and in 2022, it is ranked in the 601-650th category. Since 2019, it has remained in the same position. The QS World University Rankings take into account factors like academic standing, employer standing, faculty to student ratio, number of publications per faculty member, and the proportion of international faculty to foreign students.The University of Manitoba will be ranked between 301 and 350 in the Times Higher Education (THE) rankings in 2022. In 2022, it has risen in the rankings. Since it was placed between 350 and 400th in the two most recent years, 2020 and 2021, THE ranks universities based on factors like research, teaching, citations, global outlook, and industry results.

Name: University of Winnipeg
Overview: The University of Winnipeg in Manitoba, Canada, is a public research institute that received its Royal Charter in 1967. 9,396 and 295 students are enrolled in undergraduate and graduate courses taught by six faculties like Arts, Education, and Science.Some of the degree programs offered by the university include Anthropology, Rhetoric, Communications, Applied Economics, History, and Physics.The university offers numerous Professional, Applied, and Continuing Education (PACE) programs to develop skills and build professional relationships; certificate and diploma courses are available. To help students acquire the knowledge needed for professional programs, it also provides various Pre-Professional programs like Pre-Law, Pre-Medicine, and Pre-Pharmacy. The English Language Program is an excellent way for domestic and international students to improve their English language competency. Through The Collegiate, a high school program, students in grades 9-12 can engage in academic and extracurricular courses on campus.Financial aid is available to students in scholarships, awards, grants, loans, and bursaries like the Opportunity Fund, Louis Riel Bursaries, Special Entrance Scholarships, and Manitoba Student Aid.
Eligibility Overview: IndiaSecondary School Credential: All-Indian Senior School Certificate, Higher Secondary CertificateSecondary School Grade: CBSE & ICSE - minimum 67% (C1) average in academic subjects; PSEB - minimum B average in academic subjects; AISSCE - a minimum average of 70%University or College Transfer Grade: Dependent on Post-Secondary Grading ScaleBangladeshSecondary School Credential: Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC)Secondary School Grade: BUniversity or College Transfer Grade: Dependent on Post-Secondary Grading ScaleNepalSecondary School Credential: Higher Secondary Education Board certificate (HSEB)Secondary School Grade: BUniversity or College Transfer Grade: BChinaSecondary School Credential: Senior High School Graduation Examination along with applicant’s ID Number and Report Number for verification with China Credentials Verification (CHESICC)Secondary School Grade: 70%Post-Secondary Document Requirements: Transfer and Second Degree transcripts and graduation certificates, along with the applicant’s ID Number and Report NumberUniversity or College Transfer Grade: 70-79% or C
Placement: The University of Winnipeg organizes the annual Career Fair so students can have the opportunity to connect with employers from various companies, organizations, and university programs. Some popular employers or regular career fair attendees are PepsiCo Canada, Western Financial Group Insurance Solutions, Loblaw Companies Limited, Ka Ni Kanichihk Inc., Birchwood Automotive Group, etc. The University’s graduates are reported to have an average salary of 64,000 CAD two years after graduation.The graduates have an employment rate of 95.9% two years after graduation.
Accommodation: There are two residence halls at the university called McFeetors Hall and Balmoral Houses. Residence halls in the university also have meal plans to suit the needs of students. The housing and meal plan costs between 8,000-15,000 CAD (~4-9 lakh INR) based on the choice of the student. Amenities include a microwave, fridge, common areas, lounges, study areas, televisions, 24-hour security, air conditioners, kitchen (shared), living room, laundry, storage area, and front and back yards with deck, barbeque, and benches. There are accessible single dorms designed to accommodate the accessibility of wheelchairs. There are 23 main campus buildings on the university’s campus in Winnipeg, Manitoba. University of Winnipeg library collections holds over 750,000 items including videos, books, microfiche, and periodicals. Students of the University participate in men's and women's volleyball and basketball teams, and a women's soccer team. These students represent the university in the national U Sports competitions. The University of Winnipeg Students' Association (UWSA) has a strength of over 10,000 students. The University also has a state-of-the-art Axworthy Health and RecPlex building that provides indoor soccer services and recreation programs as well as research and student practicum opportunities in education, kinesiology, and applied health.

Name: Great Plains College - Kindersley Campus
Overview: Great Plain College is located in Kindersley, Canada. It offers several programs that span across health care, business and administration. Programs are composed of several courses that prepare the students for their careers in their field of study. Great Plains College provides several safety training, professional and personal development courses that teach broader skills and are open to the public without enrolling in a program. Great Plain College offers one of the best scholarship programs compared to most other regional colleges. More than $2 million has been facilitated to the students in full-time student loan-eligible programs since 2009. Financial aid is available, including scholarships, government student loans, among others. Great Plains College welcomes international students to experience quality learning at Kindersley Campus. The college offers Certificate and Diploma program options to international students. Recognised as a Designated Learning Institute (DLI) approved by the Ministry of Advanced Education, the College provides small classrooms with friendly, experienced staff. Great Plain College offers training and education industry-specific, that is, the regional industry requirements. The College delivers safety training and certificates that are required for the development of productive and safe employees. The college’s varsity teams have been competing for 13 years. The Sun Dogs are the only competitive athletic program in Saskatchewan’s regional college system. Other services provided by the college are academic advising, career planning and job search techniques, Pre-assessment of learning disabilities, referrals to appropriate agencies or academic resources.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Carbonear
Overview: College of the North Atlantic, Carbonear campus is situated on the east coast of Newfoundland and Labrador. The location is suitable for getting access to restaurants, health care facilities, etc., as it is located in the downtown historic district. The weather is mostly pleasant, with warm and moist summers that do not last too long and mild winters where the temperature drops to minus 15 degrees. Students can also take part in activities outside the campus, like George W. Earle Promenade.  The college offers more than 100 full-time programs to around 9,000 students each year and provides distance learning facilities. Students can get access to a nationally accredited range of programming while studying in this institution which is beneficial due to its high demands in recent times.College of the North Atlantic bagged a #89 in National Universities by Unirank University Ranking in the year 2020 due to its overall performance. College of the North Atlantic – Carbonear fees depends on the type, of course, a student is opting for. International students can enrol here, and certain facilities are available for them. From study abroad and exchange programs to housing and scholarship facilities, the college provides numerous facilities to its full-time students. However, financial aid is not given to international students; it offers a searchable database where they can look for scholarships to finance their education. In terms of the admission process, students must apply online, where proof of English proficiency, student study permit, official academic transcripts, etc., should be submitted.

Name: Okanagan College - Kelowna
Overview: Located near British Columbia, Canada, the Okanagan College was established in 1963. The name changed to Okanagan University College in 1995, but the management re-adopted the previous name in 2005, dividing OUC into Okanagan College and UBC Okanagan. Currently, the college serves students with their educational services in degree and diploma levels. Okanagan College has invited more than 20,500 students yearly for its diverse courses and programs. The college also supports applications from international students, currently accommodating over 951 students from overseas locations. The university uses about four campuses for imparting education among the students. The courses offered here are divided into bachelor's, master's, and doctoral levels. Some common areas of studies followed here include Business, Arts, Science, Tourism, Healthcare, and IT. The college offers facilities for upgrading education from diploma to degree courses, distance education, and using English as a second language. The Kelowna campus, the largest campus of Okanagan College, is only steps away from Kelowna's Pandosy Village. Here, the students receive world-class instructors and the opportunity to understand the industry. The student-faculty ratio in classes is about 19:1, which justifies its high acceptance rate. The university's success is evident from Okanagan College's ranking, holding the 82nd position for Top Colleges in Canada by Canadian University ranking (UniRank). The tuition fees set for international students currently range from $55,000-$60,000 for degree courses. The college partners with Student, Graduate, and Co-op Employment Centre, encouraging graduate students to apply for the latest employment vacancies in their specific fields. There is a section on the college's official website whereby the students and alumni of the college can apply for suitable jobs.

Accommodation: Housing Life provides a one-of-a-kind educational, social, recreational, and leadership experience. Movie evenings, laser tag, BBQs, sports activities, and games, as well as other organised social events, provide much-needed leisure and an opportunity to meet new people and create lifelong friendships. On-Campus Accommodation On the Kelowna campus, Okanagan College Student Housing provides you with furnished, non-smoking apartments tucked away in the Okanagan Valley's picturesque mountains. There are only a few steps separating the apartments from the school's classrooms, libraries, leisure centres, and food services. The accommodation provided is:PodsPrivate studio suites For more information, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/housing#housing  Off-Campus Accommodation Okanagan College does not endorse or approve any of the listings on this website. The landlords or authors of the listings are not subjected to any information, background, or clearance checks by Okanagan College, and none of the information in the listings is checked for accuracy. For more information, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/housing/off-campus-housing  Homestay Students participating in the Homestay programme live with a host family for a specified amount of time, providing a chance for cross-cultural engagement between Canadians and international students. Students are assisted in adjusting to life in Canada by host families, who also gain knowledge of various nations and cultures. Students receive more chances to use their English and gain knowledge about Canadian customs, values, and ways of life. For more information, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/international/international-housing#homestay  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/housing

Name: Sprott Shaw Language College - Vancouver
Overview: Headquartered in British Columbia, Sprott Shaw Language College is a private Canadian college. Established in 1903, this college is one of British Columbia’s oldest post-secondary institutions. With the success of the first college, it opened other campuses in Victoria, Nanaimo and Vancouver. Since its foundation, this college has been providing different programmes depending on the market requirement. Nowadays, the modern campuses of this college provide effective training to more than 3, 500 students each year, comprising 16 campuses across British Columbia. All the campuses of this university provide small-class sizes, job placement and hands-on training. With the flexibility of offering a different program, students can select the right program to meet their education goals. The Vancouver campus of this college is situated in the centre of Downtown Vancouver and an ideal location for students who want to take advantage of opportunities and activities offered by the city. Students studying on this campus have multiple programs to explore at its corresponding schools such as Vancouver International College and Vancouver International College Career campus. Being a known institution, this college offers necessary resources providing a learning environment. This college's language centres have efficient staff and provide a wide range of courses, advising, and programs. By selecting this language school for admission, students will receive a top-notch education at convenient rates. With more than 100 career-focused programs, students can find one that suits their interests. Some of this institution's courses include Tourism/Hospitality management with Co-op, Global Marketing management with Co-op, Business Communication Management with Co-op, Business Administration Management with Co-op, International Trade, Business Fundamentals, International Trade and Business Management, Practical Nursing, Industrial design and more. Apart from these, Sprott Shaw Language College offers various scholarships, grants and bursaries to deserving students. There are multiple scholarship programs available in this college, and they are employer-specific, program-specific and campus-specific. To conclude, this college offers world-class English language programs for international students on the three campuses along with a top-notch curriculum.

Name: Toronto School of Management
Overview: Toronto School of Management, situated in Ontario, Toronto, is among the top-ranking colleges in Canada, driven by the motto, “Inspired by Industry, driven by student success,” and over 100 partnerships to give its students the best co-op experience possible through its unrivaled curriculum.Admissions to the Toronto School of Management are available at the certificate, diploma, and advanced diploma levels in various programs, including business, hotel & tourism, accounting, digital marketing, and data analytics.Toronto School of management has highly qualified industry experts as faculty. They have a student body from over 100 countries that give students a diverse and competitive environment promoting overall growth and a student satisfaction rate of 91%. Toronto School of Management allows its students to work 20 hours per week while studying and full-time during vacations. Facilities like resume clinics, mock interviews, guest speakers, and job fairs give students the right and needed career boost and support.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the eligibility requirements for seeking admission to the institute are: Students must have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or an equivalent diplomaAny candidate applying to the university must be at least 18 years oldNon-native English speakers must provide standardized test results, such as an IELTS score of 5.5 or higherInternational students must have valid health insurance
Placement: Each subject's obligatory co-op hours allow students to apply their academic knowledge to real-world situations. To aid in the placement of its candidates, the institute offers interview training and internships. KASE, Delta Hotels, TDOT Performance, Thompson Toronto, DoubleTree by Hilton, and others are among the institute's common Co-op partners. The school boasts a 100% placement rate for most of its popular programs.

University Ranking: Toronto School of Management (TM) is one of the leading business schools in Canada, offering a wide range of programs from undergraduate to graduate and doctoral levels. The school has been consistently ranked among the top business schools in the world and is recognized for its excellence in teaching, research, and industry engagement. TSoM has achieved several rankings in recent years, including being ranked in the top 10 business schools in Canada by the Financial Times and the Economist. The school was also ranked in the top 100 business schools in the world by the Financial Times in 2020. In addition to its international rankings, TSoM has also been recognized for its excellence in teaching and research. The school has been awarded the prestigious AACSB International Accreditation, the highest standard of excellence in business education. This accreditation demonstrates TSoM’s commitment to providing an exceptional learning experience to its students. TSoM is also well known for its industry engagement, which includes partnerships with leading corporations and organizations. The school has established strong relationships with major companies such as Microsoft, IBM, and Deloitte, providing students with access to real-world business experience. TSoM is also committed to providing its students with the best possible learning experience. The school offers various student services, including career counselling, mentorship programs, and internship opportunities. The school also has a vibrant student life, with multiple clubs and activities to help students make the most of their time at TSoM. Overall, TSoM is one of the leading business schools in Canada, offering a range of programs and services to help students achieve their goals. The school’s strong rankings, accreditation, and industry engagement make it an excellent choice for anyone pursuing a business degree.

Name: University of New Brunswick
Overview: Founded in 1785, the University of New Brunswick is one of the top-tier public universities situated in Canada. It is one of the oldest English universities in the country. The University consists of 2 campuses: the Fredericton Campus and the Saint John Campus, and two small and remote health sciences campuses located in Bathurst and Moncton, New Brunswick. The University offers over 75 undergraduate programs and 28 postgraduate programs in various fields of study such as art, anthropology, applied mathematics, and business administration. It also has 11 academic departments including the faculty of management, and faculty of art, etc. Some of the top courses include commerce, accounting, economics, electronics, computer science, political science, engineering, chemistry, sociology, mathematics, etc. The per-year tuition fee of the undergraduate international students is approximately CAD 16,900, whereas for postgraduate international students the fee is around CAD 2278 to 5185. The university conducts various job fairs and seminars to uplift students and their careers. The university campuses have academic facilities, administrative facilities, student services, health services, shopping facilities, residence facilities, and dining facilities. It also provides various types of traditional-style residence halls such as Aitken House for all males, and Lady Dunn Hall for all females with all the basic utilities. The University offers several types of financial support to international students including scholarships, loans, and grants to study in Canada. These scholarships that are provided to the students are based on the academic records of the student as well as financial requirements.
Eligibility Overview: For direct admittance into most academic programmes, undergraduate applicants whose native language is not English must have the following English language competence minimum scores:A minimum overall score of 85 on the TOEFL IBT is required.CAEL CE or CAEL Online with a minimum overall score of 60 IELTS or IELTS Indicator with a minimum overall score of 6.5A minimum score of 59 on the Pearson Vue Test is required.Duolingo with a minimum overall score of 115 Cambridge English Assessment C1 advanced or C2 proficiency with a minimum score of 176for more information click on this link-https://www.unb.ca/international/admission/
Accommodation: Living on campus will provide you the opportunity to make your own decisions while also providing you with the support you need to succeed at the University of New Brunswick (UNB). Our campus, which features 13 residence buildings, puts your classrooms, instructors, dining halls, libraries, and everything else UNB has to offer right at your fingertips.for on and off campus information click on this link-https://www.unb.ca/fredericton/residence/

Course Description: University of New Brunswick is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of New Brunswick was founded in 1785. Located in Saint John,Canada the university is home to about 800 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of New Brunswick is ranked 26th in Top Universities by Webometrics - National. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 7 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. University of New Brunswick has 6 intakes in Sep,Jan,May, Sep, May, Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of New Brunswick is around $9450 to $11,912.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of New Brunswick include Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award,Ontario Graduate Scholarship Masters Program.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of New Brunswick is the post-study work opportunities in Canada. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of New Brunswick has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Bronte College
Overview: Bronte College is a private international school operating since 1991 at Mississauga under the International Baccalaureate curriculum, recognized by the Ministry of Education of Ontario. This boarding school offers high-quality education to students from Grade 9 to 12. The course curriculum and teaching rigor attract international students from over 30 countries worldwide. It provides a learning environment with academic excellence and stimulates individual growth through various instructional methods. For students in the 11th and 12th standards, it offers diploma courses under the Ontario Secondary School Diploma. Moreover, the placement support for 12th standard students is beneficial for their career advancement.  The Bronte community values inclusivity and open-mindedness in its students and faculty. The Bronte College fee is between $19,200 to $21,760 per year for an academic course. The 11th Grade diploma course fee is $22,000 and for the 12th Grade is $23,500. Some added prices are for admission, campus charge, homestay accommodation, security deposit, etc. Apart from academics, it also extends the platform for music, creativity, sports, public speaking, and more to nurture each student's talent comprehensively. Personality development and communication skills are given particular focus at Bronte College as these two factors help an individual become successful. Their acceptance rate is 80%, and the student-teacher ratio is 1:16. The average class size is 18 students. In 2017-18, 98% of the students passing from Bronte College got admission to some of the best universities in different streams, including the University of Toronto, Ottawa and Waterloo University. Bronte College has a five stars rating according to students' testimonials. It is considered one of the best world schools to get a well-rounded education and international and cultural exposure to prepare for a successful career.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) Admissions CriteriaRequire a minimum of a 75% average with steady grades over the previous three years of study. When evaluating applications, English, Math, and Science are given more weight. In some situations, the institution may request a written essay, study plan, or interview to allow applicants to discuss their academic background and goals for Bronte College. International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Programme Admissions CriteriaApplicants for the IB Diploma Program should have a minimum average of 80%, excellent English (IELTS 6.0+), and be involved in community work and extracurricular activities. Advanced Placement (AP) Program Admissions CriteriaCandidates for the Advanced Placement Program must be enrolled in the Grade 12 OSSD programme, and a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 80% is required. Express ProgramApplicants for the Express Program must be in Grade 12, have a strong command of the English language, a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 80%, and be highly disciplined to complete six pre-university courses in a short period of time. English Language Proficiency RequirementsThe College will place ESL students based on the applicants' English proficiency test (either submitted with their application or once the approved student arrives at Bronte).
Placement: The college often provides job opportunities within the campus for students. Here are a few such profiles:  Position: Head of School About the Role : The Head of the School is a proactive leader who will manage academic programmes and campus administration to ensure the school's overall success. The ideal applicant would be a person with strong leadership and interpersonal abilities who enjoys engaging and mentoring others. They'll be customer-focused, versatile, and love solving challenges and working on various projects. Responsibilities : Responsible for the school's general academics and extracurricular activitiesEnsure that all Ministry of Education criteria are met, including curriculum, reports etc. Serve as the school's primary point of contact with the Ministry of EducationOversee Campus Life programmes, ensuring that Bronte College's goal is carried out during the school day and after school for campus life studentsLead, supervise, and manage the school's academic teamAttend open houses and local and international school fairs to assist with global and regional marketing initiativesParticipate in the Academic & Campus Life Staff interview and selection processAssist with policy and procedure development; interpret, execute, and administer departmental policiesConduct timely, fair, and consistent performance reviews for academic staff; lead frequent staff meetings and Department Head meetingsResponsible for the Campus Life team reaching the department's objectives, ensuring that student life and safety are taken care of at schoolEnsure that the evening study session and activities are conducted without a hitchEducate academic staff about various school programmes (such as the International Baccalaureate (IB), Advanced Placement (AP), tutoring, and summer camp) so that they can speak about and answer questions about themThe International Baccalaureate (IB) Program is under your supervisionShould share feedback from parents/students with the appropriate teamsThey ensure that the school's health and safety rules are followed. This includes regular inspections, employee training on safe working techniques, and a JHSC management memberEnsure that students follow the Bronte College Code of ConductCollaboration with partner schoolsThe Head of School is available and on-call 24 hours a day, seven days a week for emergenciesTo fulfil any other duties as given by the Managing Director  Working Environment : Working hours: Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. evening and weekend hours may be necessary for school dances, parent-teacher nights, staff meetings, curriculum nights, open houses, and fairsIt is necessary to travel internationally Minimum Prerequisites :  Administration experience of five years. A master's degree or a principal's qualifying programme is required.A university undergraduate degree is required. It is advantageous to have international experience.The Head of School should be certified by the Ontario College of Teachers and in good standing.Extensive knowledge of the English language is required.Computer and software application experience are required.  Note: Bronte College offers more job profiles such as - Cook, Maintenance Assistant, Campus Life Staff, Kitchen Helper etc.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Over 350 students are housed in safe and comfortable dormitories at Bronte College. The majority of the rooms are single occupancy, although there are also double and quad rooms accessible at the institution. The dormitory, which is open throughout all vacations and school breaks, houses students from all over the world, creating a lively living atmosphere. For more information, visit:  https://brontecollege.ca/dormitory/

Name: East Coast Language College
Overview:
Established in 1998, East Coast Language College is a private career college recognised as a multi-year award winner for the Best Language School in Halifax. It is an official IELTS Test Centre that encourages and motivates students who want to achieve academic excellence. This institution ensures that students meet their diverse linguistic goals.
Every week, East Coast Language College hosts several social activities for students. Moreover, this institute has small class sizes, which allow students to get personal time with the instructor. This college encourages applications from more than 35 countries. Over the years, this institution has achieved several recognitions for offering the best work as an educational institution. In recent times, East Coast Language College has been associated with different colleges and universities in Canada. Further, it provides students with high top-notch language and academic education that assists them in studying abroad.
To ensure success for the students in international business and the workplace, East Coast Language College offers an advanced Business English program. This institution is also offering full-time UCP (University and College Pathway program) to accommodate students to begin their programs through an online platform who cannot enter Canada. East Coast Language College also provides a three-level program known as English for Parents, specifically curated for the parents of school-aged individuals who wish to strengthen their foundational English. The fee structure varies from one course to another in this college. The campus of this college is equipped with advanced equipment, computer labs, wireless internet, convenient classrooms, etc. 
The primary mission of this college is to allow students to achieve full capacity and provide outstanding English language training. Some of the East Coast Language College programs including General English Program, IELTS Preparation, Summer Programs, etc. are popular among students worldwide. This college is considered a well-respected leader in the language training community.

Name: Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) - Souch
Overview: Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) is a polytechnic institution and one of the biggest apprenticeship trainers in Canada. This institute has four campuses — 1 in Spruce Grove and 3 in Edmonton. Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) – Souch campus is situated south of Whyte Avenue. The Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) – Souch campus is home to apprenticeship training programs that include Ironworker, Boilermaker, Structural Steel and Plate Fitter and Welder. This campus location houses the Waiward Centre for Steel Technologies. At this center, apprentices learn various aspects related to steel fabrication and installation in a leading-edge environment. It features classrooms, metal building erectors, welding shops, platefitters, structural steel fabricators, upgraded and expanded ironwork shops. Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) received a #2123 ranking in World rankings given by UniRank 2020. In World rankings given by EduRank 2020, this institute ranked #2496. For one year of studies, the amount payable for tuition, fees and approximate living costs for a domestic student at this institute lies in the range of $19,100 to $19,200. For an international student, the amount to be paid for these purposes ranges between $32,200 and $41,300. Students requiring additional assistance covering their living and tuition costs while attending post-secondary can opt for government loans and grants. Enrolled students of Degree, Diploma, Apprenticeship, Certificate or Open Studies programs may be eligible for financial aid options. Some notable Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) alumni include politician Nolan Crouse, filmmaker Gil Cardinal, author Robert Barefoot, anchor Bryan Mudryk, and Chef Corbin Tomaszeski. Career-focused advisors assist NAIT alumni and students regarding their long-term career plans by reviewing cover letters, LinkedIn profiles, resumes, discussing job search strategies, and practising interview procedures. This institute also houses the Mawji Centre for New Venture and Student Entrepreneurship. This center helps aspiring entrepreneurs hone their skills through guest speakers, workshops, competitions, business mentorship, and networking.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria is different for different courses. The general criteria does not apply here. English language Proficiency Requirements :  Past Academic Study — In addition to the entrance application, students must submit authentic transcripts in English indicating their previous academic study. It is not necessary for students from English Language Proficiency Exempt Countries to submit any documents. ESL Exam — Students who cannot offer required transcripts as proof of English Language Proficiency must take the ESL exam as a formal assessment. Exam results are valid for two years following the test date.
Accommodation: While the university does not offer on-campus accommodation, you have the option of spending the academic year in dorms at the University of Alberta and MacEwan University. These are only a short rail trip away with your NAIT U-Pass. https://www.nait.ca/nait/international/arriving-in-edmonton/housing

Name: Mount Allison University
Overview: Mount Allison University (MTA), situated in Sackville, New Brunswick, Canada, was established in 1839, and received its university status in 1849. Specializing in liberal arts education, the college ranks among the top undergraduate universities in Canada in the 2022 Maclean's University Rankings. Mount Allison University has over 50 programs across six undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. Courses at MTA ensure that every student becomes a global citizen who is active and engaged enough to counter the challenges of modern times.The college focuses on experiential learning through internships, entrepreneurship, fieldwork, and more, to prepare students for the road ahead.The university has approximately 140 clubs and societies and 30 intramural sports teams. The Mount Allison Students' Union, which represents all full- and part-time students on campus, is another feature of the university.
Eligibility Overview: International students at Mount Allison must meet programme and country requirements. For example, to be admitted to a bachelor's programme, Indian students must have Grade 12 Board Examination results issued by examination boards such as HSC, CBSE, ISC, and others. Furthermore, to be eligible for admission, students must have a minimum overall average score of 55% in Grade 12. Note that the subject-specific score requirement varies depending on the major chosen by a student. Indian applicants for master's programmes must have an undergraduate degree (US equivalent) and meet subject-specific requirements. English Language Proficiency Scores International students will have to prove their English Language proficiency to be eligible for application. For this, they will have to furnish their test scores as proof. The minimum requirements are as below:
Eli Table:

Placement: Mount Allison offers many internship opportunities in two categories, summer and academic year internships open to students from all academic years and disciplines. In addition, several programmes and opportunities prepare you for the road ahead and ensure you get to choose a career you deserve after graduation.
Accommodation: MTA provides various on and off-campus facilities to ease your stay. On-campus Accommodation Mount Allison University offers on-campus housing for its students, with eight distinct residences ranging in size from 70 to 200 residents. In addition, MTA is also opening new small residential communities for first-year students for the 2022-23 academic year to cover up the lack of space at Harper Hall. Here are the details  The university offers a plethora of room types catering to different needs and entails rental costs accordingly. Here are the room types available -  Off-campus Accommodation Off-campus facilities include fully furnished apartments, with the average monthly rent between 550 and 650 CAD. Studio flats, three and four-bedroom and shared apartments are availableThe apartments are fully furnished and include free high-speed Wi-Fi and central air conditioningThe apartments are in a peaceful neighbourhood close to grocery stores, pharmacies, and restaurants

University Ranking: Mount Allison University (MTA) is a highly respected university in Sackville, New Brunswick. Founded in 1839, MTA is the oldest university in the province and one of the oldest in Canada. It is consistently ranked as one of the best universities in the country and is renowned for its academic excellence, research opportunities, and student life. According to Maclean's magazine, MTA is ranked among the top universities in Canada. It is ranked in the top 5 for overall student satisfaction and top 10 for the best comprehensive university experience. MTA also ranks in the top 10 for student-faculty interaction and in the top 15 for student services and library resources. MTA is also highly rated for its research opportunities. It is ranked in the top 10 for research intensity and in the top 15 for research income. MTA is also one of the top universities in Canada for its graduate programs, ranking in the top 10 for graduate student satisfaction and in the top 15 for graduate student experience. MTA is also known for its vibrant student life. It is ranked in the top 10 for student residence satisfaction and in the top 15 for student engagement. MTA also ranks in the top 10 for student-run clubs and organizations and in the top 15 for student-run events. MTA is a highly respected university that offers quality education, research opportunities, and a vibrant student life. It is consistently ranked among the top universities in Canada and is a great choice for those looking for an excellent university experience.

Name: Acsenda School of Management
Overview: Acsenda School of Management, established in 2004, is one of Canada's highly acclaimed institutions for management studies. Located in central Vancouver, the institute primarily offers undergraduate degrees in the business field. One notable fact about the Acsenda School of Management is that it has almost 80% of international students studying at the institution from nearly 45 countries.The university's Bachelor of Business Administration program offers popular marketing, accounting, finance, HRM, international business, and hospitality management courses. The facilities at the institute include world-class infrastructure, high-tech computers, equipment, computer labs, etc. Acsenda takes pride in small-sized classrooms that help in the well-rounded development of a student with international standards and global certification programs. It is one of Canada's newly established private universities that exclusively offers courses and programs in business management. They have multiple systems in BBA with affordable tuition fees. The institution has accounting, international business management, and human resources management clubs to help students enhance their skills and knowledge. The institution also has a small cohort size, making it easy for the staff to pay more attention to students.If you complete a BBA with concentrations or a Bachelor of Hospitality Management and satisfy all other requirements, you are qualified to apply for PGWP.
Eligibility Overview: Candidates must submit proof of the following academic and English proficiency test scores:
Eli Table:
Academic requirements 
  • 80% and above
English language score requirements
  • IELTS: 6.0
  • TOEFL (iBT): 84
  • TOEFL (PBT): 560
  • PTE: 60
Placement: Acsenda School of Management offers students placement assistance through a student-friendly job platform. They have an online portal, Jobs Connect Board, where the current and alumni students of Acsenda can connect with Acsenda Business Partners in Vancouver and find jobs that best suit them. The platform also offers employers in and around Vancouver trained potential candidates from Acsenda with relevant skills that best suit their requirements.
Accommodation: Acsenda School of Management does not have any on-campus accommodation facility. However, as the institution is located in central Vancouver, it is easy for students to find off-campus residences.  The student services team at the campus is responsible for providing the students with off-campus residence options, mainly homestays where the students are set up with a local family who provide them with food and accommodation. The accommodation costs around 700 CAD per month.

Name: Selkirk college
Overview: Selkirk, a community college established in 1066, located in British Columbia, Canada, offers a diverse range of post-secondary certificates, diplomas, and associate degrees.The degrees are offered through various programs in business, environment, geomatics, health, hospitality and tourism, academic upgrading and development, lifespan autism training, human services, peace and justice studies, industry and trades training, and university arts and sciences. Selkirk College is British Columbia’s first regional community college and boasts of highly qualified and experienced faculty and state-of-the-art infrastructure. Selkirk provides many student awards like bursaries, entrance scholarships, SIDIT bursaries, and Irving K Barber Scholarships. The college also has a robust students’ union that offers various student support systems.
Eligibility Overview: International applicants must have an IELTS score of at least 6.0 (with no individual band lower than 5.5) and a cumulative GPA of 2.0. Although recommendation letters are encouraged, SOP is mandatory for students seeking a study permit in Canada.

Placement: Students at Selkirk can benefit from the college’s Co-op Education and Employment Services (CEES) programme, which provides experiential learning opportunities to students and connects them to potential employers, allowing them to earn academic credits. Co-op positions are paid, full-time, and have a minimum of 420 hours.
Accommodation: Students studying at Selkirk College have options to stay on-campus or off-campus. On-campus Accommodation:Selkirk has two on-campus residences: Kekuli House (Castlegar) and Tenth Street (Nelson) Residence, with accommodation facilities for over 250 students. Students get two bookshelves, a desk, a two-burner cooktop, a large half fridge, and a shared bathroom. Off-campus Accommodation: Off-campus residence costs CAD 600–800 per month. There are options for fully-furnished studio apartments, 3-bedroom, 4-bedroom, and shared apartments, with free WiFi and air-conditioning.
University Ranking: Selkirk College is one of the top post-secondary institutions in British Columbia. Founded in 1966, Selkirk has become a leader in education, providing students with a comprehensive range of academic and vocational programs. The college offers more than 120 certificates, diplomas, and degrees, as well as a variety of apprenticeship and trades training programs. Selkirk College has consistently been ranked among the best colleges in the province for its academic excellence, student experience, and quality of its facilities and resources. The college is consistently ranked among the top 10 in the area. It has been ranked as high as No. 5. Selkirk College is highly rated for its commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship. The college has implemented several initiatives to reduce its ecological footprint, including energy-efficient buildings, waste reduction, and green transportation options. The college has also developed a comprehensive Sustainability Plan to ensure that it continues to meet its sustainability goals. Selkirk College is also highly ranked for its commitment to student success. The college offers support services and student-run programs to help students succeed. This includes career planning, job search support, and a variety of student wellness services. In addition, Selkirk College is highly ranked for its commitment to community engagement. The college partners with numerous organizations and businesses in the region to provide meaningful opportunities for students to gain real-world experience. This includes an internship, field placement, and volunteer opportunities. Overall, Selkirk College has consistently proven to be one of the top post-secondary institutions in British Columbia. Its commitment to excellence, sustainability, and student success have earned it a place among the best colleges in the province.

Name: Westfield Secondary School
Overview: Westfield Secondary School is an independent private co-educational institution in Markham, Ontario, Canada. It is the successor to the Eckington County Secondary School established in 1930 in Derbyshire. Subsequently, in the 1940s, its name was changed to Eckington Grammar School, which later became Derbyshire’s first comprehensive school in 1957. The present-day Westfield School campus opened its doors in the year 2007. The Ministry of Education inspects its programs and grants credit courses towards acquiring an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or OSSD. This institution accommodates numerous classes of various sizes, which combine experiential learning with creative and analytical thinking. It offers a number of courses in various fields of study, such as International Business, Financial Accounting Principles, Arts, Visual Arts, Business, Marketing, Business Leadership, Mathematics Canadian and World Studies, Civics and Citizenship, and Environment and Resource Management, among others. The Westfield Secondary School campus has a dining hall, a common area with games, and a study area. It also partners up with local communities and fitness centres to provide exercise amenities and sporting events, such as basketball and swimming. This institution also extends a Principal Recommendation Letter to the students who require post-secondary scholarships. By way of its own Scholarship fund, the school rewards select students who exhibit exceptional academic achievement. Westfield Secondary School also offers featured courses in partnership with Trent’s EAP program with an aim to facilitate a smooth transition between secondary and post-secondary education. It also extends additional support after school hours in its study hall, wherein students are prepared for the compulsory Ontario Secondary School Literacy Test. During this session, instructors also provide homework support. Furthermore, the institution offers an optional IELTS program on Saturdays, the goal of which is to enhance one’s IELTS score as well as English literacy skills. This school also provides exam preparation, tutoring, and homework support. Students can benefit from its extensive co-curricular programs, progressive curriculum, and supportive residential environment at the Westfield Secondary School.

Name: Georgian College - Orillia
Overview: Georgian College-Orillia is a publicly funded College of Applied Arts and Technology in Ontario, located 143.9 kilometres northwest of Toronto, Canada. More than 130 industry-focused programmes are available at the college in the automotive business, computer studies, community safety, design, visual arts etc., along with providing Human Services, Community Safety and Veterinary programs. Furthermore, Georgian’s Orillia Campus focuses on hands-on learning and provides research, field placements, a library, a meditative labyrinth, and a veterinary clinic. The college is the first institute to receive the prestigious title of Ashoka Changemaker College. The acceptance rate of the institute is 81%, thereby giving a chance to a bulk of aspiring talents. The college has gained popularity by receiving the highest score among Ontario colleges in the International Student Barometer (ISB) survey. Also, the college holds the 1st rank in Ontario by ISB Survey, 98th rank in Canada and 92nd rank in the country by Webometrics. The college has managed to get recognition by receiving prestigious titles from various agencies. Besides, the college extends on giving on-site residence to more than 192 students in three four-storey buildings. It makes sure that all the students experience real-world opportunities and challenges, develop entrepreneurial mindsets—All of the classes are taught in both English and Bilingual. Students can also opt for full-time, part-time and preparation courses as per their requirements.
Eligibility Overview: Basic admittance criteria Certificate and degree programmes for graduate students:Graduate certificate programmes have different admissions requirements, but all applicants must have completed a college diploma, advanced diploma, or bachelor's degree from a recognised institution.An OSSD with six Grade 12 U or M level courses is required for degree programmes. Grade point average (GPA) standards are common in most degree programmes. As part of the admissions process, previous grades of less than 60% at the post-secondary level will be examined. Degree programme applicants are not eligible for equivalency testing to meet admission requirements.  The ability to communicate in English At Georgian College, the language of instruction is English. In addition to the academic admission standards, those applicants who do not speak English as their first language or who come from countries where English is not an official language must present proof of language proficiency.

The college boasts that nearly 90% of its graduates find work within six months of graduation. With 100% practical experience and significant financial opportunities, the college has established itself as one of the best options for overseas students wishing to study in Canada.

Name: Winston College
Overview: Winston College is a PTIB-accredited post-secondary career education institute in British Columbia. It is situated in the heart of Metro Vancouver and based within the city of New Westminster. This college is also an EQA designation holder, and also features on the DLI list of CIC. The various programs offered by Winston College are Diploma of Business Administration, Diploma of Business Administration & Co-op, Diploma of Hospitality Management + Co-op, Diploma of Hospitality Management, Accounting Diploma, Diploma of Sport Management, ESL-LEAP, and Certificate of Bookkeeping & Payroll. This institution offers a continuous monthly intake system that enables candidates to start at any time. Several programs at this college have one-year practicum (Co-op) requirements. Winston College tuition fees for the various programs ranges between $4,500 and $21,000 for domestic students. For international candidates, this value lies in the range of $5,500 to $25,000. For domestic candidates of Continuing Education Courses, the fee payable ranges from $700 to $1,000 and for international students of the same courses, this value lies between $1,100 and $1,200. The programs at this institute have received approval from Human Resources & Skill Development Canada (HRSDC). They also qualify for Student Loans through StudentAid BC. The Student Aid BC program is entirely need-based via a standard Student Aid BC assessment. There are two categories of students who come to school at Winston College - international students and local students. The procedure for application is similar for both these categories only with an exception of the VISA process study permit applications for international candidates. The instructors at Winston College are trained in industry experience and job market search. Students receive coaching while studying job market trends so as to choose the right career path.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Must have a high school diploma or equivalent and be 19 years old.English language requirements to ensure that all international students have adequate English skills to learn and communicate, they must provide proof IELTS: 5.5 or higher ORMinimum 60% on Winston College's "English Placement Test." Note: Students who score below 60% will be required to take ESL classes until their English abilities improve and they pass the "English Placement Test."
Placement: Winston College offers career-related programmes for international, local, and freshly arrived students that would prepare them for employment in as little as a few months. Programs are tailored to today's employment environment, and the global economy's continually changing demands. The college provides degrees in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, and Sports Management, concentrating on the most in-demand occupations. Winston also provides flexible timetables to fit the needs of students.
Accommodation: Off-Campus Accommodation Winston College does not provide on-campus accommodation. The places that are near to the campus provide a safe and comfortable place for students. The students can find a place for themselves according to their requirements. Naming a few places near the campus are :  Burris streetThree Kittens Guest HouseHappy Day InnMichael's Lodge

Name: Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) - St. Johns Campus
Overview: Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) began as Memorial University College (MUC) in 1925 as a memorial to Newfoundlanders sacrificing their lives during World War I. This multidisciplinary institute also known as Memorial University has several campus locations with its main and largest campus situated in St. Johns. Memorial University’s biggest campus houses research and teaching facilities for the six schools and six faculties of Memorial. It also serves as the administrative hub of this university. Some of the programs offered at this campus include a Certificate program in Ancient languages, Bachelor’s program in Anthropology, Master’s program in Anthropology, Diploma program in Ancient worlds and many more. The female and male student ratio at Memorial University of Newfoundland is 56:44. The student to faculty ratio at this university is 12:9. For strengthening its commitment towards research in ocean-related areas and harnessing the massive potential of the world’s ocean, MUN partners with a 220 CAD million collaborative research initiative - Ocean Frontier Institute. The faculties of Memorial are recipients of many honours and awards for their contributions to the society. The Governor General’s Innovation Award (2018 and 2019), Arctic Inspiration Prize, UN’s Climate Solution Award, and SSHRC Impact Awards (including Gold Medal and Insight Award) are some international and national accolades demonstrating this institute as a global research university. According to QS Ranking, this institute ranked 701 in the World University Ranking 2020. MUN provides more than 1600 internship and co-op placements opportunities in research centres and organizations across the world. Some notable personalities of the massive Memorial University of Newfoundland alumni network include novelist Wayne Johnston, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development Dale Kirby, British physiologist Mary Constance Cecile Lobban, and historian Robert Gellately.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsYou must have graduated from a recognised university preparatory programme with approved senior level courses in five subject areas, which often include: English. Mathematics. Language, whether modern or antique, or laboratory science.

Name: Memorial University of Newfoundland
Overview: Founded in 1925, the Memorial University of Newfoundland, also called Memorial University, is committed to innovation, excellence, and creativity in education, research, scholarship, and public engagement. It consists of 4 primary and two satellite campuses. St. John's, the main campus, offers various academic programs in a well-built area. The Marine Institute is considered one of the world's largest marine educational institutes.The Grenfell campus of the University specializes in environmental and exemplary art programs. It has six schools, including Music, Nursing, Graduate Studies, Recreation, Pharmacy, Social Work, and Human Kinetics. The University's six faculties are business administration, arts, medicine, education, engineering, and science. The University provides over 100 undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, Diplomas, Certificate courses, other online courses, and degrees.Memorial University provides Memorial Entrepreneurship Training Program, and it is Canada's first program for international entrepreneurship training. This program is offered to international graduate students interested in starting a business. It is also the only University in the world offering a combined program in Ocean and Naval Architectural Engineering and the only institute in Atlantic Canada to provide a bachelor of fine arts degree with alternatives in acting or theatre production. The Memorial University Of Newfoundland offers financial aid to full-time international students who are academically eligible.International postgraduate students are eligible for external funding through the Government of Canada, the China Scholarship Council, Vietnam International Education Development, or the King Abdullah Scholarship Program. The University conducts Career & Graduate School Fair for campus recruitments and career networking to help students build their professional contacts. The average annual salary of the graduates is CAD 57,000.
Eligibility Overview: Students must have graduated from a recognised university preparatory programme with approved senior-level courses in five subject areas, which often include:EnglishMathematicsLanguage, whether modern or classical or laboratory scienceSocial Science Elective A minimum grade requirement : A minimum overall grade of 50% in the essential subject areas is required. This is usually comparable to no more than two grades below 50% and a "pass" in each of the five academic areas. English Language Proficiency Requirement :                   Admission to a competitive programme (if applicable) : Some programmes have a restricted number of spots, thus admission is tough. As part of the faculty-specific admissions, a higher admission average and/or further material may be required.

Name: LaSalle College - Vancouver
Overview: Established in 1988, LaSalle College, Vancouver, provides various certificate and degree programs in sectors including Game Design & VFX, Graphic Design, Interior Design, Audio & Film, Fashion, and Culinary. LaSalle College offers both online and on-campus programs. It allows students to get involved in collaborative learning experiences, familiarising them with other disciplines. LaSalle College Vancouver ranks 1 in Canada according to Princeton Review 2018. The college is also part of the LCI Education network, with 23 campuses across five continents. The average class size at LaSalle College is 15, allowing one-on-one attention from professors who are industry experts. The Career Service Team at LaSalle College offers placement assistance. Amy Herndon (Fashion Designer) and Nikki Snider(VFX for Film and Television) are among the renowned alums of the institute. Each quarter's tuition is payable 30 days after the start of classes. No student may register for any academic quarter until all unpaid tuition and fees are settled in full or until the student has set up an authorized alternative payment plan. International students must pay $11,040 in tuition. The college grants overseas students up to $18,000 ($300.00/credit registered). Beneficiaries of bursaries must follow the Student Code of Conduct at LaSalle College Vancouver. They are required to participate in events, help potential students, and give back to the campus community. For every $100 granted, students are required to give up to an hour of their time.
