Name: Concordia University
Overview: Concordia University is a comprehensive public research university commonly referred to as Concordia. It was established in 1974 and is located in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Concordia University has two campuses divided among four faculties, a school for graduate studies, and various centers, colleges, and institutes. They offer more than 300 undergraduate and 100 graduate courses. Popular majors at Concordia are English language & literature, Linguistics, Sociology, Accounting & Finance, Education, Communication & Media Studies, and Psychology.CU provides a broad range of continuous education and online and experiential learning programs for international learners across the globe. The annual average cost of attendance for undergraduate programs is approx 16,511 CAD a year, subtracting all the other expenditures. Concordia University provides practical exposure as well as excellent classroom experiences to students. They offer various career opportunities to students like Co-op Work-Study programs, Apprenticeships, Internships, on-campus employment like Teaching Assistantship, student teaching, part-time or summer jobs, and part-time and full-time placements after completion of the degree.The University grants various scholarships and financial aid to its International Students, which can be need-based or merit-based. The average Concordia Merit Scholarship is approximately valued at 10,000 CAD.

Course Ranking: The university offers more than 400 undergraduate programmes through its faculties of arts and sciences, the Gina Cody School of engineering and computer science, the faculty of fine arts, and the John Molson School of business, with selective cases being admitted in January and May. While an undergraduate degree typically requires three or four years of full-time study, a master's degree can be earned in one to three years, and a doctorate can be earned in at least four years.Regarding Concordia University course rankings, Bloomsberg placed the university in second place for the Best Business School in Canada category in 2020. According to the Times Higher Education course ranking 2022, Concordia is placed 251–300 in the arts and humanities, 251–300 in engineering and technologies, 301–400 in business and economics, and 201-250 in education. Concordia is ranked 171 in Arts & Humanities, 179 in Engineering, and 238 in Computer Science by US News.
University Ranking: Quebec, Canada's Concordia Institution, is a public research university established in 1974. One of the three universities in Quebec that employs English as its major medium of instruction is the university. Numerous sources that rate universities worldwide have recognised Concordia as one of the best. In the 2023 QS World University Ranking, Concordia is listed between positions 551 and 560. In US News' list of the 657 best global universities for 2022, the university came in at number 657. Additionally, it received a 601–800 ranking in Time Higher Education's 2022 World University Ranking. Candidates should know that various rating groups employ different criteria to determine their rankings.While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%), followed by the Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases its rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). In the Shanghai ranking, institutions are ranked based on the calibre of academic research they generate and the number of Nobel Prizes their faculty have earned rather than on their reputation among academics or employers. Consult the Concordia University Placement.

Name: New Brunswick Community College - Woodstock
Overview: New Brunswick Community College is a public community college established in 1974. It holds affiliation with CCAA, CBIE, ACCC, and AUCC. The college spreads across five locations - Miramichi, Fredericton, Moncton, Saint John, St. Andrews, and Woodstock. In Woodstock, students can meet their regular and entertainment needs through the nearest groceries, hotels, movie theatres, Upper River Valley Hospital, etc.Taxi services are also available. It takes approximately an hour to reach the nearest airport in the provincial capital of Fredericton. This campus specializes in Business Administration, Information Technology, Health, Social Sciences, and Trades subjects. Students can apply for other issues such as Carpentry, Early Childhood Education, Electrical (Construction), Power Engineering Technology, Welding and Metal Fabrication, etc.The college awards scholarships like NBCC Foundation Awards and New Brunswick Public Colleges Entrance Scholarship to provide cost-effective education to eligible students. It offers apprenticeship in carpentry, allowing students to gain hands-on working experience. Online courses in Accounting (I and II), Anatomy and Physiology, Behavioural Interventions, etc., are available for students with busy schedules.The college also houses campus stores where students can purchase necessary academic supplies and other essentials. According to Webometrics, New Brunswick Community College ranking is 152nd in Canada. Applicants must meet the New Brunswick Community College IELTS Requirement, 6.0. Each subject must not be less than 5.5. The minimum TOEFL and Duolingo scores must be 80 and 100 out of 160, respectively. The college also considers Cambridge English, CAE, CanTEST, and PTE scores.If students cannot fulfill these eligibility requirements, they can opt for Language Pathway Programs such as NBCC English Summer Pathway Program and New Brunswick. Through Career Coach, students can browse for employment opportunities, receive career-related suggestions, build resumes, etc. According to a 2020 survey, approximately 86% of 2019 graduates were satisfied with their academic experience at New Brunswick Community College. 91% of graduates from the 2019 batch secured employment within one year of graduation.

Placement: In recent years, 89% of graduates have found work within a year of graduation. New Brunswick employed nearly all of the employed students. Brennan Group of Companies, Irving Oil Limited, Sun Life Financial, Xplornet Communications, Nova Scotia Hearing and Speech Centers, and other partner firms have opportunities posted on the university's website. Career Coach, NBCC Careers, Careerbeacon, Service Canada Job Bank, Government of New Brunswick Careers, and others are among the job search websites offered by New Brunswick Community College.

The majority of the homes contain a gym. Off-campus housing information can be found here.

Name: Hansa Language Centre
Overview:
Established in 1969, Hansa Language Centre is one of the biggest and most established Canadian language schools. Hansa has two campuses, and both of them are conveniently situated in midtown Toronto, a few steps away from the Eglinton subway station. 
This institute is recognized by Languages Canada and the MTCU. The full-time students of Hansa are eligible for student visa authorization. Besides this, Hansa Language Centre has liaisons with more than a dozen Canadian high schools, universities, colleges, and scholarship opportunities.
Along with a number of English classes, students go through a flexible schedule and a range of excursions, trips, social activities and sports. This institute also extends teacher training programs and foreign language programs for Canadians like Spanish, German, French, and Mandarin.
The class sizes of Hansa are small, and there is an average of only nine students in each class. Students from Hansa Language Centre have been known to consistently outscore other students on IELTS, TOEFL, TOEIC examinations.
The various English programs offered by this institute include Intensive English Programs, Academic Preparation Program, Exam Preparation Courses for IELTS, TOEFL, CELPIP. Besides these, it provides Evening & Saturday English Programs, Executive English Program (Private Classes), and Junior Program.
Some foreign languages taught here include Arabic, French, German, Russian, Spanish, Portuguese, etc.
Hansa Language Centre Toronto has a homestay program through which students get a private room in a family home along with meals per week. Alternatively, students not interested in living with a family can opt for residences in Toronto.

Name: Nipissing University
Overview: Located in North Bay, Ontario, Canada, Nipissing University is a public institution internationally recognized for providing research opportunities to its students. Established on December 10, 1992, Nipissing University has more than 5,000 undergraduate and over 150 post-graduate students. The University offers professional degrees in criminal justice, business, commerce, social work, etc. Some of the top programs at Nipissing University are B.A. in History, M.A. in Sociology, M.S. in Kinesiology, Master of Education, and B.S. in Mathematics. It has several partnership programs, including a collaborative nursing program with Canadore. The university has an extensive internship program with career resources and placement offers for its students. Students seeking part-time employment can find jobs on the Nipissing campus. International students in their upper years who can demonstrate financial need are given part-time jobs on campus through the International Work-Study program.Nipissing University Student Housing operates four residence halls, an apartment complex, and suite-style residences. Each townhouse has basic amenities, including a full kitchen and a laundry room. Nipissing University has a student-centered approach and guarantees the comfort of every student.The average tuition fee at Nipissing University is 3,761 USD. International Students have access to funding and Nipissing University Entrance Scholarships. Based on their best grades, international students who enrol full-time in the first year of a degree programme at Nipissing University in the fall (September) or winter (January) terms will automatically be considered for a scholarship worth up to $24,000.

Name: Capilano University
Overview: Capilano University, also known as CapU, was established in 1968 with 700 students. Since then, the college has kept expanding and gained the title of a university in 2008. Today, Capilano University has four campuses with over 13,000 students enrolling yearly, with 9,000 students registering for full-time programs. Capilano University offers 14 bachelor's, seven associate degrees, 26 certification courses, 29 diploma programs, one graduation certification program, two graduate diploma programs, one post-baccalaureate program, and five post-baccalaureate diplomas.Some of the popular courses and programs offered at the university are BBA, BBM, BHM, Tourism Management, Hospitality Management, Science degree, art courses, etc.Capilano University is one of the largest public universities located in British Columbia. The institution is well-known for its wide range of courses and programs, with several scholarships available to students, even at the entrance stages. Apart from that, Capilano conducts regular industrial visits and guest lectures by experienced professionals for students to gain additional knowledge.

Name: Centre for Digital Media
Overview: The Centre for Digital Media is a university located in Vancouver, Canada. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Unassigned. The main campus of the Centre for Digital Media is located in Vancouver. The university offers 1 postgraduate program. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses.The Master of Digital Media programme at the Centre for Digital Media is a 16-month programme that is accredited by UBC, SFU, BCIT, and Emily Carr University of Art + Design.The graduates do get a competitive edge by receiving specialized training in the arts and creating strong entry-level portfolios.Applying for a Post Graduate Work Permit is possible for foreign students who enroll in this Master's programme (PGWP)Graduates who are enthusiastic about working in collaborative, diverse teams may be ideal candidates for this programme and discover routes into business, entrepreneurship, and/or higher education.Centre for Digital Media offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Name: Heartland International English School - Mississauga
Overview:
Established in 1999, Heartland International English School is a Canadian English School. Besides being a member of Languages Canada, it is also a Designated Learning Institution by IRCC. Located in Mississauga, Ontario, Heartland International English School - Mississauga  is close to the Square One area. 
The school has evolved quite a lot in terms of the academic curriculum and teaching techniques over the past 20 years. The faculties have adapted and improved teaching techniques and the curriculums have changed according to students needs. The Heartland International English School’s courses help achieve English learning goals of a student. There are pathway programs for preparing for colleges and universities as well as online programs. The programs are divided into semi-intensive, intensive and super-intensive courses depending on how quickly a student wants to learn english.  The certificates allow the students to skip the official English test and use the ‘Heartland Letter of Acceptance’ to apply to their partner post-secondary institution of the student’s choice and obtain a conditional admission to save their seat.
Heartland International English School has large and comfortable classrooms. They also provide the students 24x7 free access to wireless Internet, kitchen and household facilities, lounge and activity spaces and more. Heartland International English School tuition cost per year lies in the range of $9000.00 CAD to $9500.00 CAD. Summing this up with the cost of living applicable per year, the total estimated cost at this institute for a year is in the range of $22,000.00 CAD to $22,500.00 CAD.
Students of Heartland International English School - Mississauga can opt to stay  in a student residence or with a Heartland homestay family, or can make their own housing arrangements. Alternatively, they can find accommodation in a hotel or hostel, or stay in a homeshare or rent an apartment.

Name: Canadian College
Overview: Incorporated in 2008, Canadian College is a private college based in Vancouver. Situated in the centre of downtown Vancouver, this institute is on Alberni street along with famous hotels, top restaurants, and high-fashion retailers. The college campus includes classrooms, a sunny rooftop patio, offices, and  Restaurant. An off-campus student residence is also present within walking distance. Most students opt to live in resident apartments located in downtown Vancouver. These residences feature entirely furnished shared, single, and studio apartments. Equipped with facilities for helping student-centred learning, classrooms are situated on the second, third and fourth floors. Students can choose to pursue their studies in various programs, including International Trade, Hospitality, Tourism, Business, Information Technology, General Arts & Science, Social Media Marketing, Project Management, Supply Chain Management. For delivering the highest quality education to students, Canadian College works with several organisations. To name a few, these include Forum for International Trade Training (FITT), Adobe, Windows, American Hotel & Lodging Educational Institute, Project Management Institute, etc. Canadian College extends dual credentials for some of its programs. St Lawrence College, a public college based in Kingston, Ontario, awards the second credential. The Canadian College admission procedure consists of a few hassle-free steps. Students first need to fill out and submit their online application form. The college would then email the candidates requesting copies of their past education. It would also ask for the students’ English language proficiency. If a student’s application is accepted, the college will extend an offer letter. Additionally, it will also forward tuition payment information. Once a student’s tuition payment arrives, the college will send an acceptance letter. An international student can apply for a Study Permit after an acceptance letter is issued.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the conditions for admission to postgraduate diploma programmes:A high school diploma or equivalent from a recognised government institution in the candidate's home country is required.A minimum age of 19 is required.Proof of English language ability in the form of an IELTS, TOEFL, or other equivalent test score is required.In class, have and use a personal computer.
Placement: Vancouver is a burgeoning technology hub that is home to some of the world's most well-known enterprises. In Canada, the demand for experienced digital marketers has increased by 92 percent in the last five years. Job openings in the sector of digital marketing are also increasing at a rate of about 60% every year. The Canadian College of Technology and Business includes a work experience component in all of its programmes so that students may put what they've learned in class into practise.The table below shows the annual pay of graduates of the Canadian College of Technology and Business in various professions in Canada:

Name: Okanagan College - Penticton
Overview: Formed in 1963, Okanagan College is a post-secondary institution known for its degree and diploma courses. Located outside the Lower Mainland and Victoria in British Columbia, the college has received several affiliations from CiCAN, CCAA, CCBC, CBIE. The college initially changed its name to Okanagan University College in 1995 but went back to using the current name in 2005. Okanagan College offers over 120 certificate courses across bachelor’s, master and doctoral degrees. Currently, the college serves over 8,500 full-time students, attracting more than 20,500 applications for enrollment every year. The services are offered to students across four campuses. Situated in the Okanagan Valley of the Southern Interior of British Columbia, the Penticton campus is known for its active and energetic learning community. Some of the popular programs offered here include Practical Nursing Diploma, Health Care Assistant Certificate, Associate of Arts, Science, Business, Criminal Justice, IT and others. Currently, nearly 1,000 international students are studying in this college from across 40 countries. Okanagan College has been encouraging in inviting international students, setting a generous acceptance rate. They follow a student-faculty ratio of 19:1 in the classes. The increasing graduation rate of 63% shows the college's efforts in helping the students with their capabilities. Okanagan College fees might be burdensome for most international students, currently ranging between $55,000 and $60,000 for degree courses. However, the college offers scholarships to both virtual and face-to-face students based on their needs and merit. The joint venture of the college with the Student, Graduate and Co-op Employment Centre has enabled them to offer employment opportunities to the new graduates. With the first-hand training courses and practical knowledge of the industry, students can quickly gain employment within six months of graduation from this college.

Placement: Okanagan College supports students in finding work. To guarantee that students are job-ready once they graduate, career fairs and resume development seminars are held. Students can also participate in a Co-op programme at Okanagan College to gain work experience in their chosen disciplines.The Student, Graduate, and Co-op Employment Center at Okanagan College serves as a platform for alumni, students, and employers to connect.The students can make contact with a coordinator who can guide them through their job search based on their qualifications and interests.Wages for the jobs, which are primarily based in British Columbia and Alberta, range from $15 to $20 per hour. These pay rates are determined by the industry, job title, and eligibility.Several other positions are also listed on the College's official website. Students should, however, double-check the facts before applying.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Housing Life provides a one-of-a-kind educational, social, recreational, and leadership experience. Movie evenings, laser tag, BBQs, sports activities, games, and other organised social events provide much-needed leisure and an opportunity to meet new people and create lifelong friendships. For more information, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/housing#housing Off-Campus Accommodation Okanagan College allows postings of lodging for the benefit of its students, but it neither does any background checks on the landlords or writers of the listings nor verifies the truth of any of the information they contain. For more information, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/housing/off-campus-housing  Homestay Students participating in the Homestay programme live with a host family for a specified amount of time, providing a chance for cross-cultural engagement between Canadians and international students. They are assisted in adjusting to life in Canada by host families, who also gain knowledge of various nations and cultures. Students receive more chances to use their English and understand Canadian customs, values, and ways of life. Living with a host family is an effective strategy for studying and using English. The residence could be a townhouse, an apartment, or a house. Typically, a bus ride will take you from home to the school in less than 30 minutes. Families that are eager to help international students acclimate to Canadian society and who have an interest in different cultures are chosen as host families. A family with children, a family without children, or a lone individual may serve as the host family. For more information, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/international/international-housing#homestay  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.okanagan.bc.ca/housing

Name: College Avalon - Montreal
Overview: Incorporated in 1995, College Avalon is a Quebec-based education institute recognized by the Ministry of Education and Higher Education, Canada. This institute has expanded its curriculum and now includes an array of business programs. These are curated to foster employability, global awareness, and personal growth in a fast-changing environment. This expansion includes the introduction of a new campus in Montreal. The QS 2019 Best Student Cities survey ranked Montreal as North America’s best student city. Students also voted Montreal as the second-best student city globally. The various courses that students can opt for at College Avalon are divided into two categories – Language Courses and Ministerial Courses. There are three programs under the Ministerial Courses offered by this institute. The Computerized Accounting & Financial Management (AEC - LCA.FN) and International Business Management (AEC - LCA.FM) programs are of 24 months duration. They take place at College Avalon Montreal. The Executive Assistant (AEC - LCE.00) program is of 15 months duration and takes place at Quebec City and Montreal campuses. The upcoming intakes for all these programs will be taking place in January, May and September. Under the Languages Courses, there are two programs that this institute offers. The French as a Second Language (FSL) and English as a Second Language (ESL) courses at this institute take place at Quebec City and Montreal campuses. The international students of College Avalon are eligible for PSWP opportunities.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Gander
Overview: The Gander Campus of The College of the North Atlantic is located in central Newfoundland. The Public College is among the best post-secondary and education skills training institutions. The College offers a vast range of programs for various certificates and diploma courses. The College of the North Atlantic courses is diverse, focusing on different study areas. The University comprises 17 campus locations spread over the Labrador and Newfoundland provinces of Atlantic Canada. The student-faculty ratio is 4:1, with 700+ faculties and 7939 students. They provide several programs at undergraduate, postgraduate, associate and doctoral levels. The courses are offered to the students at some of the lowest tuition fees among all the other colleges in Atlanta, Canada. The students can benefit from many non-academic services and on-campus resources like a library, cafeteria, career counselling and guidance, a Career Exploration Centre, Student Services Office, Student Development Officer, and an active Student Council. The University has a total enrollment of 25,000 students. Among them, total full-time enrollment is 7,939; part-time enrollment is 1,510; and registration in continuing education is 11,754 students.Along with that, the annual acceptance rate of the University is 65%, and the number of international students is 3500. The Gander Campus offers several scholarships. These include the Glenn Mesh Memorial Award, Shane Gallant Memorial Entrance Scholarship, CICan Paul and Gerri Charette Bursary, A. Harvey Group of Companies Entrance Scholarships, Greg O'Keefe Memorial Award, and Helen Hooper Award.

Name: Rotman, UofT
Overview: The Rotman School of Management was set up in 1901 and is located in downtown Toronto. The Rotman School of Management is a part of the University of Toronto and is situated in Canada. The college has three campuses: Rotman Central is the main building offering research and graduate programs. The Rotman Commerce provides program services, student life associations, and career services. The Rotman South maintains the business stimulation and graduate programs on the campus. The university is known for its multicultural approaches and is the leading business school in Canada. The global collaboration efforts and innovation idea has impacted changes in the economy. The school provides a broad scope of behavioral economics, business design, healthcare, and life sciences. The college offers eight master's programs in business and management and medicine & health. The school additionally provides online career-launching and on-campus programs for women. The Full-Time Rotman MBA program is a limited program that merges 16 months of scholastics with a 4-month opportunity for a paid entry-level position. The school offers diploma courses for working professionals. The tuition fee is around CAD 127,930 for the full-time MBA program. The total cost per annum is around CAD 19,000 to CAD 27,556. The college offers various entrance scholarships and health care scholarships for international students. Rotman career services ensure excellent placement opportunities for the graduates. Some prime recruiting companies are Amazon, Deloitte, Apple, Blackberry, McKinsey, and IBM. The school offers academic accommodations for international students. The college additionally provides off-campus housing. The college has carried its diversity, including a range of students and cultural clubs. Rotman has introduced two fellowship programs for LGBTQ potential leaders. Library services are provided for the Rotman School of Management and Commerce programs.

Name: Saskatchewan Polytechnic -  Moose Jaw
Overview: Saskatchewan Polytechnic Moose Jaw campus is located on Treaty 4 territory, which is the Homeland of the Métis people. Established in 1959, the institution offers several diploma, degree, and certificate programs, including apprenticeship technical training. Students can also apply for distance education opportunities where popular courses like Business Management, Critical Care Nursing, Computer Systems Technology, etc., are available for them to study. A wide variety of amenities are available for the Saskatchewan Polytechnic students, from student clubs to other campus facilities like fitness centres, libraries, labs, etc. Saskatchewan Polytechnic ensures that the course curriculum is designed by keeping the industry requirements in mind so that students get to benefit from its collaborations across the world. The overall graduate employment rate stands at 94% at Saskatchewan Polytechnic. International students are welcome here who get to benefit from the institution’s clinical placement services, field investigations, etc. Employment services, academic and language support, assistance from international student advisors, etc., are also available for them. Several career fairs and industry networking events are organised by the institution every year, making it easier for students to get access to renowned companies. The alumni network is quite strong and includes renowned names like former Political Figure Sherwin Petersen, American Baseball Player Elsie Wingrove, Canadian Politician Roger Parent, and so on.It provides financial aid of CAD 2 million every year to help students finance their education and living expenses.

Name: McGill University
Overview: McGill University, located in Montreal, Quebec, is a reputed higher education institute and the 7th oldest University in Canada. The University has over 39,200 students, 68% undergraduate and 32% graduate students. The University offers a diverse educational environment with students from over 150 countries. McGill University had the highest percentage of Ph.D. students of any other research university in Canada. The University has an acceptance rate of 46%. The University has experienced faculty members who provide students with the required knowledge and help them develop skills in their respective areas of study.The University offers undergraduate and postgraduate courses in different areas of study, such as biomedical engineering, chemistry, business analytics, architecture, chemical energy, and anthropology. The University's main campus is in Montreal, a safe and friendly city for all its international students.McGill University, Montreal, also provides internships to the students to help them get better knowledge and exposure to the industry. The University also has a Career Planning Service (CAPS), responsible for assisting students in building a solid resume, which is essential for finding a suitable job. Some of the famous alums of the University include William Shatner (known for his role in Star Trek), Julie Payette (current Governor-General of Canada), and Mark J. Poznansky (scientist). Researchers at McGill University have made notable discoveries, such as the advancement of atomic theory and the creation of genetic codes and DNA.
Eligibility Overview: To enroll in University desired programs at McGill University, candidates must fulfill the below-mentioned eligibility criteria:   Educational Qualifications:A Bachelor's degree (or equivalent as recognized by McGill University) in a subject closely related to the one selected for graduate work. If you have obtained your educational credentials at an institution outside of Canada, you will be assessed for equivalency with a McGill University degree.  Academic Achievements: The minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) is 3.0 out of a possible 4.0, or a Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.2 out of 4.0 in the last two years of full-time studies. In some departments, a higher CGPA is required for admission.  Proficiency in English:The primary language of instruction at McGill is English. Before admission, you may need to demonstrate an adequate English proficiency level.You may make arrangements to write papers, examinations, or theses in French, except in cases where knowledge of English is one of the course's objectives.  Undergraduate: • TOEFL iBT - Minimum score of 100• PTE Academic - An overall score of 65 (with each component score of 60)• Duolingo - Score of 115 or better (120 for BCom, BEd (TESL))• IELTS Academic score - Overall 6.0 band score (with no score lower than 6.0 in any component)Postgraduate:IELTS Academic - An overall band score of 6.5 or more (with individual component scores of 6.0)TOEFL iBT - Overall minimum score of 86, with a minimum of 20 in component scores
Placement: McGill University offers placements to its students with good packages irrespective of their academic discipline.  Highlights:About 91% of students received offer letters from top recruiters within three months of graduation during the campus drive. The doctorate at McGill University is the best-paying degree, with an average salary of $118,000 per annum. Hired students at McGill University make an average base income of 93,389 CAD.Working students who gave salary information said they received a signing bonus in 35% of cases. The average signing bonus for McGill graduates is 11,212 Canadian dollars.McGill has a strong startup culture with 400+ active enterprises started by graduates operating in 36 countries.The Dobson Center for Entrepreneurship has helped create nearly 8,000 employment.McGill University's enterprises have raised more than 1.5 billion Canadian dollars, up 50% from the previous year.  The top recruiters at the University during its placement drive include:- ABB- Deloitte- Abbott- KPMG- PwC- IBM- Amazon- McKinsey & Company- GSK- Walmart- Royal Bank of CanadaThe full degrees and their average annual packages in CAD offered to graduates are as follows:

Name: Selkirk College - Castlegar
Overview: Established in 1966 and situated in British Columbia, Canada, Selkirk College is the first community college. This institution has turned into one of the biggest in the Boundary and West Kootenay regions. This college is approved by CCAA, CBIE, ACCC, BCAA and CUP. This institution has 6 campuses and 2 learning centres. Castlegar, is the main campus, while the others include the ones on Victoria Street, the Trail, the Tenth Street, the Silver King, and the Grand Forks. There is a special Gathering space on the Castlegar campus that dedicatedly promotes culture, ceremony and tradition. This college offers various courses in different disciplines, namely Lifespan Autism training, Hospitality and Tourism, Peace and Justice Studies, Business, Academic Upgrading and Development, Environment and Geomatics, University Arts and Sciences and Health. Besides, this institution offers Diplomas, Post-Secondary certificates and associate degrees, University Transfers, Post-graduate diplomas etc. for aspiring candidates seeking to study in Canada. Selkirk College also manages a school of University Arts and Sciences which provides more than 100 arts and science courses to the students for their bachelor’s degrees. As per a survey, nearly 89% of students are inspired by the interactive sessions conducted by the faculty. Some of the most prominent programs available at this college are Pharmacy Technician and Philosophy, Biochemistry, Anthropology and Forest technology. Moreover, international students can choose the English Language program and teach English to speakers of other languages. This college provides innovative and unique learning opportunities through more than 60 well-known programs. In addition to that, the Castlegar campus comprises a majority of administrative offices, ample student resources and necessary facilities. This institution offers several financial aids and student awards Bursaries, SIDIT bursaries, Entrance scholarships etc. The student-to-faculty ratio is 15:1, where faculties provide individual support and share real-world experiences with the students.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements and English language proficiency score requirements: An average GPA of 2.5 English 12 with a grade of 60% or higherHave completed a BC Senior Secondary School or equivalent19 years old or above at the time of application, or under 19 years old but have a signed reference from the Secondary School Principal
Placement: Placements in Uganda and Jamaica for International Practicums Nicole Valley Institute of Technology and Selkirk College offer five-week practicum internships in Uganda or Jamaica for Health and Human Services students. The qualification will be determined by the current programme and year, as well as several other criteria. Students with impairments, those from low-income families, and those who identify as Indigenous will be given special consideration. For Uganda Winter Cohort: Nursing students in Selkirk enrolled in a four-year programme.Spring Cohort:  Selkirk: Nursing students in their third yearSelkirk: ECCE, SSW, and EACSW students for two years For Jamaica Spring Cohort :Selkirk: ECCE, SSW, and EACSW students for two years Other prerequisites for qualifying include: Full-time enrollment at Selkirk College or the Nicola Valley Institute of Technology (NVIT)Submit proof of citizenship in CanadaContinue to receive positive practice evaluationsKeep a grade point average (GPA) of  2.3 or better

It is advised that you study for a minimum of four months (one semester). For more information, visit: https://selkirk.ca/international/our-students/accommodation/homestay-best-choice-new-students  Student HousingFor Canadian and international students, Student Housing offers independent living on the Castlegar site and Nelson's Tenth Street Campus. Meals are not included in the price. For more information, visit: https://selkirk.ca/services/campus-services/student-housing-services  Off-Campus AccommodationFor Canadian and international students, Student Housing offers independent living on the Castlegar site and Nelson's Tenth Street Campus. Meals are not included in the price. For more information, visit: https://selkirk.ca/international/our-students/accommodation/campus-housing For general enquiries, visit: https://selkirk.ca/international/our-students/accommodation

Name: Lethbridge College
Overview: Lethbridge College is a renowned public research college located in Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada, which focuses primarily on applied research in Aquaculture and Quantitative Public Opinion Studies. The college has regional campuses in Claresholm, Vulcan County, Pincher Creek, and Lethbridge's main campus. Students get several prerequisites like career training certificates, diplomas, applied bachelor's degrees in Academic Upgrading, Administrative, Agriculture, Automotive, Business Administration, Early Childhood Education, Interior Design, etc. The institution offers university transfer programs, preparatory studies, vocational training, and over 50 career programs. It also ensures quality education to its students by keeping a compact classroom size. In addition, Lethbridge College provides ESL programs for international students to cope with academics easily, is associated with ACCC, CCAA, AACTI, and CBIE, and is a member of the Alberta Rural Development Network. According to World Report and U.S. News, the college secured 36th position in Canada and 1,470th globally. According to Times Higher Education, the institute ranked 1001st among World Universities and secured 50th rank among Top Research Colleges in Canada. In addition to all the opportunities, the college provides continuing education, online learning courses, e-learning cafes, accommodation facilities, and on-campus and off-campus job postings.The average tuition fee is approximately 12,100 CAD.

Placement: ACCUPLACER is the primary placement assessment used by Lethbridge College. You may be required to complete all or part of the ACCUPLACER assessment if you are applying to a programme as a mature student or international student, or if you are applying to the Academic Upgrading programme. If the students are unable to complete the ACCUPLACER assessment at Lethbridge College, they can do it at one of the regional campuses, with an off-campus proctor, or online. They will need to fill out an out-of-town request for placement testing form for each of these possibilities. The ACCUPLACER assessment is used to demonstrate one's abilities and knowledge so that the students can be put in programmes or courses that are appropriate for them. Admissions specialists can utilize the scores to suggest programmes that are appropriate for one's skill level.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation :  The students will have an experience when they are community residents. Throughout the school year, programmes, events, and activities will make you feel like a member of the Kodiaks family and #WEAREALLKODIAKS!!! As the student strives toward the goals, the entire Residence Life team will be there for each of the students every step of the way. The residences of Lethbridge College are set in beautiful surroundings with views of the Rocky MountainsStudents will enjoy the convenience of living on campus while still being close to a variety of off-campus servicesEach person has their bedroom in their shared lodgings, but they share common areas and toilets in either four-bedroom or two-bedroom apartment-style apartments and the dormitories are situated on both sides of the campusDishes, utensils, toasters, coffee makers, and essential cookware are included in these completely furnished apartments For more information, visit:  https://lethbridgecollege.ca/departments/residence-life  Off-Campus Accommodation :  The average monthly rent is between $550 and $650 Canadian dollarsStudio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential typesThe apartments have Wi-Fi internet, kitchen supplies, laundry, and all utilitiesThe apartments are conveniently positioned near grocery stores, restaurants, banks, and university campuses

Name: Western University - THE UNIVERSITY OF WESTERN ONTARIO
Overview: The University of Western Ontario, now known as Western University, is a public research institute established in 1878 in Ontario, Canada. It has a student enrollment of 40,000 students, of which 5,800 are international students from 128 nations. There are 12 academic faculties and schools, including Arts & Humanities, Law, Health Sciences and Engineering, offering 400 undergraduate specializations and 88 graduate degree programs. Some of the courses are Anthropology, Geology, Political Science, Classical Studies and Mechanical Engineering. The university also offers courses in conjunction with certain affiliate universities and colleges such as King's University College and Brescia University College. Western University has a 481.2-hectare campus in London, Ontario, with five libraries (Music Library, Allyn & Betty Taylor Library, The D.B Weldon Library etc.), the Education Resource Centre and the Archives and Special Collections. Those looking to pursue higher education or interest can enroll in the Western Continuing Studies program comprising certificate, diploma, online, professional development and post-degree programs. Areas covered include Design, Public Relations, Human Resources, Conflict Management etc. There are several Distance Learning courses to choose from for Western University and other Canadian university students. Students can participate in exchanges, summer programs, research expeditions, internships, and placements through the study abroad program. Western University's IB Certificate in Teaching and Learning in partnership with the International Baccalaureate enables educators to enhance their skills. The ASPIRE program provides Additional Qualification and Teacher Professional Development courses. Financial assistance options include scholarships, bursaries, loans, student employment and grants like the Loran Award, Surex Scholarship Program, OSAP, First Generation Bursary and Work-Study. Delaware Hall, Alumni House, London Hall etc., provide undergraduate accommodation in traditional, suite and hybrid-style buildings. Graduate accommodation is available at the University Apartments and family housing at the Platt's Lane Estates. There are over 180 cultural, academic, sports and professional student clubs to join. Western University is known for its student employment rate of 95.2%.
Eligibility Overview: The minimal admission requirements for international students applying to Western University's Undergraduate, Graduate, and Postdoctoral programmes are listed here. Interested students should visit program-specific websites to learn more about the admission requirements for each graduate programme.Undergraduate StudiesApplicants from India who wish to be admitted to Western University on the basis of their senior secondary matriculation must provide the following documents:Grade XII results can be submitted in one of the following ways:All India Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination (AISSSCE) is administered by the CBSE.CISCE stands for Indian School Certificate.Intermediate/Pre-University/Higher Secondary/Senior Secondary School Certificate – State BoardsOn the basis of mid-year/mid-term results, applicants may be evaluated for conditional admission. As an academic record, Grade X scores must be given.The results must be issued by the proper examinations board. Photocopies are permissible if the school principal, head, counsellor, or authorised examination board has certified them. Notarized copies aren't allowed.Master's DegreesA four-year degree from a university, college, or institute is required.Any course studied in the last two full-time years of the undergraduate degree must have an average score of at least 70%.Equivalent qualifications will be assessed based on the discipline or profession's norms.Doctoral StudiesApplicants must hold a master's degree or its equivalent from a university, college, or institute, as well as demonstrate research potential.For application, a master's degree with a minimum grade point average of 70% is necessary.Documentation requirements differ by programme at Western. There are, however, a few common documents that all applicants must present during the application process:TranscriptsScores on IELTS/TOEFL/DETGoals and Objectives (some courses also require Essays and Personal Statement)Recommendation LetterResume
Placement: Western Engineering believes in connecting qualified studies with business partners to assist students interact with prospective future careers while also seeing their study make a real-world impact. Internship opportunities in Western Engineering are listed below.The Graduate Student Internship Program aims to bridge the gap between academia and industry. Graduate students can improve their abilities and expand their professional portfolios while also contributing to the aims and outcomes of their host agency through internships.For More:https://www.eng.uwo.ca/graduate/funding/internship.html
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.Western University offers a clean, attractive, well-kept, cost-effective, and secure living and studying environment.For the past 11 years, it has been ranked as the top large university in Canada.On-campus housing can be found here.https://residence.uwo.ca/
Course Ranking: Times Higher Education rankings states, the Business and Economics course at Western University is ranked between 126 and 150 in the area of business courses in 2022. The university has maintained its rank between 126 and 150 since 2020. According to the Times Higher Education (THE) rankings, the engineering and technology courses are now ranked higher than they were the year before. The Engineering and Technology programme is ranked between positions 201-250 in 2022. In contrast, the Engineering and Technology course's rank in 2021 ranged from position 251 to position 300.According to the Times Higher Education rankings for 2022, Western University's computer science programme is ranked between 301 and 400. Comparing the Computer Science course's ranking to the one from the previous year, there has been a fall. The university's ranking in 2021 ranged from 251 to 300.
University Ranking: Western University, which was established in 1878, is regarded as Canada's most attractive university. Gothic-style and modern, LEED-certified buildings coexist on the university's main campus, creating the perfect setting for the academic community. In terms of rankings, Western University comes in at #294 in the world, according to U.S. News & World Report 2022. U.S. News determines the rankings by taking into account factors such as the reputation of global and regional researchers, as well as the reputation of books, articles, conferences, etc. According to the most recent QS rankings, the university ranks in the top 200 universities in the world. The QS ranking for Western University in 2023 is 172. Western University is ranked #170 in the 2022 QS World University Rankings. Indicators such as employer reputation, academic reputation, citations per faculty member, faculty to student ratio, and international faculty to international student ratio are all assigned varying weights in the QS World University Rankings. Western University is ranked among the top 200–250 worldwide universities in 2022 by the Times Higher Education World University Rankings. In the Times Higher Education rankings, it has retained its place from the prior year.

Name: Sault College - Toronto
Overview: Sault College was established in 1965 as one of the prominent Ontario Vocational Centres. The college is accredited by the Canadian public post-secondary institution and has received several affiliations such as CCAA, ACCC, and AUCC.The college has more than 4500 full-time and part-time students. Sault College offers multiple degrees, diplomas, certificates, and training programs. Sault College courses include more than 160 areas of study. Some of the most popular ones include Aviation Techniques, Business studies, Child and Youth Care, Culinary Management, Engineering, Project management, and various others. The Toronto Campus is mainly famous because of its location. Students here receive significant facilities, including a library, television and cable, gaming, Wi-Fi, personal mail, and conferencing. Besides being academic and educational, the students also receive industry-specific training from tutors. Sault College aims at improving its diversity with an increased number of international students. For this, it has maintained a moderate acceptance rate. Apart from offering educational services, the refreshment facilities of the college have helped it generate an average student retention rate of 85%. The placement opportunities available for the students here are divided between work placement, field placement, and co-op placement offers. About 91% of the students usually get employed within the first six months of graduation. The fee structure decided here might be affordable for international students since it ranges between $14,000 and $18,000. The college arranges multiple Scholarships, Bursaries, and Awards programs to recognize deserving students every year.
Eligibility Overview: For diploma and college certificate programs, English language proficiency is required.The results must be from within two years of the program's commencement date and must match the following criteria: 1. A TOEFL iBT score of 79-80 and no tests below 20 on the Internet-based test2. An IELTS Academic score of 6.0 with no band below 5.5 is required.3. Pass the Cambridge English Exam C1 Advanced or C2 Proficiency with a grade of B or above. 4. A Cambridge score of 169 or higher, with no one exam score of less than 162.5. Academic PTE 606. Duolingo 1057. CAEL CE 60, 8. Level 7 of the Canadian Language Benchmarks (CLB) in all categories (reading, writing, speaking, and listening). India as a whole Secondary School Certificate/Intermediate Certificate Senior School Certificate, Higher Secondary School Certificate, Year 12 State Board Exams (AISSCE, ISCE, SSC) (AISSCE, ISC, Pre-University Certificate Statement of Marks)
Accommodation: Housing and Connections Off-CampusFor students, finding off-campus accommodation can be challenging and time-consuming. Sault College aims to make the process as simple as possible for you so you can focus on your studies and other responsibilities. The college has teamed with Places4Students Inc. to provide a variety of housing options for students. Places4Students delivers the finest quality off-campus housing service to students, colleges, and landlords.   ON campus Accommodation    The room price covers wired and wireless high-speed internet throughout the building, full cable in each room and suite, unrestricted use of the laundry facilities, and a Residence Activity charge. The students who wish to defer payment of their residence fees until they receive OSAP or other government assistance must submit a Residence Payment Extension Form by July 22, 2022.

Name: Fraser International College (FIC)
Overview: Fraser International College (FIC) is a private institution running under the parent organization Simon Fraser University. It is located in the Barnaby Campus of this university and is in the vicinity of Canada’s Vancouver city. \This is the only campus of this college. Macleans 2020 ranked FIC first in the comprehensive Canadian universities list. World’s Universities with Real Impact 2020 ranked it seventh regarding innovation entrepreneurial spirit. This institute also featured in the top 1% in Worldwide Rankings by QS 2020. International students can complete their first year at Fraser International College through the UTP (university transfer program) Stage II. This program is equivalent to a first-year university program, and students can directly progress into their degree’s 2nd year at SFU. International students get enrolled at this college in three intakes - January, May and September. Students can participate in over 40 outdoor, sports, leadership and educational programs hosted by Simon Fraser University in Vancouver city. Fraser International College students can find single room accommodation featuring all necessary facilities in SFU residences at Burnaby campus. These residences are located within a short walking distance from classes. Alternatively, students can opt for off-campus options for accommodation in Canada. FIC extends several foundations and undergraduate pathway programs to international students, which are designated as UTP Stage I and UTP Stage II, respectively. UTP Stage I or Foundation programs are offered in science, arts, computing science, engineering, business administration, and social sciences. There are 12 undergraduate pathway programs at this institute, including bachelors in arts and social sciences, environment, communication, computing science, engineering science, art and technology, business administration, and many more.Besides these, FIC also provides an associate degree in arts, and there are also options for two support programs – integrated and cornerstone. FIC also extends several awards and scholarships. To name a few of them, these include the Academic Distinction Scholarship, Resiliency Award Scholarship, Principal’s Honour Roll, etc. Besides these, there is an opportunity for short-term emergency funding as well.
Eligibility Overview: Eligiblity is Country-specific. Please check here: https://www.fraseric.ca/admissions/admission-requirements/#:~:text=The%20minimum%20age%20requirement%20at,subject%20to%20change%20without%20notice.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: HousingFIC students have the option of living in SFU dorms on the Burnaby campus, which are only a short walk from lessons. Single rooms with extra-long mattresses and high-speed internet connection are available, as well as common spaces with shared TVs and microwaves. They also have a dining hall and a food plan for the entire residence community to use.Buses run on a regular basis between the campus and the Greater Vancouver rapid transit system at the foot of Burnaby Mountain. Visiting family members can also stay at SFU's on-campus hotel.Barbecue nights, movie nights, and 'rez' challenges are just a few of the usual activities that make on-campus housing enjoyable!Check here: https://www.fraseric.ca/future-students/accommodation/

Name: ABC Access Business College
Overview:
With over 17 years of experience, Access Business College is a renowned business school, authorised under the Ministry of Training, Universities and Colleges, Canada. This educational institution is equipped with professional and experienced teachers and industry leaders who guide and train students in their respective fields. The college encourages its students to explore and expand their interests and help them develop skills to turn those into employable skills.
Whether students wish to earn a diploma and add value to their current skill set or earn a certificate, Access Business College can provide the necessary training and education to help them achieve their long-term goals. This educational institution has been serving the community since 2003 and has assisted many graduates in achieving successful careers. This college offers high-demand diploma programmes and provides diverse courses for the benefit of its student community. Moreover, the teachers emphasize on using innovative pedagogical techniques for the students and ensure practical application of knowledge in their selected field of study.
The institute offers diplomas associated with business courses and also provides advanced degrees in graphic design, hotel management, finance, legal studies, banking, accounting, web design, and many more. The professors in this college are committed to resolving queries of the students and offer support and guidance. The graduates from this college are equipped with the necessary professional skills and knowledge to prepare them for a successful and fulfilling professional life.
Registered under Private Career College Act, 2005, the Diploma programmes of the institute are approved as vocational programmes. Their courses are developed after extensive research and consultation with adult education experts, potential employers etc. Further, these courses are supervised and taught by experienced faculty who understand the pressures of a volatile job market. The college also assists graduates in exploring different career opportunities by developing their interview skills, self-assessment, skills identification and development, preparing cover letters and professional resumes etc.

Name: Western Community College - South Surrey
Overview: Western Community College – South Surrey is a private institution based in South Surrey, which is a neighborhood in Surrey, British Colombia, Canada. It is recognized by the Ministry of Advanced Education, Skills And Training - British Columbia. As a part of the Western Community College, it partners with the Fairleigh Dickinson University, Glion Institute of Higher Education, Les Roches Global Hospitality Education, Nicola Valley Institute of Technology, Vancouver Community College, VMware IT Academy, and Microsoft Imagine Academy. This institution offers a number of courses in the fields of Accounting, Information Technology, Healthcare, Business Management, and English Language Programs. Moreover, premised upon an applicant’s academic and personal achievements, the Western Community College – South Surrey may extend financial aid in the form of a bursary. Students can, therefore, avail of the BC Student Loan, In-House Western Community College Financing, and Student Lines of Credit. In addition, the college offers a scholarship named Smt. Amarjeet Kaur Dhaliwal Scholarship, which encourages deserving students to further their education. This scholarship program also provides an easy monthly payment plan. It is offered to students based on their financial status, academic performance, participation in extracurricular activities, and expression of thoughts and motivation. Students opt for the Western Community College – South Surrey for its instalment-based, low tuition fee and 100% practicum placement. Alongside its full-time courses, the Western Community College – South Surrey also offers some part-time programs. Therefore, it allows students to enroll in its weekday, weekend, and evening classes, which are optionally available. The college is also an approved Amazon Career Choice provider and a CompTIA Authorized Academy Partner. The Western Community College – South Surrey aims to provide intensive and thorough programs that extend skills and credibility to students to compete for better positions. It has a graduate employment rate of 97%.

Name: Institut Teccart - Brossard
Overview: Established in 1945,Institut Teccart is known for its technical and employable job-based training courses. The courses and programs offered here mainly focus on the subjects related to technology, fashion designing, commerce and management. The institute acquired the Academy of Arts and Design (AAD) in 2007, adding new courses in interior design, advertising design and 3d animation. Moreover, incorporating child education, legal, and real estate brokerage systems in their programs has helped students understand the job market better. The mission of Institut Teccart to merge passion with a career has enabled them to attract more students and enhance their graduation rate. The growing number of international students in the institute reveals that the university is less selective of the new applicants. The advanced education system requires the management to update the technologies and processes now and then to provide current training services. Apart from that, the university regularly indulges in doing something new and unique, such as launching their advertising campaign and new website. Some of the standard Institut Teccart programmes include undergraduate and postgraduate degrees and diplomas in IT management, Telecommunications, Instrumentation and Automation, Paralegal Technology, etc. The Brossard campus of Institut Teccart is in the Monteria region of Quebec, Canada. Following its 70th anniversary celebration, the institute has gained popularity in this field, and its notable alumni success rate reveals its capabilities to offer placements to graduate students. The Brossard campus of the institute mainly focuses on subjects of fashion designing, arts, commerce, management and other areas. The students graduating from here are more prone to being employed immediately within six months since they receive professional training alongside academic tuitions.

Name: Western University
Overview: The University of Western Ontario, now known as Western University, is a public research institute established in 1878 in Ontario, Canada. It has a student enrollment of 40,000 students, of which 5,800 are international students from 128 nations. There are 12 academic faculties and schools, including Arts & Humanities, Law, Health Sciences and Engineering, offering 400 undergraduate specialisations and 88 graduate degree programs. Some of the courses are Anthropology, Geology, Political Science, Classical Studies and Mechanical Engineering. The university also offers courses in conjunction with certain affiliate universities and colleges such as Kingäó»s University College and Brescia University College. Western University has a 481.2-hectare campus in London, Ontario, with five libraries (Music Library, Allyn & Betty Taylor Library, The D.B Weldon Library etc.), the Education Resource Centre and the Archives and Special Collections. Those looking to pursue higher education or interest can enrol in the Western Continuing Studies program comprising certificate, diploma, online, professional development and post-degree programs. Areas covered include Design, Public Relations, Human Resources, Conflict Management etc. There are several Distance Learning courses to choose from for Western University and other Canadian university students. Students can participate in exchanges, summer programs, research expeditions, internships, and placements through the study abroad program. Western Universityäó»s IB Certificate in Teaching and Learning in partnership with the International Baccalaureate enables educators to enhance their skills. The ASPIRE program provides Additional Qualification and Teacher Professional Development courses. Financial assistance options include scholarships, bursaries, loans, student employment and grants like the Loran Award, Surex Scholarship Program, OSAP, First Generation Bursary and Work-Study. Delaware Hall, Alumni House, London Hall etc., provide undergraduate accommodation in traditional, suite and hybrid-style buildings. Graduate accommodation is available at the University Apartments and family housing at the Plattäó»s Lane Estates. There are over 180 cultural, academic, sports and professional student clubs to join. Western University is known for its student employment rate of 95.2%.

Name: Okanagan College - Vernon
Overview: Okanagan College was established in 1906 as a post-secondary institution in British Columbia, Canada. The student population is around 20,500 students, and it is the first college in British Columbia. In 1995, the name was changed to Okanagan University College, but later in 2005, the older name was given, after Okanagan University College was divided into 2 sections University of British Columbia (UBC) and Okanagan College (OC). Okanagan College – Vernon is a public college and is located in College Way, Vernon. Okanagan College – Vernon offers courses in Arts, Science and Business discipline. Some of the popular courses are Writing and Publishing Diploma, Esthetics and Nail Technology Certificate, Associate of Science Degree, Associate of Arts degree and Business degree. Vernon campus of Okanagan College provides education support for its students, which includes Education Advising, Accessibility Services, Aboriginal Services and Student Success Centre. Apart from these, students can get financial aid in the form of awards, student loans or other funding sources. Okanagan College – Vernon has an international student population of more than 1800 and offers features like post graduation work permit, conditional offer letter, working while studying, accommodation and internship participation. Okanagan College has an average annual tuition of CAD 14,021, and the yearly cost of living is around CAD 12,960. For application, applicants must submit transcripts, sponsorship letter (if applicable), English proficiency test, an application fee of CAD 100, and others. For international candidates, where the transcripts are not in English, applicants must change those to English before applying. Apart from these, there are also age-specific requirements; for example, for Associate degrees, diploma programs, Baccalaureate, and Health and Social Development programs, applicants must be 18 years of age. So, to apply for Okanagan College – Vernon, it is important to check eligibility for specific programs from the website beforehand, as these might vary with courses. Some of the notable alumni of Okanagan College include Dan Albas, Todd Keller, Norah Bowman and others.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at Okanagan CollegeUndergraduate courses are available in a variety of subjects, including arts, accounting, applied ecology, mathematics, chemistry, business administration, aviation, and many others. Apart from providing top-notch courses in every discipline, the college also offers these programmes in three different formats: distance, full-time, and part-time. In order to be considered for a seat at the institution, applicants must meet the following requirements.Specifications for the application:Transcripts from high school/previous institutiona copy of a current passportStatement of intent to study in Canada (personal statement)Proof of linguistic competency in EnglishA valid visa to travel to Canada2 Recommendation LettersIn some circumstances, biometrics may be necessary.Coverage for medical expensesThe following are the English language requirements:A TOEFL iBT score of 79 or above is required.IELTS6.5, with no band below 6.0.The Bachelor of Business Administration programme requires a 6.0 band.PTEIn all components, a minimum of 55 is required.For the Bachelor of Business Administration, 58 is required, with a minimum of 55.DET105 - additional programmes | 110 - Bachelor of Business Administration
Placement: Placement in Okanagan College Okanagan College supports students in finding work. To guarantee that students are job ready once they graduate, career fairs and resume development seminars are held. Students can also participate in a Co-op programme at Okanagan College to gain work experience in their chosen disciplines.The Student, Graduate, and Co-op Employment Center at Okanagan College serves as a platform for alumni, students, and employers to connect.You can make contact with a coordinator who can guide you through your job search based on your qualifications and interests.Wages for the jobs, which are primarily based in British Columbia and Alberta, range from $15 to $20 per hour. These pay rates are determined by the industry, job title, and eligibility.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation On-campus housing is available.On-campus housing is only available on the main campus.There are quiet study lounges available.On-campus housing information can be found here.http://www.okanagan.bc.ca/Student_Services/students/residence.html

Name: Holland College - West Prince
Overview: Holland College is a public college established in 1969 and has seven campuses in Canada. It offers more than 160 programs in different disciplines, and every year it educates 2,500+ students in both international and domestic categories. Holland College - West Prince is at Prince Edward Island and is renowned for its certificates and diploma programs. They have won awards for competent training, faculty, and set-up. The placement of Holland College - West Prince network and process is very strong. 93% of students get placement within one year of passing the graduation and other courses. The student's teacher ratio ensures better interaction and learning process. Holland College - West Prince's tuition fees are CAD 8,842, cost of living is CAD 12,960, and application charge is CAD 100. This fees structure is highly competitive in the market among peer colleges. It also gives scholarships and other grants to support students financially in pursuing their studies. The college provides numerous facilities to the students like accommodation, work permit, internship, permission for part-time work during the course tenure. Classrooms, laboratories, research centres, etc., have the latest technology and infrastructure to support students in every aspect of learning. Arts, media, science, engineering, health science, business studies, tourism, computer studies, etc., are some of the subjects among the vast curriculum taught in Holland College - West Prince. Students from national and international boundaries take admission to this college for its exuberant course curriculum, study materials, technology, placement supports, etc. The overall infrastructure and facilities help students to kick start their career goals.

Name: College National of Science and Technology
Overview: An internationally accredited higher education institute, the College National of Science and Technology, was established on the value of providing accessible education for students from all over the world. A private institute, the College National of Science and Technology offers Attestation of Collegial Studies (ACS) in English and French. The institutes' curriculum is majorly focused on the evolving fields of Information Technology. Some top programs at the College National of Science and Technology are Project Management, Entrepreneurship in Technology, and Network Management. The College National of Science and Technology Campus is a newly established school in the heart of Montreal Saint Michael neighborhood. The campus is a short subway ride from downtown and close to the city center. The Saint Michael neighborhood is an inclusive multicultural community known to be one of the safest campus areas for students. The institute has extensive career services, including job search resources, placement offers, professional networking events, career counselling, etc. The maximum tuition fee at the College National of Science and Technology is $25,500. International students are eligible for financial aid and bursaries. The campus has state-of-the-art infrastructure, including personalized services, high-tech labs, student lounges, etc. The institute has a dedicated student services team. In addition, the campus has a cafeteria, library, hangout spots for students to meet and study, restaurants, etc. The College National of Science and Technology organized multicultural activities for the students. The institute also helps its students to find affordable accommodations and rentals close to campus. The College National of Science and Technology provides outstanding education in a culturally dynamic and inclusive environment.

Name: Concordia Continuing Education
Overview: Concordia is a public research university situated in Montreal, Canada. Founded 50 years back, this university allows admission of nearly 51,000 students through a unique approach, experimental learning, and cross-functional research. This university is well-known for its lenient learning approach and dedication to assessing societal issues through research and teaching. Here, Concordia Continuing Education provides learning opportunities to students for their entire life. Students can explore a wide range of online courses to prepare them for life and their career. This university usually provides quality education in Fine Arts, Engineering, Law, Science etc. With more than 100 graduate and 300 postgraduate courses and programs, this educational institution offers various options for students looking for successful career opportunities. This university has most students who are continuing their education and research activities. The research sector of Concordia Continuing Education provides efficient teaching in various areas such as digital arts, synthetic biology, human rights etc. This university campus has all the necessary facilities and amenities to support students in practically applying their academics. A particular EDGT program in the university allows students to learn how to utilise the tools for professional development. As per QS World ranking, this university holds 477 in the current year. Presently serving approximately 4,000 students, this university is ranked at 24th position as the best value school in Canada. With an acceptance rate of 71%, this university keeps the admission policy less competitive and boasts an employment rate of 92% within two years of graduation.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria for applicants are as follows :  Anyone eighteen (18) years of age or older is eligible for admission to a program or a course at Concordia Continuing Education.Although there are no academic criteria for enrollment, there are course prerequisites that must be followed when finishing a programme.Non-credit courses offered by Concordia Continuing Education can be used to acquire a non-credit diploma or certificate from CCE.
Accommodation: Concordia Continuing Education does not provide with on-campus accommodation. Though the university helps the students in finding a suitable place for themselves so that they get to make the most of the student life and memories which would last a lifetime.
