Name: University of Sherbrooke
Overview: Established in 1954, University de Sherbrooke is a public university in the Province of Quebec, Canada. The university has three campuses: Sherbrooke is the main campus. It has two training centres, seven faculties, management, and support services. The other two campuses are the Health Campus, which offers Faculty of Medicine and Health Science, and the Longueuil Campus, offering 100 programs, and is located in Monti. The university offers around 396 programs in various fields of study such as Law, Engineering, Theology, Ethics and Philosophy, Education, Science, Arts, Letters, and Languages, Environment and Sustainable Development, Health Sciences, Computer Science, Physical Activity Sciences, Educational Sciences, Social Science, etc. The university provides 132 undergraduate degree programs, 216 postgraduate degree programs, 50 doctoral degrees, 49 certificate courses, and eight postgraduate diploma courses. The annual fee for the courses offered is around CAD 22,743. The annual hostel and meal expenses amount to approximately CAD 4,120.The Ministry of Higher Education provides financial aid to university students. The financial aid offered to international students falls under different categories, such as scholarships, loans, and bursaries. Some Scholarship programs for international students are the Government of Canada international scholarship programs, the Canadian Francophonie scholarship program, Programs of the Agence Universitaire de la Francophonie, and the Canadian Bureau for International Education Exemption, etc. The University also offers several admission scholarships to students enrolled full-time in their first choice program. The University ranks second for its placement services in Canada. It provides a professional development program and individual training.
Eligibility Overview: Criteria for Admission Have your university give you permission to enrol in the courses you choose at the Université de Sherbrooke;Have a strong grade point average and be able to demonstrate French competence;Pay for your own transportation, housing, and food, as well as, if necessary, health insurance;Follow the Université de Sherbrooke's exchange student entrance standards.Documents RequiredForm for applying to the exchange programmeExpressions of interest (one-page maximum)recommendation letterYour university has accepted your course selection.Transcripts of completed education, preferably every year after high school (photocopy)Identification page of a passport or a birth certificate (photocopy)Proof of your ability to communicate in French. If you are presently enrolled in a French-speaking school or applying to our French as a Second Language or Modern Languages programmes, you do not need to submit this document. A C1 (CEFR test) or your score on our online French Placement Test can be used as proof (free). To apply for normal courses, most faculties require FLS 060 and FLS 083-084. A student with a good B2 may be encouraged to take a combination of normal and advanced FSL courses if they pass our placement test. Please send us an email to register for the test.We retain the right to reject any application file that is incomplete without reason.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.Students at the Université de Sherbrooke can live on campus in university housing.On-campus housing information can be found here.http://www.usherbrooke.ca/accueil/english/overview/housing/ Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The average monthly rent is between 550 and 650 Canadian dollars.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.Medical clinics, pharmacies, bus stops, restaurants, grocery stores, banks, and retail malls are all within walking distance of the apartments.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.rentboard.ca/rentals/index.aspx?s0=1&locid=6296https://housinganywhere.com/s/Sherbrooke--Canada

Name: University of Alberta
Overview: The University of Alberta is a public research university established in 1908. The university is located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. It ranks at No. 113 in the QS University Rankings. The student-to-faculty ratio is around 11:1. The University of Alberta has five campuses named North Campus, South Campus, Campus Saint-Jean, Augustana Campus, and Enterprise Square Campus in different locations. The North Campus is located on the banks of the river North Saskatchewan. It is the main campus of the University of Alberta and comprises around 200 acres of land. The University of Alberta comprises 18 faculties. All the faculties are divided into different schools and various course programs. The university offers several professional and academic programs, including 200 undergraduate, 500 postgraduate, and research programs. It also provides 300 extension programs and 40 credential programs. The university offers a Professional Development Course that trains students to help them understand the curriculum and sharpen their skills.Some famous alumni of the University of Alberta include former Canadian Prime Minister Joe Clark, Canadian Actress Sara Canning, businessman Daryl Katz, and historian George, Stanley.All the campuses include accommodation with the essential facilities required by students. The average accommodation rent ranges from CAD 800 to CAD 1000 per month. The average tuition fee is around CAD 32,321 per year for undergraduate programs. The University of Alberta also offers scholarships up to CAD 9000 for the first year for international students.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible to get admission in the undergraduate or postgraduate courses at the University of Alberta, You must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements:High school pass outs must demonstrate that they have completed five educational topics effectivelyStudents applying for majors in Engineering, Business, and other Science programs must show their maths scores or require to have maths as their subjectStudents must have an average of 3 G.P.A or a B grade in the grading system. Students who intend to pursue a Bachelors in Science, Commerce, or other programs in which Math is a necessary high school subject but do not have a 12th Standard Math course should register for and finish an online Alberta Math 30-1 Course or another provincial equivalent. English  Requirements: You must meet the below-mentioned English language proficiency score requirements:

Name: LRSD - Arts and Technology Centre
Overview: Established in 1998 and situated in Winnipeg, Manitoba, providing English language and French immersion education to aspiring candidates. The LRSD- Arts and Technology Centre, primarily known as ATC, provides different diploma and certificate programs. This institution also offers high school credits for approved Maths, History and English subjects. In addition, the programs offered by this institution are approved apprenticeships or industry certifications. After graduating from high school, most students attend ATC as they can avail reduced tuition fees. This academic center is associated with industry partners, allowing students to avail training for industry-based jobs. With a very low tuition fee, this institution primarily focuses on success and learning. The students of this academic centre are provided with updated equipment and facilities, and after successfully completing various programmes, students earn the approval of apprenticeship. Since the location of LRSD- Arts and Technology Centre is among the 5 best cities in Canada, employment is quite flexible along with low living costs. Students are provided with top-notch achievements and provide financial aid to them. Various program awards are provided to the students after successfully completing every program, depending on their respective parameters. Students enrolled at the centre can explore practical and hands-on training. They can learn the skills they require in their selected vocational program. Besides, this centre offers various courses such as Artistic/Creative courses, Computer education, languages, business and professional development etc. Also, this college provides great opportunities for the students, which will prepare them for different jobs in the market. Here, at this centre, students are given internship opportunities for structured job experience. They can be full-time, part-time, and unpaid/paid. With a placement rate of nearly 88%, the majority of students are employed within 6 months of their graduation.
Eligibility Overview: Students must have been out of school for at least six months and long enough for the class in which they last attended to graduate from high school. A student cannot have earned a high school diploma previously. The following are the requirements for graduation from this programme:English Language Arts 12th Grade12th grade mathematics2 more people Credits for 12th grade4 extra credits from Grade 9 through Grade 12.
Placement: The college provides a fantastic opportunity for students to conduct internships that will help them prepare for the challenging job of working in various industries. Students at ATC have the chance to participate in internship programmes for academic credit and structured job experience. They can be paid or unpaid, full-time or part-time.Sectors:-1. Public Services 2. Technology 3. Trades 4. Education88 percent placement
Accommodation: On-campus facilities: All students must prepare their lodgings prior to the start of classes, so it is vital to locate a location ahead of time so that you can rest confident. Also, because the lodging options fill up quickly, it is vital to apply and book the accommodation spot as soon as possible. As a result, the institution offers On-Campus Accommodations so that students can remain in a safe and secure location on campus.On-campus housing is available at ATC at the school's discretion.Off-campus facilities: If you prefer to live alone and with complete independence, you might find the numerous off-campus facilities handy. Off-campus facilities are best for students in their senior years who have settled into a new city's culture.The city of Winnipeg has a wide selection of student housing options, including homestays, purpose-built student housing, student houses, flats, studio rooms, and more. You can select any of these services based on your budget and requirements.Food facilities (vegetarian/Indian food availability): Food has always been a big concern for international students, particularly Indian students; therefore, it's good to know that Winnipeg offers a wide range of foods from various cultures, including various Indian dishes. There are also other Indian eateries around the university, such as the India Palace Restaurant, East India Company Pub & Eatery, Spice Circle East Indian Restaurant, and others. As a result, you can rest guaranteed that food will be available.

Name: Georgian College - Barrie
Overview: Founded in 1967 during the inception of the College System of Ontario, Georgian College is the first and only institute in Canada to be honoured as an Ashoka Changemaker College. Given its 81% acceptance rate, this institute follows a lightly selective admission policy.Encompassing an area of 21,000 square kilometres, this institute has seven campuses in several locations in Ontario. Out of these, Georgian College Barrie campus is the largest one. The approximate travel time to Toronto from the place is 1 hour. All the campus buildings generate a total area of roughly one million square feet with 111.5 acres of property. This campus features an Art Gallery, a fitness centre with a gymnasium and climbing wall, six public health and wellness clinics, Henry Bernick Entrepreneurship Centre, Changemaker Space, Indigenous Resource Centre, innovation labs, nursing simulation labs, etc. There are several full-time program areas where students can opt to pursue their studies at this institute. These include Business and Management, Community Safety, Automotive Business, Computer Studies, Design and Visual Arts, Hospitality, Tourism and Recreation, etc. In its part-time courses, Georgian College offers diplomas, degrees and certificates. There are over 200 personal and professional development courses available throughout the year. And these courses are delivered during the daytime, evening, and weekend. Besides these, students can also attend these courses through the online route. Other pathways are available for students, including corporate training, academic and career preparation, apprenticeship and pre-apprenticeship, etc.

Placement: The college has a recruitment staff that assists students in learning about their academic possibilities and exploring their abilities in various settings. To locate and secure placement sites for the multiple programmes offered by the college, Georgian College collaborates closely with the faculty. The students at Georgian can take advantage of specialised career and employability assistance. Georgian University's placement department helps students find the right jobs. The department that assists students in developing their expertise and knowledge in a particular field is this one. The faculty consists of placement specialists that enable qualified applicants to put their knowledge into practice while being supervised by a licenced professional.Before accepting any student, they also ensure they have met all standards for beginning the placement process. The collaborative partners of the college's placement cell provide a summary of the duties and responsibilities of a job description. Each student from every department receives sufficient training before the test to ensure that they are chosen in the first round of placements. Suites with three or two separate bedrooms, each featuring a double bed, dresser, and substantial desk, are available. Name: Selkirk College - Nelson
Overview: Established in 1966, Selkirk College is a public post-secondary community college with 6 campuses. This includes Castlegar, Trail Campus, Grand Forks. At the same time, students can find three campuses in Nelson - Tenth Street, Victoria Street, and Silver King Campus. The college holds affiliation with CCAA, BCAA, and CBIE. The college provides Biochemistry, Anthropology, University Arts and Sciences, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science programs, etc. In addition to this, the Selkirk College Nelson campus (Victoria Street Campus) offers KSA’s programs in Craft, Art and Design. It is equipped with studio spaces for textile, blacksmithing, metal, textile and ceramic casting. Students can access studios late at night as well. The Tenth Street Campus houses on-campus accommodation for students. Besides, the Silver King Campus also comprises spacious classes, workshops, and studios. Students can access amenities like a bookstore, library, cafeteria at both these campuses. Scholarships such as Early Entrance Scholarships are available for eligible students for receiving cost-effective education. According to Webometrics, the Selkirk College ranking is 111th (national). Students can opt for online and distance learning in Anthropology, English (Provincial level), Psychology etc. Besides academics, students can also opt for membership at the gym on Nelson’s Tenth Street campus. Selkirk College fees differ with each course. It also varies with citizenship. For example, international students enrolled in – Diploma in Digital Fabrication and Design may need to pay approximately $13,650. Domestic students enrolled in a similar course may need to pay $6,543. The Selkirk College offers Co-op Education and Employment Services, allowing students to gain school credit while gaining hands-on working experience related to their academic programs. Co-op Education and Employment Services is a member of CEWIL and ACE-WIL. This service served 1,470+ Co-op students. Moreover, 150+ companies connect with college students through this facility.

Name: Cambrian College - Barrydowne
Overview: Located in Greater Sudbury, Ontario, Canada, Cambrian College, established in 1967, is a bilingual institution offering courses in English and French until 1995 till the transfer of the French programs to College Boreal. The college's three campuses are home to over 11,000 students, including 1600 international students from 30 countries. Cambrian College offers undergraduate and graduate programmes, ranging from degrees to certificate programmes. You can choose from over 80 full-time and 900 part-time courses. Cambrian College offers a unique, innovative, high-tech learning experience amidst ultra-modern labs and workshops. Classes with limited students and competent faculty make you focused on academics, leading to good performance. In six decades of existence, the college faculty has gained a vast knowledge base to guide the institution in the right direction. The type of courses it offers indicates the institution's orientation towards research. The college has an impressive offering of scholarships and bursaries and is more inclined to community involvement. Cambrian College has some well-known names as its alumni, which includes:Brian Bigger: Mayor of Greater SudburyBryan Hayes: Member of the Canadian ParliamentWill Morin: Leader of the First People's National Party of CanadaGlenn Thibeault: Newscaster, reporter, and then a cabinet minister

Name: Sprott Shaw Language College - Victoria
Overview: Founded in 1996, Sprott Shaw Language College Victoria is an education provider that offers advanced language programs. One of its campuses is located in British Columbia’s capital city, Victoria which automatically helps students to get access to qualified professors with credentials that hold up to international standards. This private institution offers education in domains like Science, Arts, Engineering, Law, etc. With first-rate counselling services and several on-campus facilities, it tries to support students to meet their academic goals. Different programs like ESL, PMM or Power Speaking and Modern Media, Business English, International English Language Testing System, etc. are available here. Most of these programs come with a duration of 4-12 weeks, and the tuition fees vary depending on the program students opt for. Some of these programs are even customisable, designed as per each student’s needs; therefore, they get the convenience to go for morning classes only, as per their preferences. Students come here from more than 75 countries around the globe. The institution has partnerships with several colleges and universities in Canada. From Acadia University to The Art Institute of Vancouver, RCC Institute of Technology, University of Prince Edward Island, Yorkville University, etc., students get multiple options to apply after completing these courses.Apart from academics, Sprott Shaw Language College students get to take part in several on-campus activities, such as volunteering, cultural tourism (museum, theatre, etc.), local cultural events, historical sightseeing, etc. Accommodation facilities are provided by the institution for students coming from foreign countries. They can even opt for further academic studies on campus. Sprott Shaw Language College Victoria helps students regarding the visa application process by supplying the documentation they need to get it done. In terms of the admission process, students can apply online using its official website.

Placement: Employer Services & Career Coaching: They help the College community by providing career preparedness and development expertise so that their past, present, and future learners can achieve their career goals. They will collaborate with industry partners to assist their upcoming graduates and alumni in finding meaningful work. Co-operative Education (Co-op): It combines full-time study with the possibility of full-time employment while still a student. Co-op programmes run for four months, full-time, from May to August. There is public exposure to various job situations and growth in work experience in the workplace. Work Placement: Work Placements are interdisciplinary learning activities during the last semester of a post-secondary institution that provides them. Workplace placements are a fantastic way for students to connect their academic abilities and theory to on-the-job experience. Work Placement completion is the final step to graduation and professional employment.Every academic year, top recruiters provide job duties. The college has an excellent employment rate of 88 per cent, and the following are some of its recruiters:Bay ShoreGreenwich WindfarmGrant Thornton LLPEco CanadaJons and AssociateBISNO – Brain Injury Services of Northern Ontario
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: The Spruce and Cedar Residence has furnished units, a laundry room, and a fully equipped communal kitchen. This dwelling option includes a three-bedroom apartment-style living space and an in-suite kitchen, bathroom, and laundry facility.Every year, 229 students live in Sibley Hall Residence. The Residence was recently refurbished and is now a safe, community-oriented residence with five different room styles to choose from. Each room has a single bed, closet, small refrigerator, and microwave, with some rooms having private en-suite showers. The cost of a room varies depending on the type of room. All students living on campus must purchase a meal plan; this is not an optional purchase.Note: Residence quickly fills up; students should apply well before arrival to ensure a room. In most cases, the Residence is not available for the January intake. Students must commit to staying for the entire academic year in Residence. Students must vacate their rooms once school is ended or communicate directly with Residence administrators about extending their stay throughout the holiday break. Off-Campus Accommodation: Single-family homes, duplexes, and apartments are available for rent off-campus in Thunder Bay. Students who choose to live off-campus must conduct their research and arrive well before the semester start. Individual utility providers may require accounts to be set up for these services. Please check with your landlord to see which utilities are included in the rent and which must be scheduled and paid for individually.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Baie Verte
Overview: Situated in Central Newfoundland on the Baie Verte Peninsula is the College of the North Atlantic Baie Verte campus. It boasts a population of roughly 1300 residents. This institute’s full-time credit course registration is around 70 students each semester. This College’s Continuing Education evening courses see the participation of over 300 students. The College of the North Atlantic Baie Verte campus also hosts the Advanced Education and Skills office and Sedler Community Employment Corporation for Baie Verte. The various programs on this campus include Office Administration, Business Administration, and Personal Care Attendant (PCA). The duration of the Office Administration and Business Administration programs is one year, and the PCA program is of 30 weeks or two semesters. There are options for financial assistance for students at this institute. Student financial assistance is offered through the combined efforts of The Government of Newfoundland, Labrador, and the Government of Canada. College of the North Atlantic students can also earn awards and scholarships. They can apply for an award if they hold a full-time registration in a regular college program. Students are assessed for both provincial and federal financial aid through one application. The recognition and scholarships are grouped into specific categories. These are academics, applied arts, business, health sciences, industrial trades, information technology, natural resources, tourism, and engineering technology. The various scholarship and award categories under which students at this campus can be awarded include Merit Awards, A. Harvey Group of Companies Entrance Scholarships, and Country Ribbon Entrance Scholarship.

Name: CDI College - Laval
Overview: The CDI College is a private career college based in Canada and comprising 23 campus locations. Approved by the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Higher Education in Quebec, this institution encourages international students' application throughout the year. The courses offered in this university are available in both on and off-campus mode. International students can explore 100 programs at different campuses, including undergraduate, post-graduate, and diploma programs. The international students are not charged with any application fees. Moreover, meritorious students can avail of government-backed scholarships to meet their tuition expenses. Students can also avail different financial options such as personal loans to lower the burden of expenses. As per reports, nearly 85% of students attain employment after completing graduation from this university. Name: Brescia University College

The main campus of Brescia University College is located in Calgary. Name: Great Plains College - Swift Current Campus
Overview: Great Plains College is one of the leading Saskatchewan regional colleges, offering post-secondary certificate, diploma and degree programmes. It has three decentralized campuses, among which is the Swift Current Campus. The campus is 2 hours away from the USA-Canada border and is located near many parks, golf courses, art galleries and restaurants. Great Plains College offers courses in various fields of business, arts, science, law and technology, like abnormal psychology, business communications, commercial law, digital marketing, English language training etc. It is home to 322 full-time and 1143 part-time students. The aim of the college is to build stronger leaders, careers, partnerships and communities, and thus it became the region’s first college to offer health and dental plans for the students. Great Plains College recognizes the financial need of international students and boasts its great scholarship programmes, which make accommodation and tuition more affordable. International students enrolled in the business diploma in management or youth care worker diploma programmes are offered The International Student Award. Five awards of $2,000 are granted to international students entering the second year of their diploma programme. The college allocates $1 million for scholarships and bursaries. Great Plains College is renowned for its high graduation and employment rate. 70% of post-secondary students became full-time employees in 60-90 days of graduating. It also houses a volleyball and basketball team, Sundog, which has won three provisional championships. Given the location and the facilities offered, the student satisfaction rate is 96%.

Overview: Formed in 1974, New Brunswick Community College is a famous public college located in the New Brunswick province of Canada. The recent affiliation with the Canadian Institute of Management has helped the college enhance its popularity, particularly in business studies. Currently, they serve students with educational services across undergraduate and postgraduate courses.The Miramichi campus, located beside the Miramichi river, currently serves over 500 students out of the overall 4,300 students studying on all six campuses. The college has maintained about 300 inventions and filed patent applications for 113 technologies following their extensive research. The acceptance rate followed in the college is moderate. Name: Create Career College
Overview: Canadian Create Career College (CCC College) is a Canadian private career college accepting international and domestic students. This Designated Learning Institution has earned BCEQA (British Columbia Education Quality Assurance) designation and is accredited by PTIB (Private Training Institutions Branch). The college campus is situated directly opposite Metrotown Mall that has services for bus, taxi, and SkyTrain to make the commute easy for students. The various programs that CCC offers to its students include Digital Marketing 2-Year Diploma with Co-op, Business Administration 2 Years Diploma with Co-op, English for Academic Purposes Certificate & Pathway, English as a Second Language Certificate, Health Care Assistant Diploma with Co-op, Hospitality Management with Co-op, and Accounting. In-Canada students can receive both online and in-person college courses from this institution. CCC College also offers Co-op programs through which students can develop highly demanding workplace skills. Some of these programs consist of a practicum or co-op component that ensures students can apply their academic training in real-world circumstances prior to graduation. Students get to learn in classrooms having a low student-to-teacher ratio. This ensures that they benefit from the maximum feedback and attention from their instructors. Students graduating from Create Career College receive a 2-year post-secondary diploma or certificate graduation of professions. A university diploma is offered to international students completing this institute’s pathway programs in partnership with public universities. They can also apply for Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP). After completing their Create Career College course, students receive assistance from experienced advisors regarding practicum placements with organisations in the local region. This institute also assists students in finding apartment rentals and Homestay services.
Eligibility Overview: Nil

Name: ACCESS Adult Education & Career Training Centre
Overview:
ACCESS Adult Education & Career Training Centre is a part of the Riverside School Board community with more than 40 years of expertise in providing education programs in high school diploma, post-secondary education, learning languages, and certificate programs. The Quebec Ministry of Education recognises ACCESS Adult Education & Career Training Centre.
It has a total of 5 centres across Canada. ACCESS Adult Education & Career Training Centre course materials and training system are made with rigorous research to meet the industry standard. The primary focus of this educational institute is on enhancing the knowledge and skills of students to achieve academic and career objectives. This institute empowers individuals over 16 years with the ongoing quest for academics and professional careers. It has a stimulating learning environment and state-of-art facilities to give practical, technical, and theoretical education.
The course module of ACCESS includes health assistance & nursing, institutional & home care, academic courses in various disciplines, international languages etc. Admission, training, evaluation process, and grooming modules are recognised. It provides both on-campus and online-training facilities. It also specialises in providing adult education, therefore, maintains a respectful yet learning environment. Care, integrity, commitment, and collaboration are their values. This helps the students to cultivate accountability and commitment in succeeding in careers.
Although French is the predominant language, the institute offers all training programs in English to benefit international students. With Canada welcoming immigrants across the world, this institution provides a standard education system. The ACCESS Adult Education & Career Training Centre fees structure is in an affordable range. Name: Queen's University
Overview: Queen's University is one of Canada's oldest universities. It is located in Kingston, Ontario, and significantly impacts Canada's higher education. It offers its courses through 8 different faculties: Faculty of Law, Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science, Faculty of Arts and Science, Faculty of Education, Faculty of Health Sciences, School of Graduate Studies, Smith's School of Business, and School of Policy Studies. Queen's University provides many undergraduate degree programs, more than 125 graduate degree programs, and over 140 online courses. The top courses offered are MBA, Master in Finance, and M.Sc. Psychology, Bachelor of Computer Science, Bachelor in Software Design, B.Sc. Civil Engineering, etc. It has some unique schools, such as geology and mining. It offers more than 100 exchange partnership programs in over 30 countries for a cross-cultural experience. The per-year tuition fee of the courses ranges between CAD 12,390 and 1,30,515. The university offers affordable on-campus and off-campus accommodation to its students. The university has 17 residencies within a 20-minute walking distance from the university. Kingston provides various alternatives for staying off-campus in rental units, shared and independent apartments, and houses. The hostel and meal expenses amount to CAD 7,600. Queen's University provides financial aid to students with excellent academics. It offers various awards, bursaries, and studentships for its aspirants who need financial support to study in Canada. Some international aspirants' scholarships are the Principal Scholarship, Excellence Scholarship, etc.The University provides placement to its students, and the major sectors where students can find a job post-degree from the university include education, healthcare, government services, culture, tourism, and industry.
Eligibility Overview: Admission Requirements:To make the programmes accessible to applicants from a variety of backgrounds, the University provides different admission categories. The $100 application cost can be paid online at the time of submission, and applications are sent directly through our website. To discover more about each category, simply click on it.Check here; https://www.queensu.ca/artsci_online/future-students/admission-requirements#:~:text=A%20minimum%20of%20a%2075,a%20minimum%202.6%20GPA%3B%20OR
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Its main campus is spread across 100 acres of land and has 6 libraries, several magnificent museums, and arts facilities. The Grant Hall of the University is a well-known landmark. Check everything you need to know about accommodation here: https://www.qub.ac.uk/accommodation/#residential-fees-2022-2023-1297496-1.
Course Ranking: For 2021 and 2022, Bloomberg has ranked the institution as Canada's second-best business school. The university has been ranked 59th by The Financial Times for its Master in Management programme for 2022. For more than five years in a row, QS Subject Ranking has ranked the university between 101 and 150, at 66 for 2021 for pursuing a worldwide MBA, and between 101 and 150 for studying Accounting & Finance. In 2023, Queen's is ranked 234 overall in terms of subjects according to the QS WUR Ranking by Subjects. The university has been ranked between 301 and 400 in the Times Higher Education topic rankings for 2022 for PG Business and Economics studies.THE put Queen's at 301-400 for 2022 when it comes to pursuing engineering degrees for Engineering and Technology. In terms of clinical programmes, it was ranked between 126 and 150. According to the US News Subject Ranking 2022, Queen's is ranked 492 for computer science and 255 for social science.
University Ranking: The oldest and best-ranked institution in the world, Queen's University was established in 1841. Regarding Queen's University's position, it is 246 in the world, as reported by the QS World University Ranking 2023. Queen is regarded as one of Canada's finest institutions. It currently occupies rank 11 in Canada. Since 2017, Queen's has been able to maintain a high position in the globe. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Research, Teaching, and Citations at 30% each, QS places a full priority on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Citations per Faculty and Faculty/Student Ratio at 20% each.The university is listed in the best 250 of the world's universities by Times Higher Education in its 2022 World University Ranking. The university has been ranked at 412 for the year 2022 by US News & World Report, which specifically uses global research reputation, regional research reputation, and the number of publications cited (12.5% each) among other ranking characteristics. The university's current ranking rises 7 ranks from last year's ranking, making it 419 in 2021.

Name: CanPacific College of Business and English
Overview: Can Pacific College of Business and English be situated in the city's centre and a private English school in Toronto, Ontario? It offers various English language programs for international students. At this college, the professionals follow communicative, practical instruction, and student-centred approaches. Furthermore, students can get a high-quality education and innovative language instruction. It offers a wide range of English programs and services, including Business English, Test preparation (IELTS and TOEIC), General English, University and College Pathway, Work experience programs, etc. This educational institution also provides medical insurance, accommodation, activities, and airport services. This school accepts students from different countries to study different English programs. Can Pacific College of Business and English be proudly accredited by Canada. Moreover, ETS Canada also recognises it as an Educational Testing Service. Different Can Pacific College of Business and English courses include a Diploma of Business Communication, Bridge program, University pathway, etc. The certified and professionally experienced professors follow interactive and student-centric approaches to providing language education. Moreover, counsellors dedicatedly provide additional support to the students. Students can also enjoy the feel of virtual classrooms through online platforms and enjoy productive virtual lessons from the comfort of their homes. Besides, students can choose to learn the language they want through the ESL program, which is now available in different theme-based varieties such as literature, photography, art, culinary arts, history, etc.Moreover, aspiring students willing to be admission to this college can get an advantage of a reputed homestay program. The homestay coordinator will take care of the needs and ensure that students are safe and comfortable. Moreover, knowledgeable and experienced professionals assist students with school programs and different academic goals.

Name: Lakehead University through Georgian College, Barrie, Ontario
Overview: Lakehead University through Georgian College, launched 20 new degree-diploma programmes in 2016, which let the students experience the best of college and university. Lakehead University and Georgian College are the two largest institutions in Simcoe County, Ontario. These transfer pathway degrees are offered at the locations of both institutes. The Barrie campus is Georgian’s University Partnership Centre. The Lakehead University through Georgian College launched undergraduate programmes in 2017. The courses offered are Collaborative Bachelor of Electrical Engineering Degree and Electrical Engineering Technology Diploma, Honours Bachelor of Arts and Science in Environmental Sustainability with Environmental Technician Diploma, Honours Bachelor of Science Degree in Applied Life Sciences with Biotechnology-Health diploma and Honours Bachelor of Computer Science with Computer Programming diploma. Lakehead University through Georgian College is able to serve almost 3000 students and train them in applied skills and critical reasoning, which would allow them to meet the needs of the growing economy. These two institutions provide combined facilities worth $540 million. The students can access world-class laboratories, classrooms, and libraries. The campus also has various eating joints, a fitness center and provides on-campus housing facilities. International students entering Lakehead-Georgian are automatically considered for Undergraduate Entrance Scholarships, and based on their merit, the funds can range from CAD 6,000 to CAD 40,000. The students do not need to fill any applications to attain these scholarships, but they need a high-school degree or transfer certificate from an international college.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria is course based i.e. the criteria changes according to the course offered. The applicants must thoroughly check requirements for their choice of course and degree.
Accommodation: The university provides a safe and comfortable place for students. The authority makes sure the environment is friendly and inclusive in nature. The university looks after the fact the students make new friends and memories which will last a lifetime.

Name: Coast Mountain College - Prince Rupert
Overview: The Coast Mountain College is an approved, public-financed post-secondary educational institution serving different communities in British Columbia’s northwest region. This college offers field schools, trades, college access, health, and human service programs. The Prince Rupert Campus of this college includes multiple seminar rooms, a learning resource center, an extensive library, computer labs, science labs, and innovation labs. This institution is an essential member of the University of Arctic Network and Colleges and Institutes Canada. This college is primarily student-centered, offering a comprehensive range of student programs, academic degrees, and certificate programs in different fields such as Science, Arts, Health, Business, University Credits, Arts and Science for international students, and other diploma programs. Students can complete an Associate Degree in Science or Arts from this college. The one-year certificate of Business Administration and two-year Diploma programs provide a well-rounded education in the business sector. Some of the undergraduate courses offered by this college include an Associate Degree in Science, Certificate in Physical science, Business Administration Diploma in Accounting, Certificate in Engineering, etc. This college also offers scholarships, financial aid, part-time employment, and student loans to make education more affordable. With an acceptance rate of nearly 85%, this college follows a moderately selective admission policy. The entry requirements at this college depend on the subject area, course, and level. The Prince Rupert campus of this college extends Trades Training through different partnerships with industry and local school districts. On this campus, students can take advantage of other labs to get a real learning experience. Moreover, this college offers students unique programs that can result in sustainable careers. It provides top-notch, affordable high education to international students.

Placement: The college helps students find jobs by providing job placement services. Through its digital employment board, outcome campus connects, the college connects students with job and hiring prospects. This website is a resource for current students and recent graduates for skill development and job posting. On this platform, students can find a variety of job possibilities provided by firms. Students can create a profile on the platform in order to be found by potential employers. Apart from that, the college offers students various networking opportunities, job boards, and other resources to help them find the right employment. Students can also get interview tips and skills from the college to help them prepare for their interviews. The college believes that the development of its students is also the college's development. As a result, the college offers high-quality programmes to students in a variety of fields. To add value to their education and develop their abilities, students can enrol in any full-time or certificate programme. The college also offers job placement aid to students who are looking for work.

Name: Holland College - Georgetown
Overview:
Holland College is a renowned public post-secondary institution in Canada with campuses in 8 different cities on Prince Edward Island. The Georgetown campus is located in the municipality of Three Rivers in Kings County. At this campus, the students are offered two programmes in the field of Industrial Technology and Trade, which are, Plumbing / Pipefitting and Welding Fabrication. 
Georgetown is located on the eastern side of Prince Edward Island and is one of the most important ports on the island. It is famous for its heritage and Victorian era buildings. The students at Georgetown Centre enjoy easy access to gazebos, beaches, famous golf courses,  Brudenell River Provincial Park and 10 historic buildings. By car, this campus is just 35 minutes away from the main campus, Prince of Wales in Charlottetown.
Holland College has one of the highest graduate employment rates of 90%, which attracts a lot of international students. Most graduates end up with high-paying jobs. The college’s certificate and diploma programmes are internationally recognised for balancing theory and hands-on practical experience. It also has one of the lowest tuition fees for international students. Along with this, the Holland College offers 50-degree pathway programmes that allow students to get a place in colleges across Canada and the U.S. and around the world. 
Webometrics has given Holland College a rank of 153 among all universities in Canada. The college does not just keep its tuition fee low but also offers various financial aid options in the form of bursaries, loans and scholarships. It keeps aside CAD 500,000 for scholarships every year.

Name: College Milestone
Overview: College Milestone is a private institute located in Brossard, Quebec. The college offers diplomas recognized by the Quebec Ministry of Education and Higher Education. The college attracts many international students because of its educational curriculum and lecture delivery options – the lectures are delivered in English and French, depending on the student's choice.Class schedules are flexible, and students can make their class timetables conveniently. There are options available for weekday and weekend classes. Extracurricular events, fests, competitions, and quizzes are conducted within the campus for overall student development.After completing the course, Milestone provides an 8-week internship program for on-field work experience. Also, the college placement rates are over 80%, making them eligible for the Quebec Experience Program. International students can get Canada Post-Graduation Work Permit Program after completing the 2-year diploma course.
Eligibility Overview: To be considered for admissions at Milestone college, you must meet one of the following requirements. Please refer to the website link to get more information. Have a high school diploma or equivalentMust be at least 16 years old on September 30th of the selected course year and must have obtained Secondary four units in the language of instruction, second language, and mathematics in programs of studyMust be 18 years of age at admission and should have completed a general development test Must have obtained Secondary three units in the language of instruction, second language, and mathematics in programs of study English Language Proficiency: Since some of the classes are taught in English, the college requires you to have language skills. The following are the requirements for English ProficiencyIELTS score of 6.0 with a minimum of 5 in each band PTE Score Required: 53 Overall Score not less than 50TOEFL iBT: 80 ScoreDuolingo English Test Score: 105 Score
Placement: The Milestone college offers vast career opportunities to its students. Here is a list of a few career options for international students after graduating with the Diploma of Vocational Studies in Computing Support: Computer Network TechnicianNetwork TechnicianComputer Support SpecialistUser Support TechnicianIT Support TechnicianNetwork Support Technician Electronic Service TechnicianHelpdesk Analyst After graduating from Milestone College, international students can also take advantage of the Post-Graduation Work Permit Program (PGWPP). It allows them to live and work in Canada for up to 3 years.
Accommodation: Milestone College provides on-campus accommodation facilities for international students. Also, they can opt for off-campus accommodations or homestays. Milestone college partnered with Apply Board to match students with their hosts per their interests and preferences.The cost of living is estimated to be 12,960 CAD per year. It is low compared to the other Canadian provinces. Also, the nearby college area has Quartier DIX30, restaurants, and entertainment options.

Name: Algonquin college
Overview: Established in 1967, Algonquin College of Applied Arts and Technology is a publicly funded English language college in the Canadian capital, Ottawa. The programs and the courses at Algonquin College are organized into various schools: School of Advanced Technology, Algonquin Centre for Construction Excellence, School of Business, Academic Access Centre, Corporate Training Centre, School of General Arts and Science, School of Health and Community Studies, School of Hospitality and Tourism, Language Institute, School of Media and Design, Police and Public Safety Institute, and Algonquin College Heritage Institute. By offering more than 700 programs under various disciplines, the university has become a popular choice among students. Its academic strength lies in its popular courses in Hospitality and Management, Applied Arts, Health, and Business. It also organizes frequent industry visits for its students to provide them exposure to the world existing outside of academia. The average annual cost, including the living charges, is estimated to be around $ 35K. But thanks to the many generous grants and scholarships offered by the university, it can be brought down to accommodate students with a nominal budget. By maintaining a successful alumni network, the university catalyzes some promising placement opportunities in leading organizations while ensuring holistic development for its graduating batch.

Placement: Employment Support Center Make the most of this fantastic career resource! Students and graduates can get help with their job search through the Employment Support Centre, which includes resume and cover letter critiques, interview preparation, networking ideas, and job search techniques. The ESC also sponsors a number of recruitment and networking events, as well as career fairs, such as the Career Networking Fair (held every February), which brings over 70 employers from a variety of industries to campus to meet with Algonquin students and graduates.  Career Counselling Career counselling is a service offered to current students to assist them in choosing a career path that is right for them. The counselling team at Algonquin is a collection of experts that have been trained in the skill of assisting students in developing a viable career plan. If you're unsure about your programme choice, hesitant about your professional aspirations, or in danger of failing your programme, get help. Check other Career-related support and services offered by Algonquin here
Accommodation: On-Campus If you're attending classes at Ottawa (Woodroffe) location, you might want to consider staying in Algonquin's on-campus student housing. You'll be able to live with other students and have all of your utilities, housing, and food paid for. There are 1,050 students living in 525 two-bedroom units on the Woodroffe campus. Residents must fill out a personality profile in order to be matched with roommates who share similar interests, personality traits, and sleeping habits.Controlled entry and 24-hour securityThe Games Room, Laundry Room, and TV Lounge are all common amenitiesFor first-year residents, meal plans are compulsoryThe price depends on the meal plan options and the number of terms necessaryApply here Off-Campus You have the option of getting your own place, either alone or with your roommates. Apartments in Ottawa typically cost $1,200-$1,400 a month, including utilities, food, and living expenses. These expenditures will be lower if you share a residence with numerous housemates. By going to the Students' Association Housing Board, you can make your own arrangements. Visit http://www.algonquinsa.com/services/housing/  to see current listings on the Housing Board.

Name: CDI College
Overview: Established in the 1960s, CDI College in Canada is a private, for-profit institution specializing in career-oriented programs. There are over 23 campuses across the Canadian provinces of Ontario, Quebec, British Columbia, Manitoba, and Alberta; the Vancouver campus, Calgary North campus, Winnipeg campus, Laval campus, etc.It offers over 100 diploma and certificate programs in eight study areas: business, dental, healthcare, technology, and trades. Some courses include Social Media Management, Graphic Design, Paralegal Technology, and Early Childhood Education. Those looking for a more flexible program can apply for CDI College online courses (often hybrids) such as Law Enforcement Foundations, Education Assistant, Pharmacy Assistant, and Hospitality Management. Through the BCIT and Yorkville University Pathway programs, students can start at CDI College and then apply for programs at the two institutes to prepare for a Bachelor of Business Administration degree.More than 85% of CDI College's graduating students immediately find employment. There is also an option to take up part-time work at CDI College; some posts are Assistant Campus Director, Student Financial Planner, and Personal Support Worker Instructor. CDI College's on-campus tuition ranges from 21,000 to 78,000 CAD. Some financial aid options include scholarships, bursaries, loans, and grants like the RBC Royal Credit Line for Students and provincial government assistance programs.

Around 500 CDI College graduates are working in the province of Montreal itself.

Hostels - Hostels provide a supervised, friendly, and safe environment for students. Many hostels also provide meal options.3. Private accommodation - Studio rooms like one-bedroom apartments are very popular among the students as they are less expensive compared to the rent of larger apartments or houses.

Name: University of Victoria
Overview: The University of Victoria is a public research university and one of the largest in Victoria, Canada. The University offers students 80 undergraduate, 160 postgraduate, professional degrees, and diploma programs. The university partners with the government, industries, and other research organizations for research and development programs and initiatives. Some of the top courses available at the university are law, engineering, history, marine biology, etc.Candidates need a minimum TOEFL score of 80 or an IELTS score of 6.5.The approximate cost of living on-campus is around CAD 6,072 to 10,020 per year. The university grants scholarships to international students with great academic scores and in need of a scholarship or award. Several types of studentships are provided every year to the students, ranging between CAD 2,724 and 9,081.Graduates earn an average of $181k,
Eligibility Overview: The university has a fairly selective admissions process, but this does not mean it is a walk in the park.Enrollment at the institute is contingent on a number of variables, including a minimum TOEFL score of 80 and an IELTS score of 6.5. Standardized tests are required in Canada.While your academic record and GPA account for 60% of your application's weight, other factors such as extracurricular activities, a well-written personal statement, management and leadership ability, and so on account for the remaining 40%.
Accommodation: The University is known for its effective learning program. Modern laboratories, libraries, art studios, and hi-tech computer labs add to the environment of inventions and transformation. It has teamed up with top-tier universities and institutions around the globe for consolidated research and knowledge distributing programs. The University offers students on-campus accommodation, including single dormitories, double dormitories, bachelor apartments, family housing, and cluster housing with mandatory meal plans. On Campus AccommodationThe department of student housing services at the University of Victoria aims to give students with a home-like environment where they can make lifelong friends, learn new things, and be supported in their learning both inside and outside the classroom.Single and double rooms, cluster rooms, flats, and other options are available at the university.Visit:- http://www.uvic.ca/residence/Off Campus AccommodationApartments with one or two bedrooms are available as a lodging alternative.The sum varies between CAD $1,200 and $1,500.Electric stove, refrigerator, elevator, laundry, and other amenities are available.Visit:- https://www.rentboard.ca/rentals/index.aspx?s0=1&locid=1044
Course Ranking: Nine faculties, including those for business, law, education, engineering, science, humanities, and more, make up the University of Victoria. Several organisations rank only three fields of study, including some of the following: For three years in a row—not only in 2021—QS has ranked the University of Victoria's Global MBA programme above 200. THE places University of Victoria's PG Business & Economics programmes between 301 and 400 for the year 2021; this rank range was also true for the previous year, 2020. The University of Victoria's PG Engineering & Technology programmes are likewise ranked by THE in the range of 251-300 for the year 2021, reflecting an increase from the range of 201-250 in 2020. Since 2019 till 2021, PG Computers courses have also been ranked in the range of 251-300.
University Ranking: The University of Victoria is ranked in the top 2% of all universities in the nation. University of Victoria will be between between 301 and 400 on the global rankings for 2021. According to US News & World Report, the University of Victoria is now ranked #301 globally among all universities for 2021, up 39 places from the previous year. THE classifies University of Victoria as falling within the 351-400 range for 2021, down from the 401-500 range in 2020. For the year 2021, the University of Victoria scored above average in a number of ranking areas, including the global view (88.6) and citations (73.7).According to QS rankings, the University of Victoria is ranked #370 for the year 2021, up 06 points from 2020. The University of Victoria scored generally above average in all significant categories, including foreign faculty ratio (92.9/100), international student ratio (76.3/100), and citations per faculty (74.9/100), with an overall score of 32.2/100 that was below average. The majority of these rankings are based on the prior intake, or the 2020 University of Victoria admissions. There were no new modifications noted for the 2020 intake.

Name: Aviron Quebec College Technique
Overview: Aviron Technical College is located in the province of Québec, Canada. It was established at a crucial moment in the history of Québec and has served the nation since then. The training includes courses based on subjects as diverse as drawing, parachuting techniques, the transformation of metal sheets, assembly, welding, aeronautics, etc. Aviron’s success broke through in 1961, and they successfully opened a second school. The college offers highly acclaimed career and employability services to students. Some of them are internships and on-the-job training, job and recruitment fairs, resume, CV and cover letter building, study programs abroad, online job portals, etc. Moreover, the college faculty aims to provide the best possible recruitment to the students.

Name: Focus College - Abbotsford
Overview: After opening its doors for the first time in 1992, Focus College has expanded to provide employment-focused and globally recognized education in travel & tourism, business, and technology, as well as more miniature courses in accounting, bylaws, office, and ESL. The Ministry of Advanced Education designated this institute through the PTIB (Private Training Institute Branch) under the Private Training Act. This institution also received the Education Quality Assurance (EQA) designation. This is only awarded to institutions meeting or exceeding the Quality Assurance Standards of BC. Out of its four campuses, one is in Abbotsford. This city, situated in British Columbia, is adjacent to the Fraser River, Greater Vancouver, and the Canada-United States border. Focus College Abbotsford offers an Advanced Certificate and Advanced Diploma in Business, a PGD in ITASS (Advanced Security Specialist), an Advanced Certificate and Advanced Diploma in Software Development, and several other programs. Most Focus College graduates get employed just after their training is complete. They can finish their training and be ready to start part-time or full-time work within 12 months. The payment plan at Focus College also provides a range of funding sources for covering a student’s tax-deductible education. Focus College partnered with the University of the Fraser Valley (UFV), providing a pathway for its Advanced Certificate in Business graduates to continue further studies by transferring to UFV in the General Studies Diploma program. Besides scholarships that account for 50% savings in the second year, some eligible students avail themselves of up to 75% off tuition.
Eligibility Overview: To be considered for admission to Focus College, you must meet the following criteria:Grade 12 or an equivalent Canadian qualification is required. Either you have relevant experience or you are a mature student.Knowledge of the English language is required. Students from non-English speaking countries/territories will be required to demonstrate English proficiency at a minimum IELTS Band level of 6.0 OR equivalent. (Students who do not have documentation of English proficiency or who have a lower level of English proficiency will be required to undergo an English crash course at Focus College.)

Name: University of Prince Edward Island
Overview: The University of Prince Edward Island is a government institution established in 1969 in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada. The 134 acres of campus have modern marvels like the Main Building, Dalton Hall, War Memorial Hall, Central Utility Building, Duffy Science Center, Chi-Wan Young Sports Center, CARI Complex (swimming pools, running tracks, and hockey rinks), UPEI Health and Wellness Center, Robertson Library, and many more.The university has seven faculties: Faculty of Arts; Faculty of Business; Faculty of Education; Faculty of Sustainable Design Engineering; Faculty of Nursing; Faculty of Science;Faculty of Veterinary Medicine; and; School of Mathematical and Computational Sciences. With more than 5000 enrollments (65% acceptance rate), the University of Prince Edward Island offers postgraduate and undergraduate courses in Education, Arts, Engineering, Biology, Socialism, Chemistry, Psychology, Computational Science, etc. The university provides on-campus (Bernardine Hall, Blanchard Hall, Bill, and Denise Andrew Hall) and off-campus accommodation services. Students can stay in single, double, and triple suite options with five-day and seven-day meal plans at 5,000 CAD- 6,000 CAD, residential services like laundry, kitchenette, TV lounge, free parking, internet access, and 24-hour security. The graduates from UPEI get jobs in various sectors and an average package between 60,000 CAD to 108,000 CAD.Undergraduate and graduate courses' average tuition fee is 4,100 CAD and 11,100 CAD, respectively. The university provides financial aid to students ranging from 1,000 CAD to 3,000 CAD based on merit under programs like Alan Moore Memorial Scholarship, Halifax Kennel Club Award, Scotiabank Scholarship Series, etc.

Placement: You have the opportunity to apply and integrate your knowledge and abilities through community-based learning experiences in the third and fourth years of the Family Science and Child and Family Studies programmes. As of your third year, as part of Family Science 381: Professional Practice with Children and Families, you will be able to participate in a 32-hour field placement with a community agency during the fall semester. Following this initial community-based learning experience, you and a small group of classmates will plan, develop, and administer a family education programme in collaboration with community organisations in Family Science 382: Program Planning and Evaluation. From September to April of your fourth year, you will participate in an intense field placement for 80 hours per semester (about 1 day per week). This capstone community placement will provide you with several opportunities to integrate theory and practice in a safe and supportive environment. For more, visit.

Name: Humber College - Lakeshore
Overview: Humber College is one of the top international colleges in Canada. Since 1967 it has been educating students in different post-secondary courses like diploma, graduation, post-graduation, etc. Out of three other colleges, Humber College – Lakeshore is the first campus imparting education in computer science, engineering, business administration, science, arts, etc. It has a state-of-art classroom, laboratories, and other platforms to practice passion and talents. There are 29,000+ full-time courses and 1500 part-time courses for domestic and international students. The Humber College – Lakeshore course offers 200+ bachelor, post-graduation, and apprentice programs. The acceptance rate is moderate; students should secure an IELTS Score- of 6.0 to 7.0, a TOEFL IBT scores- of 550 to 600, or a PTE score- of 53-64. After completing courses, they offer research laboratories, internships, and other practice sessions to get job-ready. They have 2,40,000 alumni from more than 138 countries who are industry leaders in their respective fields. Humber College – Lakeshore placement network assure 85% recruitment of students every year. Humber College Lakeshore tuition fee is CAD 17,000 to CAD 22,000 per year. It offers scholarships and grants to students in a financial crisis. It provides both on-campus and off-campus accommodation to students. Humber Colleges have a vast network of 40+ global academic partners, corporate houses, and 300+ global citizenship partners. Students worldwide aspire to join here for its on-campus, off-campus, and online training facility.

Name: Northern College - Haileybury
Overview: Established in 1967, Northern College is a public college of Applied Arts and Technology. This college holds affiliation with CCAA, AUCC, and ACCC. It has four campuses in Haileybury, Kirkland Lake, Moosonee, and Timmins Campus. The campus at Haileybury is close to several public amenities and cultural venues, allowing students to access this facility easily.The campus specializes in offering three-year Veterinary Sciences (Wildlife Rehabilitation program). It is well-equipped with advanced laboratories and state-of-the-art technology, such as the underwater treadmill. Northern College awards scholarships, awards, and bursaries to approximately 1000 students annually. The college has granted over $700,000 in scholarships, awards, and bursaries to eligible students. The college funds students’ education through Go Clean Scholarship, Global Study Awards, etc. Individuals can opt for a fully-furnished on-campus Northern College Haileybury residence. Besides, students can access the college’s gym and bookstore to purchase essentials apart from textbooks. An accessible parking facility at the campus is available for student transport via vehicle. This college allows distance learning through OntarioLearn, an online portal. Students or individuals busy in their profession can opt for courses in Accounting, Early Childhood Education, General Arts, Science, etc.Applicants must meet the Northern College IELTS requirement of 6.0 and a TOEFL score of 79. Northern College Fees for international students vary with each course and semester. For example, students enrolled in BScN in Nursing may need to pay $26,996.90. It is $16,874.40 for students enrolled in Practical Nursing. Students can schedule appointments to build resumes, develop interview skills, etc. Individuals can also opt for academic pathways to transfer within, into, or out of the Northern college.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate applicants must have completed Grade 12 in a relevant discipline from a recognised board of education, with English as a compulsory subject and an overall score of 50%A three- or four-year diploma or bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a recognised institution is required for postgraduate applicants English Requirements: Northern College has defined the exams and scores for all undergraduate and postgraduate applicants from non-English-speaking countries. These differ based on the requirements of the course:

Placement: The students must get an Internship Work Permit if they are enrolled in a programme that requires mandatory co-op or internship terms (along with your Study Permit). If the co-op/internship begins in the first term of classes, the application for the Co-op/Internship Work Permit must be submitted at the same time as the Study Permit. In case of procedural delays, one should apply for a co-op/internship work visa at least three months before the internship begins. This application is free of charge. Suppose the student has a valid Study Permission. In that case, employment in question is a prerequisite of the programme, and the employment represents less than 50% of the programme, the students are eligible for this permit. Citizenship and Immigration Canada has information on study permit processing times. On-Campus Work: There is no need for a work permit. The student must have a valid Study Permit and be enrolled full-time to be able to work on campus (except during scheduled breaks & the last term before graduation). Off-Campus Work: If you are granted a Study Permit, you will be instantly authorised to work off-campus for 20 hours per week throughout the academic session and full-time during specified breaks. If the applicants are granted a Study Permit, they will not need to apply for a separate work permit.
Accommodation: On-Campus accommodation  The university provides a safe and happy place for students and provides them a place where they could build a rapport with others. The residences are situated in different places like, Timmins CampusHaileyburyKirkland For more information, visit: https://www.northernc.on.ca/housing/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/HousingList-KirklandLake.pdf

Name: Holland College - Prince of Wales
Overview: Established in 1969, Holland College is a well-known public community college located in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada. A post-secondary education institute, Holland College is reputed among the premier higher education institutions of Canada. Holland College offers more than 150 pathway online and offline courses to its students in fields ranging from arts and science to police training. The Atlantic Police Academy of Holland College was founded in 1971, and since then, it has maintained its status of being one of the best police training institutes in the world. Some of the top programs at Holland College are Data Analytics, Power Engineering, Journalism and Communications, Culinary Arts, Dental Assisting. Holland College has 5 campuses spread across Prince Edward Island. Its main campus is the Prince of Wales Campus, which is home to the Charlottetown Centre, Tourism and Culinary Centre, and Centre for Community Engagement. Besides, the institute also has 13 centers dedicated to each faculty. Holland College provides ample internship opportunities to its students. The institute has 150 agreements with other universities ensuring a high placement and employment rate for the students. The average tuition fee at Holland College is $4,400 CAD. International students are eligible to apply for financial aid and scholarships. The Holland College Students Union provides students with services that make campus life easier. The institute also has a health benefits plan for its students. Besides, events are regularly organized on campus to make student life exciting. Holland College Accommodation operates two halls of residence: the Glendenning Hall and the Cumberland Residence. Students can live on-campus at affordable rates. The apartments are equipped with 24-hour staff, Wi-fi, laundry room, cable TV, etc. Students who enrol for the Police Cadet stay in the Atlantic Policy Academy residence. Holland College promises the best college life experience.
Eligibility Overview: Transcripts from high school and college, both in their native language and in English. Official TOEFL/IELTS score report given straight to Holland College. Diploma courses require a class 12 equivalency. A Supporting Affidavit.
Placement: Not provided
Accommodation: If you want to live in one of the Prince of Wales Campus houses in Charlottetown, you must apply for a room and a programme at the same time.Before being accepted into a programme, you cannot be provided a resident room, and rooms are limited, so apply as soon as possible.Check: https://hollandcollege.com/campus-life/living-in-residence.html

Name: Confederation College - Fort Frances Rainy River District
Overview: Confederation College is a Canadian public university renowned for its courses in Applied arts and technology. It has 9 campuses, out of which the Rainy River District campus is located in the town of Fort Frances, Canada. The campus situated near the Rainy river is very close to the USA-Canada border and is 4.5 hours away from the main campus in Thunder Bay, Ontario. There are 24 programmes offered at this campus, which begin either during the fall or the winter. The college is famous for its courses in Business- Human resources, marketing, accounting and training to become personal support and social service workers. According to Webometrics, Confederation College is ranked 154 among all Canadian universities and 2544 in the continent of North America. 87.9% of college graduates get employed within 6 months. The college offers various scholarships and financial aid opportunities to international students. Every year, 3 international students get the International Students Excellence awards, worth CAD 2,500 based on their merit. 2 international students also get to achieve the Student Union Award of Confederation College Inc of CAD 500. Confederation College has a dynamic learning environment and a highly trained faculty, attracting 1,450 international students from 25 countries every year. The classrooms are equipped with cutting-edge technologies and have a smaller class size to deliver high-quality education. The college trains the students with hands-on industry experience, resulting in a student satisfaction rate of 77.4% and employer satisfaction of 93.8%.
Eligibility Overview: Academic information like as credentials, course completion, grades, and English proficiency are used to evaluate entrance eligibility.Requirement for English ProficiencyApplicants who have been educated in a system where English is not the official academic language must provide proof of English ability. Program criteria, on the other hand, differ. The following are the minimal English language competency requirements for post-secondary courses:
