Name: Loyalist College - Belleville
Overview: The Loyalist College is a fine educational institution established in 1967 in Belleville, Ontario, Canada, and is officially known as the Loyalist College of Applied Arts and Technology. The institute is heavily focused on Applied Arts and Technology programs and is one of the best institutes in Canada in this field. As the website quotes, this is the best place to receive “small town warmth with big-city amenities.” The college has three campuses located in Belleville, Bancroft, and Mississauga. These campuses have state-of-the-art facilities, labs, and classrooms. Loyalist College distributes over a million dollars yearly to support its students’ education with financial aid through various scholarships, bursaries, awards, and on-campus employment initiative opportunities.The student-to-faculty ratio at Loyalist College is 21:1, and students are provided with expert faculty who impart quality education and give the students individual attention. The college has established a student government to advocate for your needs throughout your term. There is residential accommodation present on-campus, housing around 600 students. During their stay, students can also avail themselves of various facilities such as laundry, meal plans, and entertainment areas.
Eligibility Overview: Loyalist college has a few country-specific requirements for students. Indian applicants must provide certificates of grade 10 + 2 with marks over 50%. Bachelors and should have less than eight backlogs. Here is a quick summary of the admission overview.
Eli Table:
Application Fees100 CAD
Type of DeadlineDepends on course
Intake Seasons
  • Summer (May 1)
  • Fall (September 1)
  • Winter (January 1)
Placement: According to Colleges Ontario, Loyalist College has the highest graduate employment rate in Ontario (90.8%) compared to the statewide average (85.7%). It is also among the top-ranked colleges in the province for graduate satisfaction, student contentment, employer satisfaction, and graduation rate. According to Colleges Ontario's Key Performance Indicators (KPI), 88.8% of Loyalist College graduates can obtain work within the first six months of graduation. This measurement is greater than the 85.5 percent provincial average for Ontario. In its normal programmes, Loyalist College does not provide placement services. But in the case of a co-op programme, the job can become full-time when the degree is earned. In order to assist students and graduates with their career exploration, planning, job search, and professional development, the Career Centre is established. Additionally, they offer a ‘myCareer’ Portal that you may use to view job listings, schedule appointments, and add activities to your co-curricular record.
Accommodation: Loyalist College provides a safe, fun, diverse community living environment at all residences. With 580 beds split between two fully furnished homes (apartment or townhouse), you can access live-in peer support, full-time professional staff, round-the-clock security personnel, and various social events. After careful consideration of the ill effects of the pandemic, Loyalist college has decided to reduce the fee for the years 2022-2023. They acknowledge that the past two years have been difficult for everyone and want to help their students in every way possible. Residence costs for local and international students will now be lowered to $3,400 for the 8-month contract in September 2022 from $6,200 for the contract's first eight months ($775 each month). Five homes are on campus in a rural, forested area outside Belleville. There are 476 beds available in the apartment-style residences and 104 students in townhouse-style residences. The residences are fully furnished and have laundry facilities (card system), a sports area with basketball hoops, bike storage, picnic tables, a covered outdoor patio, a beach volleyball court, and outdoor grills. Each residence includes six distinct bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, and a communal living space are all included in each residence's apartment-style layout. Each single-occupancy bedroom has a twin captain's bed, a desk and chair for studying, a lamp for the desk, a dresser, a nightstand, a bookcase, and a corkboard. There are dining tables, chairs, a coffee table, a love seat, a fridge, a stove, a microwave, and dishwashers, and these amenities are located in the shared kitchen and dining rooms.
University Ranking: Loyalist College is a public college located in Belleville, Ontario, Canada. Founded in 1967, it is one of the oldest colleges in the province and has a long history of providing quality education to students from across the country. The college offers a wide range of programs in business, health sciences, applied arts and technology, and community services. Loyalist College is consistently ranked among the top colleges in Ontario and Canada. In 2020, it was ranked as the third-best college in Ontario by Maclean’s Magazine and the fourth-best college in Canada by the Globe and Mail. The college was also ranked as the top college in Ontario for student satisfaction by the National Survey of Student Engagement (NSSE). The college is well-known for its commitment to providing quality education. It strongly focuses on experiential learning and provides students with the opportunity to gain real-world experience through internships, co-op placements, and other hands-on learning opportunities.Loyalist College is also highly regarded for its commitment to research and innovation. The college has several research centres and institutes, including the Centre for Applied Research and Innovation, the Centre for Social Innovation, and the Centre for Entrepreneurship and Innovation. These centres allow students to engage in research projects and develop innovative solutions to real-world problems. Loyalist College is an excellent choice for students looking for quality education in a supportive and welcoming environment. With its strong commitment to research and innovation, its focus on experiential learning, and its wide range of support services, Loyalist College is an excellent choice for students who want to pursue a successful career in their chosen field.

Name: Sprott Shaw Language College - Toronto
Overview: Toronto is a language college located in Toronto, Canada. Founded in 1996, this private institute offers courses for all ages. As it is located in Canada's largest city, it provides a plethora of opportunities for students. Additionally, SSLC is an accredited institution from the ministries of Hessen, Berlin, Saarland, Rheinland-Pfalz and Niedersachsen. Apart from these, it also got accreditations from the Education Quality Assurance (EQA) and Languages Canada. At Sprott Shaw Language College – Toronto, the English programs are offered for all ages. For example, English programs are ESL for Adults, English for Teens, English for Children's and Families etc. Other available programs at Sprott Shaw Language College – Toronto are Vacation English Programs, Global Leaders Program, English for Post-Secondary Education, Integrated Pathway Bridging Programs, English4work, Preparatory Pathway Program and others. The fee for ESL varies as per the program. For example, for ESL Weekly courses of more than 24 weeks duration, the fee for 5 hours is CAD 75, for 10 hours, it is CAD 150, and for 25 hours, the fee is 340. In addition, for Teen Programs, the 4 week tuition is CAD 1,500, and for 48 weeks it is CAD 16,560. Applicants must note there are fees for books and materials and also for transcripts, Medical Insurance and others. For IELTS preparation, the course fee is CAD 1560 for 4 week, and for 8 weeks and 12 weeks, it is CAD 3,120 and CAD 4680, respectively. Students can get accommodations while studying at the Sprott Shaw Language College – Toronto. Available options are Homestay and GEC Student Residence. For Homestay, the host family will provide room, meals and other facilities. Importantly, the student will get an English speaking environment in both types of residences.
Accommodation: Students should book their lodgings well in advance of their arrival, since all available accommodations fill up rapidly, especially before the semester begins.Accommodations at On-Campus ResidencesThe institution provides on-campus housing accommodations at its discretion. Accommodations Off-CampusOff-campus rental housing options include single homes, duplexes, apartments, and rooms for rent in the surrounding region. Students who choose to live off-campus must conduct their own research and arrive well before the start of the semester to do so. HomestayThere are many different types of homestays to choose from, and our partners do their best to connect students and hosts based on their interests and preferences. Singles, young couples with children and pets, and elderly couples are among the homestay hosts. All homestay lodgings have been inspected, and all adults in the household have completed the mandatory criminal background check.

Name: New Brunswick Community College - Moncton
Overview: NBCC was established in 1974 and received its provincial crown status in 2010. Saint John campus is one of its largest campuses. The college attracts many students as it offers more than 30 full-time courses. They include Business Administration, Administrative professional, Electrical and Electronics Engineering Technology, Health, Information Technology, Mechanical and Industrial, Social Sciences, and Trades. There are various technical degrees as most programs include a work practicum. The student body is diverse, representing more than 1500 students, including international students from 53 countries. There has been recent infrastructure funding hence making it more lucrative. In addition to two new learning facilities, students will find a large cafeteria, gymnasium, fitness centre and much more. The NBCC Foundation offers annual scholarships and bursaries depending on the financial need of the student. The New Brunswick Community College ranking on Webometrics is 151 in Canada. In recognition of their engaging teaching efforts, the NBCC faculty here received National Inclusive Education Awards in 2020. Fees are pretty reasonable as it comes under 10,000 CAD for an international student. The fees for local students are covered well within 4,000 CAD. The IELTS requirement for international students is 6. This college supports the unique feature of customized training as it bears the student’s needs in mind. It reasonably accommodates working professionals in its student programs. New Brunswick Community College ensures that the student’s experience doesn’t end at graduation as it promotes active participation in the NBCC Alumni. Trends among graduates show that students of NBCC continue to get employed. The annual survey indicates a graduate employment rate of 91%, of which 90% are involved in work directly related to their training. This exhibits the success of the teaching programs vividly.
Eligibility Overview: NBCC requires all international and Permanent Resident candidates to demonstrate adequate academic English competence.If one of our English language training partners provides evidence of English proficiency on a recognised linguistic test or successful completion of a recognised route programme, NBCC may request it.the applicant's native language is not English; or the applicant has not completed a minimum of three (3) years of secondary education in English; or the applicant has not completed a minimum of one (1) year of successful completion in a recognised post-secondary institution in English.https://nbcc.ca/admissions/language-requirements

Name: International College of Manitoba (ICM)
Overview: International College of Manitoba (ICM) is based in the heart of Canada on the University of Manitoba Fort Garry campus. This campus features walking trails, adequate green space, and a combination of modern and traditional buildings. Roughly 20% of individuals of this university comprise international students that represent 120 nations. International College of Manitoba (ICM) extends an array of pathway programs. This college's teaching approach and programs totally prepare the students for university studies and get a smooth transition to the University of Manitoba. The University of Manitoba is featured in the globally-recognized Times Higher Education and QS World Universities Ranking. UTP Stage I is an 8-month program curated as a bridge between university and secondary school level study. Students successfully completing this program with required grades gain entry to ICM UTP Stage II. On the other hand, the UTP Stage II courses are equivalent to the first-year courses of the University of Manitoba. An academic year at ICM comprises three terms. Each term is of 13 weeks duration, plus an exam period. The terms start in January, May and September, and students can commence a program in any term. Students can complete UTP Stage II in three months. There are more than 40 different ICM scholarships for the current students every term, along with the Navitas Family Bursary. Manitoba also turns out to be a highly popular location to settle for newly-arrived individuals. The low cost of living in Manitoba and affordable tuition fees of ICM makes it an ideal college to choose for budget-conscious students.
Eligibility Overview: The completion of Year 12 of high school or its equivalent, with overall and particular subject requirements varying by programme, is generally required for admission to UTP Stage II. The following is a list of specific academic requirements*. An applicant's whole academic record is used to make admissions decisions.UTP2: India Senior Secondary School Certificate with a minimum overall average of 65 percent in three senior academic courses and a minimum of 50 percent in Year 10 or 12 MathUTP2(Engineering): India Senior Secondary School Certificate with an average of 75% in Mathematics, Chemistry, and Physics with no mark below 70%.
Accommodation: As an ICM student, you will have access to on-campus, off-campus, and homestay housing options. It is the responsibility of the students to book their own accommodations. Depending on what you're searching for as well as your budget, there are a variety of possibilities. Remember to apply as soon as possible! Popular choices frequently have waiting lists that begin 4-6 months in advance.

Name: Liaison College of Culinary Arts - Hamilton Campus
Overview: Liaison College of Culinary Arts, established in 1996, offers a wide range of professional programs and courses including Classic French methods of food preparation. The Hamilton Campus is situated at Lloyd D. Jackson Square, Unit 260, Upper Level, 2 King St. West Hamilton, Ontario, L8P 1A1. The courses range from a few months to a few years and after the completion of them, students can pursue their career as a full-time chef. The college has a high job placement rate of 90%. Students get hands-on training while pursuing a cooking basic diploma, the culinary management diploma, the chef de cuisine diploma, the Red Seal Examination Preparation Certificate, etc. The faculty members at this college also provide comprehensive career development service. For that, they help students with interviewing skills, resume development, etc. Students keep getting placement assistance by the Liaison College of Culinary Arts - Hamilton Campus even after completing their graduation. In terms of the admission process, one has to apply online using the institution’s online portal. Applicants are also required to submit their English proficiency test scores along with their academic records. The college expects the general score of IELTS to be at least 5.5 for the same. Apart from academic assistance, Liaison College of Culinary Arts students also get help with the visa application process. In case of students coming from a weak financial background, the college provides scholarships or other monetary aid to them.

Name: ILSC Language Schools - Vancouver
Overview: ILSC Language Schools boast 7 campuses such as Vancouver, Toronto and Montréal, Canada; New Delhi, India; and Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, Australia. Among them, the Vancouver campus is located at 555 Richards St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2Z5, Canada. It offers several language training programs including Language Training for Business, Teacher Training, etc. The institution has remained part of above 300,000 student learning adventures. In 2019, it got recognition as the CSR Champion of the Year in ESL’s Language Travel Awards. Other than several program preferences, students get flexible course start dates, and convenience to start their study goals right away. ILSC Language Schools Canada has more than 150 University Pathway Partners, and multiple options designed for different age group. Apart from academic assistance, the institution also ensures that students are able to take part in extracurricular activities. For that, it has given them access to different group learning activities, cultural programs, sports, etc. Also, the location is appropriate for them to pursue their special interests, and try out different outdoor adventures, from hiking to skiing, snowboarding, and so on. ILSC Language Schools also provide off-campus work facilities to students who are opting for courses that have a tenure of 6 months or more. The faculty members or language instructors at this institution are proper degree-holders and have certificates and years of teaching experience. Apart from classroom activities, students get to remain involved in volunteer & fundraising opportunities as well.

Name: Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) - Patricia
Overview: Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) Patricia campus is located in West Edmonton. The institute offers several degree courses, diplomas and certificates in more than 200 programs. It was established in 1962 and got a ranking of 2,123 in World rankings given by UniRank 2020. Most of its certificate programs are focused on fields of Health Sciences, Environmental Management, Business, Culinary Arts, Engineering technologies, etc. NAIT has 4 different campuses, and the Patricia campus offers programs under the institute’s School of Skilled Trades. Several training programs are also provided here and students get direct access to the faculty members, helping them clarify their doubts regarding the courses they are pursuing. The overall student strength of this university is 16,400 and around 1,900 international students are coming from over 88 countries. All the programs are covered by its experienced faculty members and the average employment satisfaction rate stands at 98%. In terms of the admission process, the institution has some stringent guidelines. From English language proficiency to previous academic records, several aspects play an integral role here. It accepts IELTS, TOEFL, PTE test scores during the admission process, and it mainly involves applying online. The cost of attendance ranges between 18,000- 27,000 CAD, and Northern Alberta Institute of Technology students receive scholarships or other financial aid to finance that. The alumni network of Northern Alberta Institute of Technology is quite strong and it has more than 200,000 members presenting its global presence. It is connected to some of the popular companies which have created several employment opportunities. A career fair organised by the institution receives more than 80 companies every year. As a matter of fact, 89% of the graduates get high paying jobs within 9 months of their course completion.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for overseas students to be eligible?The following are the qualifying criteria and language requirements for applying to various programmes at Northern Alberta Institute of Technology that are available to overseas students:To be eligible for certificate programmes, students must have a high school diploma or certificate.A bachelor's degree is necessary for some courses.If necessary to calculate the entry scores, post-secondary courses will be evaluated as high school equivalents.A minimum of 75% in all four components is expected on the NAIT English Language Proficiency Exam.International Students' English RequirementsInternational students from non-English-speaking countries, such as India, must demonstrate their language competency using one of the standardised English exam scores listed below: Level 6 Courses at NAITEach course must have a passing grade of 60% or above. Assessment of Canadian Language BenchmarksIn the areas of speaking, reading, listening, and writing, you will get an 8 out of 10. Academic IELTS6.5 bands overall, with a minimum of 6.5 in Speaking and 6.0 in Reading, Listening, and Writing. TOEFL iBT is a computerised version of the TOEFL exam.20 in Reading, Listening, and Writing, and 23 in Speaking Duolingo is a language learning programme (DET)115 or higher
Placement: PlacementsCompanies host career fairs and events where students can find employment. Every year, over 80 companies attend the employment fair, and carrying a CV is a must if you want to acquire a job or make new connections. Within 9 months of completing their school, 89 percent of alumni find high-paying jobs in Canada. Furthermore, Career Connect allows students and graduates to apply for opportunities that have been posted by outside employers.

Name: British Columbia Institute of Technology
Overview: British Columbia Institute of Technology (BCIT) Canada is a public university established in 1964. It has five campuses across the state - the main campus is the Burnaby campus, and the others are the Downtown campus, Marine campus, Aerospace Technology campus, Annacis Island campus, and ten other satellite locations.British Columbia Institute offers over 300 courses under various schools of study. There are 108 courses in the School of Business and Media. The university offers 46 courses in the School of Computing and Academic Studies, 80 courses in the School of Construction and Environment, 39 courses in the School of Energy; 54 courses in the School of Health Sciences; and 40 courses in the School of Transportation. The institute also provides diploma courses, full-time certificate courses, and Apprenticeship and Trades degrees.The institute's 98% of graduates are employed within two years of graduating. The entrance requirements at the university are English equivalencies, credential evaluation, assessment testing, upgrading transfer credit, and study permit requirements. The British Columbia Institute provides on-campus and off-campus accommodation facilities to students. A long-term accommodation would cost 1000 CAD (approx.), and a short-term stay would cost 24.50 CAD (per night).The application fee for international students is 154 CAD. A degree course would range from 13,500 to 19,500 CAD, and a diploma course would cost between 16,500 and 20,000 CAD. Financial aid is also offered through rewards, loans, and scholarships. Other facilities include an international student center, library, housing facilities, workshops, etc.

Students are given support in locating their ideal work opportunities in Canada. This gives them adequate experience to deal with the difficulties that will inevitably arise in their life.

Name: Lambton College
Overview: Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences is a life science college in Canada. One of its centres is in Mississauga while the other is in Toronto. Both these centres are authorised to grant graduation degrees and run diploma and certificate programmes that cater to domestic and international students. Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences - Mississauga is registered under the private career college act of 2005. It was established in 2003 and gradually expanded its team and the courses it offers under the leadership of a strong regulatory body of board certified experts, trainers, and curriculum development consultants. The institute enjoys the reputation for being amongst the top private colleges in North America. It focuses on delivering systematic training, professional skill set, and offering practical exposure to its students to meet the increasing demand of healthcare professionals worldwide. Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences - Mississauga also consistently maintains placement records of at least 80% for its graduates and 100% for the students of its certificate courses. The students are recruited by multinational companies which are industry leaders and offer great benefits and competitive compensation. The minimum eligibility criteria to get admission in this college is as follows: Grade Point Average (GPA) – 3 International Baccalaureate (IB score) – 33 Percentage of marks – 75 The college maintains state-of-art laboratories, updated training modules, cutting-edge innovative evaluation systems, feedback classes, etc. Their commitment to supporting and training the students in order to make them the industry leaders is the primary objective of this institution. Apart from their up-to-date educational practices, they also provide financial support in the form of grants, loans, and scholarships for the students. For their excellent record and services in the field of healthcare, the institute is held in high esteem by the industry professionals and regulating authorities. The average cost of courses available in the Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences is $12960. Most of the course duration lasts upto one year. Apart from the classroom programme, the college also offers several online certificate courses as well. One can get online virtual demo and registration facilities across the world.

Name: Toronto Film School
Overview: Toronto Film School is located in Ontario, Canada.  The top courses at Toronto Film School include Diploma in Film Production, Diploma in Film and TV Writing, and Diploma in Acting for Film, TV, and the Theatre. Because English is the primary medium of instruction, students applying to this university must have an IELTS score of 4.0 or higher.Students must produce legitimate transcripts as proof of past schooling in order to be admitted.Currently, there are no scholarships offered from the university to Indian students specifically.
Eligibility Overview: Students with IELTS scores below the required minimum can apply to Toronto Film School programs in Ontario through the ESL Pathway Program, which is divided into three levels, strengthening their English academic skills. Each level is 12 weeks long and includes 25 hours of teaching per week. During their time at Yorkville University, all students will have access to ongoing language and international student services.
Accommodation: If you'd prefer to stay with a host family, Home Stay is an option to consider. This option gives a family atmosphere in which to enjoy the comforts of home as well as hosts who can answer your questions and provide you insight into Toronto and Canadian living. You may also be lodging with other international students with whom you might make friends! Home Stay gives you access to the house's living areas, as well as television, laundry, and the Internet. The cost varies depending on the meal plan and the Home Stay operator, but it averages around $750 per month.for more information click on this link-https://www.torontofilmschool.ca/resources/student-housing/

Name: Georgian College - Owen Sound
Overview: Georgian College was set up in 1967. It is ranked the 98th best university in Canada. With an acceptance rate of 81%, the college displays a lightly selective admission policy. Owen Sound Campus is situated on 15 acres of land on Georgian Bay, right beneath the Niagara Escarpment. It provides a wide range of courses in business and management, engineering and environmental technologies, health care, hospitality and tourism, liberal arts, and marine studies, among others. Owen Sound also offers on-campus accommodation to students and a safe environment so that the students can learn, grow and develop. Besides, each residential unit is equipped with laundry, a shared kitchen, a living area, and on-call staff 24*7—other services like parking, food services, computer labs, fitness centres, libraries, etc. are also available. Georgian college-Owen Sound welcomes students from more than 85 countries, speaking 110 languages. The college has an international centre to address international students. The college houses over 4500 international students. The fact that 6,200 employers partner with Georgian College to offer students work experience, and nearly 90% of the graduates get employed within six months after graduation, reflects the career-centric nature of the postsecondary institution in Canada. Owen Sound Campus also offers various meeting spaces, videoconferencing and multimedia classrooms, computer labs, and learning spaces for rental year-round.
Eligibility Overview: Students need to be 19 years old or have completed grade 12 in order to enrol in the majority of classes. The following prerequisites might not be necessary for some general education classes, particularly those that are geared toward children and young adults. Admissions requirements for postsecondary programs Applicants who will be at least 19 years old by the first day of school and who do not meet the academic entrance prerequisites may be considered for admission as mature applicants to an approved postsecondary programme if they meet the other requirements for admission. Applicants of any age will have their applications evaluated on an individual basis. An official high school diploma (OSSD) along with 30 credits earned at the general or college level, or its equivalent, is required for entry to postsecondary programmes. Certain programmes require applicants to complete certain prerequisite classes. Applicants seeking enrollment in college classes on a part-time basis may be granted admission to those classes if there is room available in the class and the applicant has satisfied the entrance requirements. Applicants to a postsecondary diploma or certificate programmes that require only the prerequisite courses of English and/or mathematics may be admitted on a probationary basis. However, they will be required to earn a grade point average of 60 per cent or higher after completing six credit courses in order to graduate from the programme. NOTE: Even if an applicant is accepted for part-time study, this does not guarantee that they will be admitted to a programme on a full-time basis in consecutive semesters. Admission requirements for degree programs All of the following requirements need to be met in order for applicants to be considered mature:Must be at least 21 years old by the first day of classes in order to register.Must have no recent poor academic performanceMust be able to demonstrate by academic accomplishments that they have the capacity to be successful in degree studies.A high school diploma (OSSD) with 30 credits or the equivalent is required for entrance to degree programmes. In addition, applicants must have completed six courses at the 4U or 4M level. Certain programmes require applicants to complete certain prerequisite classes. Admission requirements for graduate certificate programs The completion of an undergraduate degree or an advanced degree from another institution is necessary for admission to graduate certificate programmes. Some scholarship opportunities stipulate the precise field of study that must be completed to qualify. Admission process, part-time to full-time studies Students attending Georgian College on a part-time basis who are interested in enrolling to the first year of full-time studies are required to submit their application through ontariocolleges.ca and adhere to the standard admissions procedure. The status of a student attending school part-time does not grant preferential admission to a programme requiring full-time attendance. It is strongly encouraged that students enrol in credit classes on a part-time basis within full-time programmes, provided that there is space available and that the admission standards are satisfied.
Placement: Offices of PlacementIn several of the Health, Wellness and Sciences, Human Services, and Community Safety programmes, the placement offices are responsible for arranging placement opportunities and managing the pre-placement requirements for students to satisfy the learning outcomes of their practical courses. Check here: https://www.georgiancollege.ca/student-life/student-services/placement-offices/
Accommodation: Residence in Owen SoundThe Owen Sound Campus Residence at Georgian College provides not only housing but also a welcoming, safe atmosphere in which students can make friends, become active, grow, and develop. https://www.georgiancollege.ca/student-life/campus-services/residence-housing/on-campus-residence/owen-sound-residence/

Name: Okanagan College - Revelstoke
Overview: Okanagan College was founded in 1906 at Summerland to become the first college to be opened in B.C. In 1995, the college’s name changed to Okanagan University College or OUC. However, the older name returned in 2005 when Okanagan University College got divided into two parts - OC (Okanagan College) and UBC (University of British Columbia). The Okanagan College – Revelstoke centre is one of this institute’s three centres. There are some specific programs that come to Okanagan College – Revelstoke centre rotationally. Some of these include Education Assistant Certificate, Health Care Assistant Certificate, Trades and Apprenticeships, Basic Accounting Certificate. This institute extends a number of services for students - Aboriginal Services, Education Advising, Counselling Services, and Accessibility Services. Besides these, there are a number of services available for program participants. These include English tutoring from September to May, Weekly English practice groups (childminding available), Orientation sessions and workshops, etc. Live-in caregivers, refugees, permanent residents, individuals chosen to become permanent residents, and individuals on temporary work permits can use these services. A number of awards are available for eligible part-time or full-time students of this college pursuing degree programs, certificate programs and diploma programs. Students attending this institute have several different housing options available for themselves. Students with their ages below 18 years have to stay with one of the institute’s approved host families until they turn 18. Individuals having 18 years of age or more can choose from Private Rental, Student Housing and the Homestay program. Established in 1988, OCAA or Okanagan College Alumni Association is a non-profit organization involved in connecting Okanagan College alumni with the institute and with each other.
Eligibility Overview: Transcripts from high school/previous institutionA copy of a current passportProof of linguistic competency in EnglishIt is mandatory for students who do not speak English as their native language to submit English language competence results to the college. These scores vary depending on the programme and can be found on the college's official website. On average, the following are some of the basic language test scores:

Placement: Okanagan College supports students in finding work. To guarantee that students are job ready once they graduate, career fairs and resume development seminars are held. Students can also participate in a Co-op programme at Okanagan College to gain work experience in their chosen disciplines.The Student, Graduate, and Co-op Employment Center at Okanagan College serves as a platform for alumni, students, and employers to connect.You can make contact with a coordinator who can guide you through your job search based on your qualifications and interests.Wages for the jobs, which are primarily based in British Columbia and Alberta, range from $15 to $20 per hour. These pay rates are determined by the industry, job title, and eligibility.
Accommodation: Student Housing on-CampusAt the Kelowna Campus of Okanagan College, students have access to on-campus housing.These furnished, non-smoking accommodations are located only minutes away from courses and libraries in the Okanagan Valley. A public bus service is available for transportation.For 2220 CAD, you can stay in one of 22 Pods, which contain amenities like high-speed internet, a computer desk, chair, bed, and dresser.Students have access to amenities such as a shared kitchen, study lounge, and weight training rooms.For students who prefer more privacy, there are 32 private studio suites available. The suites are available for 2700 CAD and include air conditioning.Student Housing Off-CampusSeveral options for lodging are available on the college's multiple campuses, and these are noted on the college's website. The college, on the other hand, is not liable for any verification or correctness of the data submitted.HomestayThe Okanagan College offers a unique service called homestay, which allows students to engage in cultural exchange and gain a deeper understanding of the region and its people.Students can locate the application on the college's official website.This facility, which rents for 800 CAD per month, will make students feel at home while providing the privacy they require with a separate bedroom complete with a dresser, chair, lamp, and bed.
Course Description: Okanagan College - Revelstoke is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Okanagan College - Revelstoke was founded in 1906. Located in Revelstoke,Canada the university is home to about 2000 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Okanagan College - Revelstoke is ranked 81th in Top Universities by Webometrics - National. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 0 undergraduate and 0 postgraduate programs. Okanagan College - Revelstoke has 0 intakes in . The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually NaN years and master’s degree courses is NaN years.The average yearly tuition fee of Okanagan College - Revelstoke is around $40,000(Approx).For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Okanagan College - Revelstoke include Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award,Ontario Graduate Scholarship Masters Program.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Okanagan College - Revelstoke is the post-study work opportunities in Canada. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Okanagan College - Revelstoke has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: CDE College
Overview: CDE College is a private college in the Quebec city of Sherbrooke, accredited by the Quebec Ministry of Education, Recreation, and Sports and authorized by the EduCanada brand, which promotes international education throughout Canada's territories and provinces. CDE also has affiliations with various language schools committed to assisting international students from non-English and non-French-speaking backgrounds. The college has an acceptance rate of 59% and offers comprehensive and short-term IT and business administration courses. The student-teacher ratio at CDE college is 12:1, ensuring more one-on-one attention to help students realize their full potential through interactive and traditional educational techniques. Classrooms in the college have cutting-edge technology to enhance and aid the learning experience.CDE College's programs include internships to provide students with real-world work experience in their field of study. The curriculums are developed in collaboration with employer partners worldwide, who offer success criteria and industry knowledge.CDE College tuition fees for international students are Rs. 438,094. Students at CDE College can expect a great campus life with good boarding facilities, indoor and outdoor playgrounds, swimming pools, libraries, work internship offers, and the best quality science labs.To enroll as an international student, you must have a Quebec Acceptance Certificate (CAQ) and Canadian Study Permit. Send your academic dossier, which should include your most recent diplomas and transcripts, through email while indicating the session (January, May, or September) for which you desire to enroll in the program of your choice. Send correspondence from India to india@cdecollege.com.

Placement: One of the many reasons for CDE College's high number of placements is its industry-oriented teaching. The College Placement Cell organises personality development programs, seminars, workshops, and industry visits to prepare its students for their respective industries. Amway India Ltd., Bennett & Coleman, American Express, British Airways, Coca-Cola, Ernst & Young, Dabur India Ltd., HCL Group, Gillette India Ltd., Hindustan Times, HSBC, and others are among the top recruiters at the college.Placement Percentage: 92%International student placement: 90%Average Earning after course completion (annually): 43,500 CAD
Accommodation: Students starting their first semester at CDE Collège will have free access to student housing. After these four months, students can choose to stay in student housing at their own expense. The student housing is located in Sherbrooke and is easily accessible by foot or public transportation to the school. Several student housing options are also available near the college campus.

Name: DEA Canadian College
Overview: DEA Canadian College is a reputed institution for vocational training and certificate programs in different languages. Students from Canada and across the world enrol in this college to pursue various courses. DEA provides a platform suitable for the growth and self-expression of every student. Their multicultural training system assists students in learning the ethnicity of different nations to prepare for international job opportunities. The language courses of DEA Canadian College offer various options like English, Farsi, Spanish, business English, Healthcare English, etc. The vocational program comprises NPPE preparation, hospitality management, dental office administration, child care provider, etc. DEA Canadian College fee is $8,488.00 CAD, and the cost of living is $12,960.00 CAD. The overall cost of study is competitive to the market standard. They also offer scholarships and other grants for supporting students on the financial end. The location is wonderful and affordable to stay. The college is in the heart of North Vancouver, which is nestled with the coastal mountains of Columbia. The natural flamboyance provides peace of mind to study. Faculty and team members are seasoned industry experts, and the curriculum is of international standard. The classroom size is small to provide individual care; a maximum of 13-20 students are there in a class. Classrooms have the facility of modern technology, labs are exclusive for research and practice, sports ground and other amenities are available on the campus. For student satisfaction and placement ratio this institute scores higher rank.

Name: Fulford Academy
Overview: Incorporated in 2002, Fulford Academy is a coeducational, boarding or private day school based in Canada’s Brockville city in Ontario. This institute is roughly an hour's drive to the national capital of Ottawa, 4 hours to Toronto and 2 hours to Montreal. It is situated on the northern shore of the St. Lawrence River. This academy houses Grades 6 to 12 and provides synchronous online education that leads to a reputed OSSD (Ontario Secondary School Diploma). It also extends specialized programs that include ESL Prep, Camps, University Prep, a Dual High School Diploma program, Real-Time Online Education and Summer Programs. Being a member of BAU Global, Fulford Academy students become a part of the global network comprising higher education institutions situated globally. The post-secondary acceptance rate at Fulford Academy is 100%. As per official website data from the time of writing, this institute features 21 Day Students, 132 online students, 35 boarding students, and it also represents 28 nationalities. This institute boasts of small class sizes and additional instruction hours that ensure personalized support and individual attention in online and in-class environments. Fulford Academy’s individualized learning approach includes highly differentiated instruction. It emphasises STEM + A (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Arts). This STEM + A and Advanced Placement form the core of Academic Programming in this institute. Fulford Academy extends an array of scholarships and bursaries available to every student. A few Fulford Academy scholarships include Fulford Day Student Scholarship, Fulford Entrance Bursary for Day Students, Fulford Lion Scholarship, Fulford Academic Scholarship, and tuition discounts.
Eligibility Overview: Fill up the online application form for Fulford Academy and send it in with the necessary materials.Pupil passportMost recent transcript and report card for the studentThe recent image of the pupil Educational evaluations (if applicable)An application fee will be required if a Fulford Academy Enrolment Officer confirms the student is eligible to apply. Before continuing with the application process, the application fee must be paid.Complete the enrollment officer interview with the student at Fulford Academy.Submit/complete an admission language test, if necessary.The admissions committee at Fulford Academy usually has all the data needed to prepare an offer of admission once the procedures outlined above are finished.

Name: University of Ottawa
Overview: The University of Ottawa is a renowned and most prominent public research bilingual university. It provides a study of French and English. It was established in 1848 in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Ottawa University offers a broad range of graduate and undergraduate programs in more than 450 subjects. An estimated annual average cost of attendance for the Fall Semester is 26,353.60 CAD, excluding additional disbursements. In addition, the University of Ottawa offers financial assistance to students like French Bursaries, Professional training scholarships, and need & merit-based financial aid for international students. The Ideal Student-faculty ratio at U of O is 33:1. International Students can opt for a study abroad program from 250 affiliated universities in 45 countries. The University of Ottawa has a dedicated Placement Center for students to get the best placement opportunities via offline and online resources like Entrepreneurship, On-campus job, Full-time careers, Paid Internships, Summer Employment and Part-time Employment. University's main campus provides accommodation in six different residences like community-style residences, Studio accommodation, Apartment-style residences, and Independent houses for an off-campus living who wish to live outside the campus.

The campus is fully furnished and equipped with all the resources like seminar halls, research labs, labs, and a giant library with a vast collection of ebooks and printed books in all 12 different locations. The Main Campus of Ottawa is spread across 37.1 hectares at the heart of Downtown Core of Ottawa, by the side of Sandy Hill, adjoining Ottawa's Rideau Canal. for on and off-campus information, click on this link-https://www2.uottawa.ca/campus-life/housing
Course Ranking: The University of Ottawa offers more than 400 graduate and undergraduate programmes with the chance to work at one of Canada's five largest universities, as well as a boost in placement and work experience, real-world expertise, and the development of professional terms for an impending career. The Molecular and Environmental Sciences, E-society, and Health are the three main areas of research at Ottawa University, which is ranked among the top 10 research universities in Canada. By combining programmes from several fields of study, students have the advantage of customising their degrees in accordance with their academic goals and interests.Additionally, there are more than 75 UG programmes across six faculties that allow students to finish their degrees in French. Additionally, Ottawa's THE's PG Computers ranking has increased from 251-300 in 2018 to 301-400 in 2023. We can see that it has also kept its place among employers by looking at QS' Global MBA ranking, which has been at 201+ since 2019. However, it lost ground in the THE rankings for PG Business and Economics, which dropped from 251-300 in 2019 to 301-400 in 2023. Its standing in engineering and technology has improved since THE ranked it between 301 and 400 in 2019; it is now ranked between 301 and 400 in 2023.
University Ranking: The University of Ottawa, a public research university with almost 160 years of history, is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. The university provides instruction in both French and English. The University of Ottawa's ranking has dramatically increased after careful observation of the international rankings for prominent educational institutions. It was ranked between positions 253 and 300 in THE's best worldwide university rating in 2017, however in 2023 it was listed at position 137. Similar to this, the University of Ottawa is ranked 237th in 2023 as opposed to 291st in 2017 according to the QS rankings.One of Canada's top 10 universities, the University of Ottawa, has maintained its ranking. In the worldwide university rankings published by US News and World Report and ARWU (Shanghai Ranking), it has improved its place internationally. It means that Ottawa has improved in every ranking criterion, including citation impact, faculty quality, research production, and academic repute. Students interested in pursuing higher education in Canada may review the University of Ottawa's course catalogue.University of Ottawa Ranking

Name: Lakeland College
Overview: A community college in Mattoon, Illinois, Lake Land College established in 1966 and has a student enrollment of over 4,000. It offers various employment-ready and pathway programs (150+ academic majors) in ten areas of study like Health and Public Services, Business, Information Technology and Agriculture. Some workforce and transfer ready programs are Cosmetology, Entrepreneurship, Management, Psychology and Elementary Education. The main Lake Land College campus is located in Mattoon, and it also has four centres; Workforce Development Center, Eastern Region Center, Western Region Center and Kluthe Center for Higher Education and Technology. The Lake Land College Library houses numerous articles, journals, books and e-resources. The collegeäó»s Adult Education program comprises High School Equivalency (GED Programming), Vocational Programming and English Language Acquisition classes. The Dual Credit program, which has an annual student enrollment of 1,500, allows high school students to earn college credit before graduating. Several High Demand Programs boost employment opportunities in areas like Automotive Technology, Criminal Justice, Paramedical Services, and Court Reporting. Other programs offered by the college include the Traffic Safety Program, IDOT Quality Management Training Program and Truck Driver Training Program. Lake Land College also offers online classes; there are 12 certificates, four associate degree and 13 online-flex degree programs available in this format. The estimated tuition fee is USD 4,260, USD 8,083 and USD 13,885 for in-district, out-of-district and out-of-state/international students respectively. Financial aids include scholarships, loans, grants and student employment like the Federal Pell Grant, Illinois MIA/POW Scholarship, Direct Loan Program, Federal Work-Study and Military Tuition Assistance. There are no housing facilities on campus, but student accommodation is available close by in apartments. Lake Land College has over 30 student clubs like Active Mind, Common Corners and Pride and five sports teams (baseball, basketball, softball etc.). Over 80% of Lake Land College graduates find employment within six months of graduating.
Eligibility Overview: English language EvaluationsTOEFL The TOEFL test is taken online. It assesses your ability to communicate effectively in English at a university level.            A minimum score of 78 on the internet-based test (iBT) and a minimum score of 19 in each of the four areas evaluated is             required.Each year, more than 50 tests are offered at certified test centres all around the world.DuolingoDuolingo offers online English language competence assessment. The tests are available on a first-come, first-served basis.In under an hour, you can complete the test from your computer and send the results to our admissions team for consideration.Our average acceptance score is 100, with no sub-score lower than 95.Check this site for more details: https://www.lakelandcollege.ca/future-students/english-language-requirements?_mid_=46162#Duolingo
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Life in a residenceIn the classroom, you'll learn how to think. Discover how to live in a dorm.The location is convenient, full of opportunities, and secure. It's also more than just a bed and a desk.Living on campus is a fantastic way to study, grow, and get the most out of your college experience.Graduates from Lakeland frequently tell that they learned as much in residence as they did in the classroom, and that they had more fun doing it. Living on campus provided them with:Friendships that last a lifetime, a fulfilling feeling of community, and some crucial survival skills.

Name: Centre for Arts and Technology - Kelowna
Overview: Based in Kelowna, Canada, the Centre for Arts and Technology (C.A.T) is a private digital art school that has secured the British Columbia Education Quality Assurance (EQA). Renowned for its high employment rates after graduation, this school is a part of the Private Training Institutions located in British Columbia. Centre for Arts and Technology Kelowna extends part-time and full-time diplomas and courses in audio-visual arts. The courses include vet hospital assistance, photography, graphic design, filmmaking, and music recording, which range from 6 to 24 months. Centre for Arts and Technology and British Columbia Institute of Technology (BCIT) engaged in a partnership to create the CAT-BCIT program. This is a cross-institutional agreement enabling graduates of CAT an entry into BCIT’s School of Business. Besides this, there are Pathfinder Programs which are internal programs that extend an opportunity to high school students in Grade 11 and 12 to pursue a post-secondary course while they are still in high school. Students aged 19 years or older with a secondary school diploma or equivalent are eligible for admission at this campus. Besides this, they must be a landed immigrant, Canadian citizens, or an international student with valid visas. However, there are four program starting dates in a calendar year, i.e., January, April, July, and October; most intakes and starting of all programs occur in October.

Name: Mohawk College - Mississauga
Overview: One of Canada's most renowned and prestigious colleges, Mohawk, is located in Hamilton, Ontario, and is one of the largest government-funded colleges for applied art and technology. Mohawk College has collaborated with triOS College to provide educational programs for international students at a campus in Mississauga, Ontario. These educational programs offer flexibility to study, work and live in this culturally diversified city.Mohawk college Mississauga programs include a 2-year Ontario college diploma in Business (General), Computer Systems Technician (Network Systems), Global Business Management, Computer Systems Technician (Software Support), and Office Administration (Health Services).It also provides a 1-year Ontario college graduate certificate in Supply Chain Management and International Business Management. Students living in the Greater Toronto Area can earn a credential from Mohawk college after completing a course. One can qualify for a post-graduate work permit to live in Canada and listen to recorded webinars in case they have missed one. As college campus students, students will enjoy a membership to the Mississauga YMCA.The Mohawk college Mississauga campus offers Free Enhanced Language training to improve international students' written and verbal English skills. Tutoring services such as the Study Buddy programs are available for students who require a clear understanding of a course. According to the KPI Graduate Employment Rate (2018-19), Mohawk College had an 86.2% graduate employability rate. As per the Graduate KPI Outcomes Survey (2018-19), the college had a graduate satisfaction rate of 79.5%.
Eligibility Overview: If you aspire to get admitted to Mohawk College, you must meet the following requirements. 1. University has no mention of a cutoff for the 12th grade.2. The applicant must have completed a 10+2 high school diploma with Math and Science as required subjects.3. Have a 60 percent average on a 10+ diploma.4. Required/recommended subjects: Chemistry, Physics, and English5. Test of English Proficiency6. Make a resume
Placement: Within six months of graduation, 88.4 percent of Mohawk College alumni students find work.For the fifth year in a row, the institution has been named first in the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area for the graduate employability rate. The College hosts career fairs, workshops, virtual meetups, and other events to help students discover suitable jobs and internships on campus.The college also helps them improve their resumes and portfolios, organize mock interviews and aid them with cover letters, networking tactics, and other services.Students can access a Career Ready Portal Login at the college. Students can find appropriate jobs, and employers can list their job criteria and openings on the college's website.According to Payscale, Mohawk College graduates and alumni earn an average salary of 53,111 CAD.

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Living on campus is an obvious choice for students who do not reside in Hamilton or the surrounding area. Living in residence is essential for many first-year students because students require additional support to help them transition from high school to college life. A residence is also a good option for students who might not have considered living on campus before COVID-19. On-campus accommodation helps you to focus on your studies because the college takes care of the rest. It is low maintenance compared to living off-campus and is only a few minutes away from the campus, giving you an accessibility boost.  Mohawk offers three types of accommodation -Mohawk residence- This is only meant for Fennell campus students and comes with all amenities and facilities to make your hostel life fun.Accommodation information for international students- It offers homestay programs that help international students to stay with a Canadian family Off-campus housing- Mohawk College equips students with the resources to facilitate their off-campus accommodation. Off-campus accommodation may include studio apartments, upto 4 bedroom apartments, private rooms, and homestays.

Name: Trent University - Durham GTA
Overview: Founded in 1964, Trent University is primarily a public liberal arts university in Peterborough, Ontario, comprising a satellite campus in Oshawa. This university is widely known for its Oxbridge college system and small-class sizes. This institution predominantly offers graduate and under-graduate programs at the master’s and doctoral levels. Situated on Thornton Road in Oshawa, Trent University-Durham GTA serves more than 1, 600 part-time and full-time students. This campus in the Regional Municipality of Durham has been extending courses in different fields for more than 40 years. With more than 800 students at this university can explore part-time and full-time degrees and programs in courses like Anthropology, Communications and Critical thinking, Media studies, Social Work, Business Administration, Psychology, English Literature, Sociology etc. Besides, there are various courses at the Durham campus that students can take and later pursue them as majors in the Peterborough campus. They are- Cultural studies, Environmental and Resource Studies, Biology, Economics, Modern languages, Political studies, Computer Information Studies, and Political Studies, Geography etc. Besides, this university provides a program in Indigenous Environmental Studies along with a specialized Diploma in Foundations of Indigenous Learning, which provides accessibility for people of Indigenous heritage. Moreover, this university offers multiple internet-based courses to their students and nearly 70% of Trent courses utilize web-based components. Trent University also conducts different workshops and provides students with finances, health-insurance, academics, and housing. Besides, this institution offers different career exposures in multiple fields in part-time, full-time and non-academic. With more than 50, 000 alumni across the world, this institution is one of the most recognised universities and has an extensive alumni network in various countries. With a graduate employment rate of nearly 96%, the students are employed within 2 years of graduation. As per US News and World Report, this university holds the ranking of 253rd for being the Best Global Universities.
Eligibility Overview: Requirements:Standard X Certificate scores PLUS a minimum 70% average in the best four academic subjects, including English*, in Standard XII.The results of an English proficiency test will very certainly be requested. The CBSE curriculum exempts students from taking the English Language Proficiency test. Acceptable exams and waivers can be found in the English Language Proficiency Requirements.For program-specific criteria, see the admission chart.Commerce stream students in India Senior High School are excluded from having Mathematics as a compulsory course for admission to the Bachelor of Business Administration programme.The following courses are required for the Bachelor of Science in Nursing programme: English, Chemistry, Biology, and Mathematics.English, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, and one of Physics OR Earth and Space Science are required for a Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Science.
Placement: Trent's nursing and mathematics graduates reported a 100% employment rate following graduation.According to reports, 90 percent of Trent alumni found work within six months of graduation.Trent University graduates earn an average of 56,000 CAD per year, according to PayScale.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.Trent University offers both undergraduate and graduate students on-campus housing.At both the Peterborough and Durham campuses, the university has five residential colleges for undergraduate students.Students can choose from a variety of dining plans.The rates shown below are for PG students and include a meal plan.Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The average monthly rent is between 550 and 650 Canadian dollars.Studio flats, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments are also available.All basic amenities such as power, hydro, and unrestricted internet are included in the fee for the student homes.A laundry facility is also accessible on site.

Name: Luther College
Overview: Luther College is a federated college associated with the University of Regina. The college offers undergraduate programs along with diploma and certificate courses. Students graduating from here obtain a degree from the University of Regina. The best courses at Luther College include B.Sc. in Chemical Technology, BA in Journalism and Diploma in Computer Science. The college's campus is in Regina, within its affiliated university's 200-acre campus. The campus offers residential facilities for students at the Student Village at Luther College. The amenities provided to students include common areas, private rooms, and laundry areas. Students also get access to several facilities of the University of Regina. The average cost of tuition and stay per semester can come to around CAD 15,500, depending on the number of courses chosen. The college's student community is closely knit, with around 600 students studying on campus currently. The Chapel Space offers students a place to offer prayers and enjoy peace. The campus also has catering services that offer meal plans to students every week. Students stepping into the professional world can join the Pre-Professional Students Society (PPSS), which provides support and resources for those looking to kickstart their careers.

Name: Coast Mountain College - Smithers
Overview: Earlier known as Northwest Community College (NWCC), Coast Mountain College is a post-secondary accredited institution serving learners and communities of the northwest region of BC. Its five regional campuses serve 34 communities. Out of these, 21 are First Nations communities. One of these five campuses is located at Smithers. The Gold LEED building at Smithers is flooded with natural lighting. It is heated with geothermal energy featuring indigenous art, rock, and wood throughout. This serves to represent three themes, namely, indigenous culture, forestry, and resource management. These themes define that this institute is connected and committed to the Northwest communities. Coast Mountain College Smithers extends different full-time program options, including options for certificate, diploma and university courses. Students can also opt for flexible college and career preparation courses. Besides short-term continuing studies, this institute offers online, workforce-ready certificates. Coast Mountain College offers programs through Distributed Learning by using various tools like web-conferencing platforms, textbooks, print modules, email, social media, online videos, local contexts, Learning Management Software (LMS), and experiential tasks. The various study areas for which students can opt include Business, Arts, Science, Trades, Upgrading, Health and Social Sciences. To name a few programs from these study areas, this institute offers an Associate Degree in Arts (General Studies), Criminology Diploma, First Nations Specialization, Business Administration Certificate, Post-Degree Diploma Business, Public Administration, Permaculture Design, University Credit Program, etc. The Scholarships program aims to reward success and ease out financial burdens of deserving and eligible students.

Placement: The college helps students find jobs by providing job placement services. Through its digital employment board and outcome campus connections, the college offers students job and hiring prospects. This platform serves as a skill-building and job-posting tool for current students and recent graduates. On this platform, students can find a variety of job possibilities provided by firms. Students can create a profile on the platform in order to be found by potential employers. Apart from that, the college offers students various networking opportunities, job boards, and other resources to help them find the right employment. Students can also get interview tips and skills from the college to help them prepare for their interviews. The college holds the view that the growth of its students is also the growth of the college. For this reason, the college offers students top-notch studies in a variety of fields. To enhance their knowledge and develop their talents, students can finish any kind of full-time certificate programme. Students who are looking for acceptable employment prospects can also get paid by the college with finding jobs. The college is able to guarantee the overall growth of its pupils in this way.

Residents enjoy free wireless Internet access. Each room has a twin bed, a study table, and a closet.There are also lodging options on the Smithers campus.There are 20 single occupancy beds with TVs in each room, a communal kitchen, dining hall, shared living area with TV, laundry and dryer, and semi-private washrooms in the house. On-campus housing can be found here.

Name: St Lawrence College - Cornwall
Overview: Founded in 1967, St. Lawrence College Cornwall campus is situated on the shores of the St. Lawrence River. The institution offers a wide range of courses from Engineering and Technology to Business Administration, Electronics, Home economics, etc. The college has over 6700 students who get access to 100+ full-time programs, including bachelor’s degree, certificate, and advanced diploma programs. The institution has secured 57th position in the 2022 edition of Best Colleges in National Liberal Arts Colleges. The institution provides robust international student services, including housing assistance, language support, student advisors, and even help regarding transitional to life in a new country. The location is ideal for access to several campus facilities, from the library to the gymnasium, the city center, etc. For international students, the average tuition cost ranges between CAD 21,722 and CAD 16,672, depending on the program they opt for. Some of the programs have additional costs involved, especially to access equipment, study materials, immunizations, etc. The Cornwall campus has 44 fully furnished private suites for students along with some other facilities. St. Lawrence College Cornwell students get accommodation facilities and financial assistance as well. For the admission process, one can use the official website to apply online, where transcripts along with application fees will be required during this procedure. Students also get access to financial aid, which is provided through bursaries, ranging from 500 CAD to 3000 CAD. St. Lawrence College Cornwell boasts an alumni and development office that involves raising more funds for the institution and reaching out to more students. It also has a separate career management center that organizes career fairs yearly. This way, students get global exposure and get employed in renowned organizations. The employment rate stands at nearly 88.1%.

Name: McKenzie College
Overview: Formed in 1988, McKenzie College is a premier private career college situated in the heart of Moncton, New Brunswick across Centennial Park. It provides industry-relevant training in an array of diploma and certificate programs in IT, Language, Art, and Design. The Institute’s programs provide optional pathway programs and an opportunity to continue education abroad through multiple academic agreements with international and local educational institutes. The program curriculum at this college is reviewed and updated on a regular basis so that it meets the industry requirements and standards. The various programs offered at this institution are Graphic Design Prep, Photography Media Arts, Video Game Art Prep, TV & Game Animation, Social Media Marketing Strategies, etc. The institute offers Language Pathway Programs to those willing to attend programs at local institutes. It has received accreditation from Languages Canada. There is no application fee required for domestic candidates but the international candidates are charged an application fee in the range of CAD 80 to CAD 120. Both international and domestic applicants need to pay a Seat Reservation Deposit in the range CAD 180 to CAD 220 if they get accepted into any program. The tuition fees for domestic candidates range anywhere from CAD 4,500 to CAD 15,650 depending on the program chosen. For the international candidates, this ranges from CAD 6,200 to CAD 15,650 CAD. In some of the programs a supplement fee for the international students is also applicable which ranges between $3,700 CAD to $3,800 CAD. There are several McKenzie College scholarships offered to deserving students. A few of them include Ruthie M. Reid Memorial Scholarship for Design, John D. Thompson Memorial Scholarship, etc. The College also provides accommodation to its students at McDougall House. Besides this, students can also opt to stay at any of the independently-owned accommodation spaces present in the vicinity of this campus.
Eligibility Overview: Completion of high school, GED, Adult High School diploma, or similar experience is required. Transcripts must show that you completed high school, a post-secondary programme, a diploma or degree (if applicable), or have supporting documentation that show you did.To be considered for admission to a McKenzie College programme, you must submit a full application that includes all of the needed documentation and requirements.
Accommodation: If you require a place to live while attending McKenzie College, the University will do everything possible to assist you in finding suitable housing, including matching you with other students searching for roommates. On the west side of Moncton's downtown center, there are many of apartment buildings and other rental properties which might interest you. Each apartment offers the following features and amenities:Fully furnishedFree WIFIBed linensWasher and dryer in each apartment

Name: Laurentian University
Overview: Established in 1960, Laurentian University is a bilingual public institute in Ontario, Canada, with over 9,000 students across undergraduate and graduate degree programs. Students can pursue degrees like BA, B. Ed, BBA, MA, MSc, MBA, Ph.D., etc., in disciplines like Biology, Sports Administration, Social Work, and Psychology. Seven faculties offer courses in English and French like the Faculty of Arts, Faculty of Medicine and Management. Those who wish to work on their English and French language skills can earn a certificate of bilingualism. Laurentian Online allows students to pursue 27-degree programs and 540 certificate courses, professional development courses, and pathway courses. Criminology, Gerontology, Fingerprint Detection, Analysis, and Business Administration are some examples. The study abroad program enables students from abroad to study at LU while allowing LU students to complete part of the degree program overseas. Over 1,600 students reside on-campus; accommodation (with dining services) is available in multi-bedroom apartments and single/double rooms at the Mature Student Residence, University College Residence, East and West Residences, etc.There are nine recreational facilities on campus, such as the Field House Gym, Ben Avery Gym, tennis court, outdoor track, etc. 94% of LU students find employment within six months of graduating. Different student associations run multiple clubs and societies like First Love, Law at Laurentian, and Karate.Some financial aid options available to students are scholarships, loans, bursaries, and grants like Academic Excellence Scholarships, Athletic Awards, Access to Opportunities Bursary, Jacqueline Labelle Award, etc.
