Name: Northern Lights College
Overview: Northern Lights College, founded in 1975, has five campuses in Chetwynd, Dawson Creek, Fort Nelson, Tumblr Ridge, and Fort St. John, and access centers in Hudson’s Hope, Dease Lake, and Atlin. The college is a member of the British Columbia Colleges, along with 11 other colleges in the province. Different programs offered at NLC at all levels ensure students get essential classroom education and hands-on experience to help them transition smoothly from student life to a successful job.Students can earn a diploma, certificate, or associate degree at the university. While the certificate takes one year of study, the diploma and associate degree have two years of completion time. The acceptance rate at Northern Lights College is 82%, while the employment rate of the college is 95%. These numbers make it a top choice for pursuing higher studies.
Eligibility Overview: International students must meet the following eligibility requirements: Students must have a high school diploma or certificate from a recognised university.Submit proof of the following high school courses:Grade B or higher in EnglishGrade C+ in mathC in science with a minimum of two courses English Proficiency Score Requirements:Candidates must show proof of any of the following English proficiency exams:
Eli Table:
English Proficiency Test Score 
  • A minimum score of 6 in IELTS
  • A minimum score of 78 in TOEFL iBT
  • A minimum score of 57 in PTE
  • CAEL score of 60 or above
Placement: The college's certificate, diploma, and associate degree programs cover all the essential information and concepts to build the applicant's work experience and profile. Northern Lights College does not have complete placement support; however, it provides a few tools to support the career planning of its student body. Students can use the NLC Climb Centre portal after graduating to find well-paying jobs.
Accommodation: While some campuses of the NLC offer on-campus accommodation, students enrolled on other campuses can go for off-campus accommodation. On-campus Accommodation: The Dawson Creek and St. John campuses offer on-campus accommodation for all its students in a comfortable environment. Dawson Creek Campus Housing: The campus can house up to 190 students, with options to choose from one, two, three, and four-bedroom condos. All condos include a stove, microwave, and refrigerator with tables and chairs.  St. John Campus: A total of 102 student beds are available at the campus with assisted facilities. A bed, dresser, bookshelves, computer station and chairs are available in each room, along with internet and telephone access. Off-campus Accommodation: The NLC's off-campus accommodation offers students various options, including studio apartments, rentals, communal apartments, hostels, etc. All the essential amenities are available in these housing options to students.
University Ranking: Northern Lights College is one of the top-ranked colleges in Canada. Located in the beautiful province of British Columbia, the college offers a variety of programs and courses to its students. In terms of rankings, Northern Lights College is consistently ranked among the top colleges in the country. According to the 2020 Maclean's University Rankings, Northern Lights College is rated #2 in the category of Comprehensive Colleges. This ranking is based on the college's overall performance in student satisfaction, faculty-student ratio, and graduation rate. The college also performs well in other orders. According to the QS World University Rankings, Northern Lights College is ranked #3 in Canada for its overall performance in teaching, research, and international outlook. In addition to its excellent academic performance, Northern Lights College also offers a wide range of student services. The college has a dedicated Student Services team that provides guidance and support to students throughout their studies. The college also offers a range of student clubs and organizations, as well as a variety of recreational and cultural activities. Northern Lights College is also committed to providing its students with a safe and secure learning environment. The college has a comprehensive security system in place, as well as a variety of safety initiatives and programs. Overall, Northern Lights College is one of the top-ranked colleges in Canada. It offers an excellent academic experience and a range of student services and activities. The college is committed to providing its students with a safe and secure learning environment and is consistently ranked among the best colleges in the country.

Name: University of Manitoba
Overview: The University of Manitoba is a public research university in Manitoba, Canada, founded in 1877. It has since become the 17th largest university in the country, establishing itself as one of the premier research universities in the region. The university has 24 faculties across different fields, offering over 100 undergraduate programs. Many of these programs can be followed by graduate and postgraduate studies offered by the university. The best programs at the University of Manitoba include Doctor of Medicine (MD), Master of Fine Arts (MFA), and BSc in Electrical Engineering. The main campus of the university is located in Fort Garry, Winnipeg. The campus is spread over a total area of 690 acres, with nearly 60 buildings dedicated to teaching and research located here. The other major campuses operated by the university include the William Norrie Centre, Bannatyne Campus, and James W. Burns Executive Education Centre.It also operates the Universities de Saint-Boniface, a French regional public university. The tuition costs can come up to CAD 15,000 per annum.
Eligibility Overview: The following entrance standards must be satisfied by international high school applicants: Eligibility for Undergraduates You must meet the following requirements if you are an overseas student who has just completed high school and has no previous postsecondary experience: Show off your command of the English language.Satisfy the normal entrance requirements for your country or study programme. The Standard International Curriculum, which covers the International Baccalaureate (IB) and British patterned Education (GCE) requirements, is detailed on the Foreign entrance criteria pagemeet the needs of the programme you've chosen (s) For those aspiring Indians A minimum of 60% in each of the senior-level courses listed below with a comparable minimum average of 70%: English or a first language literature courseMathematicsadditional academic coursework Many programmes demand that high school graduates master a particular subject. A high percentage of at least 85% is required for direct admittance. Eligibility for graduates You must meet the following criteria if you are an international applicant seeking admission to the University of Manitoba:It is necessary to have completed a four-year undergraduate programme or its equivalentEnglish language proficiency must be shown  International Students' English Language Requirements:

Name: HEC Montreal
Overview: HEC Montreal is a Canadian business school that offers bi-lingual graduate, undergraduate, and postgraduate programs to Canadian and international students in English and French. Founded in 1907, it is the first business school in the country.HEC Montreal holds three international accreditations: EQUIS, AACSB International, and AMBA, and ranks among Canada's top 5 business schools. Nearly half of the university's faculty members are from the international community, with 80% holding Ph.D. degrees. HEC Montreal fee starts from 6,700 CAD for Ph.D. in administration and can go up to 49,859 CAD for MBA. HEC Montreal aids its international students by offering a wide range of merit-based and research scholarships and special admission options, which they can easily avail after admission. The graduates of this business school get placed with top companies such as KPMG, McKinsey, Morgan Stanley, and Deloitte.The on-campus accommodation of HEC Montreal includes residence halls and apartments. The private apartments come fully furnished with a dining room, living room, appliances, television, stable internet connection, lockers for storage, game, and fitness zones.

Academic requirements

The ACT and SAT scores are course-dependent. To be eligible, you must have completed at least 120 credits in Grade 12 in relevant subjects and demonstrate proficiency in French and English. French requirements include either of the following:

  • Finished a French course as a second language
  • TFLM

A Bachelor's diploma/degree or a general licence from a Ministry of Higher Education-accredited institution, three years of university education, and French and English language proficiency are required.

University Ranking: HEC Montréal has long been recognized as one of the top business schools in the world. Founded in 1907, it is a part of the prestigious Université de Montréal and the only French-language business school in North America. HEC Montréal's MBA program has consistently ranked among the top 20 business schools in the world by the Financial Times, and its faculty is widely regarded as one of the most productive in North America. The success of HEC Montréal can be attributed to its comprehensive business education, its commitment to research, and its strong emphasis on leadership and innovation. The school's curriculum covers a wide range of business disciplines, including finance, accounting, marketing, strategy, and operations, as well as specialized courses in international business, entrepreneurship, and digital innovation. In addition, the school offers several technical MBA tracks, allowing students to tailor their education to their specific interests and career goals. HEC Montréal boasts a robust international presence, with partnerships and exchange programs with leading business schools worldwide. The school's alum network is also extensive, with more than 45,000 alums in over 130 countries. HEC Montréal is consistently recognized as one of the best business schools in the world, earning top rankings from many respected organizations. According to the 2020 Global MBA Ranking from the Financial Times, HEC Montréal ranked 17th globally, 2nd in Canada, and 1st in North America for the degree program. The Economist's 2020 MBA ranking also placed HEC Montréal at 17th in the world and 2nd in Canada.Additionally, HEC Montréal has been ranked 1st in Canada by the QS Global MBA Ranking for six consecutive years. These rankings demonstrate HEC Montréal's MBA program's strength and commitment to providing its students with a high-quality education. With its strong international network and top-notch faculty, HEC Montréal is well-equipped to help its students achieve their professional goals. The school's innovative teaching methods and diverse courses make it an ideal choice for those pursuing a career in business.

Name: Halifax Language Institute of Canada
Overview:
Halifax Language Institute of Canada is one of the leading language schools located in the city of Halifax, Nova Scotia. It is accredited by an internationally renowned governing body, Languages Canada. The institute offers various full-time and part-time courses on-campus and online, which focus on quality language education.
Halifax is one of the safest cities in Canada, with a population of 414,400. The school’s campus is close to many attractions like Halifax Public Gardens, Halifax Public Libraries and vibrant nightlife. It allows the students to indulge in various activities and events like multicultural festivals, the Northern Lights Lantern Festival etc.
Halifax Language Institute of Canada provides courses for one, four and eight weeks that are devised keeping in mind the English requirements of students and employees. All the courses aim at improving students’ confidence, proficiency, fluency, and accuracy. It has a General English programme, an English for Academic Purposes programme for students who wish to study English in secondary level educational institutions, a University and College Bridging Programme for post-secondary level and various programmes which help students prepare for English proficiency tests like IELTS, TOEFL, TOEIC and CELPIP.  
The courses are for short periods and are made affordable, keeping in mind that most students come from different countries. Due to this, the Halifax Language Institute of Canada does not offer scholarships or financial aid. The school attracts many international students as it provides pathway opportunities to top Canadian institutions like Wilfrid Laurier University, Toronto Film School, St. Lawrence College, Algonquin College and many more.

Name: Georgian College - Design and Digital Arts Centre (Barrie Downtown)
Overview: Georgian College is the first and only Canadian institute that got honoured as an Ashoka Changemaker College. It was incorporated in 1967 during the inception of the College System of Ontario. This college has an 81% acceptance rate and boasts of seven campuses in several locations of Ontario, thereby encompassing a total area of 21,000 square kilometres. The Downtown Barrie location of this institute is home to the Arch and Helen Brown Design and Digital Arts Centre. Barrie’s downtown is the city centre, and students would find unique dining experiences, boutiques, specialty shops, and many other attractive areas at this place. Some of the noteworthy annual events taking place here include Winterfest (February), Barrie Waterfront Festival (May), Celebrate Barrie (June), Promenade Days (June to July), etc. Students interested in a creative career can opt for any of the award-winning Design and Visual Arts programs of this institute. The various Georgian College programs include a 1-year Certificates program in Art and Design Fundamentals. Individuals can opt for the 2-year diploma programs in Graphic Design Production, Interior Decorating and Fine Arts. Georgian College - Design and Digital Arts Centre (Barrie Downtown) offers a 3-year Advanced Diplomas program in the field of Graphic Design and a 4-year degree program in Honours Bachelor of Interior Design (Co-op). Besides these, students can opt to acquire 1 or 2 years of Graduate Certificates in Project Management, Kitchen and Bath Design and Museum and Gallery Studies.
Eligibility Overview: A minimum overall final average of 70% is required based on the top six Grade 12 U or M courses. Applicants must also meet the necessary requirements for the particular programme in addition to the minimum average. Please keep in mind that some Georgian programmes have a limited number of seats available, and the cut-off average may rise based on the number of applications submitted. Lakehead Admissions has all of the details.Applicants who are presently enrolled in required admissions topics may be granted conditional admittance to Georgian. If your acceptance is conditional, you'll need to make sure you've completed all outstanding prerequisites before starting classes. Passing your classes, maintaining your grades, maintaining your GPA, finishing your high school graduation (if you're under 19), and, if applying for a graduate certificate, graduating from your present institution or university are all possible prerequisites. Please check Admissions on the web to see if you have any outstanding conditions.

Name: Kwantlen Polytechnic University
Overview: Kwantlen Polytechnic University has been educating students since 1981 as a public university in Canada. It has four campuses, 1400 faculties, and 20,000 students per year in 120+ programs with affiliation from AUCC, International Association of Universities, College & Institutes in Canada, Association of Commonwealth Universities, etc. Provides a place where students get the opportunity to work, KPU equips students with the necessary knowledge and skills to succeed in the workplace. Besides traditional academics, the university focuses on the hands-on skills of students. The university ranks between grades A to B for teaching quality, student satisfaction, learning, career preparation, and information technology, with a vast and formidable infrastructure, placement, and community network to help students worldwide. This university provides diploma degrees in graduate, baccalaureate degrees, associate degrees, certificate courses, etc. The Streams of studies in this university are accounting, arts, science, automotive services, business administration, organic farming training, building construction, etc. The institution offers on-campus and online study facilities to benefit students. The curriculum and services support students to become global citizens with the enormous pursuit of learning with guidance, core values, education programs, and student services that empower and help kick-start careers with leading corporate houses.The Kwantlen Polytechnic University tuition fee per year is $20,077 CAD approximately, the cost of living averagely is $12,960 CAD, and the application fee is $120 CAD for international students. To support the financial needs of students, the university provides bursaries and other financial aid.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements. International applicants can apply for either the open or limited intake options.  To enrol at KPU, the students must: Qualify under one of four applicant categories :High School: A graduate of a high school in British Columbia or an analogous educational system.Transfer: An applicant who has completed 24 or more undergraduate credits with a 2.0 or higher cumulative grade point average.Mature: A student who will be 19 years old or older on the first day of classes and has not completed high school.Aboriginal: An Aboriginal applicant who seeks to be assessed for admission individually by the Aboriginal Admissions Committee.Meet the following entry requirements:Open intakes: An open intake is one in which no limit on the number of students admitted every application cycle had been set.Limited intakes: Intakes for which a cap on the number of students admitted every application cycle had been established. English Language Requirements :  International students must prove their English Language proficiency to be eligible for application. Name: OCAD University
Overview: The Ontario College of Art and Design, known as the OCAD University, is a premier public college for music, media, and arts in Toronto, Canada. OCAD University, established in 1876, is renowned for its courses in art and design and is ranked among the top 16% of universities in the world by Edurank, 2021. The university offers about 17 undergraduate and seven graduate courses for students to make informed decisions about their higher studies. With a fantastic list of alums, such as Rachel Hayward and Madeline Ashby, OCAD University has made itself one of the premier institutes for undergraduate and graduate courses in art and design.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements:
Eli Table:
Academic Requirements
  • For Undergraduate Degree, the student must have completed 12th with an average score of 70% or a grade B. 
  • For a Graduate Degree, the students must have completed a bachelor's degree and have a portfolio or further required documents depending on the course applied for. 
  • An English proficiency test is required for international students.
Language Test Requirement

International students are required to provide an English language test score. 

  • TOEFL: 86
  • IELTS: 6.5
Placement: OCAD University provides an intensive program for international students to find a part-time placement on campus. Students pursuing a full-time degree course can go ahead with the placements.  Moreover, the students receive specialised support to help them land successful careers in their respective fields. There are several career fairs and workshops where students can be a part of and get a chance to interact with top companies and experts.
Accommodation: OCAD University, situated in a beautiful location, provides students with several amenities. Though OCAD University doesn't provide accommodation or on-campus housing facilities, it has a program set for students in need of accommodation.  The plan, known as the Toronto Home Share Plan, provides students with house share or rent facilities at a minimum price of 400 - 600 CAD. This plan is majorly for international students since finding suitable housing is difficult in a new country.
University Ranking: OCAD University, formerly known as the Ontario College of Art and Design, is one of the top universities in Canada and is consistently ranked among the best universities in the world. Founded in 1876, OCAD U is Canada's oldest higher education institution dedicated to art and design. The university is renowned for its innovative approach to teaching, research and development and is recognized for its commitment to excellence in art and design. OCAD University is ranked among the top universities in Canada for its educational quality, research excellence and overall student experience. According to the QS World University Rankings 2021, OCAD U is ranked #251-300 worldwide and #9 in Canada.Regarding academic excellence, OCAD U offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs in art, design, media and digital technologies. The university strongly focuses on interdisciplinary research, and its faculty members are renowned for their expertise in various disciplines, including visual arts, design, digital media and technology. Regarding the student experience, OCAD U is committed to providing its students with an outstanding learning experience and is consistently ranked among the top universities in Canada for student satisfaction. According to Maclean's University Rankings 2021, OCAD U is ranked #3 in Canada for student satisfaction. The Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2020 ranks OCAD U in the top 200 universities worldwide and #7 in Canada.Overall, OCAD University is one of the top universities in Canada and is consistently ranked among the best universities in the world. Additionally, the university is ranked #1 in Canada for student-faculty interaction and #2 in Canada for its learning environment. The university is renowned for its innovative approach to teaching and research and is committed to providing its students with an outstanding learning experience.

Name: Sault College - Brampton
Overview: Sault College is a post-secondary educational institution that opened its doors in the fall of 1965. It was then known as Sault Ste. Marie Ontario Vocational Centre, or OVC. This Designated Learning institution has one of its campuses in one of the fastest-growing Canadian cities – Brampton. Some programs offered at Sault College – Brampton are Global Business Management, Supply Chain Management, and Project Management. The intake for these programs takes place in September, January and May.The Project Management program is aligned with the Project Management Institutes (PMI) Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) curriculum and is an eight-month-long graduate certificate program. The Global Business Management program emphasizes international business's impact on Canadian organizations' strategic decisions and operations.The Student Job Centre (SJC), a part of the Student Services Department in the Student Success and Job Centre division, provides employment services to this institute's post-secondary students and alumni. Sault College alumni community features more than 35,000 graduates.The tuition fee for the three programs at Sault College – Brampton lies between $17,480 to $17,970. Sault College's Student Financial Assistance team assists students regarding post-secondary education investment. They provide Student Exceptional Expense Bursaries to those having difficulty meeting their educational costs, Part-time Canada Student Loans for Low Income Students, and more.
Eligibility Overview: For diploma and college certificate programs, English language proficiency is required.The results must be from within two years of the program's commencement date and must match the following criteria: 1. A TOEFL iBT score of 79-80 and no tests below 20 on the Internet-based test2. An IELTS Academic score of 6.0 with no band below 5.5 is required.3. Pass the Cambridge English Exam C1 Advanced or C2 Proficiency with a grade of B or above. 4. A Cambridge score of 169 or higher, with no one exam score of less than 162.5. Academic PTE 606. Duolingo 1057. CAEL CE 60, 8. Level 7 of the Canadian Language Benchmarks (CLB) in all categories (reading, writing, speaking, and listening). India as a whole Secondary School Certificate/Intermediate Certificate Senior School Certificate, Higher Secondary School Certificate, Year 12 State Board Exams (AISSCE, ISCE, SSC) (AISSCE, ISC, Pre-University Certificate Statement of Marks)
Accommodation: Housing and Connections Off-CampusFor students, finding off-campus accommodation can be challenging and time-consuming. Sault College aims to make the process as simple as possible for you so you can focus on your studies and other responsibilities. The college has teamed with Places4Students Inc. to provide a variety of housing options for students. Places4Students delivers the finest quality off-campus housing service to students, colleges, and landlords.   ON campus Accommodation    The room price covers wired and wireless high-speed internet throughout the building, full cable in each room and suite, unrestricted use of the laundry facilities, and a Residence Activity charge. The students who wish to defer payment of their residence fees until they receive OSAP or other government assistance must submit a Residence Payment Extension Form by July 22, 2022.

Name: Athabasca University

It offers more than 40,000 students high-quality post-secondary education through more than 850 courses and 55 undergraduate and graduate programmes. It is one of Canada's reputedly ranked higher education institutions and one of Alberta's four public comprehensive universities. Name: Inlingua DC - Arlington
Overview: Inlingua was formed in Bern, Switzerland, in 1968 to address Europe’s need to learn each other's language quickly for professional, business and academic purposes. It was a Swiss/German initiative to promote efficiency and an engineering mindset. It was dedicated to being a language school. Inlingua DC - Arlington was set up in 1986, joining the world’s largest association of independent language schools, accredited by the Commission on English Language Program Accreditation. The campus is conveniently located near the heart of Washington DC metropolitan area, between Virginia and Maryland, allowing students to access some of the country’s most prestigious colleges and universities. The Rosslyn Metro Station is located just a block away from the school. Students from all over the world are welcomed at the Inlingua DC. It offers general group English classes at all levels, from beginner to advanced, plus Test Preparation Courses in TOEFL, IELTS and Cambridge Exams. They also customize professional and academic English seminars and courses for diplomats, lawyers, law enforcement officers, engineers, business executives, architects, and customs officers and more. Inlingua DC plays an essential role in learning and understanding foreign languages, as learning a foreign language means understanding and knowing about the cultures and people. The institute offers year-round a minimum of 4 engaging cultural activities every week as well as a conversation club. An enthusiastic team from the institute accompanies the whole program. The school offers very well equipped (TV, video player, CD player etc.) and air-conditioned classrooms. There are more than 30 computers with flat screens in the newly set-up computer lab. High-speed internet and email access as well as wireless access (WIFI) - free of charge. Inlingua DC has both on-campus and off-campus residential accommodation.

Name: NorQuest College

Name: Upper Madison College - Toronto Campus
Overview: Founded in 2004, Upper Madison College Toronto is mainly a language institution that is certified because of its ability to provide top-quality education. It has three campuses in Canada, two in Toronto and one in Montreal. Students are coming from different countries to get diverse experiences that can be found here. Upper Madison College’s main vision is to create an atmosphere that will be mainly dedicated to providing quality language instruction along with teaching students to become compassionate people who give back to the world. A huge number of international students can be found here who are choosing this institution for its accredited curriculum, certified teachers and exciting atmosphere. Upper Madison College Toronto campus has smaller classrooms where maximum of 10 students are allowed for ESL classes, and 15 students for specialised classes. The programs offered by the institution is widely recognised and students come from Brazil, Japan, Spain, Mexico, China, South Korea, Ecuador and other countries. The pathway programs students get enrolled for allow them to apply for their preferred university or college without appearing for proficiency tests such as TOEFL, IETLS, etc. Upper Madison College is also known to be participating in Community Involvement and Volunteer Programs, etc. This not only helps them to communicate better but also contribute back to their community. Upper Madison College Toronto students can also go to free conversational clubs weekly that help them improve their communication skills. For international students, they have certain features like free online assessment tests, airport transfer, student insurance, etc. In their free time, students can also visit the Canadian Accent Training Club, World Café, Survival English classes, etc. for an enriching experience.

Name: Van Arts
Overview: Designated through the Private Training Institutions Branch (PTIB), the Vancouver Institute of Media Arts is a private post-secondary school that offers one-year diploma courses. With more than half of the student body being international students, Indian students are the second-highest in the population after Canadians.British Columbia has awarded the school an Educational Quality Assurance (EQA) designation. It is called Van Arts in short. The famous award-winning American Animator and Director Lee Mishkin was its founding program director. Van Arts offers eight full-time programs for one year, including Acting for Film and Television, Animation (2D and 3D tracks), Broadcasting and Online Media, Game Arts and Design, Professional Photography, Visual Effects for Film and TV, Web Development, and Interactive Design.The tuition fee for each course may amount to approximately 19,298 USD. Students are given one-on-one attention to have more concentration on their studies. International students will need to arrange their accommodation facilities privately as there is no on-campus residence. They can consider the homestay program through which they can also explore more about the place. For a student to live in the city, it may cost 891 USD-1475 USD. At Van Arts, industry nights are conducted so that students can interact with the recruiters of various companies to get an idea of their placement opportunities and the advancing need of the field. In addition to that, to enhance their skills, various talk events, workshops, and meetups are also organized. Van Arts has an excellent record of an employment rate of 92%.They are employed in Animation, Visual Effects, Game Design, Game Development, Concept Art, Illustration, Motion Graphics, and Immersive Media. Some of the recruiters who hire students from VanArts are Capcom, Namco, Bandai, Electronic Arts, Netflix, Sony Pictures, Microsoft, Image works, Adobe, and many more.
Eligibility Overview: Requirement for English Proficiency These are the choices open to students who have not completed their schooling in English and wish to demonstrate English language ability.   Required DocumentsThere is a nominal fee for the Student Authorization/Visa paid to Citizen and Immigration Canada. When you apply for your study permit, you will likely require the following for submission:A letter of acceptance for your program of study from VanArts.Evidence of financial support during your study period, i.e., a notarized letter, an affidavit from your bank or parents, or student loan documents.Evidence of intentions to return to your country of origin after completing your studies.Evidence of prepaid tuition fees, your tuition receipt, a certified cheque, or a bank draft payable to VanArts.Proof of citizenship, i.e., passport or birth certificate.Include the Designated Learning Institution (DLI) number O19331363352 on your study permit application

Placement: Van Arts' programmes are all meant to prepare you for work in the industries for which we train. The key to your success is combining your hard work with the resources we give, and our curriculum for all programmes is designed with career support in mind from the start.Van Arts is well connected to the sectors we serve and can assist you with your job hunt in various ways, in addition to the skills taught in the programme. We help our students get work by connecting them with industry leaders and reacting to specific recruiting needs, which is critical in today's economy. Graduating students' final demo reels are frequently shared with our database of professional contacts.Maintaining good relationships with your instructors, classmates, and guest lecturers is often the best resource for obtaining a career. Student Services and Department Heads may send out communications during and after the programme when they hear of job postings or recruiting events.

Name: Greystone College - Montreal
Overview: Greystone College – Montreal, established in 2002, is located in the business district of Montreal, 550 Sherbrooke St W 8th floor, QC H3A 1B9, Canada. The place is home to top-ranked industries in the health and communications niche. This private vocational institution is popular for its career-enhancing programs that meet all the recognised industry training standards. It came first in the 2016-star awards while its world-class education facilities have made it more popular. The college is associated with renowned organisations which open various avenues for its students. The placement ratio stands at 92% and according to data, 96% of the post-graduate students get employed within 6 months of their study. It is also a part of ILSC Education Group, considered as a highly-esteemed education company and mainly famous for serving advanced-language learning and vocational training programs. It can see the maximum number of enrolments in different business and digital marketing programmes.  Greystone College students are provided with financial assistance, from loans to scholarship facilities to finance their education expenses. Besides that, they also get accommodation facilities which are taken care of by the ILSC Education Group’s Student Accommodation Department. The institution provides internship facilities, accommodation, conditional offer letters, etc. The popular programmes offered by Greystone College are Tourism, Business, Teacher Training, etc. Apart from the academic life, students also get to enjoy the diversity in cuisines, architecture, music, etc. that Montréal has to offer.
Eligibility Overview: Students must have a secondary school diploma or equivalent (accepted secondary school diplomas must be from Canada or the USA); Students must be at least 18 years of age, and pass the Wonderlic Scholastic Level Exam (SLE) with a grade of 14 or higher.IELTS Requirement :  6.5 If you don't have an IELTS test result you can send your English online test.
Accommodation: Combine your education with homestays, student apartments, or student residences. In each of our cities, ILSC provides a number of options so that you can find the right living experience, degree of support, and level of freedom for you. Allow us to assist you in creating the ideal living and studying environment for you at one of our language schools or colleges in Australia, Canada, or India.For more visit:- https://www.accommodations.ilsc.com/

Name: North Island College
Overview: North Island College is a community college located in British Columbia, Canada. The college was established in 1975 in a portable trailer and a few college buses. Over the years, it has expanded to serve a geographical area of over 20,000 km2, offering over 1000 courses and 80 programs across various fields of study. The college has also developed its reputation as one of the top colleges for distance learning programs. The top courses at North Island College include Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), Tourism and Hospitality Management Diploma, and Culinary Business Operations Diploma.The main campus of the college, known as the Comox Valley Campus, is located on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. Facilities like science and computer labs, classrooms, and a library provide students with the necessary infrastructure to further their academic prospects. The campus is home to the Trades Training Centre, where several trades are taught to students on campus. The college also has campuses in Campbell River, Port Hardy, and Port Alberni, all located in British Columbia. The college has an active student community, with many campus services offering support during their education. The Library and Learning Commons is a dedicated space that allows students to study and access relevant academic literature. The Student Wellbeing program ensures counseling and mental well-being throughout their respective programs. The average study cost while attending college here comes to around CAD 17,500 per annum, with living expenses costing an additional CAD 1200 - 2000.
Eligibility Overview: Getting qualified is reasonably simple. Given below are the conditions to be met: Applicants must be 18 years old or older in the calendar year they apply to study (if you are younger, please email study@nic.bc.ca before applying).Complete an English language programme at one of the affiliated language schools to meet the English language requirement.Other entrance requirements for your desired programme must be met. English Language Proficiency You must meet the English proficiency requirements outlined below to be admitted straight into academic programmes.

Name: King, College (University of Western Ontario)
Overview: King's University College, commonly King’s College or King’s, is a Roman Catholic coeducational liberal arts college. Incorporated in 1954, this institute was previously known as College of Christ the King and its first class was conducted with 46 individuals in 1955. This institute was formed for extending education to an all-male seminary in liberal arts. It received official certification from the University of Western Ontario for becoming a university, thereby changing its name to King's College. King’s College (University of Western Ontario) is the biggest certified college of the University of Western Ontario. It houses over 3500 part- time and full-time students hailing from 35 different nations. It comprises around 97 faculty members with 6 full-time faculty. The average class size at this institute is 42, and the student to faculty ratio is 22:1. This college extends an array of programmes and offers education facilities in Arts, Social Science, Management and Organizational Studies, Childhood and Social Institutions, Social Justice and Peace Studies. Students can also opt for Master of Divinity degrees through its affiliation with St. Peter's Seminary, a graduation programme in social work, and Master of Theological Studies. The university is associated with Culture Works ESL for providing 'English as a Second Language' programme. Students who successfully clear the Culture Works programme gain entry to this institution. There are several clubs and organizations in this institute that assist students in pursuing their talent. It maintains three student unions - King's Residence Council, Social Work Students' Association Council, and the Students' Council. The social work council caters to the students enrolled in the professional degree programmes of the School of Social Work, while the student council works towards students’ welfare.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at King's University CollegeUndergraduate programmes in Criminology, Finance, Economics, History, Political Science, Psychology, Sociology, Arts, Childhood and Social Institutions, Finance and Wealth Management, Management, and Organizational Studies, including Accounting, Human Resources, Finance Administration, and Social Work, are available at King's University College.Requirements for Admission:Standard X and XII official academic transcriptsScore on the English Proficiency TestPassport that is validPermit for studentsVisa de VisitorDocuments of Financial SupportGraduate Admissions at King's University College Only a Master's degree in Social Work is offered at King's University College (MSW). Students who have finished a Bachelor's degree in Social Work (BSW) can enroll in a one-year MSW programme, whereas students who have completed a Bachelor's degree in a different area can enrol in a two-year MSW programme.Requirements for Admission:Confirmation that the applicant's degree has been assessed as equivalent by the Canadian Association of Social Workers.Bachelor's degree with a minimum average of 70%2 non-academic references for a letter of recommendationThe Research Methods Course has a syllabus.Demonstration of English ProficiencyAnswers to the additional questionSummary of Qualifications and Experience
Placement: College Placements at King's University The King's University College Career Services section assists students in finding the proper job following graduation. College students can choose to enrol in graduate studies or hunt for suitable careers in their fields of interest.The college assists students with resume and CV resources, interview guidance, obtaining recommendations, personal statement advice, and other aspects of the graduate school admission process.Within two years of graduation, 94% of college graduates are employed.Job search resources, networking opportunities, example resumes and cover letters, effective comments, mock interviews, and instruction on using social media for job search are all available to students seeking for work in Canada.
Accommodation: College Accommodations at King's UniversityAround 400 first-year and upper-year students are housed on campus at King's University College. International students make up about 35% of the students in residence halls.Alumni Court, Townhouses, Wemple Hall, International House, Epworth Place Houses, and King's Commons are among the on-campus housing options.For a guaranteed spot, applicants must submit their housing applications by June 1.The college also offers a variety of off-campus housing options that are shared by Western and affiliate colleges.

Name: College of New Caledonia
Overview: The College of New Caledonia(CNC), established in 1969, is a post-secondary institution offering more than 70 programs in various domains. The college has more than 247 full-time instructors, 97 part-time instructors, 186 full-time and 130 part-time staff.The college collaborates with several foreign developmental projects and has connections with multiple international organizations spread worldwide, providing students opportunities. The college provides an opportunity to pursue higher education at affordable rates. It offers lifelong comprehensive learning opportunities while aiding personal and educational growth and ensure that students get hands-on learning and practical training opportunities.The college campuses cover approximately 12% of the province area, with the main campus in Prince George and others in Burns Lake, Mackenzie, Quesnel and Vanderhoof, and Fort St. James.

Name: St Francis Xavier University
Overview: St Francis Xavier University, situated in Nova Scotia, Canada, was established in 1853 and is among the oldest and most renowned universities in Canada. It is a public university offering various liberal art programs to undergraduates. The university also has a low student-teacher ratio and provides hands-on research opportunities, with an 87% placement rate.The university has one of Canada's most beautiful and picturesque campuses with top-notch facilities and infrastructures, such as a six-lane swimming pool, dance studios, etc. Olympic gold medalist Eric Gillis, former Premier of Nova Scotia Angus L. MacDonald, and former Prime Minister of Canada Brian Mulroney are among the notable alumni of St. Francis Xavier University.

Name: International House - Vancouver
Overview: Established in 1990, International House Vancouver extends high-quality language programmes to students across the world. Being situated in Downtown Vancouver, students studying can easily access some of the city’s attractions. It has received accreditation from Languages Canada. UNESCO ranked Vancouver as a beautiful, safe city and a top place globally for living. The purpose-built campus of IH Vancouver features a student lounge, computer lab equipped with internet facilities, 23 classrooms, an art gallery, several shops and multiple dining venues. The various programs offered at this institute include pathway programs, junior programs, General English programs. Besides these, IH Vancouver also extends programs for students having a Working Holiday Visa. The two large junior programs are run in summer and winter. It provides courses in Academic English, general English Language, and Modern Languages (Arabic, Spanish, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, French, German, etc.). The class sizes at International House Vancouver comprises an average of 10 students. IH Vancouver incorporates the IHWO and CEFR standards and divides them into 14 levels. This ensures that classes are directed towards a student’s specific needs. IH Vancouver, in addition through its Career College, is a teacher training centre that issues diplomas in TESL, J-Shine and CELTA. It is Cambridge University certified, and PTIB approved. Besides this, it holds Languages Canada, EQA, and IH world designations. IH Vancouver offers two types of accommodation facilities that include student houses and homestay. The student houses are available for students from 19 years of age.

Name: St Clair College - Windsor Campus
Overview: St. Clair College of Applied arts and technology is a renowned public community institution. Among all the campuses, the Windsor campus is the biggest one, serving over 6,000 students pursuing more than 90 programs in different areas of study. Students have numerous options, from Engineering Technology and Skilled Studies to Business and IT, Health Sciences, etc.,The annual acceptance rate is 44%, which indicates that the admission process is highly competitive. Along with academic transcripts, international students must submit their IELTS, TOEFL, or other English Proficiency score reports during this process.  The total cost of education for undergraduate courses ranges between CAD$ 12,000 and CAD$ 30,000, while for graduate courses, it is CAD$ 14,000 - CAD$ 18,000. The institution provides financial aid and scholarships worth $1.5 million each year to help students finance their education costs. Apart from the course preference, the institution is known for its world-class education and great placement quality for fresh graduates. As per data, around 87.5% of students are immediately employed after completing their diploma courses at St. Clair College Windsor.
Eligibility Overview: In order to study in Canada as an international student, you will need a Canadian Study Permit granted by the Canadian Embassy. Only once you have gotten an acceptance letter from the college may you apply.For Indian students, the following are the minimum requirements:Diploma and transcripts from high schoolThe CAEL (Canadian Academic English Language) is a 60-point scale with no band lower than 50.Overall, IELTS 6.0 (individual band score not lower than 6.0)Level 51 of the Pearson Test of EnglishDuolingo is a language learning programme (Score of 100)The proficiency test results must be no more than two years old at the time the application is submitted.Applicants must be at least 18 years old or have finished Grade XII or an equivalent grade (Some exceptions may apply)a verified copy of an English translation of a high school transcriptYou will be needed to provide the following documentation as an overseas student:Transcripts from grades XII and high school diploma/graduation certificateResults of English Proficiency Tests (IELTS/PTE/Duolingo)If you want to apply for the Student Partners Program (SPP), you must have IELTS 6.0 (with no band lower than 5.5) English proficiency scores that are no more than two years old.If you do not meet the TOEFL or IELTS minimum score requirements, you will be asked to take the English Proficiency Test (CanTEST) once you arrive at the university. If you do not pass the CanTEST, you must enroll in the St. Clair College English as a Second Language (ESL) programme before applying to post-secondary institutions.
Accommodation: Apart from monetary assistance, students also get facilities like accommodations, sports and recreation facilities, food and dining services, and access to co-op programs, library services, student clubs and societies, etc. Students from foreign countries can also access the on-campus 204 - 2 bedroom suite residence. St. Clair College also boasts a sports complex called Sportsplex that also features walking tracks, gymnasiums, workout studios, etc.On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.St. Clair Residence, which provides a variety of facilities for students, is available on campus.Each of the 204 rooms is a two-bedroom apartment with a fully equipped kitchenette with microwave and mini-fridge, satellite TV, 24-hour security, shared lounge areas, laundry facilities, and is just a short walk from class.On-campus housing can be found here.https://www.stclaircollege.ca/future-students/residence Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus housing is available.The typical monthly rent is between 550 and 600 CAD.Studio flats, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments are also available.All basic services such as power, water, and high-speed internet are included in the rent for the student homes.A laundry facility is also accessible on site.Off-campus housing linkhttps://www.rentboard.ca/rentals/index.aspx?s0=1&s18=188&s19=5https://www.places4students.com/http://www.rentseeker.ca/Windsor.aspxhttps://www.kijiji.ca/b-room-rental-roommate/windsor-area-on/windsor/k0c36l1700220

Name: Montreal College of Information Technology (MCIT)
Overview: Established in 2006, the Montreal College of Information Technology is located in Montreal, Quebec's most populous city. This college provides IT programs and has credible accredited partners such as Cisco, Citrix etc. Approximately 4000+ students have graduated from this college. It provides diploma programs, divided into standard, fast track, and international student programs. Standard courses include Programmer Analyst LEA.CK: Profile Full Stack Web Developer, Networking, Technical Support LEA.CL etc. Students can apply for fast track courses such as Supply Chain Management LCA.EN, Software Testing LEA.CW etc. International students can opt for courses like Business Intelligence and Visualization Analyst LEA.CV, Software Testing LEA.CW etc. After completing the course, students will receive an AEC diploma, recognised by Quebec's Ministry of Education. Professionals with busy schedules can access course material and lab 24x7. Besides, one can also receive personalised feedback for improving themselves. Eligible students can apply for financial assistance programs to cover the cost of their education. This includes – MCIT student loan program, MCIT unemployed grant program etc. The Montreal College of Information Technology fees for the respective course is mentioned in the contract. However, students need to pay a registration fee of CAD 250$ before the issuance of visa documents. IT professionals, engineering and college students can opt for IT certification in programming, SAP, Salesforce, Software Testing etc. It has over 11 fully equipped classrooms and three accredited test centers. Since its inception, 3000+ graduates have found jobs in their respective fields. IT industry's leading companies such as RBC Royal Bank, XEROX, Equifax etc., recruit college graduates. As far as the Montreal College of Information Technology work permit is concerned, international students studying at MCIT can only work part-time jobs. Graduates need to apply for a work permit to work in Canada after graduating from Montreal College of Information Technology.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility requirements for the applicants to be considered for admission are as follows :  To be eligible for our A.E.C Diploma Programs, you must be a graduate and provide transcripts for all study periods. IELTS overall 6.5 in all bands 6 or 4 modules ( if one module is 5.5 it is acceptable). Significant financial assets and related work experience should also be included. On a case-by-case basis, some waivers may be applicable.
Accommodation: Montreal features some of the most cost-effective housing options in the country. Students like to remain in the downtown Montreal area because of the abundance of attractions, which include a variety of restaurants, bars, entertainment venues, transit stops, and sports arenas. The city, which is surrounded by a high level of educational institutions, provides a specific stimulus to learning. This is why the majority of students opt to stay in downtown Montreal. The prices are low, and shared accommodations are a viable option for lodging. Individuals looking to become acquainted with their cultural counterparts, such as Indians, Lebanese, Chinese, or different immigrant communities in neighbourhoods such as Cote des neiges, Cote-Vertu, Verdun, Down Town west, and Jarry east, may find it amicable in Montreal. https://www.montrealcollege.ca/accommodation/

Name: Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) - Main
Overview: Founded in 1962, the North Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) is primarily a government institution providing education in several disciplines of skilled trades, business, health and science. This institution comprises three different campuses, where three are located in Edmonton and one in Spruce Grove. The main campus involves productivity, centre for applied technology and innovation centre and the HP centre. The other campuses provide different apprenticeship training programs. This educational institution offers students from various parts of the world. Moreover, approximately 1, 700 students from more than 91 countries are registered in different credit programs. Further, this institution provides various part-time and full-time programs in different programs. This institution provides more than 80 credit programs leading to certificates, degrees, applied degrees and diplomas. This educational institution teaches in the classroom, provides opportunities to the students, and involves them in real projects associated with reputed companies. This college offers technology-based learning that develops students with necessary knowledge, rewarding careers and fundamental skills. Its primary focus is educating the next generation in technology, business, health and environment, and apprenticeship and trades training. Moreover, the Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) provides nearly $5.6 million in scholarships and bursaries to deserving students. This institution is considered one of the largest apprenticeship trainers in Canada, providing 34 registered trade programmes. This university has a huge alumni network of nearly 200,000 students in 95 countries. Through events and career fairs, students are offered with placement opportunities. Moreover, to enhance students’ learning, this institution has an equipped library, maker-space with 3D printing, full-service print shop, laser-cutting and robotics technology, soundproof audio and video production booths.
Eligibility Overview: A formal assessment (such as an ELP exam) is necessary for applicants who have not completed three years of full-time academic study in English.Exam results are valid for two years from the date of the exam. The most recent English Language Proficiency results will be used to evaluate applicants.Students entering an NAIT ESL programme should take the ESL Placement Exams. When applying to most NAIT programmes, they cannot be used to demonstrate English language proficiency.Your most recent ELP assessment, the ESL Placement Exam, may still have an impact on your admission to other NAIT programmes.Please consult an advisor before taking an ESL Placement Exam at NAIT if you already meet the ELP criteria for your programme.Exams and scores that are accepted vary.
Accommodation: While we do not provide on-campus housing, you have the opportunity to live in residences at the University of Alberta and MacEwan University for the academic year. With your NAIT U-Pass, these are just a quick train ride away.Both university campus residences will provide you with resources includingin-residence recreation, fitness and study facilitiesaccess to laundry facilitiesresidence support servicescommunity activities and programmingfree wireless interneton-campus dining and grocery optionfor more information click on this link-https://www.nait.ca/nait/international/arriving-in-edmonton/housing

Name: Ryerson University International College (RUIC)
Overview: Ryerson University International College (RUIC) is situated in downtown Toronto, surrounded by diverse industries, which is why students get both employment opportunities and access to arts, food, and culture. It offers a lot of courses and programs in different fields, from economics and Finance to Business Management. It got a ranking of 933 in Best Global Universities because of the students’ academic performance, retention rate, etc. As mentioned by UBI Global, Ryerson University International College’s Digital Media Zone is the leading university-based incubator in the world. It offers different kinds of programs, from the Faculty of Arts Programs to Business Management, Economics and Finance, etc. According to the data, based on a total number of programs, 31% of the enrolment comes in Business, Management, Economics and Law, Politics, Social, Community Service, and Teaching. Apart from academic facilities, the university also takes care of international students’ accommodation, pre-departure and arrival, etc. It also offers scholarship facilities to them; however, certain eligibility requirements are there that students have to meet to get such aids. Even when it comes to the admission process, Ryerson University International College has English language requirements, and for that, applicants’ IELTS, TOEFL test scores get assessed apart from their academic records. The average cost of tuition per year reaches somewhat near 30,597 CAD, and the cost of living is around 12,000 CAD. Apart from scholarships and awards, Ryerson University International College students get features like post-graduation work permits, work while studying facility, internship facility, etc. There are other amenities such as a 24-hour fitness centre, dramatic study and lounge spaces, etc., for its students. The institution has also come up with RUIC orientation, which provides a virtual tour of the classrooms and the entire campus, other information sessions related to visa status, dining services, etc.

Name: Western Community College - Surrey Main Campus
Overview: The Western Community College – Surrey Main Campus is located in Surrey, British Columbia, Canada. It has been in service of the Vancouver community since the year 2012. It also works in close collaboration with several partner institutions, namely the Les Roches Global Hospitality Education, Glion Institute of Higher Education, Nicola Valley Institute of Technology, Fairleigh Dickinson University, Yorkville University, and Vancouver Community College. This institution offers a number of programs in various fields of study, such as Healthcare, Hospitality, English Language, Accounting, Business, Office Administration, Legal Studies, Warehousing, Information Technology, and Child, Family, and Community Support. It also extends several post-graduate programs in the areas of Nursing Practice, Business Management, and Health Administration. Furthermore, the Western Community College – Surrey Main Campus provides financial aid to students based on their academic and personal achievements in the form of BC Student Loan, Student Lines of Credit, and In-House Western Community College Financing. In addition, it offers a scholarship to students, known as the Smt. Amarjeet Kaur Dhaliwal Scholarship, based upon their financial status, academic performance, expression of thoughts and visible motivation, and participation in extracurricular activities. Along with its full-time programs, the Western Community College – Surrey Main Campus also offers part-time class schedules, which comprises weekday, weekend, and evening courses (optionally available). The college also offers free CLB preparation classes. Additionally, it provides post-graduate pathways, which enables students to continue their education at a Canadian university or college with transferable credits. Therefore, students completing a Diploma in Advanced Studies, Business Management, and Hospitality Management can enroll at Yorkville University, Nicola Valley Institute of Technology (NVIT), and Vancouver Community College (VCC), respectively. This institution is also a CompTIA Authorised Academy Partner as well as an approved Amazon Career Choice provider. The Western Community College – Surrey Main Campus has a graduate employment rate of 97%. Students opt for this institution for its instalment-based, low tuition fee and 100% practicum placement.

Name: Evergreen College - Markham
Overview: Evergreen College is a private career college registered under the Private Career Colleges Act, 2005. This institute is a member of the Career Colleges of Ontario (CCO) and the National Association of Career Colleges (NACC). It is present at eight campus locations across Ontario. Out of these, it has a campus in Markham. The City of Markham is regarded as one of the most vibrant and diverse communities of Toronto. The Evergreen College Markham campus is situated a few steps from the highway and is close to many high-tech, life sciences and communications organization headquarters. From strolling through old-world Unionville shops or visiting an art gallery, shopping mall or local museum, students would feel lively at one of the fastest-growing cities of Ontario. This Markham campus offers career-focused diploma programs that students can often complete within a year. It also provides field-related practicums and free peer tutoring for one-on-one academic support. After graduating from Evergreen College, students automatically register with the ERAA (Evergreen Roots Alumni Association). This association provides Employment Workshops to members that offer a competitive edge to alumni for their job search. There are part-time job opportunities available for students on-campus in the administration, admissions, and marketing fields. To name a few, this institute offers programs for personal support workers, pharmacy assistant, medical office administrator, hospitality operations, clinical research, network system engineer, etc. Besides these, some other courses include English Preparation Program, corporate training, academic preparation course, CPI Nonviolent Crisis Intervention Training and Gentle Persuasive Approach. This college extends three awards to the deserving candidates considering they fulfil specific criteria for that. These include the Perfect Attendance Award, IT Specialist Award and Leadership Award.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions to Evergreen College's Certificate ProgramEnglish Preparation Program, Corporate Training, CPI Nonviolent Crisis Intervention Training, Gentle Persuasive Approach, and Academic Preparation Course are some of the certification programmes offered by Evergreen College. After submitting an online application, the admissions counsellor will schedule a campus tour for the candidate. An enrollment meeting will be scheduled whenever the student is ready to enrol. A copy of your photo ID, transcripts, and a diploma from your high school or post-secondary education are all required documents for enrolment.Requirements for the application: The following documents are required:An application for a course that has been completeda photocopy of your IDTranscripts from high school or post-secondary education are official academic records.Resume/CV of the candidatePersonal Statement (optional but recommended for international students)
Placement: College placements that last a lifetimeEvergreen College's postgraduate diploma programmes include internships that allow students to gain real-world experience in various areas. Work study programmes and field placements are also available at the college. Orientation programmes, workshops, skill-building events, and other career services are planned for students to assist them in finding jobs in Canada after graduation.
Accommodation: Residence at Evergreen CollegeInternational and domestic students do not have access to housing on the Evergreen College campus.International students can take advantage of the College's homestay programme.Students must pay a 150 CAD application fee to apply for a homestay programme.
